text: Friendly staff, and actually quite knowledgeable about French pastries. Pastries have all been awesome and it smells great. My only nag is the coffee mugs are square shape with a big lip on them and it makes it hard to not drip when you have a sip. Looks cool it's just not that functional
The food was pretty bad.  Black bean taco salad was just that.  Canned black beans with almost nothing else.  Chili was made with really fatty beef.  Disappointing.

We had my sons birthday party this weekend there. Needless to say, I will never go back and talked to the manager twice and all he could do was make excuses for the terrible service we got. Our "party planner" (I won't name her on here)was completely checked out, sat in the dark room ( not with the kids) playing on her phone. Thankfully my friends were there to serve the kids drinks and pizza. We paid for laser tag, ball blasters and black light mini golf. The laser tag was broken, one ball blaster wasn't working so one kid had to sit and watch and we never got to play mini golf. We had no clue what was going on or what activity was next as our party planner was no where to be found. We talked to the manager and he gave each kids ( there were 8) tokens to play arcade games... ha! What a joke. The games were broken and just took their tokens or didn't spit out the tickets. I called the manager today and he told me she is his best girl and something must be wrong. It's sad if that is his best girl. He told me to call him and he will let my kids play golf anytime on him. I said no thank you, we will not be returning. What really pissed me off was having to leave a $25 to a girl who played on her phone. I should have tipped my friends. I will never go back again.
I loved this place. Cheap. Easy. And amazing!!! I got the muffelatta and I was in love!!!!! Absolute perfection. Highly recommend

Stopped in tonight for my wife's and mine annual birthday dinner. We have been here several times before. Tonight's off menu surf and turf was exceptional. Service from Mary was excellent.  Fillets cooked to perfection. Salads, sides and desserts outstanding. Definitely a repeat. Fleming's has lost a customer.

Chicago Paulies, WHAT A PLACE. such good vibes. funny jokes. Paulie is a good dude who makes great hot dogs. 

My boyfriend Kyle and I recently went to FL for vacation. Our first food stop was Chicago Paulies. It was our first time but saw good reviews.The food was great. The locals seem to LOVE him. We totally get why, Paulie is the heart and soul of that place. He tells it as it is, and has great comedic delivery. Food's great. Local biz. Great dude. We'll definitely come back whenever we're in town.

I Used to love this place alot. So what did I do? I applied I worked with them for 6 months and then one day BOOM out of nowhere I get fired for some shit I didnt do. I was so mad because they said that when I was training a girl that i was cursing in front of kids in the dinning. Which is dumb cus I didnt like to curse much back then and I was in training which I knew they will ask the girl how the training went. So I basically had to be on my best behavior. I was upset that they would believe a new girl over me. That was back in 2013. I would have still worked there. Also they got mad at me and my friend for speaking Russian and when I told them that they always speak Spanish they got mad. Lmao oh well. Food is bomb though. But they go through employees like paper towels.

They deserve more than 5 stars. 
We were so worried because my daughter's passport expired and we're going on a cruise in 7 days. 
They over night the passport to us in 2 days. 
The lady was really really nice. 
Thank you !!!!!!!
Super nice guys here. They'll admit if you could wait another month for an oil change. Always go out of their way. Always friendly.

Delicious hand made pasta.  Decent sized portions.  Smaller place so definitely make an appointment if you're going on peak hours/weekends.  Wait staff is hit or miss--i feel like they get busy and forget to check back for drinks,  bills, etc and we frequently have to flag them down.

When I was in Delaware for a leisure and business trip, I decided to take my friend to Buffalo Wild Wings for dinner because he has never been there before. It was a tremendous place with lots of TV's so we didn't miss a minute of all the NFL games, but the service was spotty as we ordered a traditional and boneless wings plate and it wasn't ready until 20-25 minutes later. BWW is a sit down restaurant and bar, but the wait time should be a little shorter. Overall, the food was not bad and we got what we paid for, I guess.

I finally got to try Seoul Fried Chicken the other night, and I think my mind is blown. I went for the five-piece combo with original chicken, slaw as my salad, and the corn fritter as my side (as opposed to fries). The chicken was crunchy and extremely juicy, while the slaw was fresh and had lots of hearty carrot in it. I loved the corn fritter, which was served in a milky, sweet liquid. I did not find the chicken too greasy, and the price point was great. The place is rather small with most people doing take out. You might have a hard time finding a seat if you want to dine in during the lunch or supper rush.

Sitting in this restaurant right now. Just canceled the food order after waiting over an hour after ordering. This cannot be the busiest this place has ever been.  The chargrilled oysters we had were good. However, when after that you try to deliver the incorrect food to our table 3 tines, it's a problem. Simple orders, salad, gumbo, entree.  No excuse for a supposed established place.  Two stars only because the chargrillled oysters were good.

I purchased a couch at Yvonne's over 6 years ago. The frame broke in the corner, and the couch began to sag. This got progressively worse for about a year. I phoned Yvonne's and they told me to send pictures. That day they got back to me, requested i bring the piece in so they could fix it - for free! i had the piece back the next day - looking like new again, and probably stronger than new. 
friendly staff, Excellent customer service.

Get some help in this store. It's a disaster! Boxes sitting stacked in every isle. I was seriously afraid one stack that was leaning over might fall on me. Merchandise scattered all over the floors. One cashier & 10 people in line. Thought I'd never get out of there. Never again.

The Stillery was AMAZING and is my new favorite Nashville restaurant. The Hot Chicken Pie was outstanding and is the best pizza I've ever had...and that's saying something! We also ordered the Mac and cheese with hot chicken added, which we had seen was recommended on Yelp prior, however, while it was also really tasty, the pizza outdid it BY FAR. If ordering pizza, our waitress recommended ordering any pizza with mozzarella cheese, as they make it in house along with their crusts and breads. I also saw quite a few sandwiches and burgers, which looked good too. You may have to wait for a table and something I wish I had known was that there is additional open seating upstairs, however, regardless it was worth the wait and I will definitely return!

What great stuff!  I found several wonderful Holiday gifts here and will be back next year when I can just shop for myself. 

There are so many vendors, they've spilled into the mall. Selling a vast variety of items, Nevada calendars, Great Basin book directly by the author, jewelry, clothing, scarves, yummy goodies, ceramics, candles, paintings and pictures and so much, much more!!!
Very good in taste, friendly staff and a good bar counter.! Good place to hang out till late night.

Movegreen did our move from Santa Barbara to San Diego with a stop to drop off at a storage unit. They were incredibly professional and great at their job! We had Frank, Sergio, Ramiro and Justin and they were so efficient and careful with our stuff. Everything arrived in exactly the same condition as when we left. They guys were really nice and did a great job remembering where things were meant to go as I haphazardly told them what was going to our new place and what was going to storage. I couldn't believe they got it all straight! They were also really a fun group of guys and kept the whole experience upbeat! Will absolutely use them again for our next move.

On our stay on 12/1 things went well. We were in the same room as before (2016) and it's a comfortable room but the mattresses need replacing really bad!  As I mentioned before this place is due for some major renovations!  Last update must have been 10 years ago or more!

~~~~~~~~~

Nice rooms and what you would expect from Embassy Suites.  It's about time to do a 'refresh' on this property and make it look like 2017 (not 2007). Big rooms with nice beds and great views from the 20th floor!  Furnishings are nice but outdated and the TVs could be bigger. There are fingerprints from previous guest on the wood furniture and microwave. I'm a Hilton Honers member and only stay at Hilton properties. It is what it is cuz it's only for one night!

Nice hotel. All workers were pleasant and helpful. I even got a complimentary upgrade with free breakfast. Can't stay the stay is inexpensive but it was a nice hotel in a good location with access to restaurants and shops nearby. Was there for a business conference and all went smoothly.

We stopped by Sun King and thought we would check out the new Oca restaurant/shop inside. Oca, meaning "Goose", is a spin-off for Goose the Market that opened inside the public area of the brewery. Although they hadn't "officially" announced they were open, I had heard that they were open in the evenings and were working through a soft opening process. So glad we stopped by!

My wife and I both tried one of the bundled French Bread sandwiches. Tonight's featured City Ham and Gruyere with Dijon mustard, tarragon, and mini sweet pickles (cornichons). I placed our order at the counter, paid, and gave my name. They asked if I wanted the sandwiches toasted (yes!) and that allowed me time to pick up a couple drafts at the Sun King counter. As soon as I was making my way back to our table, the Oca staff called out my name and I was good to go. 

I loved the crispy crunch of the bread and the toasting brought out the flavors of the ham and cheese. Excellent pairing for the spices too. Can't wait to come back to try some of the sausages and charcuterie. 

*****update******
I made it back one evening and decided to try the Choucrote Garnie which may as well translate to "meat lover's dream!"  Actually, it's a "traditional dish of France's Alsace region bordering Germany" and the Choucrote is fermented cabbage while the Garnie means it is dressed with Riesling (white wine), herbs, potatoes, and charcuterie.

 This huge option is brought out in a roasting pan.  My eyes started to glaze over at all the meats.  In the center was a large peppery Knack(wurst) nestled over a large serving of the Choucrote.  To the left was a thick (a full inch) smoked rib chop that was the most tender pork chop I've had.  In the upper left corner were two Nuremberg sausage (technically much larger at about 5 inches instead of the 9 cm traditional).  The Nuremberg have a thicker casing and more in the Bratwurst family.  To the right of the Knack were a couple slices of Pancetta that looked like American bacon, but have a higher salt content.  Just below that, there were two Strasbourg frankfurters.  Oh, and there were two potatoes that were halved and roasted.

The Choucrote itself was a great surprise at how much I enjoyed it.  My mother used to make a really nasty version of sauerkraut and dressed it with white vinegar.  I hated it!  But here, the pungent odor of vinegar is replaced by the pleasing notes of the Riesling.  The sour of the dish is tempered as well, so the overall taste is quite pleasing, especially since it is warm and served thoroughly tender. (I am not a fan of the sometimes rubbery and tough texture of raw cabbage.)

The portion size suggests it is for two to four people.  They mean it on this dish!  I made really great headway on devouring the dish, but common sense struck me before I was stuffed and decided to get a to go box.  Not for the picky eater, this is a dish that goes great with a dark beer (I went with the Sun King "Stuck in the Middle" Milk Stout option. Yum!)

*****back to the original review*****

As if I didn't have enough reasons to stop by Sun King already, now I can get great quality sandwiches while there. Note that Oca sells packaged meats to take home if you stop by to fill your growler.

Tech stuff: They are open generally the same hours as the brewery.  Parking is free in the Sun King lot.  A number of platters are meant for 2 to 4 people, so bring friends!

Review #439
Rev #30
While walking in St Pete we stumbled upon this cute little place.  Had a cup of delicious coffee and yummy slice of cranberry bread.  Staff was very friendly and attentive.  We'll be back!

I love pets of any shape and size. And I love cool stores that cater to fur babies.
This location of Doggie Style had a nice selection of items. I like looking at all the cool clothes and treats. They are more pricey that your big box pet suppliers but, the experience is much more pleasant and the stock is much more varied and interesting. 
Pet people are also more apt to drop some cash for our babies. 
Best of all, there are usually pets for adoption. This is a wonderful thing for these shops to do as a service to pets that would possibly be destroyed and to the communities where these stores are located. Bravo!

Pricey but consistently great! Very good quality, with large portions. Their super salad is full of goodies and dressed well; their fries are abundance and their burgers (even the turkey burger which I got an accident once) is excellent!

My wife and I were enjoying a trip to New Orleans and found the most amazing Cajun restaurant. Muriel's restaurant had the perfect balance of a high-end and Cajun casual. My fish was fresh from this morning and cooked to perfection and the fried oyster chowder was freaking amazing. I'm looking forward to our next trip to Louisiana. I love you guys!

I brought a group of 15 in to Axum one night and they not only accommodated our size, but they also accommodated some of our group's dietary needs. One person wasn't able to eat onions or garlic and they made a special dish just for her. Some of the best Ethiopian food in the city. I will definitely be coming back here.

Moving some of my old reviews over to Yelp. This review was originally written/posted on 20 Dec 2007.

I've been to all three Natural Way locations. This location seems a bit smaller than the Webster Groves location (Webster Groves is my pick out of the three). Regardless though, they have a lot of good vegetarian options, but I feel that they lack variety and could carry more vegan products. Nonetheless, the employees are really nice and *always* extremely helpful!

My first time with Afghani food, though the dishes we tried seemed very familiar.  Prices were a bit on the higher side, but this isn't a doner kebab takeaway!

You will need a group of six people at least to reserve the spot where you can all sit around a low table with your shoes off. Good to know in the future!  We were miffed to know we were short one person to get it and we almost considered dragging someone off South Street to join us - hahaaha.

The ambiance was lovely - our table of five could easily chat and hear each other. It's definitely a white table, candle light and clinking glasses kinda place. We shared a number of different dishes, none of which I care to attempt to spell out, but everything was delicious.  I loved my Afghani meatballs, my sister loved  her kebab (not the most appetizing looking thing, but it was spiced well), and the four different appetizers we tried out were all gone quickly (they were on the smaller side, so we could each only have a bite or so each).
Hands down my favorite restaurant in New Orleans. I've been coming here for five years and it never disappoints. Staff is friendly, food is consistently excellent.

Delicious giant pockets of cheese, meats, veggies etc, what else could I be wanting?! There are great choices of calzone ingredients to choose from and if I want to build my own, I have that option too. The salads are also huge portions and super filling if you're not in the mood for a tasty calzone. Great beers on tap and wine selection too. Service is fast and family friendly if you need to bring kiddos. The owner with the beard is rather nice on the eyes as well, so that's a plus

Might edit my rating later, need to see how Sunday night turns out.

Have frequented Maggiano's religiously since I work in the area.  Have had Groups there multiple times, even one that filled one of their larger banquet rooms.  So it was a no brainer to consider Maggiano's for a family Xmas eve dinner. 

All that said; I am so disappointed in a gentleman named Brewster...here's the deal; have a reservation for a large party (8) at a very busy time (Xmas Eve) and had called to see if we could add an extra person.  I called completely understanding that this may be a long shot, not expecting they/he could come thru in a pinch!  He did!!  Awesome 

Unfortunately, he was so rude about it (didn't even say "goodbye") when he hung up the phone, I couldn't believe it!!  Seriously??!!  

Thanks for fitting us in Brewster, I do appreciate that, but geez, at least if your going to give me something, do it with a little grace...tis the season I suppose!!

Update; well regardless of how rude Brewster had been on the call for the reservation; the dinner ended up fantastic!  Excellent service, great food...highly recommend it for a large party!!

Management is rarely on your side here. Hopefully you never have any issues but if you do like the cleaning guy stealing your things and yelling at you on multiple occasions, you will not be taken care of by management. There are way more apartments with professional staff in the gulch area than what I've experienced here. If you work with maintenance directly they are pretty good about it luckily I have gotten to know those guys. The cleaning guy is running some kind of side business selling things the residents throw away which makes him all too eager to take your things. I know this because he has asked me about buying those things off him before...didn't think I would be having issues with solicitors at my gulch apartment. Just a really weird experience.

I'm from SoCal and have been to very, very hipster places (including PDX), but Milktooth might actually take the cake. It's in a converted seven-bay garage and is influenced by all types of cultures - Spanish on the wall directing you to the bathroom, traditional Jewish cuisine with a twist as well as miso soup on the menu) But, I really enjoyed it even though we waited a little over an hour. 

We had the: 

*potato & rutabaga latke (acorn squash butter, green harissa cream, scallion) - this was SO good. I don't think I've ever had a latke, but it was tasty. Not too oily. The flavors will the butter, cream and scallion were perfect. 

*cranberry walnut & geneva & raclette grilled cheese (black truffle honey, local sunny duck egg) - Whew, I'm glad I shared this dish because it was very heavy. Extremely delicious but if I ate the entire grilled cheese myself, I'd definitely fall into a food coma. 

*indiana hot chicken wings (dried chiles & crystal sauce, bleu cheese dressing, carrot & celery slaw) - this was SERIOUS business. I've had seriously hot nashville chicken, but damn this was SO spicy. I loved it though!

The only thing I didn't love was the camellia drink I had (apple, matcha, pistachio and steamed milk). It was grainy from the pistachio maybe? and just an interesting but not that tasty combination of flavors. Also, a small cup was $6!!! Ridiculous.

Last time here was Mardi Gras 2015 at this hotel. This place is always clean and front desk is pleasant. The room was a nice size 2 double beds living area with pull out couch and full kitchen . Now king suite same setup with pull out couch and full kitchen. Plenty of outlets for everything. Mon-Tues nightly reception with lite snacks and acoholic drinks .Breakfast was eggs sausage cereal and some fresh fruit coffee/tea/juice

I've gotten pizza to go from Top Tomato and it's always delicious. Their speciality pizzas are perfect (IMO) - They have a thin crust and lots of toppings. The bruschetta and mediterranean are favorites of mine. I even think the plain pizza is pretty delicious as is.

One of my favorite brunch places in the St. Louis. Rustic, delicious, very friendly staff. I can't remember ever having better blueberry pancakes (which you can have cooked in bacon grease if you so choose). The doughnuts are a fantastic appetizer and come with a side of warm chocolate dipping sauce. The coffee is great! Pro-tip: I would download the NoWait app before trying to come here.... you can check in on line from home and save yourself waiting 45 mins (at a minimum) at the restaurant.
Came back tonight after a few months. Sitting at the bar and service is terrible. Bartenders are totally oblivious to us. Will be even longer before we return again. Such a disappointment.

I love sushi, it's right up there with pizza. I only eat veggie sushi and their avocado roll was great. Also I had a pot of green tea, also great as was my miso soup. 

Our server, Mayumi, was friendly and attentive. 

And now for the cons.....
website said my avocado roll (at dinner) was $4
The menu said the avocado roll was ........$6
The bill? .........$7 each.
The spicy edamame was 1.50 extra for spicy?
My husband's spicy chicken was not a favorite. 

One small thing. We were seated 10 ft from the door and were hit by a cold breeze with every person entering. 

Not sure if we will return.
My husband says three stars is generous.

Mayumi gets five stars though.
Got the primavera and the antipasto misto for lunch. Order came on time and both salads were delicious, all ingredients were fresh.  Will definitely get again.
Confused about all the good reviews. We went here for breakfast. The service, food and cleanliness of the restaurant was very disappointing. I don't see us returning.

I have been a customer with this restaurant since their opening. I use them a minimum of twice a week. As of tonight my patronage ceases. I called regarding the order. I typically order the same special which was the case tonight.  When it came back wrong I called and was told oh I only heard large pizza.  Ironically I never said that as its a special that I request. I then said ok well just send over the 2nd pizza. Well she then said I was charged for the order she heard and then a delivery charge ..I was like delivery charge??she then promptly adds well other pizza places do it. I said yes they do with properly letting the customer know beforehand or in writing in their brochures. She said well this is how we do it...so tonight will be my last order. She never even tried to accommodate her error in taking the order wrong and make amends , especially with a long time good customer.  The manager definitely needs to train her staff in to understanding the importance of good customer service..without the customer there is no business...

Props to the community members that make this family friendly event possible. We have so much fun every year "oooooing and awwwwing" at all the houses. I'm in such awe of the families that work so hard and allow their neighborhood to be packed with people throughout December, I can't imagine the logistics it must take for them just coming and going from their homes.

Each year there are awesome classics along with fun new displays. This year we were in love with the Stranger Things tribute and the Star Ward manger. So much fun! 

There are usually food vendors with hot cocoa, hot dogs, and popcorn. Also Port-a-potties sprinkled throughout neighborhood-much appreciated.

Event is free, but if you are able don't forget to take a canned food item or some cash to donate to the Community Food bank at the entrance! Great organization that can never have enough support. 

Pups are welcome on leashes, our pup loves to go and show off her Christmas sweater.
I will never eat there again. The worker brought her sampler bowl over and meat was placed back in serving dish. Against my better judgement, I ordered anyway and had food poisoning the next day.

Amazing and such awesome people working here. I've had friends recommending this to me forever, and finally made it by. The food rocks, the atmosphere is relaxed, and it's just SUCH an underrated Santa Barbara treasure. LOVE!

Had the best experience with driver Byron. He made the whole process effortless for us after an unfortunate situation. We appreciated his flexibility, excellence, and hard working attitude greatly today. Not to mention, the most affordable option we found!

My wife and I are fairly new to the area. We have tried most Mexican restaurants in the area and have not found a good one until now.

I have been there 4 times (3 times in Weldon Springs and once at the newer St. Charles location). The food has been great on every occasion. And each time I have ordered a different dish.

I would like to add that we mainly order carry out. We dined in once at the St. Charles location. Dining room was nice and the service was excellent. The Weldon Springs location appears to have once been a Wendy's. So it is relatively small. I personally would not dine in there as they have fluorescent lighting in the ceiling that totally destroys the atmosphere.

I was a fan of this place before it moved into a fancier setting. It used to be a hole in the wall place where you were guaranteed to wait outside if you came on a Saturday during regular lunch hours and even irregular lunch hours! My SO and I were so saddened that it decided to move to a new location because we didn't know where to go for solid BBH as we wait for it to open back up again. But the wait is over!!! We both ordered the deluxe BBH and while the taste is the same and still so delicious I thought the freshness of the beef cuts dropped. It tasted like the beef was several days old. Perhaps the BBH we got was on the later end of the batch, because I do know at the old place- they mass make it during one of the days and just store it in plastic containers and reheat as it is ordered. Will definitely give it many more chances because the flavor is still solid.

As a vegetarian for a few years now, I can't say I ever crave the taste of meat, including burgers. 

Burger Study offers the Beyond Beef veggie burger that "bleeds" (from the use of beets) and was created for omnivores to give it a shot in the hopes that it'll convince them to not eat as much meat. I was excited, at first, to see that this place carried this. 

Now that I've tried it, I hope that Burger Study will look into creating their own veggie burger, in addition to the Beyond Beef patty that they currently use. I feel that the Beyond Beef burger option was an "easy way out" for them. Put it on the grill and it's done....not much effort involved. It tastes eerily a lot like meat and the bleeding part is just weird for me.

I tried a few of the sides while dining here (all of which come separate). They were all a-okay but the portions are way too small for the price tag that comes along with them. I honestly don't remember which apps we tried as nothing left a major mark for me.

My biggest issue with Burger Study: the price tag + the small portion sizes just don't add up. I always create two meals when I dine out. I ate all of my burger (and sampled a few apps) and was still hungry.

My favorite part of the dining experience was the bourbon milkshake.... now THAT was yummy and worth the price tag. They bring out the milkshake and then pour the bourbon into the milkshake in front of you. Pretty neat. 

In terms of decor and interior: it could use some work. It takes the restaurant name fairly seriously. Books around and some random photos and that's about it. 

Burger Study has the potential to be a great place; however, at the time of this writing, there are other, better burger spots around Indy that I'd recommend checking out before this place, especially for you vegetarians/vegans.

Typically consistent chain Chinese food, although I prefer smaller Chinese places.  I have always gotten lo mein noodles here and the quality is the same every time.

This location is hard to get to off Allisonville, you have to turn at the McDonalds then sharp right at the florist.  Parking brake is recommended if you are on the hill (it makes sense when you see it).

Stopped in for dinner and drinks before a concert. We sat at the bar and had great service. My husband had the Shewman Special, which he gets every time, and I got the Chicken Avocado Club. I usually get the Buffalo Chicken Wrap but decided to change it up and was not disappointed. The waffle fries are always great. This is my husband's favorite restaurant so we go here pretty often. The location is great if you're going to an event at Banker's Life.

Amazing food, amazing service. Highly recommended! Had the Italian beef, everything from the house made chips to the pickle to sandwich itself, were all excellent. Bring your wives, bring your kids, they feeding everybody!!
Amazing flavor and presentation. Friendly wait staff. I love jalepenos on my sushi and they have two rolls with them as ingredients. Yay!

After a wonderful Christmas celebration at our son's home, we stayed the night at Gaylord Opryland before driving home.

The property is lovely and we looked forward to staying here to enjoy the facility and the decorations.

Shortly after 7 AM on December 26, we were rudely awakened by the noise of trucks, hammers and workers shouting! Our room was located directly beside an ACTIVE CONSTRUCTION SITE!!!!  Is this the reason for the "resort fee" charge??? 

This hotel is massive so why was our room literally on top of the construction site for a new water park? Why weren't we told that when we checked in???? 

I can't describe how disappointed we were!! 

BEWARE if you stay here!!!

Food good, entertainment good, service good,  but boat is WAY past its prime.  Furniture in the state rooms needs to be replaced and ship needs to be taken off line for a good cleaning.  Our second cruise on this ship and probably our last.
We love it here. Green curry is my favorite, and they gave great boba teas. Everyone is always so friendly too!

Getting a table on a Friday night was slow even though we had called ahead for seating, so we stopped by the bar for a drink while we waited. The bar was packed, but the bar tenders were quite friendly and quick to service us. 

Once seated the service was quick, but did feel like we were being rushed through our meals. 

I ordered the guacamole bacon burger.  The burger was pretty lackluster, and the guacamole was flavorless and a little too viscous, all running off the burger as I grabbed the bun to get my first bite. The dominating flavor of the meal was the onion that it was topped with. 

The wife had seafood Mac and cheese which she said was very good. 

Beer selection was good and they had a decent amount of seasonal beers to choose from. 

This visit was exactly what I recall from the last time I visited about 6 years ago, which unfortunately is not enough to lure me back anytime soon.

Sometimes I feel like I'm in a relationship with Café Envie. I visit often since I work around the corner and I'm never let down by the mouthwatering breakfast sandwiches and paninis. 
From the moment I walked in over a year ago, the staff treated me as if they had known me my whole life. Greeting me with a friendly smile and making time for small talk even when busy. 
Coffee is fresh and always hot. I'm always a little hesitant to review coffee shops since some let their coffee sit and get bitter. This does NOT happen at Cafe Envie. I've gotten coffee throughout the day and into the evening. It's always fresh.

This was our second time here. We were here a year ago and had a great burger and really enjoyed the patio. 

We went back hoping for a similar experience. The patio was lovely as always, the waitstaff was attentive. 

The food was hit and miss. Between the 4 of us, 2 left satisfied and the other two not so much. We had a severely overcooked veggie burger that was sent back, a range avocado burger that was completely devoid of any flavor. 

The tortilla soup and mushroom burger were good. 

For the price for a burger I was hoping for more. 

Not sure I will go back for more than a beverage.

Very good service. The staff was friendly, the service was fast and the manager came to my table at the end to check if everything was ok. I'm giving 3 stars because of the food, not great, not bad. Maybe I'm being unfair because I didn't try the pizza, which apparently is their bread & butter.

The food menu was very brief. I ordered the Salmon sandwich which I found out was terrible, after a few bites. My friend was also disappointed in the food. The restaurant has a lot of hype, so we expected more. Our waitress Allison (curly brown hair) was very helpful and amazing, though!

October/November 2017: Moved from Philly to NJ.  2 guys in uhaul truck show up.  No moving blankets, no supplies.  While moving my stuff out of the house they did $950 worth of damage to the house.  Literally threw our stuff in the truck with no rythme or reason to it, used no moving blankets, etc.  When they arrived EVERYTHING I owned was scratched or otherwise damaged.  

The mover blamed me for the damage to the house because he asked for my help when moving.  Started to yell at me and then the owner of the moving company tells me he lost his temper.  

Long story short, the employees are no longer with the company because they have had other issues.  But the bigger problem is that Art (owner) refuses to pay for the damages.  At this point I just want my $$ for the damage to the old place and move on.  Instead he offered me $500 and has then disappeared.  Refuses to answer any calls/email/texts.

Stay far far away.  Shady and very unprofessional.

Great seafood!! If you love mozzarella sticks, definitely try the spicy cheese curds!! They're amazing!! 

When the weather is nice, ask to sit outside, the view is gorgeous! It's so relaxing out there. Great place for a casual date.

Really cute set up and the food is super fresh and delicious! My boss and I dined here together and sat outside. Just be aware that it is right next to a train track so you'll have to pause conversation for while as the trains pass through during certain times of day. I think kids would really enjoy watching the trains roll through though!

Last week I had my care detailed and Mario did an incredible job.  I have young children and they had left numerous stains on the back seat.  I was amazed that they were able to get all of them out and now my car looks brand new.  Amazing work!

I love this store!!!! If you are in need of unique ingredients, cultural gifts/furnishings, or maybe a bottle of wine or two...this is your place. They often run sales and have special emails that will give you additional discounts on everyday products. I always seem to find way more than I'm actually shopping for at this location. I stop in every chance I get!

Wow that was amAzing!!! I typically don't eat BBQ because I'm too picky with it, but my boyfriend loves it so he dragged me here... and I'm so glad he did! I tried his chopped beef, sausage, potato salad, Cole slaw, and even some of his red velvet cake. All of it was incredible. Seriously, this place turned me into a BBQ eater! Next time I'll definitely get my own plate! YUM!!! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

What a great spot! Nice atmosphere. We both got pizzas because they sounded so good. I usually never eat the crust but OMG it was so good. I actually eat the crust first!!! Drink we're tasty too :-) Staff was friendly and responsive. Great prices and would go back.

Our heater wouldn't stay running last night...of course when its going to be in 20's. Called, left message and got a return call in 15 min. Told Jet what was happening. He said he could be out at Noon today. Wow, really! He was here promptly at noon. Asked a few questions and got right up where furnace was located. Ignition Sensor was really dirty. Cleaned it and made sure unit worked. It did! Let it run. Turned off and restarted, it worked. Very thankful for prompt service.  I was pleased that he didn't charge for anything but service call. Nothing else needed to be replaced. Thank you so much!

I bought a bedroom set for my son on 12:7/2017 and also a kitchen dine in set 2 days later. Firstly, when we bought the set, the salesman said that " it would be no problem to remove the old bed frames". Secondly, they delivered the headboard alone a week ago and said they didn't have the foot board yet(who delivers half a bed?). Thirdly, they finally show up today, 12/23/2017 and they refused to take the old bed away. Fourthly, the workers tracked mud all up my steps and bedroom because they didn't wear the protective booties. I will never, ever buy even a trash can from this trash store. They will say anything for a sale and it's completely different when you actually deal with the delivery and set up.

I'm severely lactose intolerant so I love the fact they have 5-6 coconut milk based ice creams. Tonight I tried Red Velvet Oreo and it was great. Family all enjoyed the flavors they had especially the Candy Cane. Prices completely fair. Tip: at night the place may or may not look open & busy - don't just drive by. It's simply the way the building and signage is. One of my fav ice cream places in the entire Tampa Bay Area.

Fabulous beer garden.  There's a large outdoor patio area with a lot of tables and chairs.  Inside is a good size... not too big and not too small.  There are a ton of craft beers.  They have fabulous red sangria.  When it's packed it can be a bit loud.  Glad Seminoles Heights has this relatively recent addition.

This place has always been a go to if you're starving, and want cheap eats. The fried stuff is pretty good, the soups are usually pretty tasty, and the area where you can get noodles, or fried rice cooked to order is nice. It's BYOB. If you go there at lunchtime you can pretty much guarantee that you will see Russians sipping vodka. My favorite memory is when I saw 2 couples literally throw blows over some crab legs. You would have thought they were the last crab legs on the planet. I think I may go there this afternoon.

This is a must visit in Philadelphia for breakfast coffee or breakfast sandwiches. The breakfast sandwich is made right then and there. Nothing is frozen and everything was fresh. Very helpful owners and patient while we looked at the menu.

This is one of the best meals I have had in years.  We were a party of four and each person agreed that this was worth the two month wait.  We ordered a variety of items of the menu as well as a few specials.  Everything was prepared to perfection and the portion sizes were on the larger size which was nice.  The pate was amazing!  The timing between each course was perfect.  The service was impeccable.  This is a treasure on this side of the bridge.  We will definitely be going back and plan to make my reservation tomorrow because I know this is going to be a destination for many foodies as the word spreads.

After moving here from Florida I have yet to find a good pizza. After reading all the good reviews on this place we ordered from them tonight. Yuck pizza -soggy crust.i don't know  what they consider NY style crust but thin. Flat &  soggy is Not!! Wings are so TINY and they charge $1.00 a wing Wow Rip Off! I guess the owner is laughing all the way to the bank! Never again!!!

Adding more pics of this great local gallery & destination for locals & visitors , young & old alike. Also holiday performances music, dance ,& food watch website for details .adding pics of closed chapel from fire
Kevin is awesome. Honest, compassionate, reasonably priced, on time and overall a good guy. I'm book marking him for sure!!!

Just for a return was sooooo difficult, the way the guy talked to us not nice , kind of look down on people. First time to Burberry store and would be the last! So sad that's a high-end store would treat customers so poor!!!

The donuts here are not too shabby, and if you're looking for a donut fix, this is the place to go if you're around. I would recommend them to put the donut display near the entrance where people can see where they need to go and see how many donuts are left, or what kind they have. Overall, I enjoyed the design of the joint because of its donut feel and the funny signs that are on the walls.

They will charge cover saying that they will be open till early morning. But they will kick you out and close early if there are less people. You will not be getting what you are offered basically, so spend your money somewhere else, unless you wan to pay the cover for half an hour or so.

Posh, chic and neat. 
Perfect place for happy hour and lunch. 
Biggest shout out to chefs George, alyssa and Jessica Latorre for giving us an amazing culinary experience. 
It was a pleasure seeing chef Bryan work (at the bar) in so much sophistication and gracefulness. His creative and seasonal cocktails are must tries!!!

Best hamburgers in the French Quarter! The staff is attentive but not overly, bartenders make some of the best drinks and hold good conversation even whenever they are busy. 
Saint Lawrence is a fantastic choice for many reasons but the atmosphere of the hole in the wall is really what does it for me. It's cozy and enjoyable year round.

Hands down, the best brunch in St. Louis! This place is indeed very hyped, but is completely worth it in my opinion. Love the open and casual atmosphere, even though it gets pretty crowded at times. Personally love the mugs they serve coffee in... they're nothing special, but something about them makes you feel at home. My favorite item on the menu is the salmon hash. It is spectacular (I've even gotten it to-go a few times)!

This hole in the wall restaurant has high-end southern food in a divey setting. The food is really something worth trying, especially the alligator cheesecake, but don't expect to be able to hold a conversation in there... it is VERY loud. Prepare to shout over all the noise!

It's nice to take the kids for the part of a day. This place is a bit worn when it comes to the jumpers. Kids love it so that's what is important. 
Be ware some parents don't keep much of an eye on their kids so if you have a smaller one is best to be a bit watchful as opposed to camping in your phone while the kids run around.
I only bring it up because an older 5 or 6 year old jumped over into my son's slide lane and then began purposefully stepping on his legs till I shouted at him. My 3 year old was frightened of that slide for the rest of the time we were there. I tried finding the kids parents just to let them know but they were no where in sight. 
I've worked with elementary kids and know some tumbling and knocked heads happens at these places but no child should think it's okay to try and step on and kick a smaller child. I will not tolerate it from any kids. 
The kid had a blast on the pirate boat slide. I'm just putting out the word that not all kids know how to behave around others so speak up. It takes a village.

Went in for my first experience on a super busy night. Used NoWait which helped get to the table, but unfortunately had a bit of trouble keeping an attentive waitress. I understand the business, but we only saw our waitress a few times. She was nice when we saw her, but didn't bring us our food and the girl who did had to check on why our drinks had still not arrived, but the food did. We also had to ask a different server for the check and didn't even see our waitress until we were walking out - we paid in cash so we wouldn't have to wait any longer. The food was tasty but a little less than the ideal heat temperature I expect of getting in a plate of barbecue and mac and cheese. Still giving this three stars because I know the reputation of this restaurant and will give them the benefit of the doubt of still being new to the neighborhood on a busy night.

My experience at Coast Dental this morning was beyond horrific! I cannot believe that I wasted my time, money, and energy. Let me begin:

When I arrived for my 10:30AM appointment, I was left waiting for over 40 minutes before being called back into the exam room. Then the medical assistant came in and told me that she would be taking TWELVE x-rays, despite my informing her that I have already had recent x-rays that I can transfer over from my previous dentist. She insisted that she needed to take her own x-rays and despite my protests about not wanting to be exposed to radiation from a dozen x-rays, she took the images anyway. On the 11th x-ray, I opened my mouth slightly because of the pressure from the metal rod in my mouth and the stick fell out. The medical assistant came running in the room and rudely said, "You don't have to spit it out!" I was shocked and told her that I hadn't intended for it to fall out of my mouth, that I absolutely had not spit it out, and that because my arms were restrained by the weighted x-ray jacket, I did not have use of my arms to catch the stick as it was falling (it only landed on my chest, not on the floor.) For the remainder of the x-ray session, the medical assistant was unnecessarily rude.

Then I waited another half hour for the dentist to come in. When she arrived, she briefly looked at my teeth, told me that I had not cavities, and said that I would have to make an additional appointment with the dental hygienist for a cleaning (though I had made my appointment for a cleaning today, they said that they do one appointment for x-rays, a second appointment for an exam, a third appointment for a cleaning... instead of the one appointment that most dentists do for an annual cleaning.) I have a chip on one of my front teeth, so I asked the dentist about having it shaved down. She said that she would refer me to the in-house orthodontist who would take care of it. Then the dentist left.

I was left in the exam room for another 40 minutes before the medical assistant came back in and said, "We forgot to tell you that you can leave now." What?? You left me in the exam room unnecessarily for over half an hour?!?! 

I have Invisalign, so before I left the room, I asked the medical assistant if there is anything that I can do at home to clean the brackets. She said that she would check with Dr. Patel and let me know in a few minutes. Instead of going to ask the doctor, I saw her walk into the break room (leaving the door open), pull her lunch out of the fridge, and sit down next to another medical assistant. I waited for 20 more minutes while I watched her chat with her friend and finally realized that she was not going to ask the dentist my question, so I got up and left. 

When I checked out, I asked the front receptionist (Chris) to make an appointment with the in-house orthodontist to have my chipped tooth smoothed. He told me that since I have Invisalign, if I want to see the orthodontist for any reason whatsoever, I have to start my Invisalign treatment COMPLETELY OVER and pay out of pocket. That's right: even though having my chipped tooth shaved down has NOTHING to do with my Invisalign (which is being treated by another orthodontist), the only way that the in-house orthodontist will see me for my chipped to is if I agree to re-do my Invisalign treatment with him by having all of my brackets taken off, the Invisalign molds re-done, and new retainers made. This was the most absurd thing that I had ever heard and was nothing more than a greedy play at having me pay out-of-pocket for a treatment that is almost complete (I'm on my last Invisalign tray) and that has nothing to do with my chipped tooth. Between this and the 12 x-rays taken by the medical assistant, I question the ethics of Coast Dental. 

I wish that I had read the other reviews online before attending my appointment this morning because every other patient has detailed my experience and it would have saved me from wasting a beautiful morning. Coast Dental does not operate like a normal dentist's office. They seem intent on drawing out treatment plans to maximize their profit, they are manipulative in their practices, and they seem to care very little for the patient. Additionally, the exam room was filthy. The floors had dirt and dust. When I entered the room, the medical assistant told me to place my purse on top of the "medical waste" bin. THE MEDICAL WASTE BIN! I told her that I was pretty certain that was a biomedical hazard and that I didn't want to place my bag on top of the open medical waste container, but she told me that was the only place for it. Again, another completely bizarre occurrence at Coast Dental.

If you make an appointment here, plan to spent at least 2 hours and to only be seen by the dentist for approximately 10 minutes. Be ready to be dismissed, minimized, manipulated, and prompted to pay out-of-pocket for completely absurd treatment plans.

I think one of the best poke bowls I ever had.
So many different ingredients and flavors. Just wonderful!

My wife, 6 year old daughter and I arrived on a Thursday during lunch time and noticed a sign advising to wait to be seated. We waited but noticed no one was around to receive us. So after looking around and finding no wait staff, we decided to go seat ourselves. After about 3 minutes we were greeted by a waitress. 

The restrooms were not clean. This should've been the first red flag. The doors, light switches and anywhere people touch were caked with dark brown grease/dirt and there were no paper towels available either. This made me wonder about the cleanliness of the kitchen. 

My wife ordered the cashew chicken and the Mongolian beef for me. The mongo beef was good with green and white onions and a good sauce. The cashew chicken looked and tasted bad. The veggies appeared to have been canned and the the sauce was milky white colored. The chicken was breaded and soggy. Definitely stay away from their cashew/almond chicken if you decide to come here. 

The egg rolls that came with the lunch special were freshly made but a little hard and weird tasting. The fried rice was good. The service was okay. The wait staff was friendly but not very interested in checking up on us. Had to wave them down for things.

$7.50 lunch special enticed us but would have rather gone to Panda Express across the street if we would have known about the lack of cleanliness and food quality.

I'm not going to say if Michael Vasta is a good or bad therapist due to my experience being overshadowed after I was instructed to be in my bra and panties. Not wanting to be a prude or irritate, I complied. Immediately upon Laying down, I felt completely uncomfortable while he was doing Thai stretches and shiatsu. I did address him directly after I shared my story with others who were appalled. He apologized and acknowledged he never took a moment to "read" his client and said he will never do massages in underwear unless a person asks. What? I will never know if that is a true statement or not. So just giving at heads up to unsuspecting clients who could feel distressed like I was.

Place is 40 Mins from me and I would even justify driving 20+ miles to this place 

Pho
-HUGE bowl for the price $8-8.50 (12-12-17)
-One of the best broths I've ever had. Flavorful, yet not tainted by memories of excessive msg. It'll smack your tastebuds without warning. 
-meat is fresh, not too fatty/tough even when soaked in broth for a while
-noodles are prepped perfectly 
-all veggies like the bean sprouts are fresh

Spring rolls 
-exactly what a spring roll should be. No disappointment

-Authentic family run business
-Nice looking booths, good change from traditional cheap looking chairs. Abundant choices of beverages in the fridges
-they even have fish sauce along with the condiments 
-Plenty of street parking
The craw fish ettouffe was Phenomenal. Good service too ! The place is simple but very authentic. I recommend it 100%

I'm giving this establishment 3 stars for one reason, customer service. The food is great but the way these people will speak to you is ridiculous. I order from there at least once a week and the one time i have a minor issue i was treated HORRIBLY! Not only do i order here often i promote their business every chance i get. Not sure if i will order again.

BROWN LETTUCE. This place USED to have the best salads on the planet but the last 3 times I ordered the lettuce was old wet and brown. I told our bartender and he said I'll let the kitchen know but never took the salad off my bill. Today we ordered takeout because we're extremely busy with Christmas orders and I got another brown salad. I went back and told the food manager and he yelled at ME for not being nice. We used to eat at this place 4-5 times a week between dinners and lunch take out. No more. You're off my list. How dare you serve me old brown slop for food and then yell at me. 

A different horrible experience was a few months ago. Bring noise cancelling headphones because the music is intended to please the staff NOT the customers. Loud, head banging horrible music. I looked around the patio and inside the restaurant and aside from a few youngsters at the bar we were the youngest people in the place and I'm sure no one was enjoying it. My brain was bleeding. And when the music slowed down a depressing song came on about a man using needles and crying because all his friends were dead. Made for a very unappetizing and horrible lunch experience. 

We usually get take out because our very first experience with this place was very similar but lately they've been burning our food beyond recognition and forgetting important items like salad dressing. How do you let food leave your restaurant like that? 

When the food is done right  it's really good. The Greek salad and the crispy salmon are my fav dishes. But I can't deal with the music. We eat out everyday but there are numerous good restaurants in our area to choose from.

All I have to say is I came today with the family 4 adults and 2 baby's, and was told it's a 15-20 min wait but the place is half empty kind of ridiculous I guess it's so hard to put 2 little tables together.
Great selections to choose from and nice people working there; not to mention the rolled ice cream concoction I got called "The Monster" was delicious.

Ugh the pho is so good. I wish it were closer to home so I could go more often (I work and live in Jefferson Parish.) Reasonable priced and delicious food. I had the spicy shrimp pho the first time and it was delicious. May try another type of pho the next time I go but definitely will get pho. So good!!!

Stop reading reviews and go eat at Murph's. 

Still here? Well, I guess I'll give you my two cents, then. I don't know how anyone can give this place anything but 5 stars. Murph's is one of a kind, and it does what it does perfectly. It's a relaxed neighborhood bar, staffed by neighborhood people, and an authentic Italian chef who creates some of the best Italian food on the planet. Trust me, I've eaten so much Italian food. It's a problem, actually.

You won't find a better meal, at a better price in the city. I have read a few of the negative reviews, and I just can't get with them. Customer service issues? Never in my million, bazillion visits to Murph's have I experienced bad service. They get super busy in there, sure. It can be loud sometimes, sure. It's a flippin' neighborhood bar, not the GD Ritz! If the soup Nazi was running this place, if I had to wash my own dishes after, if I had to catch my food mid-air with my mouth, I would still be eating at this Murph's! (A side note about people who have ONE bad experience and feel the need to write a negative review for a business - someone's life work, the result of their dream, blood, sweat, and tears - all because it wasn't what you expected. Seek help.)

Furthermore, about Murph's, get the pear and cheese fiocchi if it's still on the revolving menu. My boyfriend and I usually split it as an appetizer (it's an entree), and then get two other pasta dishes for our meal, so we can consume as many dishes as possible in one sitting. It's all made fresh, it's all perfectly balanced, portions are just right and the prices cannot be beat. So far, after every meal we have been treated to a delicious limoncello, homemade by the chef's wife. It's outstanding, and just a nice touch, adding to the, "You're home. You belong here," feeling of the place.

I'm going to leave it at that for now, because I'm getting way too hungry writing this. it's a good thing I have plans to have dinner at Murph's tomorrow night.

My friends and I met here for Happy Hour.  
Great Space. Great atmosphere. 
Good HH deals.  I ordered the Brautwurst Sandwich with sauerkraut which came with mustard on the side.  I really enjoyed the food and the time there
This spot is pretty nice. The food in this park is pretty trash. Beer selection is also terrible. But sometimes there's great music. Music makes up for the wack food.

Excellent store to pick up what my fur child needs.  Very friendly, knowledgeable staff, and well stocked with necessities.

Today they had two very adorable guinea pigs in the store.  I had to stop and visit with those cuties.

They have a great selection of dog and cat food, treats and toys.  They also carry beds, leashes and habitats. They cover lots of other pets as well, but I didn't venture too far into the store since the things I came for were near the front,  and I had to get what I needed and skedaddle.

I'll be back to peruse another time.

The lack of concern for their customers at this CVS is truly astounding. They take multiple days to fill a prescription and will only actual fill it if you come into the store and wait (behind all the others waiting)- regardless of how many days they have had the request. I won't be returning to the store or the Pharmacy - especially if my health depends on it!

Frady's is a super-friendly neighborhood establishment to get fresh home cooked breakfast and hot daily specials to take out for lunch and dinner. Get eggs anyway you want it for breakfast, hot meals and po-boys for lunch/dinner or coffee and maybe a beer anytime of day. There are cold cuts for sale, deviled eggs to die for and a modicum of groceries. There are a few covered outside tables to enjoy the neighborhood and the weather. This is one of the few breakfast places that opens at 7:30. Normally they close at 6 PM but on Saturday they're open until 3pm. Did I mention the Grumpy old man breakfast? (two eggs, home fries, Bacon and toast).

I was surprised how pretentious the wait staff was. Never even took a drink order, so had to go to the bar. Since I had to go to the bar and wait for the drinks, by the time I got back to the table, my fried oysters were ice cold. 

Garlic chicken was ok, but at times sun dried tomatoes over powered the flavor. 

Braised rabbit was not falling off the bone tender. It had not simmered long enough. 

I would say this was the rare unpleasant dining experiences in NO.

If you have not to the Bruka,  you will have to make your way down. I have lived in the Reno area since 1996, and this is the first time going to the Bruka theatre
It is not a big theatre, but a small intimate theatre where there really is not a bad seat.
We say the Nutcracker, it was hilarious, but that is another story.
I really believe in supporting local theatre, and this group does a awesome job.
The theatre is set up in a black box set up.
If you are not familiar with that term, it is a small theatre where literally the first row is on the stage.
The actors make due with very little stage and
Backdrop changes.
I hope to be back soon.

This is one of the best Chinese and Sushi restaurants in Reno.  That is one of the biggest reasons I gave it 5 stars because both types of food are excellent.  Fresh, light sauces on the Chinese food and minimal rice on the sushi. Friendly staff and great food can't go wrong.

Great addition to the Rittenhouse restaurants. Came for Christmas Eve dinner and wasn't disappointed! Seating took about 10 minutes, longer than expected with a reservation but service was very pleasant. Atmosphere is romantic and warm. Cocktails and food are great! Definitely would recommend the rolls with chive butter, fried chicken, and the BROCCOLI is to die for. Who would have thought it would be such a stand out? 

Would definitely come again.

Impeccable and I mean- impeccable service. This hotel is not only clean and beautiful, the hospitality of the staff takes your experience to a whole another level. We came here with our one-year old, who is not easy to travel with, and the staff did everything to make sure  we are comfortable. You get A lot more value for what you pay which is generally the opposite for most hotels. I can't say enough about the service.

Love this place. Good food and pleasant servers. 
Pancakes are wonderful as well as the California BLT.

Waited 20min in the lobby because it wasn't ready when I got there, when I went back to the counter they said it had been ready for 15min. They didn't even bother letting me know it was ready. On top of that, our order was missing the cheese sauce we paid extra for.
Lunch here is $9 or something for an appetizer, entree, and soup!! This is an amazing deal. We were in and out ! It's delicious Thai food and I would gladly return.

Great Food! Service was a little slow, due to a car issue with an employee, but overall was great!  Our family had a little bit of everything! Burger was great, Isaac's scorcher sauce was great on the wings as well! They were still putting the art on the wall when we were there and looked great!

This theater is disgusting. The seats old and stained with Lord knows what. Tickets cost more than the new Cobb theater at Tyrone. They don't have a 2 drink and popcorn combo like most other theaters. I know why we don't come down here anymore. This place needs a major cleaning/renovation.

Based on another Yelp review, I made an appointment and it was super easy. I definitely second the recommendation that you MAKE AN APPOINTMENT ahead of time. I scheduled online, and even though I arrived 20 minutes early, they took me right back. It's obvious that they prioritize appointments over walk-ins. 

It's also obvious that they are used to dealing with patients who are combative or otherwise difficult. The nurses were very no-nonsense ("Don't flush, don't wash your hands until you bring me the sample, you have four minutes etc. etc.) and aren't really in the mood for small talk. Come prepared (read: hydrated), be polite, and it'll take 5 minutes to get in and out.

Our waitress was great. Food was probably a 3.5. We ordered the chicken ranch sandwich. The atmosphere was a 0. Sat there with my wife and daughter listening to some white guy at the bar getting berated for at t least 15 minutes (when we were done) about how bad white people are etc.  what a freaking joke of a place. Our first impression of Philly did not disappoint. "City of brotherly love" my ass.

We ate here on a Friday night and had a great time!

Our service was the best we've had anywhere in a long time. Christina was super nice and helpful as well as attentive to us. Great food and drinks as well. 

Located in a good spot on the strip next to a few hotels, you can't beat something this good within walking distance. They have a lot of seating which is always nice (and a good sign).

I had the shrimp tacos which were amazing. They were sweeter than I normally like, as I normally like spicy, but they were delicious. They had jicama coleslaw with pineapple in it. The sauce on top really perfected it.

My husband had the blackened grouper sandwich which was cooked perfectly. 

Definitely recommend!

My daughter had two vision screenings at her daycare- one in July and one in early December of this year, during these last 6 months, they progressively worsened. As a result, I decided to locate an optometrist who works with pediatrics and has the patience needed. I called three different places that Google recommended including Envision Eyecare Center, Banner Ophthalmology,  and Sato's office. The Banner people were rude and not helpful (review pending), the staff at Sato's office were equally as rude and unhelpful; nonetheless, I made an appointment with them (for mid- January 2018). Finally, I called Envision Eyecare Center and they were so personable on the telephone and were able to get me in the following week. I called Sato's office and cancelled my appointment and showed up at Envision a few days ago (12/27/17). 

Everyone from the front desk person (Erica) to the optometric technician (Jessica) to Dr Barry and the licensed dispensing optician (Laura) were amazing and most of all patient with a 3 year old: 

Erica greeted us upon entry even though she was with another patient. We waited patiently for our turn and then check-in, filled out appropriate paperwork, provided our insurance card and ID and sat in their waiting area. They even had a smaller kid-sized table and chairs. Erica came and showed my kiddo where the toys were and helped her get settled in as we patiently waited our turn. Unlike, most of my experiences with doctor's office we only waited the 15 minutes we were early and were then called back by Jessica. 

Jessica introduced herself to me, but most importantly to her- YES, TO A KID! Jessica asked my kiddo if she felt more comfortable with her sitting on my lap or on the chair alone, being my kid- she responded "alone." She then proceeded to ask me the questions only a parent could answer and would intermittently check-in with my kiddo. *MAJOR KUDOS FOR THAT* This built immediate rapport with my kiddo and my kiddo proceeded onto the exam. At the end of Jessica's part, she even remembered to get my kiddo the cup of water that she had previously promised her. *KUDOS X2 FOR FOLLOWING THRU*

Dr Barry came in, introduced himself to mom and dad and than to our kiddo. He was a slender, mid-height, older gentleman with one of the kindest faces I have ever seen. He had an appropriate level of energy and made us (mom & dad) laugh occasionally. He was extremely knowledgeable of his "trade" and was able to effectively explain to both of us what exactly was going on with our kiddo's eyes, how the school screening went and was his recommendations would be. By this time, my kiddo was becoming inpatient and her attention span was shorter and shorter, not to worry though, Dr. Barry was able to hold it for as long as he could for each step of his examination. He even offered to take a picture with her for her first exam, but she declined and told "next time." 

Finally, Dr Barry escorted us to a section adjacent to the waiting area where there were numerous frames, big, small and some for the kiddos. Laura came out and helped us. Showed us a cabinet with kiddo frames and my kiddo went away trying them on until she finally decided on ones she liked and the rest is history...well actually, we're waiting for them now. 

I've had glasses for many years and so has the hubby, we've only had two seamless interactions (including this one) and we're so happy we know our kiddo is in good hands. We were also happy to find out that we can bring our prescriptions to Laura (or one of the other ladies) and get our frames here as well!

I hate that I'm actually writing a review for a fast food chain, but this Wendy's is absolutely horrible. On multiple occasions, I've experienced the slowest customer service I've ever received. Took an abnormal 10+ minutes just to get through the drive-thru... after several cars decided to jump out of line due to the slowness. I thought this was supposed to be fast food?

Nice little place in East Nashville! I had lamb pita and husband had chicken pita both were very good and the meat was tender and juicy.   Street fries were also good!  Staff was friendly, service was fast and restaurant was clean. Can't wait to go back when it's nice out and sit in the patio area.

A fun yet cozy atmosphere here and the cocktails are quite good.  Decent beer selection and the staff is always really accommodating and nice.  My one complaint is the food (sometimes), mostly the price.  Although it was good, a CUP of chili & cornbread for $11?  $9 for a side of average mac n cheese?  Seems a little much to me.  Their burgers & chicken sandwiches are tasty, but overall I find the menu kind of meh.  Not a ton of diversity.

I'll definitely continue to go here because it is a fun and spacious place, but probably mostly just for drinks.
High walls and creative setting on the routes. They have plenty of bouldering space as well as a variety of terrain for roped climbing. What's not to love?

Eh, it was food and I was hungry. I'd hoped to go to the cafe just across the hall but the wait was ridiculous. Wanted a breakfast sandwich on a biscuit - they were out. So, croissant it was. It was HUGE. I was expecting a standard size but geesh, this would have fed 3 people. The sausage had good flavor but was on the greasy side. 

If you're in a pinch and not picky you could do ok I guess. Probably lots of other options nearby though. I won't be back.

The only place in New Orleans with completely mediocre food. $25 for bland fried fish and rice. Busboy was rude, rolled his eyes any time we asked for anything. The only thing you're paying for is live music from upstairs to be played thru speakers in the restaurant downstairs.

I happen to like the food, but am really starting to lose my patience with this location. Called in an order for burgers and was told 15 minutes. Walked in 12 minutes later, and had to wait another 20. I live 5 minutes away and found my food was cold, and the ranch had been diluted so much that you couldn't even taste the seasoning. It was like dipping my (soggy and gross) fries in warm milk. I don't like paying the surcharge for such poor quality. Get it together please, or I will be going to another place.

So I moved to Tennessee and have very limited options close by for needed work.  My singer told me about Corner Music - the place to go even though we have to drive down to Nashville.  These guys were friendly and supportive, got my guitar checked in and understood what I wanted (old guitar, don't want to do major work at this point).  Jeff called me 10 days later and apologized that it took so long!  This guy is swamped all the time!  He had to take the bridge off (38 years of tough abuse) and soak it to get the adjusting screws moving.  Set up is perfect, guitar looks great, he cleaned it up real nice.  At this point, I don't have many opportunities to buy gear but will certainly be using Jeff for all my setups and other work.

We were looking for a nice date night spot and this place was recommended. It was a Friday night around 6:45 and we were seated right away, but shortly after a line formed of people waiting for seats. 
The restaurant is large and simply decorated. It's BYOB, so don't forget your favorite bottle! All of the employees were  friendly. Our waitress was very busy but she was still attentive and a great server. 
We started with the salt and spicy pepper calamari. I was surprised that it didn't come with a dipping sauce, but after eating
It we decided it didn't need one. The little green chilies that were sprinkled on top were very spicy, which was a nice way to cut the richness and saltiness. We ate the whole plate- they were delicious. 
We also got the fried pork dumplings and they were very good as well. Pretty typical dumplings with a nice dipping sauce. 
For our meals we split the Singapore curry noodles and the chicken in spicy garlic sauce over jasmine rice. The curry noodles were different than most curries I've had. They were dry but had a nice flavor. The chicken in garlic sauce was addicting. I couldn't stop eating it, despite being incredibly full. We can't wait to eat our left overs today, and will definitely be coming back in the future.

Definitely wanna stop in at this diner/cafe if you're in the Tampa area. It's all American kinda food. I'm all about the breakfast menu though. It's a simple little spot but with a nice friendly non-pretentious vibe. Easy parking. Outdoor patio. Great service.
Ordered Caramel frappe at Drive thru, BIG MISTAKE! Took 30 min and there were only 2 cars in front of me.

Authentic French bakery, a French owner & Baker, managed by an authentic stylish French lady with a French accent! It feels like France in there :) I love this place! 
The space is an awesome transformation from the last cafe. All white, with a long white bar. Bold glass chandeliers, and lots of French charm.
The cases are filled with Nutella-whipped cream chouquettes, a Bouche de Noel, croissants, chausson au pommes (my fave) and pain Au chocolates. It's the real deal, authentic French pastries right here!!! The owner makes them all! 
I will be back very soon!

This was my first time eating at this establishment and I loved the CAT bagel sandwich. The tempeh was yummy but was not crunchy. I'd love to return to try other options. They do serve eggs and chicken for people who prefer those options. They have coffee, teas, and hot chocolate as  a few of their drink options.

They just can't get it right. Let's face it, this is fast food pizza, you know what quality you are getting. My complaint is about their service. Every few months I forget why I don't buy pizza here and make an order, and then I get reminded. In the last 4 visits I have had the following problems:

Twice have I gotten home to find that the pizza was either not cut at all, or only partially cut. You had one job dude with the pizza cutter. Remind me again why a minimum wage job should be a working wage? There's a reason some jobs should not pay enough to support a family.

Twice have I sat waiting for my pizza (over 15 minutes the most recent time!) only for some genius to look at the rack of boxed pizzas and realize that my order was sitting there all along. I can see the rack, I can see when boxed pizza is added to the rack. Not that there will be a next time, but if there was I would ask them to read me the names on each pizza if I show up and they tell me it isn't ready yet.

These are all problems specific to this location. I hope that they realize that there are 2 competitor pizza chains within 200 yards of them, because I sure do!

The "RP" is still the best party in town. Friendly staff, excellent entertainment, especially 6:00 to 8:00 when Jason plays. Happy hour prices are great and you can beat the $5 cover if you get there early (I've never had to pay it). Grab a booth and the chances are high that a fun couple or group of partiers will ask to join you which makes the night all the more interesting (lots of tourists, birthday celebrations and bachelorette groups). If you enjoy dancing, you have just found your go-to destination!

I brought the family here on a local's recommendation. The staff was friendly and sincere. Our server Seven was training someone and was still relaxed and happy. I recommend the tacos, they were delicious. For sure a dish I would come back here to eat. Most of the main entrees are average from what I saw and heard. The sandwiches, tacos and burgers are the " go to". We will come back.

I want to amend my initial review.  The owner reached out to me today to correct the order.  I must say, this doesn't happen often enough these days.  He was really concerned w my satisfaction.  Thank you Tony.  I will be giving your pizza another try.  It takes a special business owner to stay committed to quality.  

First time here and by reviews I was looking forward to it.  Got home (5 min away) and pizza soggy and looks a mess.  It tastes raw except for a quick turn in the broiler maybe.   Only positive is ranch sauce.
Great all around restaurant. Staff made me and my family feel comfortable and important. Cocktails and food are wonderful, very authentic
The concept and the gimmick of the Nitrogen freezing your treat is a great thrill for kids, but the wait is going to be awhile. I went mid-week and had to wait 20 minutes before I even ordered.

COMCAST BUSINESS Cloud Solutions is the absolutely WORST company to work with. They are not pro Small businesses!  Please know that you will put your company at risk if you use them as they will shut your business down.  Their customer service folks are cluel!  Be warned!

When I say a place has everything, I don't say so lightly or with little thought.

This go-to of golfing and gaming is host to numerous activities, foods, and libations to hydrate even the most finicky imbiber.  Prepare to have more choices than your happy-hour brain cares to make here.

1st, let's discuss the elephant in the room: golf.  25/35/45 are the price points per hour, and it gets pricier throughout the day.  You can have 6 playing per station, so average cost $7.50/hr peak not too bad.  And the games/range are fun/forgiving (yes, you get good rolls & bounces!).

There's a game room on the 1st floor hosting foosball and pool tables, and an area to host a birthday party.  This is also entrance to the 1st floor golfing bays (Top Golf has 3 levels of these).

The 2nd floor has a massive, full-service bar and restaurant where you can find staff dancing to tunes to liven the mood and your spirit.  The 3rd floor has yet another, smaller full-service bar, courtyard area, and additional areas to rent out for private or corporate parties.  

There's much more to experience here - way more than 1 visit can provide.  Top Golf is hopping, too - Friday nights it's packed and quite fun with all the people there.

Check them out!

Excellent drinks and small plates. Love the atmosphere, they play great music and the ramen is the best in St. Pete! 

Will be back very soon!!

We went for the breakfast with the trains.  It was $25 per ticket.  The "continental breakfast" was a plate full of pastries, doughnuts, sugary muffins, some fresh fruit and sugary yogurt.  The coffee was very watery. The activity was a printer page anyone could get online and color. The train set-up was beautiful, but not much more than what one sees at reading terminal market for free.  If you are going to charge that much for breakfast you should offer something a little more substantial than desserts.  We spent 30 mins at the museum and had to leave because we were all hungry for a real continental breakfast.  The cost far outweighed what was delivered and it was not worth our commute from Philadelphia.

The best $20 spent in NOLA! My mom, friend and I got in line for the 8:00pm show around 7:20pm and we got the last 3 seats available! The space is so much smaller than I had anticipated but it just ads to the intimacy and charm of such an old building. The jazz music, singing and band were wonderful and we had such a great time. No photos or video are allowed inside. Just sit back, relax and enjoy every minute of the show
Fresh, quality ingredients with a home made family flair - super friendly - try the hummus and refreshing tea. A must visit for us when in Westchase.
Ramon,  the nuyoriquan juicer guy,  is very entertaining.  My chicken sandwich was positively interestingly!
