Was in town and craving pizza. Stopped here and was not disappointed. Chicken bacon ranch pizza was delicious. Friendly staff and very clean. Will definitely be back

Great tunes, Waylon playing when we walked in. Lots of coffee options and the nitro cold brew is delicious. Excellent, friendly service. Surprisingly full food menu, so this will be my go to breakfast spot when I'm in the area.

This is a small but well designed gallery displaying Ted DeGrazia's work. The building itself is interesting. It's wonderful to see the wide range of his work and the artistic depth. I've always enjoyed his art but now I appreciate him more as an artist.

Came in at 9pm for drinks and one appetizer. They close at 9:30. They stated they close and need to clean so they can't serve us. We say we only want Thai iced tea and an order of crab rangoons. So then they say they can make it to go and we agree. Crab rangoons we're delicious but it was supposed to have 6 count and only had 5. And the Thai iced tea was soooo very sweet. Could not have more than a few sips. If you're going to stop accepting customers at 9 then don't say you are open till 9:30.

A quiet shop in Ybor, this place has open seating and some games to play. There are minimal good options, but the coffee is excellent! I had my usual latte and it was created really well. The temperature was great and the milk was nicely texted. Served in a real mug, which they also sell in addition to t-shirts. Overall a great place to stop in Tampa.

Have only ordered delivery. The order has been right, and the wait about 30-40 minutes. 

Their vegetarian pizza is very good. Great dough and assortment of standard veggies. Smaller calzone was delicious and crispy, the same one, larger size was mushy, chewy. Called the store to share the experience and they offered 50% off next time --after some prompting-- and then abruptly ended the call. At least they offered, but... 

They're down the street or so, but so are a few other spots like them. They do send coupons with their menus and they also have ad with coupons in the local mailer that goes around. They are tasty, but customer service could improve...no need to be rude to paying customers...after all there is market competition.

If you have food restrictions, enjoy eating fresh, or just have a hankering for Mediterranean food, this is the place for you!  I have been to this Zoe's location on multiple occasions and have never been disappointed.  The restaurant is clean and friendly, and conveniently located in the Promenade near tons of shops.  The hummus is very good, the tomato basil soup is something to write home about - delicious.  The salads are crisp, fresh and yummy.  The kabobs over rice - also fantastic.  I recently tried the new bowls - I had the lamb meatballs over caulirice - very yummy and grain free!  My only complaint is that the serving size was way too small.  I could easily have eaten 2 of them.  Be sure to join their email list - they regularly send coupons!

I was in a bad auto wreck in 2011. I have severe neck and lower back injuries. I have already had 2 surgeries and should be going for one more on my lower back. I go to M E once or more a month and it gives me the relief I need. My regular Therapist Lauren is absolutely amazing. She know the temp I need for the bed, and knows her craft very well! She hits those spots that are really knotted up and makes me feel very comfortable in the room. I truly appreciate the professionalism she has and respect for her clients! Thank you for providing the help I desperately need at a price I can afford, being on a fixed limited income.

So I used to come to this Panera all the time years ago and thought I'd try it again today. (Why not, right)
I am amazed that they are still (!) not able to toast a bagel. Its either as pale as an English person who has not seen the sun in a year or burnt (not dark brown - its burnt).
They do ask you if the pale version is okay.. when you ask for it more toasted it burns and they hide it on the plate.. then you try to nicely say it's too burnt and they do try again. (How they cant see that themselves I'll never know....) After the second try I give up and eat it. It's usually a mix of half pale and burnt. 
I wont be back unless I get the bagels to go and take care of the toasting at home.

On a positive note, the staff are very friendly!!

I went in one day a few months ago not expecting much because generally food in the university area is mediocre and overpriced. But I must say the brisket was wonderful and so we're both sides which were potato salad and coleslaw. I had it with a good beer and although it was a little pricey that's what you get in the university area. It's very good and I'll go back.

Recommended. A lot of everything. Much clothing upstairs and seems in good/neat condition. I found many nice toddler puzzles with excellent price. Nice jewelry collection (price is ok, not cheap though). Do not park in front of the shop. There is metered parking lot behind it.  Also there is a dentist clinic not open on Mon & Tuesday, which has ~10 parking spot.
Fresh! Healthy food, tasty, great non-carbonated drink options and reasonable prices.

Some of the best Mexican food this city has to offer!  Super friendly staff who always accommodates any needs that we have. Our family visits one of their locations multiple times a month. Great menu selection and fantastic salsa bar and chips!

This was a great experience!  The office staff answered my call promptly at 7:30 am. they were very friendly and professional. They scheduled a time to come out within two hours of my call.  The tech came out and was knowledgeable and professional. He charged a fair price, and explained all of our options. within an hour, the spring on our garage door was replaced and the whole unit was working better than it ever had. I would gladly recommend them to anyone.
The last time I was in Grottos, the manager threatened to punch me in the face.  All I asked for was a glass of water.

My daughter had to replace her work truck that was burnt up in the Thomas fire and found a used Tacoma at this dealership via an internet search.  The price was discounted and very fair.

Her business could not wait for the insurance check to arrive, so I contacted the dealer, confirmed the truck's features and mileage and bought it via email and a couple of phone calls.  Took under 10 minutes.  Wired the money and they prepared the paperwork - all she had to do was arrive, sign the forms and drive off!

Fastest purchase ever and the vehicle was as nice as it was represented.  She is happy and her business is back in service!  The folks at the dealership were very nice to her and considerate of her loss.

Now all we have to do is wait for the insurance check!
Best crunch ever!!! Nice staff friendly environment:)  equipment is nice. Charles and Nick are the best!

I have a haircut that literally NO ONE wants to cut, style, or color. Until 6 months ago I was cutting and coloring it myself. And then I found her.
We locked eyes over a crowded massage clinic. She was loud and brazen. I was quiet and reproachful, as it was my massage clinic I was running.
She wasn't taking no for an answer, so I gave into her advances and agreed to let her touch my hair.
She's the ONLY one who will EVER touch my hair for the rest of my life! She's adventurous and tries anything once, and if she likes it she'll do it over and over!
She has my heart.
Who's this amazing master stylist, you ask? None other than Samantha. She's, quite literally, the best stylist I've found who not afraid to step out of the hair box and so styles other than the popular norm. And I highly recommend her!
After the debacle I had with another nail salon , I came here and they fixed my nails. Staff is very friendly and the place is very clean.

Got the Hibachi Steak lunch special and Clear Onion Japanese Soup.  Both were excellent.  The Yum Yum Sauce that comes on the side isn't enough, so either order an extra side or just get 16oz like I did!

Definitely get a room with the river view.. the sunrise over New Orleans is just wow! Staff are extremely nice and accommodating, beautiful conference and ball rooms, the elevator system will not disappoint... aaaand the M Club- need I say more?
One of my all time fave spots in st Pete.  Always plan a stop in for lunch when we are hangin in the burg.

Food-wise - delectable, distinctive flavors. We got the Cambodian beef kroeung stir-fry, the eggplant and tofu curry, and the Singapore noodles. Enjoyed all of them, but especially the melt-in-your-mouth vegetables and the al dente nature of the tofu and noodles in the Singapore noodle dish (thankfully wasn't over-spiced the way it is at many places). Satisfying portions that aren't too heavy and are good for sharing.

Outside the food - super clean place and well lit; new shop (their dessert menu's not up and running yet, but they say it's coming over the next few months); friendly and responsive owner and employees in this family-owned spot. Street parking is pretty easy to find. Mostly small tables but there's room for a larger party (8-10ish) too.

Would definitely come back!

Cheap pizzeria place, HOWEVER, it is decent/very good for the price they charge.

Good sizes and nice taste. Good place to go when you are starving and have no money. 

- Do not expect a fancy place. 
- I would recommend getting the food and then leaving

Stopped by here before a Blues game. The atmosphere is really cool and hip. They've got a solid menu full of burgers (chicken, bison, veggie and beef.) They also offer some appetizers, ice cream, and other dishes. I got the Buffalo Chicken Burger was good but small overall, however I got large fries and a shake so plenty of food. You get multiple dipping sauces with fries would recommend the Cheese and Siracha Mayo personally. Shake wise go for Cinnamon so good!

Tried new spot and location was top notch over looking the Hillsborough river Outside choice was fantastic since noise level was better for conversation Now the food both hubby and I enjoyed fish dishes Blacken grouper  and cedar plank salmon which was grilled perfectly Paired with  roasted potatoes and fall vegetables very satisfying but not heavy dinner choice Sure the server would have liked to serve more drinks but we stuck with one each and bill came to under $100 With the river walk ending at this spot we will be back again

Had a nice hike here today.  I walked the main road for a couple miles and turned back.  I think $15 is a little pricey to go drive through to hike the trails so I just paid the $5 to park my car in the lot and stayed on the road.  I think I prefer Sabino Canyon to hike but this was a nice change of pace.

First off the owners are very inviting and really nice people.  Second, beautiful cats to hang with and adopt if so desired.  Third, coffee...I was apprehensive but then noticed the Chemex.  Chemex and cats, incredible.  I encourage everyone to at least go for the beverages.  Great local roaster represented and fun and appropriately named teas, bites coming soon.  The cats are in a separate well designed room to allow humans to chill with them.  The front portion of the cafe has a nice big window to enjoy the cats from a distance...but why get in there and pet them.

Good food. We've eaten there a number of times and the food has always been good but service is slow and inattentive. I've liked the farmhouse slider and the Southern slider and the black bean burger is crazy good. I only wish the service was better.

What can I say, you get what you pay for I guess. The meal started off pretty good. The Fried Wontons were really good, the wonton soup, while lacking flavor, wasn't bad--it was really to only thing I could eat. The chicken fried rice was not good at all, it was not fried it was more like pilaf. The chicken and broccoli was not great either, there was a lingering smokiness (like a slim Jim) in the sauce which was just not good . Sadly disappointed--and HUNGRY

Will never step foot again. Walked in & felt discriminated against for carrying a purse & with everyone looking at me...that was uncomfortable. To top it off the lights in the parking lot were off. Maybe they can't afford to turn them on.....hrmmmm. That's ok, I'll take my business to one of the many other stores around.

We are new to the area, and my husband picked this place for my birthday dinner as a surprise. As another reviewer stated, I also got a "weird" vibe from the staff - no one was friendly at all, except for the bartender, who was only slightly so.  Our waiter was okay, but again, not friendly at all - more "robotic" when citing the specials, taking our orders, etc. My husband spent a small fortune on drinks and dinner - which were good - but not really worth what they were charging.  It's a beautiful place, if only the staff had a bit of warmth in their demeanor.  Overall, I was disappointed and I'm not sure if we will be back.
One of the best donair poutines in the city. The staff work efficiently, communicate well to make sure each order is correct, and are friendly.

We came here for brunch and absolutely loved it.  The service was awesome, the Bloody Mary and mimosas were delicious and the food...oh my gosh the food!  My boyfriend got the sausage and waffles and added fried chicken to it, which is his favorite brunch dish, and he was thoroughly impressed.  I got the three eggs breakfast and a biscuit and while it's more simple, it was still delicious.  We're from Chicago so we're no stranger to delicious brunches and this one was truly such a treat.

Didn't care for this place the first time in 2010, but subsequent visits since then have changed my mind. Really enjoy "The Don" and the Greek salad, which the regular size will easily feed 2. Easy take out set up as well.

I've been to BB Kings in West Palm Beach as well as New Orleans many times. Always a phenomenal experience. This time was extraordinary because of our magnificent waitress Julia who was overwhelmed with orders though still went above & beyond to make our visit indisputably the best experience yet. We never waited a moment to ask for anything, Julia was on top of our needs before we had the time to ask. If it weren't for her Christmas wouldn't have been nearly as joyous. Thank you Julia for going above & beyond.

Save your time and don't shop here. I went in to purchase a bedroom set for my daughter first time I went in to look and get prices then I had to go home measure and talk to my husband.. I went back and the lady who quoted me all my prices which she wrote down in detail everything she told me was off. The manager said why didn't you buy it the first time you were here then and basically told me he dosent know what to tell me so I said I was going to shop elsewhere and he said OK. I was blown away from the lack of professionalism. The furniture is cheaply made anyway. Ended up going to ashley furniture the same day, got my daughter a 5 piece bedroom set for 1,800!!!! Including mattress box spring warranty delivery mattress protector everything !! WAY BETTER quality than bobs and I saved money at Ashley's!!!!

I came here for 2 used rear tires and an oil change. After a couple days I started having a whole new slew of problems that I never had before!!!! All of a sudden my cars RPM starting skyrocketing at a low speed, feeling like it was in cruise control--even would remain driving while in neutral. Then all of a sudden a strange metal scraping sound from my passenger side front tire. And then to top it all off, my rear passenger tire almost FELL OFF WHILE DRIVING!!!!!! Felt like it was wobbling and all this smoke started coming out!! Brought it to another shop and somehow the wheel bearing and cap were missing!!! So now I have to pay $240 to repair this!! 

NEVER EVER GO HERE!!! 
I wish I would've thoroughly read the reviews before I went! I now see on other review sites that many others have had issues with this place too!!! Oh and the guy (not John) but some other guy put the rear tire on, he didn't even know how to drive a manual so go figure this is the tire that almost fell off!
Disaster. Dirty fridges in the front. Cash only. Greasy film ion everything including the tables. The cheese pizza with hot sauce was good.  $4 for a slice and a bottled drink is good for the area.
Food ok not great. Service slow.  queso appetizer and house margarita good. Music also good.

Ok I'm basing my review on all the other BBQ I have eaten. I'm always looking for great BBQ in my travels. I asked for moist brisket and they gave me lean. So not impressed with it at all. The Ribs were Great and the burnt ends were very good the Burnt ends were moist and had tons of flavor.  Ate at another BBQ place yesterday and it was so much better.

Wow. What a nice surprise! I just had some terrific curry chicken stir fry made with just the right amount of heat. My husband had Pho Ga and it was delicious as well. Wish we lived closer as this would be my go to place. Reasonable price and excellent service also. Worth the drive from Weeki Wachee.
Fun place, and the people are great, but the meals are very heavy and just don't settle well with my family's digestive system.

My partner and I love PFFCU, but our last visit was absolutely exceptional.  
We are buying a house soon, but all of the online calculators and articles were conflicting. We could not get answers to our specific questions, nor get a detailed roadmap for each step we needed to take. 
We sat down with Elliot, who was so incredibly knowledgeable, and broke down the entire process for us, along with details that were specific to us. He spent plenty of time making sure we understood each aspect and the actions we would need to take. After our meeting, we left feeling much more empowered and educated. 
I can't recommend this bank enough!

This place is fantastic. I used to live just up the road and brought my dogs here out of convenience but I've since moved twenty minutes away and will only take my dogs here. They always do a spectacular job and genuinely care about your dogs well being. I highly recommend.

So over this place!!!! Came in day today to get a mani/pedi because not many customers. So I'm waiting patiently to get my feet done and another customer walks in to get a pedi al well. So I get up and ask the girl who was working would SHE do the pedi and she said yes and starting running the water so I could soak. She had done such a good job before but they just don't remember you or how well you tip them apparently. As she is finishing her customer and I thinking I'd be next she passes me off to someone else which is my biggest issue with all salons of this caliber they just don't get it. So I will not return as a customer which is unfortunate because I left the old
Salon for similar reasons. I don't have a problem that it costs a little more but if you're looking for a different t experience this is not the place for you. SPEND YOUR MONEY WHERE IT COUNTS THEY DON'T CARE!!!!!'

NOTE THAT THIS IS FOR THE LOCATION ON THE RIVER WALK, NOT THE ORIGINAL IN THE FRENCH MARKET. Stopped by on our first day in NOLA. Tried Cafe au lait for the first time, and found it a bit more bitter than I hoped. I figured it would be half coffee, half milk/cream. At least it was hot. The beignets were tasty and sweet, a bit heavier than I'd hoped. If I stood in the line at the French Market, I would have been disappointed.
The views here are better than the views in French Market. You can watch the steamboats on the river, and maybe a Carnival cruise will pass by.

Bowling only: we bowled in the vip section which is more money. You would expect some ounce of better service. Our lane broke. We had to go up to the desk 4 times. Don't press the service button on the consol to get help that does nothing. We wait for 25 min for someone to fix it (we had the lane for 1 hr). Finally fix it and offer us 5 min back. Spent over 150 bucks to go bowling. Awesome

I'm giving this Waffle House 4 stars for the wait staff. Their cook. Basic looking chubby white guy on the other hand messes up my orders on a regular basis. Never takes accountability and then blames it on his majority female of color staff. He's also just rude to the women he works with in general. 

This is a prime example in America of how mediocrity is allowed to exist on the basis on privilege. 

Other than that service is always stellar.

We were in town for NYE and always try to find a local spot to eat,  this one is a definite return visit spot!  BBQ nachos were good,  she got pulled pork and I got Brisket platter.  It was all great!  The Brisket is the best I have ever eaten!  You can't go wrong!
Excellent and fresh sushi! Started with the soba noodles and ginger salad. So delicious! I got the J&J roll and I wish I had ordered two!! Best sushi I've had in the city by far.

A delicious French restaurant set in a row home in South

I went with three other people and we shared three of the first or second plates and then we each ordered a main course. The first and second plates range between 15 to $20 and then the main courses are between 20th and $30 a person excluding the beef.

For starters, we ordered the poached Lobster, the foie gras on fish, the escargot, and the beef tartare. All the dishes are pretty good, but the escargot was particularly delicious and creamy. We even asked for more bread to soak up the sauce with.

For the main course, I ordered the seared duck breast which came over a bed of risotto. The duck breast was cooked to Perfection and melted in your mouth.

Leslie and for dessert, we shared the chocolate souffle and the Apple Brandy creme brulee. The chocolate souffle came with some sort of pour-over sauce, it was delicious creamy and chocolatey. The Apple Brandy creme brulee was unique in that it wasn't overly sweet with the caramelized sugar on top. The Brandy Apple flavor was refreshing with little bits of Apple on top

Great little Italian bistro- casual attire solid Classic American Italian dishes at a fair price. I had the House Calzone and subbed the Genoa out for their homemade meatballs. My wife had the classic stuffed shells in sauce which came with a house salad & garlic knots. Both were prepared well & were generous portions. Our waitress, Kirsten, was helpful and took care of all our extra requests promptly.

TERRIBLE! Told us there'd be 4 races in front of us when we signed in, but we had to wait 6 races! We saw they let 2 diff groups go TWICE! Either they thought we would be too stupid to notice or they just didn't care. Also, they also told us our group of 8 would have our own race but when it was our turn they inserted 2 other racers who just walked in.  And the rules about "no bumping allowed" was BS! They allowed those 2 racers to constantly bump us, including our teen girls. Safety? My A$$!!! And beware, racers dont get 14 laps each. The race stops when the FIRST  driver finishes 14 laps. Hope those 2 experienced drivers they inserted in to our race are proud of themselves busting up first timers consisting of mostly teen girl drivers. Moreover, they allowed those racers to go again right after our race. Don't go unless you want to risk unnecessary injury and subject yourself to being taken advantage of.   Wish I could give minus stars!

So. Ok like but. The cheese cake was good but cold. Maybe suppose to be? And the Jambalaya was cold ? Not suppose to be!. Snails special in cheese yet weird & Luke warm saved the day.. a 2 star.. Get over this place hippie wanna whatever's! Jerry dead !

We tried three tours in New Orleans recently. Melissa Vo0doo tour quite good. She's very knowledgable. Moved along well. These tours aren't really that much walking. We stood is same spot for quite a while say 20 minutes at least a spot. Kayla, Culinary Tour also well worth it. Slightly more walking. Kayla knows her stuff and she's very nice. Both were good ways to learn about the French Quarter. Ghost tour with Mikko, he knows a lot as well. All tours pretty much started on time.

Breakfast was alright, the food was fresh, but underwhelming. The wait was long, but gave it an extra star because the hostess went out of her way to serve us. Best part of our meal was the smoothie and the fruit.

This is a great restaurant that is fresh and fast that I think is under patronized. Great service that explained everything on their menu even gave suggestions on what they thought was the best. Also got onion rings which they fried fresh for me, and I watched them put together my Hot Dog and burger in front of me. Great quality and I didn't think a Hot Dog would fill me up so I also ordered a burger and wish I only chose one. DJ's is a great bargain for the quality and speed. The Hot Dog meal with keep you full and has many different options. The location was very clean and obviously well kept and staffed with caring employees.

Terrible customer service. I am a platinum plan customer. In the beginning of December they said our oil tank was unsafe and forced us onto a 55 gallon drum, the only issue was their company could not place a new tank until January 8th due to schedules. I was assured by meenan that since we are on automatic delivery our drum would be continuously topped off during this time. Low and behold our heater locks out today around 4 and no one can come for service until between 930-1230 tonight. When the tech comes the issue is we are out of oil. Meenan let our drum run out!! What a joke! Run from this company fast, they'll gladly take your money but let your family freeze even though it is their fault! Disgusting and shameful! I even told them I have two little ones in the house and they still wouldn't expedite the call!

Note their sign does not light up so it was a challenge to find. They are in a parking lot with a liquor store. My family of 10 came in Christmas Day. Thankfully they were one of very few that actually opened. We arrived around 5:30 and there was 3 large groups ahead of us. We got seated about an hour later. Thing we're hectic and I don't think they were prepared for the heavy crowds as they were running out of utensils and cups. They finally take our order which took a really long time and the food came out a lot later. Although the food took a long time and they seemed unprepared, I think they still handled it well. (Maybe they will take this as a lesson for next year) Everyone was friendly and by the end of the night it seemed they had called in more people to help. I ordered the Bun Bo Hue and it was flavorful. The spring rolls & spring salad were ask very delicious. This is the longest time I've ever had to wait for pho or Vietnamese dishes but can't complain too much about the wait cuz it's Christmas. They are open New Year's Day also!

This branch on Hope avenue is seriously understaffed. The copiers were not operating properly and it was difficult to find someone to help. The staff member who ended up helping, was great. However everything took longer than it should have. No one is at the counter. I called before I came in to ask a question and the person on the phone was very disrespectful. It was an ordeal just to get 40 pages printed.

Overpriced, but good. Have tried twice now and both times have been delicious and consistent. 

The brisket is super satisfying, being strips instead of ripped to shreds and swimming in sauce. 

The fried pickles are fried spears, not chips, so you get more bang for your buck with this item. The batter on them is so light and flavorful; they can definitely stand on their own without the dipping sauce. 

The best thing, hands down, is the banana cream pie milkshake. Heaven in a cup. 

If the prices weren't such a ripoff ($18+ just for a brisket sandwich and milkshake), I'd go more often.

You wouldn't know this was a tequila cantina so I think they could do a MUCH better job of marketing it.  The servers should suggest types of tequila to try or at least some kind of mention of it.  Our server, Angela, was attentive and informative.  Very helpful when it came to the menu.  The salmon is great.

Came here for a friend's birthday and we all had an amazing time and enjoyed everything we got. The ambience and decor is awesome! Service was rather quick and it wasn't too crowded. Happy hour margs for $6? Yes please! 

We started with chips guac and salsa. The guac was very chunky and i really enjoyed it. I also loved the salsa verde. I got the enchiladas verdes and they were very enjoyable. It was a huge portion and was enough to take home. My fellow diners really enjoyed the quesadillas and enchiladas poblanas. The enchiladas come with rice and beans!

Spare rib is really good! But I think it's a bit of small amount for a price we paid. I went there with family and we are big fan of Pad Thai so we ordered it too. That was a bummer. It was red and taste different than the all other Pad Thai I've eaten in my life. I would go back there just to eat the spare rib dish and some tea.

Food was delicious here. We were visiting from Northern CA/Bay Area and wanted something different from the American food. 

The service was amazing, such friendly workers there. 

This is not a sit down restaurant, it's more like you go choose your food, they put it in a plate and then you pay. You sit where you want. 

They had cold and hot water for self service.

One of the best Filipino food I've had!!

Had 5 "extreme wings". The sauce is pretty good, it's much spicier than buffalo, not really tangy, and I think with some Worcester? They had me sweating pretty fast but nothing too spicy. The wings themselves are pretty big and full of meat, chicken is soft and tender, not tough and dry. Only problem is the price in my opinion, 8 dollars for 5 wings is way too much.

Love this new expansion of ichicoro! I have tried a lot of items off of the menu in the dining area as well as some from the ramen bar and each was just as tasty as the next. The most surprising item was the cauliflower, they somehow made my least favorite food into a dish I couldn't stop eating.....I mean seriously try it!! The cocktails are extremely creative as well, my favorite is the one with activated charcoal. Yes I said charcoal and its the perfect refreshing drink that goes down almost too easily. Perfect place to grab some great food and drinks and feel as if you are transported to a trendy New York restaurant.

We came on a busy Thursday and had a great time with our Chef Yoshi and our server Li! We had a somewhat rambunctious group and they were both entertaining and attentive to taking care of all of us. Li made sure our drinks were full and our orders correct even though we were a bit confusing! Yoshi cooked our steaks perfectly! If you want to have fun with an awesome dinner go to Kobe and ask for Li and Yoshi!!!

Been here enough times to know that this is great BBQ. It's as good as Pappy's IMO. My GF actually prefers this over Pappy's. This is actually closer to me so I come here more and will keep coming back as long as they keep making amazing BBQ. I've only ever had the ribs & they've been great everytime. The sauces I've had are good too. Wish they had more seating, that's all.

On Nov 28th, 2017 I had an appointment at 11.15am and ended up getting there late at about 11.40am due to heavy traffic held up by police removing a car wreck in the direction of my travel. As soon as I entered the shop, the owner YELLED at me for being late, I apologized and asked if I could wait /come back at another time. She would not hear any of it and was very surprised at this very UNPROFESSIONAL BEHAVIOR. The customers who were in this shop at the time can attest to this incident. Why not come and address the problem with me one on one instead of disrespecting me by yelling at me in front of everybody?? I am sure I am not the first customer to be late...it happens all the time everywhere..just has to figure out whether to reschedule for another day/time.
I was coming back to get discount on nails that had been badly done on a previous visit....So they owe me actually! But other patrons need to know this behavior from the very OWNER...how unprofessional

This looks like an old school diner. It has the charm of one but so much more.  Not only does it have typical diner food: pancakes, waffles, eggs but also great vegan alternatives. There is a great quinoa breakfast bowl with roasted veggies and vegetarian cheese steak.  The place is fantastic. Expect to wait on weekend mornings for brunch.

This was my Third time visiting and will be my last.
My family from Europe was visiting on their very 1st day (November 20th) so we decided to give this place one last try only because of the proximity from my house.
First thing, when we walked in trying to get a little bite at 9:15 pm after coming from the airport, we asked the hostess if they were still serving. She gave us a look as if we were crazy to "disturb" her that late. She replied "Well, I'll ask my manager", who was just right there by the bar. Next thing she did was taking the menus and taking us back to seat down with an unwelcoming attitude. (I almost left but we had guests). If I were the manager, she would be unemployed right now, and if I was the owner, both of them (as a Manager, he didn't do his job)
From there, the service was less than good. Our feelings were that nobody wants to be working here.
So now here comes the food, we ordered a vegetarian and Margherita pizza, both which came out raw. The only thing we liked was the lentil soup, that's the only reason I gave it 2 stars...
And just one more thing... when my family left and we took them to the airport, they told us "What a great trip and city!!... except for the first night at the Pizza place!!!"

A big ol' Super WaWa in a great (but super busy) location on the Black Horse Pike in Runnemede.  

It's next to El Tequila (very good Mexican - the guac varies and isn't the best at times?) and Cook's Florist, which is a gorgeous floral shop with beautiful selections.  

I parked my car for a fill up then went inside for my favorite (spinach & cheese) panini.  When I went to pay, the cashier noticed that the gas purchase wasn't showing (not "hung up" or something she radio'd out?).

So I got a couple of free items (I didn't complain a lick) to offset the inconvenience for me, so of course I was happy.  

What can I say?  I stinking LOVE WaWa!  With or without the freebies.  The coffee, the hoagies, the paninis, the gas, the free foutain waters, my bank's ATM and a big, clean potty if I need to!

The location was great, I was happy with my food. But I didn't think much of the service.

The bar stuff seemed to come to our table with drink after drink, that wasn't ours.

I ordered a pepsi and got given a rum drink, followed by an ale, followed by another liquor drink. Then our original waitress bought me the correct drink.

However I did enjoy the mac&cheese burger, it was lovely. But think the service needs some work.

Pascal is an amazing bartender! He's been super sweet and attentive! He was very knowledgeable about the beers on draft and the food on the menu. PS the fried pickles and wings rock ! Get the ghost dry rub for a flavorful punch. I'm having a great experience here thanks to the great food and staff. Plus N64 wow how can this place get any better?

My favorite place in Nashville!
Lookin for something a bit out of the ordinary.  This is your place.  Careful if you bring your spouse.  Leave her home and surprise her.

Wholly burger! Yummy! Delicious!  I can't say enough about this place.  Our family pays a visit every time we are in St. Louis and it is always a pleasure. I have tried Fuego every time and this last time I tried the Greek burger, what a pleasant mouth full of delicious flavors in both burgers.  If you are fond of flavor combinations and gourmet burgers, you have to try this place, the best burger restaurant in town.
Really "Pleasant" delivery people (not all but definitely the last two). Plus the last delivery was delivered 25 minutes after app claimed it had been.
This year the "Newfields" light exhibit is glorious and magical; so much more than ever before. So do yourself a big favor, buy a ticket and go! You will be happy you did and it runs through Jan.7!
This place was o'k ... Please hire more people the LINE is OUT OF THIS WORLD.

I am fairly new to Tucson and was very nervous about getting overcharged on a windshield replacement for my Toyota Camry.  I'm so thankful to have come across Wisecrack Auto Glass.  His quoted price was way more affordable than Safelite and I was able to get an appointment for the next day.  He was on time, speedy, and very professional.  I highly recommend going with Wisecrack Auto Glass.

Your search for comfort food ends here. Definitely a hit in the winter and sometimes the summer too! They adapt their menu often, so you never run out of new things to try.

The scallop and potato bake is an amazing appetizer, but be sure to leave room for the shrimp and grits or fried chicken plate as your entree. Service is always great so it's always an option for us when deciding where to go for dinner.
Definitely not using these guys again I was charged 97 dollars to get my car towed 2miles. If your looking to be over charged go right ahead and call them. I'll take my money else where next time.

Disappointed. I've heard good things about this place from my local friends and family. Yet, I just found it to be overpriced and average. 

My cobia was over cooked and the flavor profile of cranberry and pesto sounded interesting but was not good at all. My wife's salmon tasted like a dinner from the freezer section at the grocery store. The shrimp tortellini came out with lots of shrimp but NO TORTELLINI! Sauce was good though. 

Drinks and service were solid. But you could honestly get waaaay better food for waaaayyy less money.
I'm VERY picky when it comes to Chinese and they've always been great! We love their spring rolls and their sushi!
I love this place. The food, drinks and service were all great! I had a beer and tasted another and now I have to go back just to have more "whiskey scented Santa". Thats a good beer!
I spent $54 for an 8 inch four layer carrot cake for my father's 80th birthday! WORTH. EVERY. PENNY! It was decadently delicious! You guys rock the bake shop.
Had the "chicken" taquitos last night and there were maybe three tiny pieces of chicken in each one. Other customer got cold boneless chicken wings. Disappointing
Good gym with a nice variety of classes for all experience levels. Nice sized Indoor pool , hot tub and ball court. They also have a computer lab and library .

This was the good time here. This time I oder ed small by small and eating slowly.  My wife and me had really good time.  Clean and beautiful interior.  When I had other restraint, I was sick. But here no problem.  I think the food us very fresh that is why. Strong recommend this.

Worst experience I have ever had. I rented a car from Budget and not even 48 hours after having the vehicle the side wall of the tire blows out. Clearly this tire was not in good condition to begin with and when I called budget the representative told me I would be charged for someone to come out. They stated if I could put on the spare tire  myself I could come exchange the car, so that is what I did. I returned the car and was told by the person checking in the car that I would not be charged for the tire, as well as the girl at the counter issuing me a new vehicle. After issuing me 3 different vehicles that were not parked in the designated spots in the garage, I finally got another car and was on me way after 2.5 hours. 

Also, I pre-paid for my rental and when I returned it I was changed an additional charge of $85. That took 3 phone calls and that was finally returned. 

Well about a week after returning the car I received a letter stating I was being charged $165 for the tire. I have called and spoke with 5 different people. I was told by one rep named Abel, that I would not be charge and he would note the account so anyone could see it. Guess what, I was charged. I called in again and mysteriously no one can see those notes. Finally I speak with a supervisor Taurean who stated he would look into this and call me back by Friday December 1st and I still have received no call. I have asked everyone I have spoken with for something in writing but they all state they can't give me that but they have "noted" the account. Such horrible service. They have scammed me one to many times now and I recommend staying far far away.

Place looks rejuvenated since Siam used to be here. A lot more modern and cleaner. The staff is friendly and helpful. This is the second time I have been here since they opened and the food is good. The Lad Na is ok, the pad Thai was very good, the pho was good also from the happy faces of my coworkers! The waitress is super good at her job, she took our orders and did not have to write it down. Awesome job of taking care of us. Come here if your hungry for some Thai or Vietnamese food. "Give it a try and feel the hunger!"

What a disappointment this restaurant is. The food is forgettable and the management is downright rude. Save your money and go somewhere else. In fact, rude doesn't begin to describe how I was treated.

I tired the chicken friedrice,  could not be more satisfied. Portion size was huge, hope they wont cut back after reading this. But plenty of fresh veggies and white chicken peices were provided. The to go box was huge with no sections, the fired rice was layed over foil for proper protection. Good deal and good value for $10. The hostess was nice and friendly as well.

I was told to never come back...by an immature abusive host. The meal started out fine. Then the host, a young man, began verbally abusing his mom. Raising his voice, after she seemingly asked an innocent question about a contract. He threw a box in the air in exasperation. She got up with her coffee to remove herself quietly from the situation and he chased after her stating "Give me that, you don't deserve it". He was trying to pull a hot coffee from her hands. He turned to me to address my astonishment and noted he was "taking the coffee because it was unhealthy for her". She doesn't need the coffee? I'm pretty she also doesn't need a disrespectful abusive son!! That will kill her quicker than any coffee will. If he treats her like that in front of customers I can't imagine what it is like behind closed doors. I left crying, heart broken for the woman. All customers in the establishment got up and left. Grow up young man and learn to treat others with respect. Your family business now suffers because of your actions.

Paramour is in the Wayne Hotel. A recent visit was very good. Very reliable, and a dinner menu varied enough for our young teens to stretch their interests (lamb shank)  or play it safe (Paramour burger). 

The Ciopino is delish, with a deep flavored broth. 

The Caesar salads are really great. 

Espresso was great, but otherwise desserts appeared pedestrian. 

Good special occasion destination.

This place is as classic as they come. The best cheesesteaks in Philly. Do not let the name of the other location fool you- there is only one true Joe's Steaks. I routinely make the 30 minute trek here despite living much closer to Fishtown because it is worth it.

I love their food! Especially when they have stinky tofu! Although it hasn't been stinky as they were when they first opened. I wonder if it's because of complaints by people in the neighborhood. I hope they will make it stinky again! Other than that all their food has been consistent in flavor! There are so many dishes I love there and if I name them all, it'll be the whole menu. The main reason I love this place is that they serve authentic Taiwanese dishes. They're not like other Asian restaurants with limited menu that gears to only westerners. I'm glad this place expanded because they're always packed!
There's no words to describe this restaurant other than DELICIOUS! We had the mofongo and also fried snapper..AMAZING!

Alright guys, this place is way too legit. If I could give it 6 stars, I would. First off, there's so much to do. It's great for all sorts of ages. Obviously there were tons of kids there, with their unlimited energy. Trampolines are an insane workout, and Flying Spider is very aware of this because they offer classes to get your heart pumping. But I've seen teens, adults, and middle-aged people here, all having a blast; that's because this place is so fun. If I ever have a 1st date with a girl, I bring her here. It's way more fun than dinner and a movie. They have zip-lines , dodgeball, and tons of different trampoline types and areas. Not to mention the prices are extremely fair. But on top of all of this, the staff are so great. Everyone is extremely friendly and have a genuine positive energy that makes this place better than anywhere else. 
 When I eventually have kids, I'll be bringing them here, this place is great.

I've used this location for tire work, oil changes, etc. multiple times without incident, and have been pleased with their customer service.
Yesterday, I called to confirm an appointment to get tires switched to snow tires, oil change, and headlight replacement. I asked the technician whether it would be a problem if he could leave the key under the floor mat so that I could pick the car up after they closed at 6pm.   He assured me that leaving the key under the mat would be no problem.
At 5:30, I called to confirm that I would, in fact for sure not be there until after 6, but would the work be done by 6, and would the key would be left under the mat.  
The new manager reacted wirh surprise, and explained she could not allow the key to be put inder the mat after hours because of liability and theft concerns, despite what her employee had told me.
This required that I change my transportation plans to go back and get my car immediately.   I had to call for an Uber (rather than rely on a friend who got off work after 6pm) so that I would be there before they closed at 6 p.m.
I arrived via Uber, with the cost associated with, shortly before 6 pm. Although they were now closed, my car was not ready until well after 6:30 pm. When I explained that my car had been promised to be ready at 6 p.m. and that I thought they wouldn't wait because of them closing at 6 pm, I was cited corporate policy about leaving key under the mat, what a liability that was, Etc.
I explained that now I had waited longer than promised and could have had my friend pick me up to take me to get my car, without incurring extra expenses because of their false deadlines and refusal to work with me by leaving a key under the mat.
I was again cited corporate policy, they were not willing to be responsible for my car theft, Etc. ad nauseam.
All the manager had to do, was to tell me that they could not in the future leave my key under the mat, but that they would be willing to wait for me until 6:30 p.m.  That way, I would have understood their future policy, and had a reasonable solution to come get my car after hours. 
The manager seemed so unreasonable to work with, citing nothing but corporate policy, concern about responsibility for car theft, etc.
I simply refuse to do business with a branch location of a major corporation, who hires "robots" who simply want to cite corporate policy, and won't work with their customers.
I do not recommend having your car repaired at this location, unless you want broken promises and the threat of having your car impounded unless you happen to have a spare key ready to use to pick up your car after hours. Giant FAIL.

Clean, super spacious, cozy, and never too loud!
Most of the people come here study, get works done, and even for interviews because it's such a great environment like that!

There are three different section on the first floor and more in the basement if you need. There's wall plugs everywhere for your digital items, fast WiFi, one clean bathroom. Easy to find parking! Drinks and small pastries are available with friendly baristas. 

My favorite is their London Fog Tea!

Great beach tiki bar, we ordered conch fritters and a few drinks while watching sunset - had a great time! Live music and friendly staff!!! Great views.... also they have beach volleyball !!!! I will be back!

We ordered food to go. I am only giving 3 stars because they were out of several things we ordered. I was "upgraded" to the creazian salad because they did not have the salad I asked for. It seemed like mostly just lettuce and dressing, I expected more for $7. The pho was very flavorful. We also had the shaking beef and it was good, just a little salty.
My go to place for a late bite to eat. Usually not too crowded at the time I go. The lobster dip is a MUST HAVE. Definitely one of my favorites in Indy
Best affordable food in Boise. Hands down. Great atmosphere. Their patio seating is a great way to see downtown Boise while you're enjoying your food and drinks.

Full disclosure- This review is for soft opening. So excited that this location is finally open & absolutely thrilled with the menu! Carnivore husband would not stop stealing bites of my country fried seitan & loved the Mac n cheese croquettes (totally didn't realize it wasn't actually cheese).
Hands down best app was the poutine- that mushroom gravy is ridiculous. Mac n cheese croquettes were good but need consistency in sizing. One of the 3 was very large & frozen in the middle. Needs to be 4 balls honestly. The hot sauce served with them was fantastic & we drizzled it all over a sandwich as well. Polenta fries were good but have had them many other places with similar flavor profile.
I want my last meal to be the country style- think chicken fried steak with mashed potatoes & Mac n cheese smothered in gravy. The Bahn Mi was my fave at the city market location & still fantastic. Something about those fresh sliced jalapeños. Friend really enjoyed cauliflower steak. Only disappointment was the pulled sandwich- it needed a sauce or maybe some slaw, tasted dry and missing something. We were served salads with the meals that had some really great dressing options. All the food looked amazing, the restaurant has really taken the next level with Three Carrot's food.
They have lunch & brunch menus so we will def be back to again. They will also have craft sodas (wasn't working first night) which is a fun addition. Healthy selection of wines & craft beers too. Service is still learning- they will figure it out but plan to be patient the first couple of weeks.
Three Carrots is a gem because they do comfort food that isn't just vegan- it's legitimately honest to goodness food pure & simple.

Food ordered- 

Egg biryani - 8/10
Pav bajji -8/10
Egg hakka noodles -8/10

2 people 

So good!! It was perfect for a snowy and child night! Nt husband and I loved the good and the convenience ood where it's located! 

If they start delivering,  we might just bed in trouble!

Without a question the worst dining experience I and my 14 other friends have ever had. After confirming our reservation that same day, we showed up to a fully packed restaurant with no table for us. After waiting nearly an hour, we were finally seated with half of our party squished against the wall with no way of getting out (which would have process to be particularly problematic if anyone had to use the restroom).  About 15 min later we moved to a table that was just cleared but our food was not served until two hours after our reservation. The prix fixe menu items were all incorrect--the squid ink pasta had no squid ink pasta and all pasta was undercooked, the red sauce was watery and sans flavor. When we approached management to address all of these issues, the owner was unbearably rude, at times becoming belligerent and ultimately yelling. I have never been so blatantly disrespected in my life. As a patron expressing legitimate concerns with service, I was shocked to be berated and attacked by the owner (whose only excuse was "it's a party of 15 in a small place what did you expect?") how about this: if you can't seat a party with a reservation within ten minutes (or 25) then don't take reservations. This owner is a pig and a bully. 

Poor aesthetics, bad food, and abysmal service. DO NOT EAT HERE. Especially if in a large group. You'll thank me later.

I thought it was time to replace the carpets.  Heaven's Best was recommended by our realtor.  We gave them a try and the carpets came out great!  They were super nice on the phone and very easy to work with.

The worst customer service I've experienced in a retail grocery store of this magnitude. The products they sell are superior, but expect to be treated like garbage.  I've been here several times able today sent me over.  No manager to speak to, leave feedback on their page and get an absolutely rude response, which I did a screenshot of and will be sharing!
Simply the best pizza in Philadelphia. Amazing thin crust. Sometimes they're sold out and you can't order it on a whim but if you have the time to reserve your dough...it's the best.
Excellent Fish & Chips!  Only 4 stars as they only bring you a menu with dinner portions at $16, you have to ask for lunch menu or portions. Great place nonetheless!
I think this is the best place for haircut thank you so much Sode she is very professional she did my haircut I cannot believe it this is the best clubs I have never I have it before.

This McDonald's is very conveniently located at the end of Vets near the interstate. The parking lot is easy in and out.  I usually use the drive thru so I'll speak to that mode.  

Today at lunch the line was relatively short and moved very quickly.  No issues at the payment window and just a short wait and confirmation of my order at the second window.  

There was a little traffic jam as I was leaving because someone had pulled up to wait for their order and was blocking the exit.  

For the most part I was happy with my visit. I find this McDonald's to be one of the better locations.  The staff is polite and friendly, and that means a lot when you're talking about most fast food chains.

On my way back to California stop by to have some Mexican. My daughter had the caldo de pollo it was flavorful and was enough for two. My husband, son and myself had tacos and they were very tasty. Service as well was excellent.

I came in for the lunch buffet with a couple coworkers. It wasn't busy, and we were seated right away. The inside of the restaurant was very nice!

I tried a few different dishes that they were offering at the buffet. The channa masala was tasty, as well as this paneer dish that I can't recall the name of. The butter chicken was good, but could stand to be a little more spicy. Usually, I prefer tikka masala, but this was not offered. The chicken biryani was good, spiced very nicely, and had nice portions of chicken on the bone in it. Complimentary naan was offered, which was great. I think that the only thing missing, that I enjoy from an Indian buffet, is an assortment of fried vegetable appetizers, such as pakora or samosas.

The owner and his front house staff were very nice, and checked on us often. I'm looking forward to my next experience with them, hopefully the buffet offerings are changed up by then.
Stoped by when visiting the city and luckily found this and let me just its delicious!!! Quick stop, fast service, good spot to consider !

I have been sitting in the waiting room for 2 hrs. They say they accept walk in but I now know to schedule an appointment.  They will take every appointment that comes in before any walk in. I will say that the woman who took my blood was very good and did it on the first try which does not usually happen for me.

1st Time @ FTO. Thank goodness I saw it out of the corner of my eye while visiting REI. Briefly Checked reviews and walked in. Very clean and modern space.

The food selection is wide w/ many healthy choices. The self serve wine& beer is an interesting concept.

I went with the small plate coconut chicken curry and 1/2 soup for $9.50 and upgraded the soup to a full bowl for $1 extra. The wild mushroom soup is incredible. Very rich and creamy w/ many mushrooms in it. 

The chicken curry is grilled chicken on a bed of wheat berry rice w/ curry sauce poured over top and a corn relish on top of that. Very good and plated in a visually appealing fashion. 

Overall, a more than satisfying experience. I just wish there was one in Btown.

When the plumber I'd previously used didn't return my voice mails for a week, I searched my neighborhood Facebook group for recommendations and found Derek with Hurricane Drain. I called, he answered immediately, and made it to my house within a few hours. He took the time to show me what caused my leak and had it fixed within minutes. I will definitely call him next time I have a plumbing issue!

Chris and Dan at Grace were wonderful to work with. They were friendly knowledgeable and responsive. They have a great variety of cars and make the buying process simple and easy! I would recommend Grace any day!

Tonight my husband and I brought a friend in for dinner. We arrived at 9pm looked at the menu for a few minutes and then ordered a pizza, appetizer, and a few drinks. Our drinks came midway through eating the appetizer. We actually just assumed they weren't coming. A few bites into our pizza we decided to order another of the same because it was so good and everyone was starving. The waitress came around collected our plates and silverware....then dropped off our pizza in a to go box. We told her we planned to eat it now & she responded, "Well, we close at 10."  It was 9:50. I understand everyone wants to leave, but after spending almost $100 I thought it would be acceptable to stay at least until 10. I have been in the event/hospitality industry for 15 years and I have never been made to feel so uncomfortable and awkward. I would never complain about service if the restaurant was packed and understaffed, but we were 3 of 5 customers and there was no excuse for such poor service. There are way too many other good choices in our neighborhood for us to come back.

This place amazes me more and more I visit. The atmosphere sets the tone of a welcoming environment. The staff are amazing and treat you as family no matter what the skin color is. I don't know if they offer this but years ago they offered the "I owe you". I took them up on that and was met with the same service as a paying customer. Of course, I did pay my tab back. The food is wonder. They have a variety of selection. My favorite is the jambalaya. I choose to dine in when I visit. Excellent service, staff and company.

Tonight friends and I dined in at Ooka Restaurant for sushi. This restaurant does have a hibachi section as well. It is BYOB but we chose not to wine tonight and just dine! I had the sushi entree B for 19 dollars - eel, shrimp tempura and California rolls (6 in each) that came with appetizers of salad and miso soup! We were pleased with our rolls!

I've been coming Edson's for over 2 years now and believe me it's the best barber shop in Tampa. Edson's shop has that classic barbershop feel with a mix of old school bullfighting and Frank Sinatra pictures with Real Madrid posters throughout his shop( Hala Madrid!). Before I went to Edson I got a boring ceasar fade but I trusted Edson and he's groomed my hair to a perfect combover fade that I couldn't be happier with. I always leave Edson's with a smile on my face after a precise haircut full of laughs. You won't regret coming to Edson's barbershop!

Amazing atmosphere with an extra proactive staff! I will be eating at here again! Very modern local restaurant with an easy menu. This is a family friendly location with local specials served fresh. I would vote this a most dependable eatery in the Nashville area if it was my choice!

I stopped by Salernos after reading all of the good reviews and hearing good comments by friends and neighbors! Im so happy i gave it a try! The food was delicious. I ordered chicken parm and a side of soup! It was to die for... i will definitely be coming back or getting delivery. 

Also cashier girl was very friendly & thats a plus! Hate having a bad attitude cashier person take my money.
This is my new favorite restaurant ANYWHERE. The food is amazing, the service is fantastic and the prices had me sold. Definitely try the pizzas!

One word. Cockroaches.  We woke up in the morning to find a giant cockroach on the wall of our room.  It forced us to leave the hotel much earlier than we had planned.  The hotel would only give us HALF of our money back after this horrific experience.  When I explained to the front desk that we had a cockroach the room and are leaving because of it, the front desk staff said they would be able to refund our room.  However when it came time for Expedia (who we booked the room through) to contact the hotel to approve of the refund, The Quality Inn said they could only refund half.  

Worst hotel I have ever stayed at, and very disappointed with the customer service.

Let me begin by saying that I had been to Allora before, for lunch, dinner, and Easter dinner with my family and had never been disappointd...in fact gave a great review on Yelp last Easter.  But last night, our woman's club had their annual holiday party there (for a change in venue) and disappointment was the consensus all around.  Over 30 local woman from our club attended the dinner.  The space allotted to us was fine;  large and pretty private.  The dinner selection was fine. We were promised "4 courses" for the, I think, $28.00 pp plus tax and gratuity.  The service was fine.  But here is an accurate description of the food and you be the judge.
First "course" was salad, which was served on a saucer sized plate and consisted of 3 literally forkfuls of salad.  Second "course" was another saucer of penne pasta.  I counted LITERALLY 6 pieces of tiny penne on my plate.  When I joked about it with my fellow members, everyone commented on how skimpy the serving was.  One person bragged she had gotten 7 pieces on her plate. I commented on this to the head server (who appeared to be the manager) and he said that he was giving us a bargain for 4 courses at such a price.  When I replied that he probably had paid like 30 cents for a pound of pasta to feed us all, he said, "oh I am only kidding..but the servings are intended to be appetizer size portions."  Sorry, dude, but 6 one inch penne is not an appetizer by any stretch, and since pasta is the cheapest thing you could serve, you could have at least given us, like 8 penne!  Our President was embarrassed by the negative comments (though it was not her fault) and she, too, told the manager of our disappointment. So by now we are all starving and filling up on bread.  Our entrees were on the smaller side compared to other Italian restaurants, but were acceptable.  The chicken parm I had was tasty and tender, and I think it was risotto with it, also creamy and tasty.  Those who had the short ribs said they were good.  The 4th "course" was dessert which consisted of a dish of 5-6 mini cannoli (they were dry and skimpily filled) and about a dozen very thin , small slices of soft biscotti (tasty) for the table of 8.  I mean it was "ok" as a dinner, but not what I had expected from my previous visits here, which had been much better.  To the managers:  when you have a group of Marlton woman coming into a Marlton restaurant, you should try to impress a little more, since we ae usually the decision makers on where we will bring our family to dine.  You missed the mark this time.

If you like waiting in long lines for donuts then this is the place for you. It's a tourist trap. If you've never been I do recommend you try it once. Otherwise, you can get the same thing without the wait in about 100 other places in New Orleans.
First time here on a recommendation from a friend. Cashier was unwelcoming, food was ok but extremely over-priced. Doesn't matter.... I always see a line to this place.

Without a doubt, Goody's lives up to its name.  My buddy and I were just visitin' (he from Memphis, me from New Hampshire) which meant that we just HAD to order what seemed like half the menu, featuring the Slinger of course.  Had to have it.  It was probably THE best breakfast of my entire life (well, at least this side of Helen's Restaurant way "down east" in Machias, Maine - absurd [local wild] blueberry pancakes!).  We both waddled out of there, completely stuffed to the gills, and couldn't even look at food for the next 12 hours.  Before I sign off, I have to mention how nice (and fun) ALL of the people there were, from our fellow diners to the folks who worked there. Thank you Goody's for an unforgettable experience!!
Great place to dine anytime. I've went during lunch and dinner, always left stuffed. Great sushi and sashimi and they have all you can eat sushi

My friends and I are night owls and we love applebees for the awesome drink and apps specials and we go a few times a month.  That being said this past time going was the absolute worst experience I've ever had at an applebees or any restaurant really. 

Our server's name was Lorilyn(?) and she was just awful. We had to use the call server button just to get her attention after waiting 20 min to even get our drink orders. And then it took another 25 minutes to even get our drinks (some of which were wrong).  And then a half hour later we finally got our apps and still waiting on refills and for her to fix the wrong drinks but it sounded like she just completely forgot.  At one point we called the manager over and very calmly and politely pointed out all the issues we were having because at this point it had been like an hour and a half and we still didn't have the right drinks or even all the apps we ordered or even our food yet, but he did nothing to resolve any of it besides "I'll go check on your food"  it sounded like he didn't care at all.  And we're not ones to make a big scene and scream and moan over stuff so that's probably why he didn't actually do anything even though we were all very upset. 

We finally get our food and over half the table just decided to get a to go box because it had been two hours and we weren't expecting to be there that long.  It was just really awful because three of us ordered the unlimited chicken tenders and riblits deal but couldn't even use it because of how incredibly slow it was. And the restaurant was over half empty. 

As we were all checking out and getting ready to go we overhear our waitress badmouthing us.  Which was just absolutely unjustified because it was the worst service I've ever experienced and because we're good people we still tipped.  

Just awful overall and will never go back to this applebees.

I was recommended to Cameo by my best friend who has her hair cut and colored by Lori, the owner. She knew how I was never satisfied with a hair cut and color, ever! Especially since it always costs so much. So I saw Lori for a blonde balayage and layered cut. I wasn't satisfied so I came back a second time and had some of the balayage redone to get my hair blonder as it still looked very brassy and not white blonde like I wanted. It seemed I had difficult hair and the color just wasn't lifting. She tried, but again I left ($400+ later) feeling like I'm just never going to leave a salon feeling truly happy with my hair. About 6 months later, I scheduled another appt with Lori to get my hair redone, but she was booked 2 months in advance. So I got in the same week with Samantha, who I was told was previously Lori's associate.  
     Nervous about getting my hair done, as usual, and knowing that l have difficult to color, very thick hair I attempted to warn Sam about my hair.  I've been told by many, many stylists that I just need to use toner to get my hair blonder or that the color can never be lifted enough to get it the shade of blonde I want. (I had white blonde hair as a child and its gotten increasingly darker blonde over the years). However, Sam, (who also has blonde hair) listened, she colored, she cut, and MAGIC happened!  She had the color lifted to the right shade of blonde in half the time and used products to keep my hair healthy. She cut my hair wet then cut some more when dry. She was like Edward scissor hands, cutting so quickly! In the end, I left the salon for the very first time in my entire life feeling 100% satisfied with my cut and color! She is definitely a very skilled stylist. Sam is your girl if you have or want blonde hair or if you're not really sure what you want, she'll make magic happen, trust me!! Plus she's so nice, like all the staff there. 
     My only complaint is that the salon is very expensive and they all try to push the products on you.... like most salons do. But if you find the right stylist for you, it's worth it to feel beautifully transformed when you leave. Thank you, Samantha! My friend, Liz, still goes to Lori and loves her, her daughter gets her hair cut by Dominic, and my Aunt Caroline now sees Sarah and loves her.

CL is a great place to feel welcome. It is a church full of diversity and overflowing with energy. I gave it a 4 because it would be nice to see more POC in leadership rolls throughout the church and giving the message from time to time. The music selection and guest artists could be more diverse as well. Otherwise, I love the church, however, I love my culture as well and often visit other places to get the mix/flow that I need from time to time.

Stopped here for lunch. It wasn't busy at all, so our food was made very quickly. 

This location is not at all like the other location I've visited in Tampa, but it is quite nice. The food came out hot and fresh.

Tip/advice: This Logan's does not have NFL Sunday Ticket (so only the locally televised football games will be on the TVs here).

Logan's is always a solid option for a chain steakhouse/bar, IMO.  Nothing really new to report about this location... I just wanted to potentially save someone a trip here in case they were expecting to watch an out of market NFL game.

The staff I interacted with were friendly, though when I called to ask if a particular NFL game would be on, the hostess led me to believe that the bartender "could put any game on that I want."  I may have been a bit presumptuous in assuming that meant they'd have access to every NFL game, but I digress.  I don't blame the hostess.  Management might do well to train their staff to clarify that only locally televised games are on the TVs at this location, however, if someone calls to ask.

I cannot believe such a place exists. If Walt Disney Company opened up a shooting range, it would resemble Shooters World (in a good way). The place is well organized, friendly knowledgeable staff that gets you through the system rapidly, clean and well-lit facility.  Range area was well sound proofed, nicely lit, clean, and well ventilated. 

There is no shortage of handwashing sinks, soap, or cool (not cold) water to wash the hands.

Best place I've ever shot!

Walking in was a pleasant experience. It's open, welcoming, and well lit. It has a rustic/hip feel. It's clear that you are supposed to get in line and order first. The counter lady, Taylor, is awesome. Super friendly and helpful.

We started with the Fried Green Tomatoes w/ Comeback Sauce @ $6 - they were tangy, crispy, warm, and delicious.

The Hubs had The Mississippi Catfish Sandwich w/ baby greens, green tomato relish, and comeback sauce @ $9. With a side of roasted cauliflower w/ seed pesto. He enjoyed it but said next time he would get the main rather than the sandwich because it had too much bread and he would have rather had a 2nd side.

I had Rick's Famous Fried Chicken Tenders (not hot) w/ buttermilk dipping sauce @ $10 with the roasted cauliflower and collard greens w/ smoked ham hock and pepper vinegar. Mine was delicious. Crispy chicken that was tender on the inside and the side flavors were spot on. However, the chicken was a little inconsistent as some pieces were a little over cooked (dry and a little tough) and both of my sides came out cold. Maybe they were supposed to be but I expected them to be warm. Also, I would love to see some mashed potatoes on the menu but that is just my opinion.

All in all it was an excellent experience and you should check this place out.

We will mos def be back.
This is a go to place for us. I have taken various friends here and they always love it. They continue to add items to their selection.

As far as lounges go, I can give this a strong 4 stars. It has all of the amenities you'd typically find in a delta or American lounge, lots of comfortable seating, open bar, food buffet, business services, free newspapers, and even a shower. Some things that push AMEX a little above would be the premium drinks at the open bar (although they frequently run out of popular options), their signature mixed drinks, a dedicated "phone room" for taking calls which has been very helpful, and overall a level of service and attention that other lounges just don't offer. You really feel like they're taking care of you here, as opposed to just checking you in and getting you off their list. 

My one reason for providing 4 stars is that I've never been very impressed with the food. Typically go for more of the protein-heavy options and it's just seemed very dry. Would appreciate a few more meat options (maybe with some sort of sauce?) but other than that really glad this lounge opened in Philly.
If you want to wait in the drive through for 30+ minutes for some nuggets and ff because that's all you're craving at midnight then this is your place! Yes. 30+ minutes.

Really enjoyed the cheesesteak empanadas. Had a burger and tacos as well. Waitstaff was attentive and kind. Bartender was a little sassy but it's philly what do you expect. Great place for dinner and drinks

Good place to grab lunch. I usually get the salad bowl with chicken. It is really good for a quick lunch option and you get a good portion. The salad bowls are good sized and the portions of meat and toppings are generous. You get a fresh pita with your meal as well. The prices are reasonable and I will definitely be back.

This local eat was on me and my husbands list to visit. Unfortunately after the way my daughter was treated by the manager/owner I will not visit this location. I will make sure that I tell my friends and associates not to visit this location either.
Very polite and excellent food. I love their chicken and goat Madras and bullet naan!
You should experience this one by your own. It's mostly about the feeling and tradition here, however I love the taste too. My favorite: Strawberry shortcake!

Another Bench gem! Walked down the other night they had nice live music but not so loud we could carry on a conversation. My daughter and I ordered the Carne con Papas, which was amazing. My son had a chicken dish I can't recall but it was excellent too.  Service was very friendly and attentive, beer and wine available. So happy to have another great restaurant on the Bench.

Dangerous place to shop at night. Manager turns off half the lights, completely darkens the produce section, the employess are unhappy and get hurt on the job re: lack of light. Had to use cell phone flash light to see in places. Their offerings are wonderful, but the poor attitude and the darkend aisles are scary. Stay open or stay closed, but don't treat people this way. I may never come back. I have been there previously with great results, but tonight's visit was really beyond the pale. Workers don't want to engage with customers when they are asked for assistance. Seriously, why stay open? Shop Rite, Acme, and Fresh Grocer (the old Pathmark) are close by. SAD

Lord! The place that originated the char-grilled oysters aka "Heaven on a Half-Shell", truly lives up to its reputation! I've had them elsewhere but here, I am forever ruined. These are the best - hands down! The shrimp and grits are amazing; with fresh rosemary and fluffy as a cloud grits - OH MY! And then one of the best creme Brûlée I've had outside of Paris! 

Ask for Fredrick - he is the best waiter and the nicest person!

Wife and I went here on a date.  My burger (Southern Classic) was burned and lacked all seasoning.  I could not believe how little flavor it had, other than char.  The weird thing was, the internal temp was ok-ish near medium, but the crust was black.  My wife's Double major was slightly better.  The onion rings were limp and the breading fell off as soon as you picked it up.  Had to eat with a fork.  Will not be returning for food at that price point

December 13-Nick, Initial contact-easy. Initial estimate-easy. 
December 15-David and Moving team: were on time; worked efficiently; were polite and respectful; were careful with the furniture; were accommodating to special requests. 
Price was better than the estimate and extremely reasonable. 
Excellent. 
Would definitely use again.
You can split pancake orders and get two kinds. So why wouldn't you? Tennessee Ham? Yes please! Punny sayings about pancakes, you got it. A line worth standing in? For sure

I frequently use mega bus but after today I will no longer spend any money with the company. I was scheduled for a 2:35A.M departure from Indianapolis, IN to Chicago, IL and at 2:55 A.M the bus had still not even arrived yet. When I called customer service 908-282-7420 I received a lot of unnecessary conversation and the representative Alex was rude. He was of no assistance and instead of trying to ensure the proper service to the consumer he persisted on proving a point and attempting to argue. Please listen to this phone call and take proper action to correctly train this employee. No eta, no apology, nothing!
I'm so delighted with this cafe. It's exactly what Yardley needs. The atmosphere is lovely, and the staff is very friendly (and very hip).

Overall I really enjoyed my meal. My ribeye was cooked to correct temp and with the cheese and veggies on top (forget what they call it) was yummy. The Brussels sprouts were so good!  One thing my friend and I decided though was that we should have split one instead of getting one each. Towards the end of the meal we realized that our waitress never brought our tortillas. Neither of us are eating a lot of carbs so in the end it was ok.  Finally we picked this restaurant as it had two dollar signs signifying it was moderately priced. You may want to add a couple. I'll go back!

as someone who used to work for this company, i have to say that my experience on the other end at this store was not something i was taught at my location. i went in about 2 months ago to pick up something new. i didn't have any makeup on and i believe i was in sweatpants. i wasn't greeted by ANYONE, was in the store walking around aimlessly for about 25 minutes watching cast members talk among each other, hoping someone would reach out and point me in the right direction with some advice, but nothing came my way. i've never felt more uncomfortable around a group of people than i did when shopping in this store.
Tried it today for the first time very good. The jerk chicken was fantastic!  Also tried the beef patty and fried wing and would recommend them both. I cant wait to go back!

I ordered the holiday special for our Christmas Day dinner (10 people). It was delivered to my home- a total plus!   The presentation of the food was beautiful and it was delicious!
