Everything came with heating instructions that were spot on.  The seafood bisque was phenomenal!  I seriously wish I had some right now :). The meal fed us all and there were leftovers. Amazing!!  I already plan to order Thanksgiving and Christmas dinners next year.

An eclectic shop, stocked with newer country-themed things, and as one ventures further down back the large store, it turns-into more of a garage sale full of dirty ole stuff.   Some of the stuff up front is very nice, albeit a bit overpriced.  The couple that work there are a bit grumpy, but once a purchase is made, they lighten-up.  A place like this should greet their customers, not size them up when they walk-in.  It's worth a visit.

Since my wife became vegan we've been waiting for this place to open! Everything we've had has been tasty and flavorful, we had the seitenderloin, buffalo Mac, and fried polenta...so good. Plan to make this place a weekly date night.

I really really wanted to love you, Cake Bake...but I just don't think I do.

Let's start with the positive: the decor was so gorgeous. The place was decked out with twinkly Christmas lights and pink and white Christmas trees. It was very magically Victorian and I really felt like I was in a story book. The wait staff wore adorable pink and white dresses and aprons and the building itself is breathtaking. 

My husband and I ordered a slice of red velvet cake, blue birthday cake and a cafe au lait. The red velvet had chocolate chunks and cream cheese icing layers which were tasty; however, the icing was a cross between a whippy frosting and a buttercream but not very sweet, surprisingly. It was almost like it was made with shortening because it was very stiff but the flavor was not there at all. It was strange to us that the entire cake wasn't frosted with cream cheese icing. 

The blue birthday cake had the same tasteless frosting and the cake itself was just ok (think funfetti). The slices are massive (which for $12 they should be) but were relatively crumbly and some bites were dry. 

The cafe au lait was served in a bowl with no handle and it was barely warm.

We came here on a Friday night around 8:30 pm and had to sit at the bar which was ok. We were attended to right away but I felt slightly rushed by the staff; they brought boxes for our cake before we were even finished and gave us a bill pretty quickly. They never asked how our food was or if they could get us anything else. We did order two gingerbread men for our children to eat later so we'll see how those taste. They were adorable. 

I feel like you're definitely paying more for the experience of this place than the quality of the food. For $50+ with tip for what we got, I would have expected better tasting desserts. I think we'll stick with the Flying Cupcake from now on.

It is a catering venue but becomes a restaurant on big holidays when they are open to the public with elegant holiday buffets.  The place is quite lovely; with tables spaced nicely apart, clean walls, classic chandeliers and big windows overlooking the Mississippi.  The venue is on the second floor with elevator access and has a patio overlooking the French Market as well as the River. The staff is young and friendly and eager to please.  They seem to enjoy their jobs. The food was excellent: Prime rib, Ham, baked fish many well-made sides, terrific soups and salads and cold shrimp and crab claws and raw oysters. Desserts were rich and flavorful. Crab Benedict from the kitchen was perfect. Well-chosen soft Christmas jazz was the best possible background. Overall totally satisfying Christmas dinner.

I can't believe this company is still in business. They have changed their location but it appears to be the same business.  I've noticed there used to be a lot of terrible reviews that are now gone.  Some say that the posts were removed under threat of litigation.

I feel morally compelled to say something. I hired JM Grove to convert my garage to a family room.  I got five estimates and JM Grove was the lowest.  I walked Justin through the entire project including the materials I wanted used (for example, I wanted the same sink and toilet as upstairs).  Justin agreed to everything and promised everything would be done as specified.

I signed a contract and Justin insisted that all the details we discussed did not need to be included in the contract because I already told him everything in detail orally.  

The project started several weeks late.  The township permit office said it did not appear that JM Grove knew how to fill out the permit paperwork correctly.  I got involved and completed much of the paperwork and paid for the township fees (even through the fees should have been included in the contract).  The situation was so bad that the woman at the permit office suggested I go with a different contractor. However by that point I had already given a $5000 deposit that I knew I wouldn't get back if I fired them.  The work started about three months after I signed the contract.  

When it came time to pick out materials, Justin said the price I paid only covered the cheapest materials and if I wanted better materials I had to pay extra.  For instance, I wanted a toilet around $200 (the same one I showed him) and Justin bought an American standard toilet for around $89 that was a different color than the sink and toilet I showed him (tan instead of white).  I ended up paying significantly more for adequate materials. Over a thousand dollars.  I took several jobs out of the contract such as the carpet because Justin was trying to charge a higher than reasonable amount.  For example,  I told Justin I needed a sub panel when I showed him the job. He said we didn't need to put the sub panel in the contract because his electrician may determine it's not needed. I told him that's fine but I would not pay extra for a sub panel.  Months later, Justin told me that if I didn't pay an extra $950 for a sub panel that he could not complete the job. I ended up hiring an electrician to install the sub panel for $600, and the average estimate I found was $650.  

Next came the plumbing and HVAC issues.  Justin hired someone to do the plumbing and HVAC work but the sub-contractor only did the plumbing work. He said Justin did not pay him enough to do the HVAC and refused to come back.  All the sub-contractors said this was their first time working with Justin.  I got HVAC estimates and learned that Justin put the name of a plumber who gave him an estimate on my inspection paperwork.  I previously pointed out the error, and he told me directly it was corrected.  The township stopped work until the correct plumber came to the township building and paid licensing fees.  This became a big deal and the township inspector said he felt sorry for me but there wasn't much he could do.

Justin subsequently hired some guys on Ebay to complete the HVAC work and the rest of the project.  He ended up only paying them half what was owed.  There was also a drywall subcontractor who Justin refused to pay.  

I ended up hiring a different company to do all the finish work, because Justin wanted to use materials that I thought would make the job look cheap.  

By the end of the job, Justin said he underbid the job.  Throughout the project, he often said he ordered materials but they never showed up.  I ended up charging about $600 on a credit card to pay to finish the job.  In total, I paid about $1,800 out of pocket.

Finally, it came time for me to pay the last check.  I had the drywall contractor, plumber and Ebay guys all asking me to pay them directly because they knew Justin would not pay them.  I told Justin I was going to write the check out to the contractors and he proceeded to send me a lot of angry emails and texts insisting that I do not do that. I'm an attorney, but I contacted my own attorney and determined that I had to pay Justin. I felt terrible since most of the contractors did not get their money.  

I paid my bill minus the approximately $1,800.00 I had spent out of pocket.  Justin sued me.  Yup, he sued me for materials he did not supply.

I proceeded to write a very long legal brief with many, many, many exhibits.  I showed up to court ready to show the judge that Justin was engaging in a fraudulent scheme.  Justin did not show up.  I reported him to the better business bureau and the PA Attorney General Office.  I believe he was engaged in fraud.  

I am writing this post to warn other people.  This was a terrible experience and I hope to help others avoid the many hours of time and frustration I experienced.

Sean was a fantastic tour guide with infinite knowledge of the City/State history! We had an amazing time with him at such great historical spots and we will keep these memories! So great to find someone that has so much knowledge and truly does this because they love it. Would hands down recommend the Ghost Tour provided by Sean to anyone!

The bar, the booze, the BURGERS the owner SAM who greeted us @ the door & took care of us along with Melissa AMAZING!!! There is a reason these guys have won best burger in STL the past few years. My bestie & I are the toughest customers & we have nothing but great things to say about STACKED. Located in the quiant  Holly Hills neighborhood its a perfect example of why STL is FOODY heaven. I had the guacamole  bites, mac & cheese bites, BLT grilled wedge salad & veggie burger & was more satiated than last Sat night when I ate a petite filet @ Ruth Chris! God must have a hand in STACKED cuz IT WAS HEAVEN!!! Why are you not grabbing your keys & going there NOW man!!!!

The views are even more beautiful than I could have imagined. I was in town for business with a weekend free, and I had the courthouse on my list of things to do. I can see why so many couples choose to get married here!
There are elevators that go up to the top or you can take the stairs.

I love this place but has THE WORST experience yesterday. I have been here 3x and that's only because i live in New York. I usually have great experiences but I went to Candace yesterday and not only was her attitude sour, but she was SO harsh on my nails. Even though I said no, she buffed twice (why? I am only getting a regular manicure) and when she was filing my nails, I had to pull away because she was being so rough. I could SEE my nails bending. Terrible. She rolls her eyes constantly AND then when I told her there was a hair stuck in my polish, she rolled her eyes again and said no it was a bubble. No, I now have hairs in my nails. TWO of my nails have broken in less than 24 hours. My nails haven't even chipped in months. Terrible. She didn't give the back massage that accompanies the maní either. AVOID HER.

Hands down my favorite bar in Seminole Heights. 

This bar offers flexible seating--bar stools, picnic tables, high tops, and outdoor seating complete with fans, shade or heat, depending upon the weather. 

The Independent has a WIDE selection of beer and wine. The tap list is constantly changing as well as their collection of cans and bottles. The bartenders are knowledgeable and will let you taste anything on tap. They can also recommend something new for you based upon what you usually drink. I like this option since I'm prone to order what I like to drink. 

The Independent is connected to a cafe that offers coffee and tea, as well as salads, soups, sandwiches and shareable dishes. I've had so many things on this menu and I love all of them. The beer cheese and pretzel, cheese plate and sausage platter are delicious to share with company. As far as the sandwiches, the Grilled Indie is my absolute favorite thing on the menu, hands down. The Havana and the Rob are also very good. I prefer the side salad over the chips and it's worth trying! I don't even like blue cheese, and I like this side salad. 

Parking is a bit odd but there's an abundance of it if you know where to look. There is parking in the back of the bar and along the Dollar Store directly next to the bar. Be careful when parking in the Dollar Store parking lot, though. If the Dollar Store is open within store hours, they will tow your car if left in their lot. There is also parking available across the street from the bar in the field that's fenced in. If you bike, there is a bike rack available. 

The bar also has darts and a few board games.

Incredible burgers, sweet potato fries, and appetizers. House salad is also great. I appreciate the grass fed option!  The bacon bourbon maple jam is so good. Every time I come back I am reminded how phenomenal the burgers are! So good!

We came here twice at the end of the year, the beignets were outstanding-prices seem good, however the music was gold! They had a band called "Steamboat Willie" playing every night till 12am, consisting of 5 older men, playing jazz. It was very nice to sit down and here NOLA jazz and have a snack. I warn you though that you should get there at least before 7pm because of limited seating.

Delicious food and Cocktails! The balcony, open courtyard and their upstairs walkway is decorated in a cool and funky style. Bartenders are knowledgeable and all the workers greeted us with a smile. We love this place!

My wife and I came here looking for a sofa and loveseat to purchase for our living room. We weren't looking for anything fancy, just something nice and affordable. Needless to say, Bob's Discount Furniture had the best deals of the all the places we checked out. We immediately found a comfortable sofa/loveseat that we liked, right within our price range. Some of the other places we visited cost nearly twice as much for a similar set! The sales associates were very friendly and helpful, without being pushy. The sofa did have to be back ordered, but they offered to deliver the loveseat by itself on an earlier date at no extra charge (which we declined), and both pieces were delivered right on time as promised. I can't yet speak to the lasting quality of the furniture, but my initial experience at Bob's has been nothing but positive.

Went to this target because frankly it's cleaner and nicer than Walmart, had a hand basket of food and miscellaneous items and put my carrier on the cashiers conveyer belt. When it arrived to the cashier, he, David, began throwing and dumping all of my stuff out?! I couldn't believe it! I guess, unknowingly that's a code sign for  battle. I asked if it was offensive to him that I had put my basket on his conveyer belt? I received no reply. I tried to think to myself how in the world that someone could misconstrue what I thought was a helpful act in such an aggressive manner. The man behind me had a hand basket as well...I warned him not to put the basket on the belt as apparently David found it offensive and his items would be quite roughly thrown out of it! I have friends who are cashiers and the appreciate it when a customer puts the hand basket of goodies on the conveyor. Say it's a bit easier. Not sure what the exact customer protocol is here, but I'm sure the cashier protocol wasn't appropriate.
Obsessed! Delivery is so fast as well. I use grubhub and have this delivered to my office quickly and the food is great!

Nice lady in the office that answers the phone, but terrible customer service otherwise.  Do not hire this company to service your pool.  They ruined my brand new pool in about 2 months.  Doug the technician was a grumpy guy that said uncalled for threats to me like, "if a dust storm ever comes along and blows dirt into your pool, i'm done." I asked "what do you mean done?" and he said he would no longer work on my pool.  First of all, my pool is never dirty, and there is no threat of my RAISED pool yard being attacked by a dust storm filling the pool.  And he said something else along those lines threatening me....OKAY, so I started looking for a new technician, one that was going to help me, not threaten me, and when he tested my water he and one other 3rd party verified the extremely high levels of Cyanuric acid and said I need to drain my pool and start over.  Tucson pool confirmed my CYA levels were perfect when they started my pool service a couple of months ago. The water still LOOKS perfect too, but the CYA levels are unacceptably high now and they don't test for that on a regular basis as the technician would have to bring a water sample back to the office (and how would a consumer know to do this on their own or what it even is if you're paying for someone else to keep your water treated correctly) and it's unfortunately due to the type of chlorine tabs they use.  Just skip this company or else you will be sorry if you ever even realise how they ruined your crystal clear water with this invisible problem.  They also won't take any responsibility for the problem even though they confirmed the level was perfect when they started service and now is 3 times the recommended level.  They would not handle my issue in a professional manner when I called to speak to the owner, I talked to Lee who tried to blame it on someone else (God only knows who else could have done this!)  They could have made it right by re-imbursing me for the water bill I will now face to replace the water, but it looks like i'm screwed unless I win in small claims court.  DON'T TRUST THEM.  I am a Realtor and this company was recommended by a client who has crystal clear water, so they were also duped.  And they will no longer use them nor will any of the clients that ask me to refer them to my pool co of choice.

Food was slightly below decent but service was superb.  They were really sweet to my kids.  The cashier gave my little one a special snack on our way out, so, we'll likely be back despite the less than ideal food.
Fair sushi but at exorbitant prices. The decor is interesting and I really like the rotating HD pictures on the giant screens. Service was nothing to write home about.
The portions are large and food is great. Unfortunately the kitchen is VERY slow! It took almost an hour for our table to get our food.

Great food but the service is a little bit crappy. Me and my best friend didn't get seated until our other friend got there even though there's a lot of open tables and they are not busy. Their reason for that is because it's lunch time and there's a lot of people but at that time they weren't busy at all. We even told them that our friend is 2 minuets away they still didn't gave us a table.
The Cuban is EXCELLENT!!!!! The Pan Con Bistec, Chrizo sanwiches are delicious! ALL the coffee is excellent as well! The pastries are so yummy.
Amazing bar, my favorite on south street. Food is great especially for bar food, beer is great, bartenders are quick and friendly as long are you're not a jerk. Always a great time here

We were so excited to eat here that we made a reservation over a month in advance for Christmas day so that we could take part in the special Revillion menu. What a dissappoint. The food was bland/ under seasoned and cold. Over $300 for cold food? You must be joking. We sent it back and when it returned it was better, but still not hot. Hey "chef" maybe if you weren't reheating day old prep... Just a thought from someone with a clue. Wine parings showed up after the food and were dropped at the table by dissappearing waiters with no explanation of varietal, region or vintage (yeah we asked to back track and find out what we were drinking, but should we have to?) We told the manager how terribly dissappointed we were with our entire experience, and oh hey SURPRISE she didn't care. Do not eat here. Seriously, anywhere else is better then this garbage on a plate.

They do everything right..."hello" with a smile as soon as we walked in.   Immediate seating and service.  Server took our drink order, told us the specials, and brought our coffee to the table quickly.
We had very tasty, creamy omelet with bacon, cheese, avocado tucked inside.  Also had the made to order, steel cut oatmeal with banana, pecans, and strawberries...delish.
Service was outstanding.  Food was wonderful.  
When can we go back?!

Well, we went back today, 12/8.  What a difference a couple of days makes.    Started well...seated immediately, drinks right away, order quickly taken.  One frittata with veggies, including onion.  Singling out the onion because you don't expect to have several slices of onion skin included, which this one did.   We compare it to something like finding a hair or two, just not quite as gross.
Also ordered bacon, egg, cheese sandwich with side of well done potatoes  Asked for eggs over medium but still runny.  Got eggs over well, nothing runny about them.  Normal potatoes, not well done.

Pointed out the pieces of onion to waitress who said she let her manager know.  We stuck around for several minutes but no manager came by to comment, apologize, or offer a discount.
Maybe I'm expecting too much of today's managers.  They're too busy or lack the customer service training, or worse, they don't care?
If rating restaurant today, it would be a 3 1/2 star.

The most creative donut concoctions known to man. And delicious lunch to boot. The filled donuts tend to be your better bets, although the lemonade raspberry glazed is memorable. And the coconut cream is the best filled donut you will ever eat. Hands down.

Seven Things to know about the Feast of the Seven Fishes Christmas Eve Dinner here:

Uno: Acqua e Farina (Water and Flour), owned by the same owners as Vecchia Osteria, is usually a pizza place, but for Christmas Eve, they transformed into a seafood lover's dream, and like, the number 7, we were lucky to be able to attend!

Due: The menu was small (7 dishes, and actually 10 fishes!) but everything was delicious (yep, we ordered the whole menu for 4 people, and had a LOT of leftovers). Gluttony is clearly my family's favorite of the 7 deadly sins.

Tre: The menu included a calamari and fried smelts appetizer and two gigantic salads (arugula, shrimp, and octopus, and a salted cod and cauliflower salad), lobster ravioli (so good it was the only dish we didn't have leftovers of), a heaping portion of linguine de mare (clams, mussels, calamari, shrimp in spicy red sauce), lastly, a branzino with sauteed spinach and Chilean sea bass with tomatoes and toasted bread to dip (both incredible). For dessert they were out of cannoli but we had a delicious (and surprisingly light) limoncello vanilla cake (tiramisu and a chocolate cake were also available). We were so full, but basically in 7th Heaven.

Quattro: The service was amazing- they coursed out the dishes for us since we were eating family style (definitely recommend doing so), and our waitress told us all about her family's Italian roots and traditions. We started with a complimentary roasted veggie appetizer, and finished with housemade chocolatecello on the house!

Cinque: It wasn't too crowded but they could accommodate parties as large as probably 7 at one table, maybe more. The restaurant can probably seat about 50 max. We called ahead to make a reservation.

Sei: The ambiance was lacking a little bit (bright lights and a pizza place with a big oven...) but we still had such a good time! 

Sette: Don't forget to BYOB!

If you're looking to change up your Christmas Eve traditions (we're not actually Italian) or just trying to avoid cooking for your family on Christmas Eve, I highly recommend it! Buon Natale!
Clean, orderly, and quick service. Another perfect meal from Chick-fil-A. Even with how insanely busy it was, all of the employees were pleasant and responsive. On Black Friday, no less!

One of the best bars in Philly. Great place to get some drinks and dance. Like nothing else you'll find in Philly, and the go-go style 60s dancers and wall of projected music videos from the 60s create a great atmosphere. Hands down one of the funnest bars in Philly.
I love this place. Both Ashley's are wonderful and Austin is great too. I think it is expensive, but I understand that ~40 is the price everywhere these days! It's a luxury, but my fave luxury!

This place is fabulous. Huge portions, homemade food, lots of southern hospitality. Their French toast is a must. Very good coffee. It's a nice little shop that everyone must try! Also, their fruit sides.. they are huge and fresh!

Absolutely fantastic! Great place for a date night too. The decor is beautiful and calming. The food is wonderful. You know the places where after the first bite, your eyes roll and "mmmm" inadvertently comes out? That's this place! I had the paneer tikka masala (my go-to dish) and it was heavenly! Not quite as spicy as I like it but the best flavor I've had in Philly (so far).

Every Wednesday night from May to September, Media, Pennsylvania hosts an event called Dining Under the Stars. State Street is closed down and each restaurant offers dinning outside under the lights. Media offers all genres of food such as Italian, Middle Eastern, Japanese and even Irish. This beautiful Wednesday night we chose my personal favorite, Spasso Italian Grill. We started off at the bar inside. We kept it very traditional. I ordered my usual extra Dirty martini w/ kettle and Steph ordered her usual Old fashioned w/ Makers. Before we could even finish our drinks we were being called for our table. Walking outside you get the full experience of dining under the stars. From the classical sounds of the Frank Sinatra performer to complimentary sidewalk chalk given to the children to entertain themselves while their parents enjoy a nice dinner.

We started off with the fried Calamari and the Tomato Bruschetta. The Fried Calamari batter was seasoned perfectly. I find restaurants often over season their batter because of their lack of knowledge on cooking seafood. Spasso did a really good job on allowing you to appreciate the actual taste of the Calamari. The Tomato Bruschetta was on point. The mozzarella was fresh. The Tomatoes were packed with flavor and the smoked salmon's pinch of fresh cracked black pepper was just enough.

For the main course I had Filet Mignon overtop a crispy Potato, dressed with Oscar sauce and crab meat. The crab meat alone could have been a small meal. The Oscar sauce poured over top was essential to the meal. It helped define the steak while giving the crispy potato a little more flavor. The Filet was cooked very well (medium), not too soft but didn't take much effort to cut.

Steph had the classic chicken parm. Kind of hard to mess chicken parm up, spasso did not disappoint. Despite having a very large portion, the meal was still cooked with care and from the heart.

Both kept tradition going by ending our meal with coffee and baileys.

Legitness 8.5

Portion 8.3

Display 8.2

This Walmart can have its issues sometimes. Long wait to check out etc. BUT I bought a hatchimal for my niece as a birthday gift which she got tonight. She went straight home from her party and started working in hatching it. It was the one that had twins. A very devastating experience for an 8 year old. One of the twins born died. Walmart allowed for her to exchange it for a new one. I do appreciate them allowing this as i know Walmart isn't responsible for a toy doing that but for them to exchange for a new one was awesome!! Her new one hatched. Both came out singing and dancing. Thank you Walmart for making a very sad girl happy again.

Excellent Baked goods! Can't really "miss" here. The bars are my favorite. A recent Birthday cake was ordered and believe me, none was wasted! Usually we end up throwing out leftovers. The only sad part about this place......The prices! Too expensive. If they had cheaper prices, they would do so much more business!

First time getting my lashes done.  The studio made the experience great!  I booked last minute and was able to schedule lashes, eyebrow wax and tinting.  All services came out great!  I got the natural lashes and at first was a little shocked by how they looked. I'm naturally blonde and I've never seen myself with eyelashes besides caked on mascara.  Once the shock ran off I was able to truly appreciate what a great job they did!  I can't wait to go back.  My makeup routine went from about 20mins a day to NONE.  With eyebrows and eyelashes all set there's nothing to do but get up and go.
Went last night with a group of people and the service was horrible . The food was was awful. The waitress had a very nasty attitude! Will NEVER NEVER go back.

The machine at one time it pay out a lot now the most you win is 20 30 dollars you put 20 on the penny machine you bet 60 to a dollar you loose it waiting minutes they are capable of sating  the machine with a laptop so there gos you're adds

After a long day of shopping,  we decided to go to the Claim Jumper for dinner. I have been there a few times before.  Service started out ok, but once the food was served, not by our waitresse, things went down hill from there.  She disappeared, I mean I saw her across the resturant, but she never came back to see if we wanted drink refills, or to see how the food was until we were almost done. The food was extremely salty, to the point  of not being edible. When she finally came over, I informed her, and while she offered to replace the food, I had at this point lost my appetite.  It was very frustrating.  Would I recommend this place I am not sure. I have had better service there, so I am not sure.  My date was bothered by the fact that the table was not clean.

Awesome service!!!
For all those who complained about the wait... There is a sign everywhere that there is a short wait time as this is not a fast food.
The wait time for the amount of food we ordered was reasonable. Everything was delicious. The staff were super attentive and pleasant. 
The place was clean and a nice open space..

I wanted to get BBQ while in Nashville, and I'm so thankful we wound up at Edley's! The pulled pork sandwich, bean salad, and the Mac n Cheese were delicious. The manager gave us samples of a couple side choices, because I was having trouble deciding, which was great customer service. Staff was super friendly too. We also got a side of fries topped with Hot Chicken, which was on point! Those fries are a must. There's two types of BBQ sauce on the table, one a little spicier than the other but both had great flavor. Wish I lived here, I'd come here often.
This place is great. The food is delicious and the beer brewing is so wonderful. It's not a fancy place but it is a great place for an intimate date night.
A wide variety of Mediterranean/middle Eastern eats. From humus to a Kafta burger to the fruit Fantasia you will be pleasantly pleased.

Awesome bar that I will be back to next time I'm in NOLA. The bigger white comedian walking around with the microphone talking about everyone in the bar was absolutely hilarious. I was dying from laughter. The 3 for 1's were also a plus during their happy hour. Probably one of the best deal's on Bourbon.

Call me crazy, but this place seems fresh. Maybe I'm just used to Manayunk food, however $15 for a salad is a little over priced. Happy for now, will check out the stir fry options on my next venture. The dressings are excellent!

Great place!! Andy was our server and I cant say enough about him. This guy is amazing and chose the right dishes for us. Like he told us the food is unforgettable and the service sucks LOL. The food was incredible and his service was top notch. Please try his guacamole with chips, yummy. 
I will definitely return to try more delicious dishes and see Andy. 
Again Thank you Andy and the entire staff of Besito's .

I hate doing laundry, but I love coming here. Always clean and tidy, the space always has good music or films playing too! Plus free WiFi? Home run. The staff is super friendly and helpful-even today when I got stuck with a broken dryer (didn't realize until 60 min later), the team offered to take over and not only made sure my clothes were dry, but folded them and kept them behind the counter...for FREE! The guy was super nice and just gave me a crisp high five and told me to have a great day. Thank you Modern Laundry!

Dear Five Guys, 

Just take my money. Take it all now .

This place has the best freaking French fries! I love that they always post where the potatoes came from that they're using that day on a board outside of the kitchen. They are a little pricey, but I feel like they're a higher level of fast food, so it's totally worth it.

My go to is a "Regular Fry". They fill the cup up with fries, and then throw another scoop of fries in my bag. When I get back to work the bag is soaked with grease, and that just makes me even more excited to dig in (as horrible as that sounds). I make sure to fill a condiment cup with ketchup and I'm set!

I have eaten their burgers before, but I don't eat red meat that often, so when I do indulge I add the green peppers and onions. So friggin delish. I may have to have it for lunch tomorrow.

Well let's start out with the bar. Old fashions....best in the area. I tried all the Kennett bars. I have to say this place has one of the best bars in the area. Now food....homemade pasta. Do I have to really say more.
Meatballs were great, better then mine. Go in sit at the bar and hope Chelsea and Gary are working and you will absolutely enjoy your dinner. Who needs downtown Kennett when you have this gem!
Loved the chill hip feel of this place. Plenty of yummy options. Ribs were delicious. Fried chicken batter was just right-seasoned and a thin crust.

I planned a wedding rehearsal dinner for my son's wedding.  I made the plans via email since I live out of town.  I was very disappointed by the venue - the Club Room. It was folding tables and folding chairs - like a picnic. My husbnd's knees were killing him after sitting in these very uncomfortable seats all evening. The food was served family style and I assumed this would provide significant quantities for the 22 adults at the dinner. My son is 6'4" and is used to eating a fair amount at dinner. Although the food was quite delicious, the quantity left much to be desired. One of the "large" plates I chose was crab cakes - I assumed this would be 1-2 crab cakes per person but it was 1 small crab cake to be shared by 4 people. My guests didn't even know what to do when 1 crab cake was placed on the table for 4 people. Did everyone get a spoonful? For the price, my husband and I were very disappointed and embarrassed. This was the first time we were entertaining my son's new in-laws. I wish the event planner gave me an honest sense of the amount of food since I was doing all the planning via email/phone. Very embarrassing.

I'm from New Jersey, so I'm a big fan of pork roll. This is one of the best places I have found near my school in Philly that knows how to make a good pork roll, egg, & cheese! The owners are super friendly and so sweet. Fast service and great food! Amazing for a quick late breakfast on the weekend. Highly recommend!

I came here with my husband and his brother and brother's girlfriend for double date night and we had a great time. When you first enter, there is a small market where you can buy artisan cheeses and if you keep walking past the market, that is where the restaurant is. The restaurant is super cute. We all got their signature cocktails which are delish so make sure when you eat here you try one of their drinks. After drinks were ordered, we got one of their charcuterie plates and their combo appetizer plate which included fried pickles, cheese stuffed onion rings, and their sweet and spicy chicken wings. Their sweet and spicy chicken wings were amazing - perfect blend of sweet and spicy. For entrees, my husband got their grilled cheese sandwich with avocado and bacon. The sides were tomato bisque soup and sweet potato fries. I got their fried brussels sprouts salad with fried prosciutto and goat cheese. Both dishes were amazing - the grilled cheese had thick slices of bacon and avocado, and the brussels sprouts were perfectly grilled and that fried prosciutto added the perfect crunchiness! If you're in the West Reading area, you gotta give this place a try, so worth it!
Amazing food. Great service, the shrimp are amazing and fresh. The Gulf Fish are the best though. If you are around Canal Street the restaurant is one you cannot miss.
Refused to let me go through with my jeep because it has a steel bumper with a winch I have four cars I get them all washed never again

Although I visit infrequently, I do adore this place! The Shelby Blue Ribbon with strawberry and rhubarb, and the Rethinker with hops and blueberries are my two favorites that I have tried thus far! Definitely recommendable, and within walking distance to other great activities and dining.

Sakana is without question one of the best sushi restaurants in Santa Barbara. Fish is always fresh, sauces are amazing, and the workers are ALWAYS so amazing. I have been coming here since I was probably 8 years old and I still go every time I'm in Santa Barbara!!

This restaurant was a last minute decision- we wanted delicious food and a good happy hour but we needed a break from heavy Cajun style food. It's a beautiful restaurant, classy designs, lots of natural wood, it's lovely! Our server was extremely kind and helpful, we always love a waiter willing to chat and joke around a little. We initially went for happy hour, got some delicious oysters (the happy hour deal is amazing- 75cents for a raw oyster!!!). We were so impressed that we decided to get 12 more oysters and share the Flammekuchen for dinner. The oysters were all around impressive and I highly recommend this place for happy hour and snacks! The flammekuchen was slightly disappointing for us. It's originally a thin crust pizza from the Alsace region of France and that's where we first were introduced to it. We expected it to have lots of cheese and appropriate toppings. It came out mostly onion and bacon, with a very small portion of cheese sprinkled on top. The flavors were good but it was TOO much onion. We were pretty sad about it, and it definitely lost the restaurant a star. However, if you love caramelized onions and bacon, you will likely love this!

Overall this space is cute, convenient, and they have great happy hour deals! I hope that if we don't make it back by this trip, we will on a future trip because the entire menu was mouth-watering. Plus, it's hard to beat 75 cent oysters!

Clearly the owners of St. Elmo's did some studying before opening up this fantastic spot. From the food, to the drinks, the atmosphere and service everything about this place is ivy league. 

Most people don't want to go back to school, but everyone needs tic one here and get learned about this food. They take tater tots which are already a gift from above, and take them to a whole new level. Also they fry up cauliflower and give you one of theost incredible sauces to dip it in. 

Then you get to the burgers. The meat is from the same providers of the meat for the St. Elmo's steakhouse. So you know it's good. But the creativity and combination of flavors for each of the burgers is brilliant. 

The food may be pricey but this isn't the Trump University of burger restaurants. And make sure you finish off your meal with a nice bourbon milkshake. The proper way to finish off any studying.

Kent Budish is an honest guy!  My husband & I own a 45 Ft 2016 Monaco MotorCoach.  We've just purchased the Coach which as a Demo Model and this is our 1st trip away from our home in Oklahoma.  En route from Phoenix to Tucson we actually lost the skin off of one of the compartment doors.  We called the factory in Decatur IN and they told us 8-12 Weeks and at an exorbitant price.    We discovered Kent's firm and he handled this unique challenge in a superb manner, working with us every step of the way.  We highly recommend this firm!  They fabricated the metal frame, helped order the electric locking mechanism, overcame production engineering drawing disconnects, matched the paint expertly  and delivered the coach repair within the time specified and well below expected cost.  Plus, we feel we've made a new friend in Tucson!  A superb job in a stressful situation!  We highly recommend Artistic Elegance for all MotorCoach Body Work!

Do not shop here.. The furniture is crap.. Breaks in less then a year and i have had three guys here over 8 weeks and they keep sending the wrong part... The customer service dept is horrible... 45 minute hold times and they refuse to do anything... Also sales lies about what the goof proof policy covers which i paid extra for and still i have a broken couch...
Please for your own sanity stay away from att direct TV they have horrible customer service, they will nickle and dime you for years after you kick them to the curb.Terrible company.

This is possibly one of the worst Indian restaurants I've ever tried. Food tastes below average but the prices are sky high. They chose a good location but not good service to fit in. Also, the restaurant itself is too small to accommodate a buffet. I have been there for 3-4 Times just to give it a chance. I'm done with this place forever. The buffet food is no where near to what you get at other places for $14. That menu has 140 items and I don't know who in their right mind have written it. You can't expect a chef to cook those many dishes, and I definitely will not be going to this place again ever!!

Stopped in for some drinks and apps on our venture through Peddler's Village. Beautiful establishment. I had a dirty martini and it was delicious. I always LOVE a place with blue cheese stuffed olives. Also, their lobster dumplings and calamari was delicious.

Excellent service, good food, good wine selection (of course). Have only been during warmer months where outside seating is available, but it was so enjoyable! The staff is helpful, and their little shop area is charming. Love the feel of the little area that is downtown greenwood!

I can't speak for the whole place but if you do stay here make sure your not in the north wing, it's like the overflow for this place. Our room was extremely small, barely fit the 2 beds and the decor they use only makes it feel that much smaller and gawdy. It's also a very confusing casino hotel and incredibly easy to get lost and we were sober mind you and not the only people trying to figure there way around. Id hate to be hammered walking around this place, security must get a kick out of those people and good luck trying to find someone to help you navigate this place. It's very interesting to see wierd windows and doors off of the hallways and wierd little nooks here and there. It's like they kept expanding the hotel and didn't quite have a master plan with each addition. TV channels are limited unless you wanna drop 20 bucks on a movie...yeah not me! After we checked in we wandered to see the pools, one which was closed for renovations that we clearly couldn't see any type of Reno going on. With one pool closed it caused the other one to be packed full of heads, turning it into a giant cesspool. Think I'll pass on taking a dip. We asked one of the workers for a good spot to eat, they recommended Milan, I wanted the island buffet, but the line was forever long,  food was typical make sure you don't look behind your booth in the artificial greenery, it's packed full of dust, gum and old food. It hasn't been cleaned in months, great job health department! In all I find it funny so many people have rated this a great casino hotel for families with kids, it smells of smoke even in the non smoking rooms but I do realize I'm in Nevada and all casino hotels smell like this, they have tried to put air purifiers everywhere but it's not much help. In all  I wished we had stayed at the Grand Sierra, at least there pools were open, they have a movie theater and a bowling alley. This shit box has an arcade with expensive costs to play the games. Try to avoid this place if you can.

Been going here for a long time and I won't trust my hair to anyone else. The owner, Russell is the best! My color is gorgeous and he figures out how to make my fine-textured hair look full and beautiful.  Plus, the salon has its own free parking lot, a rarity in the center of Doylestown.
I love this joint. Great craft beer (the blonde every time) and the food is fantastic. Add the best service in Nola  and you've gotta try this place.
Best food in U. City IMO. Huge portions and fairly priced. Favs are the Greek lady salad, chicken platter, and gyro. Good seating inside too gets very busy at lunch time but they move the line quick.

I came because I had been searching for a Thai massage for a while. Thanks to Yelp I saw that MidCity wax and Spa does that and more! So I went ahead and booked a 90-minute Thai massage as well as a brow waxing. 

From beginning to end, Suzie was courteous and professional, doing everything she could to ensure my comfort. The online system wasn't allowing me to log on, so had to call and leave a message.  She immediately return my call. 

On the day of my appointment she called again to confirm and got there early to ensure the room was comfortable before my arrival.

Massage itself was everything I wanted and then some. It hurt in more places that I wanted, demonstrating how desperately my body needed the massage. And Thai massages are NOT for the faint of heart. As you're laying on the floor, getting pulled and yanked, I felt like my body was getting a work out. If I could hire Suzie to stretch me like that on a daily basis, I'm sure I'll grow a couple of inches by next year. 

The waxing was also smooth and effortless. It didn't irritate my skin and I loved how painless that part was. 

Best of all, you get 20% off for checking in on Yelp. Love it when businesses show Yelp love!

I have been going to Drs. Rosen and Dworkin for about 10 years now after a bad experience with my previous dentist. Well, they helped me forget about that experience pretty quickly. They are excellent dentists and honest about what you do and don't need. 

I have been following their recommendations for a decade now and they have never steered me wrong and my teeth are in good shape. If it's an emergency they're great about fitting you in. Very happy that I was recommended to this dental practice which in my opinion is the best in the area.

Also I definitely recommend requesting Olga as your hygienist. She is awesome and very funny. Olga - we will never let you retire!

Usually Ienjoy meals here at IHOP, but I have to tell DON'T ORDER THE POBLANO OMELETTE ! It is suppose to be spicy, but its not. The "shredded beef" was not, it was pieces ! Also it was "very bland" no taste. The only spicy flavor came from the sauce n jalapenos. Told the waiter, he said he would tell the manager, who said, if he ate some we won't offer any deals ! Are you kidding me !

I have to say this is the best Winn Dixie store I have ever been in. It has the freshest Produce than any Publix I've been in. The employees were fantastic asked if they could help us as we were walking around. Probably one of the cleanest grocery stores I've ever been in. I can't say enough good things about it. I would switch immediately to only Winn Dixie if there was one like this around Wesley Chapel. It's about time Publix had someone to challenge them. One thing I forget to mention is that we were craving a good hot corned beef and a Ruben. This is the only place that you can purchase kosher deli except for saints Pete.

Patrick and the crew always serve up fast and friendly food, and they remember their customers. 

The wings are consistently well prepared and flavorful. While I usually order using the app and my order is ready when I arrive, even ordering at the counter they are fast -- but this food is made to order and not under a heat lamp, so expect it to take ~15 minutes.

I have celiac, and so order from their gluten-free options, and have not had any problems or concerns.

Every time I get connected to a phone rep that actually knows what they're doing, they're very helpful. For example, I wasn't even asking about lowering my bill, but the woman I spoke with said "By the way..." and then told me if I switched to Autopay and paperless billing, it would save me money on my bill. 
Another time I was transferred to someone to help with my specific problem, the woman ended up resolving my issue quickly and hassle-free. I wish initial contact was like that!
Cheesesteak just tasted like grease made my boyfriend eat it and he even he hated it and he eats everything

Best steak and cheese sandwich on the West End, and the pizza is great too.  I've also had the wings which are spicy and good.  
They have a small dining area, but I've only picked up and service has always been on point and very friendly.
I at least try to come twice a month to enjoy there home tasting breakfast. The Meat Skillet is my favorite and the coffee is decent. People are super friendly food always fresh and delicious!

This is a service/beer review. I didn't have anything to eat except the complimentary peanuts, which were good...but they're peanuts so yeah. 
I usually review on Untappd but this place was an exceptional experience so here's my opinion on the beer. There's 8 taps with one or two Stella-type brands; the rest are local craft beers. If you're looking to throw a few beers back or even try new ones, this is a good place to start on base. Not only did I get a neat little flight, I also was promptly and politely served by the beertender, and he also did his best to help me make good decisions for my tasters. Great place inside the MacDill Inn, and great beer selection. I'll be back.

This guy is a smart mouth jerk and a liar. When I called him the day of our charter, he said he'd meet my father, my son, and I at the ramp in 40 minutes, and never showed. 5 minutes before he was supposed to meet us, I get a call from some other captain who said David wasn't going to make it and that this other captain was taking us out. When I called David, he said he was "stuck", offered no other information, and acted like I was annoying him with my questions. 

The replacement captain was another 40 minutes, and we caught a total of 4 small fish. I must say, though, the replacement captain did his best to put us on fish, and was very professional, but we were really disappointed. 

To make matters worse, "Captain Dave" was docking his boat back at the boat ramp with another client when we got back, and had the balls to continue lying about getting stuck and make more of an ass out of himself. 

Don't waste your money on this guy-he obviously doesn't care about customer service-or his reputation. 

Find somebody else.
Chris F.
Visited today saddened to see the burned chapel, FYI told reconstruction starts in March 2018. The gallery gift shop great cards of his paintings & gift wrap 3$ roll.

I tried the beer sampler, frankly I'm not a beer person and this didn't change it . . . I liked the uniqueness of the beer flavors, like espresso. Their portions were huge! I swear the appetizer nachos were for at least 3 people and their blue cheese burger was great!

Not our first visit here but it's been a while, and it will probably be a while again, if ever.
The service was inexcusably slow to the point we had to ask another server to find our original waiter! Took way to long for first round of drinks and not all were brought. Sane way for appetizers -- some came, then the rest came with main course. Continuing, the main course finally arrived  after obviously sitting somewhere for a while--nothing worse than lukewarm to cold pasta. .
How do these places find so many suckers?

Food was great.  Ordered the Lunch Duo, Alfredo with unlimited salad.  Robert as the server was great.  In December the Air Conditioner was at full throttle, which was great for an arctic eating experience.   I did not find the penguin feeding station, which the temperature would suggest. 

Olive Garden should issue quilts so patrons can maintain a stabilized temperature while dining at the Reno Olive Garden.

We came into this place looking to try something new. When we first walked in we were stared at by the bar staff and it took at least 5 minutes to be approached by the hostess to be seated, there were maybe two tables taken throughout the entire place. When we were seated the cloth napkin for our place setting was dirty. After finally receiving our food we were more than disappointed that they had drowned out the flavor of our mesquite burritos with mediocre enchilada sauce. Along with the burrito it tasted as though the rice and beans came from a package instead of being made fresh. We were approached once to get the order of our meals, once when we were given our meals and 20 minutes after we had finished our meal, blatantly being ignored by our waitress. The lack of hospitality was dismaying. Will not be returning

My family always has a great experience here! The food is delicious and large servings. There is always enough for leftovers. Not only is the food great but the accommodations are as well. Indoor restaurant seating, bar seating and outdoor patio seating.
The head massage that I got while shampooing was great! And the hair cut was good too. Will come back for sure.

We frequent this joint and always have fun! My hubby is a member so the lucky guy gets to drink from their beautifully made hand thrown mugs. They are pure art! I'm a big fan of the hummus plate and my man likes the grilled cheese. The love music is always solid, but we haven't attended other nights like trivia or bingo. Sometimes we do whip out the uno cards though and make our own entertainment. My only complaint is the beer selection. Often not an option for the mellow light crisp beer people. Stouts, ipas and some craziness, but often not a kolsch or americanesque ale that drinks like hot summer crisp. The cream and punishment is close but not quite there for the light novice micro beer peeps.

In another life, in the old location, Brawley's was a once a week stop. Back then you could get two eggs, hash browns and toast for $.99.

As time has gone on the prices have, of course, risen. Still, two people can out of there with a good hearty breakfast for about  $15, including coffee and tip... if you order the build-your-own, which lets you choose four items (hash browns AND toast or biscuit and gravy being one item); eggs, breakfast meat, coffee etc...

If that's not your thing, there are omelettes, chicken fried steak and eggs, chorizo and eggs, pancakes, french toast.... you get the picture. Flip over the menu and you'll see their lunch menu. All served fast and hot at very reasonable prices.

There's usually a wait and they're only open until 3:00 so get there early and start your morning with the most important meal of the day.

Let me start by saying the setting is really nice and staff was great. However, the place is quite overpriced for what it is, don't go by the prices on their website's menu (or rather add $7-10 to each entré).  The food is visually appealing, ingredients seemed good, and it tastes okay... okay is the problem. At this price range I don't expect just okay I expect great Mexican food and a good handle of spices and Mexican cooking techniques. If I'm paying $20 for an enchilada, then the sauce better be superb; I should exclaim "oh my God!"  Also skip the drinks. We ordered a pitcher of margaritas, which was just limeade. Nobody felt the slightest relaxation from drinking those. There are much, much better options at this price range in Tampa and saint Pete. If they charged $12-15 ave for an entree, I could possibly consider coming back, but not when the entrees average $20-30; it's just not worth it.  Sorry... this place is bougie for the sake of being bougie. 
Now for excellent Mexican food, it's always the no frills holes in the wall. Food is great, authentic, and cheap and the drinks are always strong!!!

I've had credit cards with Chase bank since 2007 following the institution's takeover of Washington Mutual in 2008. Last month I discovered the secondary credit card attached to "my" Chase credit account (issued in my grandson's name) was "missing" after the child's wallet was confiscated (later returned) by the Encinitas sheriff's department following a still pending dispute. Upon discovery of the missing card I immediately called Chase and "cancelled" the old card and was told (per website instruction) to notify ALL existing merchants if the billing information were to remain the same. (New account number issued/balance forwarded but old account closed for "security" reasons. Simple enough, you would think? But apparently this is not the case.)

When reviewing my Chase account on 12/12/2017, I noticed a new charge for $39.99 (posted by LA fitness--my grandson had signed up for reoccurring billing prior to the credit card account being closed and balance reassigned) prompting me to file a single charge dispute. Two days later, another charge by LA Fitness (Encinitas location) ($19.98 also not authorized) was posted to which I called to file a second dispute. 

When I called Chase I was put in touch with the institution's fraud department (both calls routed through India call center) and was told the charges were related to the previous account (even though the account had been deactivated, closed and reassigned) and were therefore "authorized"! (What?! And by Whom?) When I explained that no new information to authorize billing had been forwarded to LA Fitness and that the new charges reflected since new account issuance had been reassigned were not authorized the representative could not understand! 

Ten minutes later I called Chase back (800-945-2000 ext. "0") and asked for the newly assigned account to be placed on a temporary hold until the matter could be resolved. I reemphasized my reasons for WHY I was disputing both charges and informed the India consultants that I would be doing so in writing once Chase forwards the paperwork to explain why.  Pending HOW Chase handles this dispute will determine what action I follow up with, which could include taking this matter to federal court! (Since it's the banking industry and because it affects the general population it's seems fitting at this point.)

While I'm waiting for a response from Chase anybody have any suggestions as to why Chase - or any credit card company for that matter - would take on other businesses contractual obligations and without both parties first consenting let alone being informed ? Is that even allowed?  F.Y.I. Amazon won't do it - their call center is also based out of India - so why would the banking industry take such a risk?

Check back..... I'll post updates or modify or change the 1 star review as events unfold....

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Update 12/19/2017..... Called JP Morgan-Chase Bank USA N.A. fraud department yesterday and the problem was "instantly" resolved. The man on the phone pulled my account (with my permission) and immediately understood and transferred me to someone to reverse the unauthorized charges. They put a block on LA Fitness vendor and made sure my accounts were safe and not subject to future charges.

Should you ever encounter difficulties or not be able to resolve a problem from Chase's India based customer service location I suggest calling the USA number (1-800 -432-3117).

Thank you gentleman working in Chase's Fraud department, I appreciate you looking out for my best interests! 

(F.Y.I. reason upgrade to 3-star review - first experience 1 star, updated experience 5+ star = 3+ stars.)

Chicago Paulie is THE MAN and Chicago Paulies is the real deal. When I parked at the gas pump to go and order my food, Paulie told me he was closing... and then I proceeded to tell him how long I've been wanting to try his food and he agreed that he would cook me some food.

I ordered Chicago Dogs, a large Italian Beef Sandwich (hot) & some mango lemonade.

This place was life changing. I don't ever drink lemonade but Paulie's lemonade blew my mind. He squeezed the lemons right in front of me, added some mango syrup and water and then mixed it up. The lemonade was crack. I could legit drink a gallon of it in one sitting.

The Chicago hot dogs were delicious. The buns were soft and Paulie cut all the toppings fresh in front of me. You can certainly taste how fresh the ingredients are in each bite.

The Italian Beef sandwich was off the chain as well. I ordered it hot, all the way and it was perfect for someone who likes a little kick. I asked for it dipped but Paulie suggested the sauce on the side so it wasn't completely soggy when I brought it home to eat.  I poured the aua jus over it when I got home and man, it was delicious. One large sandwich was over 1 lb of meat and definitely enough to share if you have a side or hot dog.

Chicago Paulies is my new go to for lemonade, hot dogs and italian beef. They are closed until January 2nd so this next week of waiting to go back will be agonizing...

Pretty good. Better than sushi GoGo in harbor but same idea. Yellowtail and albacore sushi were tasty. G-special roll was also very good. Red dragon roll was decent. Good spot for when you want a quick sushi fix and some people watching. I will be back to try more.
Amazing food, great beer selection, and very friendly staff! We will definitely be back! The tacos and white bean burger were awesome- highly recommended!

This is our go to butcher shop. They have excellent customer service. We recently ordered a fresh turkey. That was the best turkey we have ever had, I don't think we can will ever purchase a frozen one again. The quality of their products out shines the normal grocery store selections. 

There is also a wonderful selection of cheese too that is a must see. And don't forget to get a bone or a pigs ear for the dog while you are there!
Ordered 2 lbs of wings online. Came sooner then expected and were warm on delivery. The wings themselves were big and juicy. Will order from again for sure. Try the sauces, they're wicked.

This is a definite must stop while either passing through SB or spending the weekend!  I love their cold brew, super smooth, and strong.  Their lattes are super frothy and beyond tasty.  Overall, I don't think you can go wrong with any choice on their menu. Sip and enjoy.
One of the best and biggest Reuben sandwiches in town.  Cole slaw is great too.  I'm coming back!

Taking dance lessons was not even on my radar, but my Mom gave me a gift certificate, so I thought I would try it out.  I am thanking my lucky stars for that gift certificate, and especially that it was for Dream Dance.  Here I am now seven years later still taking lessons and loving it even more. My lessons are with Matt who is a wonderful dance teacher who somehow weaves a lot of fun into his lessons. Working with Matt and growing as a dancer has brought a lot of joy into my life. Whether you just want to learn to dance for the pleasure of dancing or want to compete....or even perform (thank you Zhenya for your beautiful choreography) you can find it at Dream Dance. It is a professionally run and fun studio and I would highly recommend it.

A good restaurant to go with the family. You don't need to wait for a table because it doesn't get that crowded. They have parking, the food was good as well as the service.  The decor is pretty cool, they also have some great live music and if you order food, they give you free "donuts" before your food arrives.

I ordered a small pizza on a busy night right before Christmas. They told me 15 to 25 minutes. I showed up in 15 minutes and was told they accidentally gave my pizza to someone else and a new one was being made. I was waiting for that one and the manager came out. He got my name grossly wrong but it was a very busy night with a lot of loud people. He apologized for the mixup and gave me a free drink and a $5 coupon for next time. I was impressed by the level of service and my pizza was, as always, delicious.

We had a great brunch at Luke's. My wife ordered a Bloody Mary that was perfect. It was spicy but not overwhelming. We ordered the Brussel Sprouts and they are to die for. The omelette was very good. And as you would expect the waiter was professional.

Came here this morning, because I got tired of wawa and Dunkin donuts and wanted something different. I was automatically attracted to this Starbucks even though I passed 4 others because they have a drive through and it was freezing cold outside. I didn't realize that it would take forever to get my items. With 5 cars in front of me it took several minutes. Once I ordered they were out of cream cheese which is kind of annoying. You would think the buyer would order enough cream cheese to equal the amount of bagels, but no. And by the time I got my bagel it wasn't even really warm. My white chocolate mocha didn't taste right. I probably will not comeback unless it's another cold morning because when you pay $7 for 2 items that didn't come out right and take forever to make that's not acceptable.

I love Ichicoro in Seminole Heights, so I couldn't wait to try the new location!  I went shortly after their opening and have to say it was awesome!  The drinks were out of this world and so was the new decor.  Then came the food, awesome.  I am not a very adventurous eater (very picky) so I generally stick to the simple stuff but someone insisted I try the cauliflower appetizer!  Wow! I was shocked by how good it was!  I was eating cauliflower and was loving it! My mother would never believe it!  Then came the entree, I ordered Yakiniku, and it was amazing!  Melt in your mouth amazing!  Can't wait to go back!

Literally had the best experience today! I did not catch the name of the representative that helped me but I wish I had. Extremely great service by every employee there. I have not felt that welcome in a retail store for a long time. I wish there was a location in Park Place Mall as I'm sure it would do amazing!

This place has a license to steal.  If your not into Texas hold em ( and have a clue) save your money.  Expensive drinks even when you play.  Slots are ridiculous, many people very disappointed.  Needs some fo4m of regulation.  I will not return.

I had a Groupon for $30.  Many times businesses can to treat you a little differently. This place didn't. I had gumbo, a large dinner salad, and barbecued grouper. Yes you heard me, barbecued grouper. I've never seen that on any menu before. It was just grouper in barbecue sauce, but what a great combination.  The food was good, the service was good, but you can always tell the nuances of places by how they interact with other customers. They appear to have a lot of "regulars." And that's always a good sign. Big bar with a ton of TVs. If I lived closer, it could be a regular haunt for me.   If you live near there, it's worth a ride in. Good prices, cold cold beer, and nice people.

Went with my guy's aunt and uncle who were visiting from Houston. His aunt had read a review in a national magazine that raved about the pearl sugar waffle and she had to have it. 
It was a weekend but the wait time was only about 30 minutes. Yes, on weekends there is a wait but when you have a delicious, steaming cup of absolutely perfect coffee and a serious pastry to munch on- time flies. I am not a fan of "fancy" food that throws together disparate flavors haphazardly in an attempt to be special or precious. Milktooth does not go there. Flavors are balanced. Food is hearty and real. Service is great. The experience left me looking forward to the chef and owner's dinner venture soon to open in my 'hood. Everyone, including aunt and uncle (who are gastronomes) loved it.
Why only four stars? Holy crap, this food is super rich. I know that if you get a grilled cheese with a duck egg over easy on top you should expect a lot of fat... but this felt a bit like death by sandwich.

Intimate cozy bar with great whiskey choices. Friday night, crowded but didn't have to wait! Very attentive waiter named Stefan, did an amazing job at seeing we had everything we needed, and kept our drinks full. Food was great, and for as busy as they were, it came out quick, the jalapeño bacon on our burger was just amazing. Oh and the duck fat fries-oh my goodness!!! We'd definitely hit it up again!
This place is awesome. Amazing donuts and equally amazing coffee. The decor was on point and aesthetically pleasing.

I have enjoyed Buena Vista many of times now and always meant to leave a review so here it is.  I lived in AZ for 6 years and I have a hard time finding authentic Mexican dishes since I have returned.   In AZ and being only 40 minutes from the Mexican border, to get anymore authentic would be hard pressed.  I highly recommend Buena Vista to anyone who is looking for a real Mexican experience.

I was a little skeptical to try the pizza (I'm a connoisseur) here cause the photos did not look super appetizing. But I gave it a go, given it's location right across from my hotel.

I was pleasantly surprised. The pizza was really good. Not the best I've had but definitely not disappointing.

I came in with no appointment and they immediately helped me. The staff was knowledgeable, professional, and straightforward. I told them what I wanted, they gave me their recommendations, and after I made my decisions on what services I wanted they didn't try to pressure or bully me into getting any "extras". I appreciate the quality of service and the great work they did.

This is my all time favourite place for business work clothes. Always find a great selection of tops and casual dresses and they always have a sale! Clearance selection is amazing. Clothes are great quality and looks are classy.

Sorry BB, the food here needs a lot of work. Brisket sliders were awful. Old, dry and thinly sliced. No flavor at all. I specifically asked for lean and what was served was far from lean. I don't remember the name of the burger but it was supposed to have mushrooms. When asked for them, the waitress offered to get the mushrooms but came back and said they were out. A small cinnamon roll was ordered but again, out of icing.  The bloody Mary's were good and the hurricane isn't too syrupy sweet so those are a plus. The music was very good so keep that going. Stop in for drinks and entertainment, pass on the food.

Grant, Marnie and their crew took great care of us. They were very responsive with an estimate. Marnie came out and did a thorough visit. Our fallen tree was hanging over our neighbor's fence and they made us a priority. They expedited the quote and were out the next day. The crew was very professional. They got rid of the tree quickly and left our yard very clean. We will most certainly use American Arborists in the future! Thanks to everyone at American Arborists.
Absolutely delicious steaks! And I love pickles, so having a jar on the table is wonderful! We always take our family here when they are in town and they all rave about it!

Food ok, but also nothing to write home about.  Service was terrible.  I was literally the only person in the restaurant in the middle of the week.  All of what I ordered never came.  I should have looked at the bill in more detail because I'm pretty sure I paid for more than I received.

So don't waste your time.

Wow - lunch was amazing! Sabrina hoovers around to make sure her service is perfect and that you are 100% satisfied. Her recipes were tops, loved the soup-of-the-day! Looking forward to coming back - Bravo, bravo...

First time to Hawkers.  Very nice decor and layout.  Great inventive cocktails, and really delicious appetizers.  We each had a different noodle bowl and then shared 5 apps.  The chicken wings were fabulous. Great service as well.
Will go again very soon.
I LOVE THIS PLACE. I have always loved it even with all the different owners. Great burgers and they have a huge menu. Great spot for kids so they can play. Always a plus to be on the beach

My husband and I live nearby and I actually go to the chiropractor next door who told me about this place. The waitress was incredibly nice/helpful with questions when figuring out which drink to choose. The burger came out fast and was incredibly delicious. We shared the fries and I immediately regretted not getting my own order they were crispy, delicious and a generous portion. Normally I am a bacon burger woman but I heard the Caprese burger and was intrigued. Let me tell you I was impressed. Delicious and could really tase the balsamic honey reduction  we will definitely be back soon. Also, they had the door open to the side of the restaurant which was an adorable touch on a beautiful night.

No WiFi??? 

Good coffee, but what coffee shop doesn't have WiFi these days? 

Normally I'd give a company minimum three stars, but that's such a huge thing these days, so don't even feel it's worthy of three.
This quaint little bistro is amazing. The couple who owns it are so nice and attentive to their customers. The creme brûlée is amazing. I have had many meals from here, and not one has disappointed.

Went to VRC on Sunday afternoon with my injured dog.  They came out to my car to carry my dog inside and each person I came in contact with was very helpful and courteous.  After much discussion with the attending vet, we decided to euthanize our dog.  Hardest decision anyone could ever make, but it was in the best interest of the dog.  Two days later we got a sympathy card signed by the staff we came in contact with that day.  Each one wrote a personal note in addition to signing the card.

This is the best apple repair store I've ever been to!! Right before the store was supposed to close, water spilled all over my laptop and I lost all of my finals due at midnight. I ran my computer over there and they stayed open and worked till midnight to retrieve my finals literally saving my college career!! I cannot thank these guys enough, and will always bring my electronics there when needed! Great, fast service and awesome staff!!

Please get these poor 2 young workers some extra help! The one man is handling the drive thru orders, front counter, making drinks, making sandwiches and the only other worker is doing all the same things and they are running around and getting irritated which is totally understandable when they probably can not even make a living wage which is so sad especially since they both work harder than any over paid crook politician!!! Someone wake up management and/or corporate and get out of bed and work to help fix this mess, like if you Remember the old 80's DnD commercial where the old man is up bright and early "time to make the doughnuts"! Get these workers some help people so they can be nicer to customers and not pissed off and barking at each customer! Read the other reviews and its obvious there is a damn problem and management does not give a hairy rats ass! Shame..

Been here a couple times... normally I go in the weee hours of the morning since they are open 24 hrs and it's way better than iHop by far. It is more homestyle and the menu has something for everyone! If you're looking for a nice "mom and pop" place especially after hours, definitely give this place a try. Plenty of parking and the service is great as well!

I haven't eaten here in years, and took my mother and daughter here for lunch.  I was looking for high end creole cuisine.  As I remembered, the food was spectacular.  The crab cakes were perfect.  My mother loved her vegetable pot pie and I enjoyed the shrimp creole.  If you want some delicious creme brûlée, then you better come here.  The wait staff paced our courses perfectly so that we never felt rushed or impatient.  I love that.  This is a beautifully restored mansion as well.  This would be a perfect spot for a romantic dinner!
I love these empanadas.  Grab a couple and a mandarin Jarrito to complete the package!

They were very accommodating with room requests. The staff is super friendly and helpful and so polite when we utilized the room service. The food from the grill down stairs was excellent. The bathroom is very small and the blankets are very thin. The room did have an odd smell when the fan shuts off. We had an exterior room that faced the east, and it was pretty peaceful. Didn't hear much traffic noise. Heads up though, they require an extra $25 a day deposit that they charge immediately. This was something that we were completely blindsided by. Also, if you use the room service and want to charge to your room beside they understand that. The first night we ordered they charged to our card even though we asked to charge to the room. (That comes out of your deposit) check in and out is very simple and there is a tiny fridge in the room even though the room descriptions don't include that. There is a microwave at the end of the hall. The pool is in a big open area in the middle of the hotel and would be nicer if it was a little more private. Over all our stay was enjoyable and I would stay here again.

I am a small town girl who has only had Red Lobster once before this week, maybe 8 years ago. I went this week and had a great time! I know, it's a chain restaurant and it can be pricey, but sometimes it feels good to indulge and not worry about prices or calories. 

I got a Long Island ice tea to drink, for only $7. Great deal! Wellll. The liquors listed are top shelf but I barely tasted alcohol. Doesn't anyone make strong drinks anymore? Bummer. 

Luckily, the food pleased me. 

The biscuits are, of course, amazing. I ate 3 before our entrees came, and honestly could have had more. (Ha). 

I went for a triple item platter - lobster tail, salmon, and shrimp. It came with a salad and I upgraded my side to get the baked potato covered with mashed potatoes and sea food - omg it was so good. 

The meat was wonderful, although too much butter was used for my preference on the lobster and shrimp. The salmon was AMAZING and had a delicious taste. The lobster tail was smaller than in the pictures, but that is to be expected I guess. It all smelled amazing and tasted amazing. 

Service was incredible. Very friendly, prompt, and eager to please. Sent us home with 4 fresh biscuits. 

I definitely look forward to a return adventure.

Whenever we're in the mood for tacos, we go to either this place or El Tapatio on Nolensville Rd and order the tacos al pastor. It's a tossup between them for which is better, but they're both hands down the best tacos in Nashville. Can't believe how lucky we are to have this place in Hermitage.

I am so happy with my experience here! I am in love with my nails now. 
I've been looking for a forever nail salon and I finally found it. The prices are great, the nail techs are great, and the outcome was awesome! Will definitely be coming back here!

A great place to go grab a drink, an appetizer and play a little golf (or not.... I suck at golf so I usually let others play while i eat lol). I like to come on weekdays and beat the crowd since it can get a little crowded on Saturdays.

There's a huge parking lot surrounding it so you won't have a hassle finding a spot. There are bars to order your drinks and food from. Plus there are even TV's so can watch the game.
I loved the atmosphere of this place. The live music was excellent and provided for such a fun experience. The food was delicious, good gumbo and great drinks.

We went to Minado at Norristown so many times because we used to live in North Wales where is 15 mins driving distance. The food quality was very very good 5 years ago. The latest visit was 2 months ago, and I will truly tell you that the quality of the seafood obviously declined in the past couple of years.
