The crab legs are thin and salted now, the same taste in many low price buffets. The oysters are smaller and not served as quickly as it was 2 to 3 years ago. People have to wait in line now because Minado tents to leave the oyster bar empty for a while before they reserving oysters. They used to serve tiger shrimps, but not any more.

Sushi bar is still good, fresh and tasty. However, it's now expensive to spend $33 dollars plus tips for just eating sushi. Most people come here for crab legs, oysters, and raw fishes, but again, they are not the same qualities 2 to 3 years ago. I won't stop going Minado, and wish them not only considering raising the prices but also the food qualities.

I've had my haircut by Dean twice, 3 months apart. Like the below review says, you don't realize just how good Dean's haircut is until a couple of days later, when all the salon hairdo is gone and you are left to do your hair normally. I have a strange texture for an Asian. It's wavy and textured in the front and side, then straight in the back. If cut and layered just right, I get this free easy wavy layered effect, but only if the layers are done right. Dean's haircuts left me with awesome natural waves, and I just have to wash and go to get it. He just know my hair. The second time he cut it, he did it under 30 minutes and I was frankly shocked and a little doubtful that he did it right. But I am sorry I doubted. His cuts are on point! He is also laid back and doesn't pressure you to upsell services like other hair dressers that I've seen do. Thanks, Dean! Happy New Year and I will be back I'm 3-4 months.

This is my favorite Indian place in Reno. Nice atmosphere and the food is always good. Have never been disappointed. I've tried the buffet multiple times and dinner many many times. Love the garlic naan with mango chutney. My favorite is the masala dosa!!!

We ordered the Shrimp n grits and side of gumbo.  Very rich in flavor but very good.  It's a shock to the taste buds.  Recommended that you call for a reservation, the place gets crowded early.  Nice ambiance, friendly staff and good food.
Just got my Daith and helix pierced by Mikey! He was so nice and personable. He gave me an option of multiple different jewelry to choose from which was cool!

Update on Orchids Thai: They are going downhill. Food quality and service are slipping. We have noticed these changes over the course of several visits recently. "Mom", who used to cook there regularly, has clearly retired, or is no longer there for whatever reason, and the food quality has suffered noticeably. Noodle dishes are greasy, vegetables are cheap and frozen from out of a bag, service is slow, and not nearly as nice as it used to be. When we asked a question about some of our food, we got a "lecture" from the older lady serving us instead of an offer to help or an apology. Not worth it anymore. We won't be back.

Outstanding customer service. Carlos Rosado is very very knowledgeable and 150% customer oriented. It took him no time to look at my IPhone and find out what needed to be fixed. This is what makes the ATT difference.

This is not my favorite store at all. I find it tricky to maneuver with a cart. The aisles seem cluttered and difficult to pass, especially when it's a rush time. When I look through the produce section I find it very picked over and on the less fresh side.
After a friend recommended it, I tried the click and collect option. The first time I ended up waiting with a screaming baby for 20+ minutes. It would have been easier to get my groceries myself.
The second time it was much faster about 5 to 7 minutes. Both times the groceries were exactly what I'd ordered.

This location has become a complete waste of my time. I seriously waited 15 minutes for one simple milkshake. The music played in their stores is inappropriate especially for a family establishment. I'm so disappointed in this location & management should re evaluate how this establishment is perceived. I won't be coming back here. Last milkshake I'll be buying for awhile. 

Hopefully someone from high up reads these review and does something about the appearance & customer service for this establishment. This isn't a positive experience for the main line area. 


Sincerely, 
 
A pissed off customer !

***CAUTION: DO NOT RENT FROM THESE SCAM ARTISTS!!*** I'm only giving this shady business one star because negative zero isn't an option. Had my fiance and I seen these reviews, we NEVER would've rented from them. Where do I start? From the beginning, Realty Corner false advertised their rental unit in their ad stating the home had granite countertops and stainless steel appliances...they were plastic. (Pssst! That's illegal, Realty Corner!) We let it slide because we loved the home so much. We moved in and next thing we know, the washer/dryer doesn't work properly. The law states that all advertised appliances in a rental unit must be in working order at the time of move-in. The heater was also blowing cold air and we moved in in December. So here we are in the middle of a snowstorm with no heat and me, my fiance and our little girl couldn't do our laundry. Luckily, my fiance does maintenance for a living, so after SEVERAL attempts to call, email and put in online work order requests and no response, HE took it upon himself to fix the heater. The dishwasher also was not working properly, so once again, my fiance had to flush the lines himself. After an unacceptable number of maintenance requests and a threat to report them to the Nevada Housing Division/ Tenant rights, did they finally come out and replace our washer/dryer. That was it. Great first impression of this horrible company! We stayed for two years and had nothing but problems with Realty Corner- now calling themselves "PMI Nevada". Chris, the maintenance manager has little to no regard for people's lives or privacy and lacks people skills something fierce. A quarterly inspection is conducted and they send you a letter TELLING you when it will be. Any request that they work around your schedule is useless. I work from home and requested they come on a day my fiance was off work and could be there, as I did not want to be home alone with a male stranger. This request was repeatedly never honored and Chris decided to show up anyway, causing my dog to bark and my customers to hear it over the phone, also leaving our garage door open after he left giving anyone access to our vehicles, personal belongings, tools and access to the inside of our house. Yes....all while I was working alone from home and did not realize the door was open until evening when my fiance returned home from work.  When you call to express your grievances, your concerns are met with snide, snarky comments and NOTHING is ever done to resolve these matters. The majority of our issues always stemmed from maintenance and Chris- who is clearly in the wrong field of work. Don't try to stop by their office to pay rent, ask questions or do any business with them- their office is never open. Not in the morning, not during lunch, not after lunch. You can't leave your rent in a drop box, because they haven't figured out a way to get people to stop vandalizing theirs (lol). So your only option is to pay rent through their online portal and they charge you $5.00 to do so. They will raise your rent, your sewer, trash and water without notice. Lastly, we always paid our rent on time. We took care of the house- we never even wore our shoes in the house in an attempt to keep the carpets clean and new.  We cleaned the house from top to bottom, including blinds, vents, baseboards, cob webs, steam cleaned the carpets, etc. We got $250 back of our $1,500+ deposit...basically our pet deposit. They charged us a LOCK CHANGE FEE AND AN "ADMIN. FEE" just for moving out- even though we returned the keys to them?! They nickel and dimed us for things like light bulb changes, a new coat of paint on the walls and nail holes, which is considered normal wear and tear. Considering we lived there 2 years, we should not have been charged for these things.. Get it together, Realty Corner/ PMI Nevada. You are going to be in a heap of legal trouble very soon! Renters/Buyers, beware! The internet is your friend...you've been warned.

I brought in my 35 year old Pionus (parrot) as he appeared very ill.  He had never seen a vet as he was healthy his whole life.  I knew it was the end.  I called to ask about euthanasia and was told they perform it on birds.  I appreciate that they saw him right away.  I asked about putting him down as I didn't want him to experience the suffering he was going through.  The examined him and told me what was wrong with him, although the tech who greeted me agreed he was a very sick bird.  I asked about euthanasia and Dr. Gerstenfeld  refused saying that he would not put an animal down the first time he saw them, and needed to treat him.  They quilted me into a $270 bill, told me to buy a heat lamp and call them tomorrow.  They also quoted $250 just to euthanize an 8 oz. bird, not counting the cremation costs.  I paid for the treatment, went home, bought a heat lamp and two hours later, my bird passed away.  I would have rather paid for euthanasia and cremation, than worthless treatment.  I know my bird having lived with him for 35 years.  I have reflected on this before posting as I didn't want to post a negative review in anger and pain, BUT they are like many vets, looking for revenue first, rather then telling the client what really needs to be done.

I've always wanted to try this place and I've heard some good things about the food. My fiancee and I decided to try it out for date night and overall we enjoyed our experience.

Parking is limited there but we were lucky and found a spot near the entrance. There's paid parking but the meters operate from Monday to Saturday 9 am to 6 pm. 

I absolutely loved the ambience and decor of North 53. It was definitely a bit darker but it's a smaller place with a bit of an intimate feel. There were lots of couples and a few small parties.

We ordered the fried rice with pork belly, the fried chicken and the Bulgogi game hen. The fried rice was by far our favorite; it was rich with flavor and the pork belly was tender and delicious! The fried chicken was nicely crispy, the meat tender and I loved the accompanying dill dip. While I kind of enjoyed the game hen, it was just too salty. My fiancee had a bit of a stomach ache as a result of it.

We enjoyed our time and the food at North 53. While we wouldn't order the game hen again, we'd definitely return to try other items plus our new favorites!

I really appreciated how dense these tacos were (2 filled me up pretty fast), but they could have used some more flavor and freshness... I felt like I had to add quite a bit of sauce to liven things up. I would like to try something other than the pastor next time, I just wish they made it easier to mix and match.

I've enjoyed a cocktail here previously, but today was my first time in for brunch. My companion and I both ordered a house mimosa which is a playful twist on the original mimosa with hints of basil and star anise. Delicious. 

Here's what we ordered to eat:

Squash Fritters - Good and crispy but not special. 

Chilled Shrimp Coconut Curry with Tostones - The Tostones are perfect but the topping is really chopped chilled shrimp with avocado. Good but not special. 

CL Bagel Tartar with Calabrase Crema - YES YES - Must try! Perfectly toasted everything bagel with spicy cream cheese smear topped with chunks of perfect raw tuna. Maybe order two - you won't want to share!

Vanilla Bruléed Grapefruit - delicious bit of acid to compliment this rich meal

Goat Bolognese with Cavatelli and Ricotta - there is a reason Chef Nina is famous for the goat dishes at this restaurant. This is absolutely delicious. Rich, meaty sauce in perfect pillowy Cavatelli. 

Chicken Hash with Poached Eggs - good, but not special. Could make at home. 

The atmosphere of this restaurant is very cool yet unpretentious. I decided I would definitely be back for cocktails and small plates at the bar.

The potential for this place is sky high. Very cool space with lots of character and simple yet carefully crafted cafe food. The three stars, however, is necessitated by our terrible experience there for a Sunday brunch. The place seemed very understaffed for such a peak time, which caused very slow service. We paid around $30 for 2 sandwiches that were sloppily thrown together and two lattes that we waited nearly an hour to receive. The staff was very nice and we usually don't mind the wait, but our experience crossed over into ridiculous territory around the 45 minute mark. I may return simply because I want this place to be great.

A couple weeks ago we tried to get pho at a couple other locations, but they were closed on a Tuesday night?!?!  SF Kitchen was close to the second location we tried, so we decided to come here.  
The staff seemed pleasant and attentive.  When ordering pho, there was no option of small or large, it was a single bowl for all.  In our group, one person ordered the chicken pho and another ordered the rare steak pho.  Both of them said that there was nothing that stood out to make it better or worse than any other pho place, but they both indicated they liked the pho at the other places we go to more.  I ordered the grilled pork over vermicelli noodles.  The waitress brought out the fish sauce prior to my dish coming to the table.  The color was more red than any other place I have been to, and my wife sitting to my right indicated that she could smell the sauce from across the table (to my left).  It didn't smell bad, it just had a strong smell.  The portion of my dish was fine, and the addition of the fish sauce, made the flavor that much better.  I agree with the others, there was nothing that I tried that made me want to come here over the other locations we enjoy.

Very skilled techs and friendly environment.  Convenient location.
Reasonable price for uptown New Orleans.

I've never left a Yelp review before but the experience was so awesome that I have to. On Christmas Eve, I called the store panicked because my bulb was out and I thought I could do it myself but I couldn't. I spoke to Matt who told me to come right in and they would replace my bulb. They had me in and out in 5 minutes. Thank you SO much. If you ever think Pep Boys is the better answer for car service, you need to think again.

I love puppy playground and my pup loves puppy playground too! He gets so excited when he realizes where we're going, and he can't wait to get inside, so I know they're treating him well and I don't worry at all about leaving him there. We only live about 5 minutes away, and he's usually asleep by the time we get home, even from just a half day of play. He's usually tired all day the next day too! They always offer to dry him off when I pick him up (his favorite thing to do there seems to be playing in the kiddie pools), which I appreciate. Their prices are reasonable compared to other dog daycares we've gone to, and it's definitely worth the money if you have an energetic pup! I also like that, unlike some dog daycares, they do have the half-day option.

I was a little disappointed given the aesthetics of this place is very pleasing and I had attended a work party here where the crab dip was very good & there was a lovely spread. 

Fast forward 2 years and I used up a gift card I received almost last year. I made reservations on Open Table which was very convenient, and was sat immediately even though we arrived a little early. It was the day after Christmas and very slow. There was 1 other table occupied in the dining area when we arrived. The waitress was nice, but stopped coming to our table after we placed our order, which was a tad off-putting considering it was not busy at all.

The crab soup IS delicious! If you go here for anything, go for that. The bread they give you before the meals is also very good and a nice assortment (a seeded roll, corn bread, and another type of roll). I appreciate good bread. Move onto dinner and although my boyfriend thought his Pizzette was good (for $8 it was reasonably sized as well), my salmon was dry and overcooked. It was a big serving, but for the price, I'd expect a nicely cooked salmon. I needed to dip a lot of the lemon caper sauce to add moisture to it. I should have said something, but did not want to wait longer or waste the food. When I got it packed up to-go, the person who packed it up didn't bother to put any of the sauce in my container, which there was a lot of it on the plate. I ate it right when I got home as to not waste it or have it dry out even more the next time I heated it up. Overall, I might go back for drinks and that soup, but was unimpressed by the entree.

I visited this bar as part of the Brew Bus Ugly Sweater tour. This is a great little neighborhood bar with a nice outside patio. 

They have an extensive beer and cider menu, lots of tvs inside and a couple dart boards. The restrooms were clean. They also had a watering station outside for dogs so I assume the patio is pet friendly.

I had a pear cider here, and if you check in on Yelp, like I did, you get 50% off your first drink!

I would go here more if I lived in the neighborhood but it is still someplace to think about going another time.

Had dinner at Fogo de Chao Brazilian Steakhouse on Saturday evening. It was my first time and I highly recommend. The staff, food and atmosphere were great! I usually don't eat a lot of meat but I gave all of their selections (which was plenty) a try. This restaurant is definitely on my list to revisit.
Captain Anthony was great! Highly recommend giving him a call if you are looking to do some fishing! I can't say enough good things about his company!

I'm so glad by niece lives around the corner and suggested this place and that she knew to get there before 6:30.  By 6:45 the place was full!  I'm so sad she is moving farther away!  We decided not to BYOB because we knew ahead of time the cocktail selection.  My Negroni and her Aperol Sprtiz were excellent and priced right.  My beef carpaccio appetizer was outstanding and served on a very cold plate, as it should be.  My niece loved her olives and pickled peppers.  The olive I snuck from her dish was outstanding.  My niece got the pasta with clams and she loved it.  The pasta (I can't remember what it's called but it was a twisted, solid bucatini-type pasta - no hole in the middle) with fungi is the best I've had outside of Italy.  Service was friendly, water glasses were filled often, and the pace was even and not rushed (they kept checking, surreptitiously, to be sure we were done).  My pizzelle were a tad sweet for my taste, but I managed to finish all 5 of them.  A definite repeat - with or without my niece!

The employees always look unhappy and it carries over into their customer service. I have the app and rewards for Auntie Anne's but it is literally useless because this location's scanner never works. I've tried a couple times and the employees never try to help. Oh yeah, they did honor a BOGO we had one time, but it was because the girl was trying to get my boyfriend's number when I wasn't there.

I'm so disappointed! I had such high hopes based on reviews but was very very unimpressed.

The restaurant is a huge turnaround from the chicken place that used to be in the location. It's a cute, modern environment with welcoming seating.

The menu is kind of interesting but when the food comes out, it looks like it's cafeteria food.  It also tastes like cafeteria food... I had the mushroom frittata. The portions were very small considering the price point. It severely lacked in flavor, was overwhelmed with their tomato sauce/jam, and the eggs were rubbery and overcooked. I truly think they make a large sheet pan of this frittata then reheat as it's ordered. Really unimpressed.

The one cool thing is they're environmentally friendly with their plates.

This practice goes above and beyond in every way. Scheduling and initial paperwork are a breeze and everyone is extremely helpful.

I have seen two therapists at this practice - one for therapy and one for hypnosis - and they both have gone above and beyond to make me feel important. One of my therapists even met me on a Saturday afternoon, so that we could work on some things together outside of the office. 

Every aspect of this practice is commendable, and I would HIGHLY recommend it to anyone looking for some support.

Everyone time we are in Reno, we stop by. It's a small family owned business with great customer service. They are always accommodating and kind. It is hard to feel welcome when you have 3 little ones that is why this place deserves 5 stars. Their food is delicious and very reasonably priced.

Located in a busy plaza, so if you plan to come at a busy time, prepare to hit your PATIENCE button or else risk road rage.  The parking lot is shared with many other businesses.

Inside, the store is well laid out and there are plenty of places to sit and try your shoes on with little floor mirrors that let you see what the shoes look like on your feet. Those fake little foot stockings are hard to track down, so grab a few if you find a box.

Prices here are reflect the shoe brand quality. This ain't Payless, so look for bargains if price is an object.

Absolutely love this place. Perfect when the weather is nice. Great place to go if your local or tourist.  Get the cheese and meat-- the charcuterie they prepare is so nice and really fun while you listen to the live music.

This is Wawa is consistent, consistently bad. If you have a special order such as a two bagels with cheese and bacon in it, it will take over 40 minutes to get it. Even if it isn't busy! They will be confused for 15 minutes wave bagels around, bicker among themselves... then make the wrong thing three different times. Someone in line said I probably asked for too much from the staff (sarcasm),which I agree since they never made it correctly. Yes after 40 minutes still gave me the wrong thing. Again it wasn't busy, also the entire time I was there no breakfast sandwiches out at the registers, but there were 5 people hanging out talking. Also they rang it up incorrectly and the cashier was not pleasant and didn't fix it which caused MORE issues because it was such a difficult special order and I couldn't produce a receipt for what I ordered. The store was a mess as usual with people that looked homeless inside with bags and asking for money. When I contacted Wawa and complained they said someone would call. You can guess that they never bothered. Start making food at home. I sure am! Such a terrible eyesore to my neighborhood.

We went here for a recent Yelp event and had a great time. The food was really good and the drinks kept flowing. I particularly liked the maple glazed pork belly. Although most of the things were complimentary on this night, we did buy a few cocktails and took a look at the regular menu. I gotta say, I was pleasantly surprised at the prices. I was expecting them to be higher. Everything was quite reasonable and they have a happy hour for drinks. The location is nice, kind of between downtown and midtown right next to the museum. And, unlike a lot of other midtown spots, parking is not an issue here.

I have fished on all the party boats in the area and Hubbard's is top notch.  The boats and equipment are in good repair. The people are excellent and they offer the widest variety of fishing trips available. People complain about the quality of the fish that is caught but imo the 10 hour boat would compare favorably to any other full day option in the area.

I don't understand all the good reviews, unless it's from people who've never had authentic pho. This was both the most expensive bowl of pho I've ever had as well as the worst. By far. The broth was bland. They pile on all the Thai basil, bean sprouts, and jalapeños on the pho so you can't add what you want yourself. There was no fish sauce on the table. There are no traditional pho proteins like seafood, tendon, meatballs, etc. Just a vegetarian or beef pieces option. And did I mention it was really bland? 

There are so many good pho places in Nashville. This isn't one of them. Try Kien Giang or Saigon Cafe for good Vietnamese in Nashville.

Visiting St. Louis on a business trip, and was glad to found this little gem. Excellent Pakistani food! the buffet was top notch! 

Owner is a nice person too.

The coffee is good, but over priced. Super convenient location which is probably what you are paying for. We got our coffee in to go cups when we did not ask for them and it was not much coffee in the cup. The big room is renovated and has some cool elements, but is missing the cozy feel that coffee shops beckon. Staff was not very enticing either.
Great food, and great prices too! It was so hard to pick one thing on the menu because it all sounded so yummy! Thanks to our server Mike B for the great service. If you're in St. Pete you must go
Pad Thai was delicious. And now I know where I'll be eating on Christmas.

We went there for breakfast this morning. Although the beignets were great, the rest of the food was sub par. The Cajun hash was not good. And the breakfast sandwich was strange in that it was basically an omelet put on a croissant. The area where the cafe is is cute and it's nice that they have live music in the morning. On our way out we got some bloody Mary's and those were excellent.
Wow.  Their food is great and their ice cream is super super good and rich and tasty.   Their cafe coffee is just Wow.  I'll be back to try your other flavors!

Pizza was amazing!!! We kept ordering more pieces!! The Stromboli's were delicious!! Staff was very nice!!

Salad was a little wilted but the delicious pizza made up) for it!

Great little spot to grab a quick breakfast. Seating can be limited at times but I've never had an issue getting a seat. It is very easy to order and they have many items for self severe. You pay for everything at the end, the prices are very reasonable. Delicious egg, meat and cheese breakfast sandwiches and fresh fruit!

Our family's favorite restaurant.  Fun and comfortable atmosphere and every seat allows you to watch the big games.  Perfect place during college football season.  Wings are always cooked to perfection and nothing beats Mango Habanero sauce with a side of buffalo chips with buffalo dry rub.  Many beers on tap.  I have tried other wing places but none come close to the Buffalo Wild Wings experience.

Came to grab some dinner and had such a great experience with Chris! We ended up in the middle of the dinner rush on top of the Music City bowl and he handled all of his tables like a true professional. Great food, great drinks, excellent service!

I had a wonderful experience with Dr. Nardone! I was referred to this office by my dentist, and couldn't be happier. I was so relieved to have my wisdom tooth extraction go so well from start to finish. Also, Dr. Nardone is a funny guy and helped keep me calm and comfortable during the extraction. 

I only had one tooth to get out, but had a bad experience during my lower extraction 8 years ago so was apprehensive. Turns out I had nothing to worry about!

During the initial consultation, they showed me an informational video, answered my questions, and discussed options. Dr. Nardone really listened to my concerns and came up with a great solution!

The office was able to give me the estimate up front, and answered all my questions about how they bill out so I knew what to expect if the extraction was more difficult than anticipated. 

On the day of, they were prepared and there was a very short wait. I opted to just do local anesthesia, which the Doc agreed with since I was just getting one. He said if at any point I felt uncomfortable or it got more complicated we could switch over to general. Fortunately, it was the fastest procedure ever! My tooth was out before I even realized he had made an incision! It was really exciting actually. (Yes, my tooth extraction was exciting...)

They were really clear about follow up care, and gave me 2 prescriptions so I could start with the mild painkillers but could go get the stronger ones if needed without having to come back. My follow up appointment was a week later and he said it was healing perfectly! 

I really appreciated the care of Dr. Nardone and definitely recommend going to him for your extraction needs. 

I also appreciated that the office was well prepared, and that the were so up front with fees and helped me plan since it's a large expense. 

And most importantly, no more wisdom tooth pain!

Homemade corn tortillas are amazing. The portions are generous and everything was delicious. We enjoyed the music, nice staff and cleanliness. We will come back and recommend a local spot with great flavor.

Meh, for an hour wait on a Friday at 11:30a, I've had better biscuits. The service was lackluster, my chicken biscuit was missing components, and the biscuit was so dry and crumbly. Husband got the hot mess biscuit, it was just all right. The server mentioned bringing us the house made hot sauce, only to tell us later that it was out and takes 7 days to make. Don't think I would revisit.

I have been dying to try this place. Heard alot of great things from people who visited in other places on the East Coast. It shocked us that on a Sunday that they had happy hour. We were not expecting that but price was regular hour if you ask me. My french martini was $11 during hh. We got the crab cakes on happy hour menu for half the price. They were so GOOD. If I had to do it over again would just order a white wine and crab cakes. 

It took forever for our chicken, potatos and spinach to come out. Spinach was super good too. Customer service was good. Wasn't a wait on Sunday night and parking is pretty good and valet is also an option. 

Nice music and love the wine bottles as decor. 

Thinking of bringing my picky auntie here for her bday. If I am bringing her here, I must really think highly of this place.

Absolutely wonderful people run this establishment! I found them on google, walked in on a Sunday morning and ended up having to make an appointment for later in the day. I came in later for my appointment and was handed a water bottle and an assortment of colors to choose from. The owner called me by name and totally agreed and understood when I told him I needed to give my nails a break so I just needed a good manicure to fix them up a little. Very kind couple (owners I believe) and very relaxed atmosphere that really makes you feel at home. My nails looks and feel great. I will be back for sure!! (With an appointment of course )

Went for coffee Thursday, never happened before anywhere, but there was hair in my coffee. Took it back, he rinsed out my cup and gave me another. In the same cup! I suggested staff wear baseball caps or something
 Isn't there a rule about food and hair? Yuck!

Geographical Location: Up & coming (kinda feels a little sketchy)
Are the floors sticky: No (thank goodness), however you do feel like you think they are going to be.
Is it loud: HECK YES. bring your ear plugs to soften the loudness
Parking is a little sketchy too, and you will likely have a little jaunt.
Variety: It's a good thing! There's a cute quieter smaller more intimate room but still with big noise (on the right as you walk in), the "lobby" where the front door is has a couple games and a couple booths and separates the different rooms.  The room on the left (when walking in) has the bar and more music. I didn't venture to that room, so I don't have much to comment about that. Would I recommend? In general I probably wouldn't just come out to hear music but if my friends are playing their music there, then definitely!

Bratz Y'all is killin' it. I've been few times now and they never disappoint! Be sure to try the bacon cheddar pretzel for starters...feeds two easily...just eat quickly before the cheese gets cool. The "king brat" is my fave, "the Nuremberger" is a close second. Great outdoor eating space, inside is less special, but not bad! Good beer selection and fun extras (desserts, jerky). The sauer kraut is GREAT. Go check it out.

Nothing to write home about.  Our server was good.  The other staff were friendly.  The drink was stiff.  The food was interesting, but not great.  The oyster Rockefeller special was good but the oyster got a little lost in the sauce.  The cheese empendada was cooked perfectly and stuffed full of rich cheese, but was paired with a bitter kale salad... It needed a sauce to cut the richness.  The plantains were cooked well, but the relish with which it was served didn't quite work.  Unfortunately because the small plates were underwhelming, I doubt I will give the restaurant a chance to win me over on the entrees.
The wings are the best in town!! Service is good one visit not so good the next. But the food stays the same.....yummy!!!

Those of you seeking authentic, south-of-the-border Mexican may want to look elsewhere because Juan's ain't it. That said, they don't exactly claim to be. This is creole Mexican, and as such must be judged as a different breed entirely. I walked in without specific expectations, and therefore was not disappointed. 

I ordered the three amigos nachos without cheese or yogurt. The server, hinting that the dish might be boring without the dairy, offered to have guacamole added in place of the cheese, so I said sure. I kinda regret that because they ended up dousing the chips in an ungodly cascade of guac, but hey, it was my own fault, and I did manage to remove some and thus locate the other components. The tofu was smoky and delicious and the salsa was quite tasty. The beans, as well, had good flavor. 

And did I mention the portion size? This mountain of chips and toppings was a thing of beauty--nothing short of epic. I barely finished half! Prices are super low for what you get: only 7.25 for my meal!

So bring your appetite, leave your usual standards for Mexican cuisine at the door, and you'll probably go home happy.

This is high quality pizza that my office is always excited to order. Reminds me of Dewey's pizza with quality ingredients and amazing taste. Our personal favorite is the Buffalo Chicken pizza. I look forward to trying their salads and ordering from here more often.

I think I made the mistake of ordering Carne Asada with chimichurri here. The coffee shop and the bake goods looked amazing. The steak was not fresh. It was chewy. The location is great as well as the ambience but the food and the bloody mary were not tasteful. Order something else from the menu if you expect something tasty. My mistake, this is not a place for that steak. Coffee seems like a better choice.

I enjoy brunch very much and my favorite is eggs Benedict, which I ordered here. My food was cold but the taste was good. I can't remember what my friend ordered, but she also had minor problems with her order. Overall it was a pleasant experience but not an  impressive one.

Horrible kitchen management.  Can not get reliable service times or pickup times from this establishment.  And the excuses are so lame.  The most recent excuse:. A party got my food!!  And that is such a joke.  

I cannot wait until my kids get a little bigger so that they know that bw3 is not the only wing restaurant in town.

If you only do one thing, do it well. Bab Cafe does some kickass bibimbap. 

I lived in South Korea, where the rice bowl is a staple, and this stuff was good. Veggies and add-one were tasty, you can sub brown rice, everything comes with miso soup and the portions are big. The homemade hot pepper paste is really good! 

Try the japchae for something different - they're delicious noodles with little bits of meat and veg. Kind of hard to find in the States but so worth it. 

Hit it up.

Every time I eat here I'm surprised at how delicious it is. I've gone for breakfast, dinner and dessert and everything is meticulously well made. I can suggest the quiche, Cobb salad and I always end with the creme brûlée. Don't miss out!

Sweet Italian Pizzeria with great food at a great price. Servers are attentive and from our table we could see them making pizzas in the kitchen. We had Pasta Fagioli to start. It was good comfort food! We both ordered Supreme Calzones but boxed one immediately because they are so generous. We couldn't finish the 2nd one so that one went into the box as well. We will be back. It was a great find!

Ordered bagels the night before to be picked up the next day. I arrived at Panera to pick up the order from the window only to discover it wasn't there. I then had to wait in the massive line to get to the counter and talk to the bored and disinterested cashier as to why my order wasn't ready since I had placed it let night in order to avoid waiting in line in the first place. After searching for nearly 5 minutes around the store for my order the cashier informed me that they were missing 5 of the bagels I had ordered because they had run out. I don't understand how they could have run out of bagels that I had ordered the night before unless the workers didn't prepare my order until right before I arrived at 12 PM instead of in the morning when all of the bagels were fully stocked.

It's making me give some kinda star... it goes to the service NOT the food. 
Love the mini TV's! 
But the kid at the front door wasn't very friendly. Our server was amazing!
The drinks were cute with mason jars. The question is only offered at brunch but so good! The Mac and cheese is worth it!
The best! Charbroiled oysters, oyster voisin, gator bits. Good pricing, outstanding food & service. Doesn't get any better then this.
This dollar store is a teacher's dream! They carry craft items, party items and many unique things! The store's hours are convenient and 320 Market is a few doors up.

My first time here, and I was very happy with the service and the quality of my manicure. I got the new powder/dip polish, and I can't believe how well it's held up and how shiny the top coat still looks after a week and a half.

I was a little surprised that they didn't do anything but polish my nails, but someone else was paying for my service and they may have just requested the basics. They did put a nice coat of cuticle oil on at the end, however.

I'm planning a trip back soon to get a pedicure, and will update my review once I've been back again.

So sad :( Chatime was our favorite milk tea place in Tucson by far, and we've given it four chances since it started to go downhill with weird summer hours that weren't listed anywhere.  Unfortunately, we haven't been able to taste the tea under the new ownership, because every time we've gone (after summer break was over) during normal business hours listed on their door, they've been closed!  

Chatime, I loved you, but it's time for us to give up on you and look elsewhere.  Guess we'll have to keep working on perfecting our homemade milk tea *sigh*
Absolutely horrible !!! I live 6 miles from them but they can't deliver that far !!! REALLY ?!??? Trinity needs a new pizza place !

This is one of the best Starbucks anywhere, great customer service, the baristas are awesome. I did my computer work in a little corner of the store, but couldn't help listening to them greet customers and engaging with everyone. If I'd live here this would be one of my favorite spots. Ah yes, my mint tea was great too!

9th Street Classic. Ok you have to eat on the street. It's only a window to order from. Everything is great but the tripe sandwich is a South Philly staple. All the old guys dig it and you see them gathered in the morning for coffee and there fix of Italian perfection. If your in the Italian market, nothing is more authentic.

Nabruzzi is delicious. We've been a few times now, and it is always great. Top notch food preparation in a great atmosphere. Kid friendly too. This is a perfect family place for a special dinner. The ossobucco is next level amazing. Service is always on point.
Why is the manager so creepy and borderline stalker? The world may never know. But hey, foods still good tho.

I opened up my account on line from California with my planning to utilize storeage until I could relocate.  I based my selection on solely on price NOT LOCATION OR CONVENANCE.

As turns out needed two units so had to get another same day.  I was so tired, really exhausted, was very unhappy would not rent another unit for same price, if course it was much more!

So many hidden costs they do not advertise. Forced to purchase their calendar lock for $30 non refundable and useless to use any other place like a pad lock can use anytime, not these, and they will not buy them back or give your credit back.  I didn't know this until I arrived either. 
Try to get renters insurance on your own stand alone policy, better coverage, less money overall.  Then two months later they notify you there is a rate increase.

Somewhere in their bookkeeping they misplaced a payment, keep trying to charge late fee.  I actually pay two weeks in advance to eliminate late fees, gives them ample time to process my check, since they do not have epay, direct electronic payment from my on line bank.

So it is a constant dispute monthly about extra charges and raising rates not as advertise pricing.  Not good for long term faithful customers.  The longer you are there the more they raise rates.

I feel my things are safe and secure, well lit, and can have access early and as late as 9pm 7 days week, can even go on holidays if I need.

Such a lovely restaurant with good food... lots of choices but why does the bathroom look like an airplane lavatory in need of a cleaning??  Trendy?  I think not.  Long story short... go to eat but if you need the bathroom.  Hold it.

My husband and I ordered take out one night. I got the Spaghetti and meatballs and my husband got the chicken Marsala. My spaghetti was really good. My only complaint was the meatballs were salty. My husbands chicken Marsala and risotto was delicious. Again my only complaint was chicken was salty. I would be happy to give this place another chance

I like the idea of the food but it is so poorly executed. Same goes for the drinks (bartenders range in quality and friendliness). The entertainment is fine. Enjoy the drag show but haven't seen it in a while and the space is too cramped.

Siam square is my favorite Thai restaurant! I wish I could have the drunken noodles for every meal. The serving size is generous, noodles taste so fresh, and the seasoning is just right!! The pad Thai is also very good. Thai iced tea is a little too sweet for me but that is just my personal preference. I've dined in and gotten carry out and quality of food is excellent both ways! Siam Square can also host large groups- I had a birthday dinner here a couple of years ago and we got the upstairs to ourselves!!

For a chain restaurant, this is not a bad meal! 

The hibachi chef we had was talented and the food tasted great. The prices are a bit steep, but you're also paying for the experience. 

The support staff who helped wait on us were all great - refilled our drinks, brought our salad and soup promptly and made sure we had everything we needed.

Something to keep in mind - if you do hibachi and your party is fewer than 8, you may be sat with another party or two. It's not bad (depending on who you're sat with), just something to know!

We came here right before seeing a show at the AMC in Plymouth Meeting, and it was perfect! We would be back.

Sleek, modern, and really rad vibe! 
I got to have a working breakfast with some work buds at Whitebox and it was the perfect spot for a working breakfast! 
I was not in the mood to eat quite yet, but the food looked incredible and  everyone at my table was super excited about it.. The breakfast salad looked extremely good, and quite large! 

I did put down one of their fresh juices that was super delicious and a soy latte that got my own juices flowing!

The layout is open and modern and the internet worked great for us! 
This is the type of place I could see myself buying one of their unlimited drip coffees and working from the whole day!

Staff was super smiley and nice!  The bathroom are a bit of a jaunt and though the kitchen area but I like a place that has no fear about you seeing where your food is being prepared!

The art show on the wall was really beautiful as well! 

Great spot!

Went for a full service wash and wasted $25. There was still dust and debris on the dash, center console, and steering wheel. On top of that, my windshield wipers were ripped off going through the exterior wash. No one bothered to inform us this occurred, but I heard through an employee's radio that something happened with the wipers. When I asked an employee if everything was ok, she responded that the wipers were reattached, but I later discovered only one was put back on and it was completely broken. Don't waste your money here.

First impression walking in was great, bathrooms are clean and lemony scented, atmosphere was laid back nothing to it you just do your own thing! Service was h o r r I b l e ! I had a two questions about the menu which had to be asked to another server than the cook in the back. Being a vegetarian and not having the veggie patties was pretty disappointing! After paying I was told they weren't able to accommodate and I would need a refund and repay the refund was given and than when I tried to pay the server said it went through I tried to argue that didn't happen. At my seat I was then approached and asked not to sit there and that the order wasn't paid for (no surprise I tried to tell them that the first time) overall a very simple question and order (gluten free bun for a celiac and no bacon) was over complicated unnecessarily. I would understand if there was a line up but we were the only new customers there! Once we receive our order it looked great but nothing past that sadly! The burger was okay (if you've tried burger priest patties this would not be up to par). They need to try the gluten free bun there's a lot of better choices and as for the mac n cheese it was MEH I could've made it better at home disappointedly I was hoping for a savoury, cheesy good time! High expectations and low delivery but as for the milkshakes I will give them a second chance as it could be the one thing worth it to go!

I want to start by pointing out that I ordered food very late at night (11:30pm). I wanted to try shawarma so I got the chicken and the beef.  As well as a potato.   It was delivered via skip the dishes.   I was disappointed to find that it was all very very dry.   Perhaps the time of day I ordered affected the quality.   I do not recommend ordering late at night from these guys.   I have been told to go during regular hours, sit down and try them.   I intend to do so.   Hopefully it was just a bad night. 

-disappointed

Great service! Responded quickly to my urgent call and took care of a bobcat! We had a bobcat in our backyard and were unable to let our dog out. We called Diamondback Wildlife and they came right away and new exactly what to do. My family now feels relieved that our dog can go out back safely.

I needed to find a dependable truck or SUV, preferably manual transmission for delivery services. 
I bought a 2008 Mazda Tribute, 2.3 liter, 5 speed with 91k miles. 
The lot is Cash and Carry so bring your own financing. It's a low frills outfit in a single wide trailer office but the price was fair and the vehicle ready with a clean title.

Great coffee and maybe others don't care, but I found that the way they handled the order line in the morning was very efficient... one line in one line out. Thought it was really crowded on the morning with both take out and dine in orders

This was an awesome time!!  Tony was amazing!!  So incredible to be that high up.  One thing I wished was I brought my phone up with me.  Seems like you might not be very comfortable, but you are very sturdy up there. Obviously you dont want to drop it in the ocean, but I feel like I could easily handle it.  All that aside, i would do it again.  Soooo much fun!
Food was delivered much quicker than expected, was hot, fresh, and everything you'd hope for!  yum!

All the food was made to order. Everything was delicious and fresh. The dining room is simple. The food is exceptional. I had hummus with eggplant, egg and smoked paprika. The cucumber and tomato salad side was a good balance. The pita is substantial and thick.

We have used trinity twice now in a short period of time.  Both times we were completely, 100% satisfied and could not have asked for better service.  Jenelle was amazing both times.  She feels like a friend and went out of her way to do the " extras" we would have maybe not gotten around to.  I would not even consider going anywhere else.  Trinity will always be the funeral home I use,
Food is OK. It's great for kids. Perhaps a night out after a kids sporting event. Always consistent and generally pleasant service. I recommend the salads.

My family and I went in for dinner before our movie. The hostess was very polite and seated us promptly. We ordered our food and drinks which we did receive fairly quickly. After the waitress(different woman) brought our food to the table she did not return to our table to check how our meal was or to refill our drinks. After we made eye contact with her to wave her over to our table she came over and asked us if we needed anything. We asked for drink refills even though we were already done with our meals. The food was pretty tasty but the service wasn't that great. If you expect good service you may want to try a different location.

Lets start with the physical part first. The windows are absolutely FILTHY. The handle on the men's room door is broken so if you need to take a dump expect company!! The temperature is set at 60 degrees. I felt like I was in a meat locker!

Now for what they call food. I ordered scallops in garlic sauce EXTRA SPICY NOT ONCE BUT TWICE!! What I got is some scallops in a very mild brown sh-- sauce with no spice whatsoever. The hot and sour soup had no hot or sour in it at all.

The place is a sh--hole stay far far  away!!!!!!!!!!!!

Highly impressed with our brunch experience! Adorable decor and friendly staff, yet fairly affordable price. The B&B biscuit was unique and did not disappoint. The sausage was superb and the feta cheese pairs perfectly with the meat & egg. The only downside was the biscuit could easily fall apart, so be ready to use a fork and knife! Great experience overall!

This is not the place to go for Greek food.  Seriously. The Greek salad was quite pathetic. It had no feta, really ok'd bits of tomato, old green pepper. I took one bite. Very dissatisfied. Will not return.

Amazing seafood!!! The scallops were the best! We also ordered the build your own shrimp pasta with Alfredo sauce. I didn't care for the stuffed shrimp with crabmeat. The crab meat was smooshed and probably squeezed out of a tube into a blob. I did not like the texture, but the broccoli & mashed potatoes were perfect! My daughters had a house salad and Rubin sandwich. The bread was soggy on the sandwich, so she ate the meat out the middle.  Over all good place, great location on the water!

The food was mediocre and the service was horrible. Our waitress made a mistake with our salads and then forgot one of our orders. She didn't realize until everyone else's food came out. Then 30 minutes later our order came out. The expectation would be that we would not be charged for the meal they forgot to bring. However we were charged and when we asked to see the manger were told he was too busy. Can tell why it was the only restaurant on the beach without a wait. Will not be back.

They never picked up the phone or call back when you have questions. They charge $300 upfront no matter what insurance do you have. They charge $25 per form when you need to apply for FMLA or STD. It is impossible to have the same physician attending you cause they always ask you to see a different one, you nevwr know who is going to be the doctor to deliver your baby.

Really nice place! The food and flavors were solid and the experience was great. The bread and butter started the meal off nicely. We had the short ribs, copia, pompano, bacon veg, sunchokes, and brown butter tart. All were very good! Highly recommended!

Worst drive through ever encountered. Very long wait just to get an incomplete order, second time in 2 days. Tried to get a partial refund for what we didn't receive and was told I'd have to come back in for that. Didn't want to have to drive back but they refused to mail me anything. Several attempts at contacting corporate resulted in just being ignored. It's really worth your time to stay away from this Taco Bell.

Full disclosure, this restaurant is very pricey. But, you more than get what you pay for in terms of food, quality, and service. I went here for my mother's birthday, and they truly made it a special occasion. Every person that came to our table wished her a happy birthday, and she left with a signed card and complimentary box of homemade truffles from the staff. So sweet! The steak was flavorful, juicy, and done to perfection. And, as amazing as the steak was, the brussel sprouts side was actually my favorite - slightly sweet and cooked with thick cut bacon. And the desserts were even better. I'm a sucker for berries and cream, and Fleming's mixed berries and Chantilly cream did not disappoint. I'd go back just for that! I would highly recommend this restaurant for all of life's special moments. The food is delicious, and the staff is beyond accommodating and thoughtful. We were never rushed, and the whole meal was more of an experience than just your average meal out. Five stars!

The service is a joke. I went in and was motioned to sit at a table that still had money on it. I waited 15 minutes and wasn't acknowledged even though there was only one other table occupied in the restaurant. Instead they were cleaning dirty tables and setting them for nonexistent customers. When the waitress finally picked up the previous customer's cash, she came and brought me the change. I tried to tell her it wasn't mine and I was still waiting for service but she walked away while I was midsentance. So I took that bitches tip and left. Needless to say I will not be returning.
We had 4 dishes. The best was the Mee Siam; it was superb. The iced coffee was good. Plenty of free tea. Restrooms were clean. Staff friendly.

Really disappointed as we had heard a long time ago that this was a good place for brunch. Drove all the way from N Wesley Chapel to try it when we were on vacation as we had purchased a restaurant.com coupon for $25 off $50. After we sat we saw a big poster stating they don't accept them because they changed owners. We stayed anyway since we had driven all that way and the waitress seemed nice even though she couldn't really speak English very well.
BIG mistake, cannot even believe how bad it was. Flavorless food and all cold. Very literally reheated bacon that was old from the morning as you could see the white from the dried grease. Just microwaved it and then let it sit to harden and I mean it was like biting into hard nuts if you can picture that. Should never have been served even if it is new kid cooking because of new ownership.
Owner yelled at the staff about the food in front of everyone so that was awkward. No compensation, even a free coffee offered. Very high pricing for what it was especially. We then walked to our car through a cloud of smoke from the owners relative sitting on the sidewalk on the side of the building so that was the final cherry on the cake.

So lucky to have found true Venezuelan cuisine in the burbs!  The owners are extremely friendly and the food ..... "suculenta" as we said "back home"
Try it!  I've tasted several different dishes and all of them have been delicious!

I'm a big fan of the food at Zoe's Kitchen, and with the rewards program, they give a good amount of discounts. Fast casual, so you get the food quickly, but everything tastes clean and healthy. It's a tad on the pricey side, but bonuses through the rewards program help!

I didn't dine in when I went - I had ordered my meal on the app and gone to pick it up. It was ready when I arrived, and everything I needed (utensils and napkins) were in the bag too. This has always seemed like it should be second nature, but not all restaurants give that to you unless you ask, which I've found perplexing.

If I'm in the area again, I may find myself ordering food there again!

Customer service was awful.  Paid for the shipping then 4 weeks later took more money out. I have been calling for 2 weeks trying to get fixed.  First I was told the class code was wrong so the shipper changed then was told the BOL wasn't used.  Said one fee was $90 and other one was $66.   I had my receipt from shipper.  No help from them to resolve. Finally drove to shipper and showed what was going on they said fright center was full of it.  We called them from shipper on speaker and guy talked with us for about 1 min then said please hold then hung up.  We called back and shipper told them to email them the reason for charge and the class code they wanted and they would fix.  They wouldn't do it so the local shipper filed a paper with the shippers headquarters telling them who they Are doing business with. I put a stop payment on my bank.   Cons

Lobster Mac n cheese is worth the $10.95 and the burgers are excellent too! We tried the Hunger Burger and the Fun Guy Burger. Service was fast, friendly and the food is fresh and made to order. We love coming to the Reading Terminal whenever we visit Philly. Now we know where to get the best Mac n cheese. Kudos to the "parties with a purpose" also, it's great to see them participating in positive efforts to end world hunger.

Milestone birthday called for a special dinner party for 11.  Dominic's couldn't have been more helpful from the first phone call.  Reserved a space right in front of their private room (which was booked) and we really had our own section of the dining room to ourselves.  We brought flower arrangements and a birthday cake in ahead of time and they took great care of setting it all up.  Our waiter, Emiljo, was superb at handling all drink and appetizer orders, without rushing us as we took our time getting settled.  And the food...was just flawless.  Toasted ravioli and calamari starters were hot fresh and crisp, with a subtle marinara that didn't overpower the foods' flavors.  House salads were crisp and fresh and the vinaigrette with a hint of lemon was just right.  Entrees were equally well prepared, from my delicious Tenderloin Brochette, my partner's Pasta Primavera, several Veal Chops around the table, steak, chicken parm, etc.  All superbly done! To top it all off, when the birthday cake was presented to the guest of honor, then taken back to the kitchen to be cut and served, the owner sang a lovely Italian serenade to my sister, who had the birthday of her life on this perfect evening.  You won't go wrong at Dominic's , whatever the occasion.  Complete 5 star experience!

My entire pregnancy/maternity experience was excellent. From my prenatal care at Temple Northeastern with Nurse Amanda and Dr. Herrine (and amazing staff) to ultrasounds in the fetal center with the amazing technicians and Keisha (non-stress test tech) to my actual labor and delivery with the amazing Dr. Martin, Dr. Pantoja, Dr. Kylee, Nurse Sylvia, Nurse Linda, Nurse Jody, Nurse Jaime, Dr. Kylee and every single nurse, doctor, resident and student who made us a priority....we can't thank you enough. Everyone who works for the OBGYN, fetal center and labor/delivery absolutely LOVE what they do. It shows. If you want to go natural then they support you, which they did for me. Because my son was estimated to be larger, I had to have a c-section but wasn't pressured at all. My husband and I were informed of all the details and were left to make whatever decision we felt was best. Everyone on staff was so supportive and encouraging (I went in early for induction and didn't dilate for 2 days straight). Many times Temple can get a bad reputation but this was NOT my experience. I will have all of my children at Temple as long as I am living in Philadelphia. Thank you from the bottom of my heart for making my experience a wonderful one!!!
I absolutely love this taco truck! The food is ALWAYS fresh and on point! And these guys are super friendly!
My favorite hibachi and best yum yum sauce. Lunch specials are the best bang for your buck.
They changed ownership to Carmike and are also playing current movies. I enjoy going there with the Mrs. because of the location and the prices.

I met Mega while on vacation in 1998.  I was in the throes of an MS episode that flared up from my trip across the country.  Having never experienced energy work at that time, I gave it a go.  Needless to say, I found immediate physical relief but more importantly it began my journey to self healing in a significant way.   Proudly, I am free of MS today and have been for 17 years (diet change, healing work both emotional and physical were part of the routine).  Over nearly 20 years, I have worked intermittently with Mega and other healers to help clear deep layers of emotional and spiritual wounds that led to dis-ease in my body.    It is my firm belief that no one heals without their own commitment to doing so, leaning on someone for a miracle is not the way out.   This is a principal that Mega clearly shares with me.   She is grounded (which is not always easy to find in a healer), she is VERY skilled (and I have been to many people), she is deeply caring, she just IS magnificent.   I am sincerely blessed to have found Mega on my path.
When you come here, order the creole slammer. This dish was everything. A great breakfast mix of seafood, scrambled eggs, and a biscuit. Very filling meal.

Today I had very bad experience with this theatre. I had booked my movie ticket online long back and when i went at the ticket counter the girl who was assisting me she was literally saying that due to some reason we are not showing the movie and she asked me for the refund and she gave me the refund as a gift card  then i got doubt so went to next counter and asked for the movie ticket which i went to watch that guy gave me the ticket. I dont whats wrong with that girl, literally infront of me for 4 people she lied that we are not playing this movie and sent them back. She dont even have that much of sense that people travel from so far with family and friends to watch movie and spent some time.  Heartless girl seriously i dont want to take out her name in this message. Atleast if she reads this review  she wont repeat this things again. Because people travel with family and friends from far to watch movie.

If we're in the area...we always choose this Hardee's over the one on East Washington St or elsewhere. The Staff at E 21st are usually friendly ....orders are fresh, accurate, and the yum factor is on point.

TERRIBLE service ruined the meal entirely. Our main waiter took our order and then never once did he come back to the table, despite the fact that after 45 minutes we still had no food and needed drink refills. He was checking on other tables around us, but he wouldn't even look at us. The second waiter (Rhett or Brett?) was trying his best, he brought us a second round of drinks and finally brought our food. My husband and I split a burger, each of our kids had pasta, and our granddaughter had fried fish. Our $18 burger and fries were stone cold, completely inedible (this should have been that big, delicious burger you can only get at a bistro). The two pasta dishes were both terrible - the Shrimp & Angel hair Pasta was bland and tasteless, and the Pasta Jambalaya was just gross, it tasted awful. My granddaughter's fried speckled trout was actually delicious. We sent the burger back and waited, and waited, and waited some more. Keep in mind, our main waiter could see all of this unfolding the entire time and still never approached us. Finally we asked to speak to the manager, he didn't seem too concerned and he never apologized, just said he would "go find our burger." After another 15 min or so, we got up to leave and the manager finally showed up with our burger. By this point we didn't even care. Finally, the manager became apologetic and offered to comp our meal, he boxed up our burger to go. After two hours of waiting in a beautiful restaurant, my husband and I ended up hurriedly eating our burger in an Uber on the way to City Park. We will NEVER go back, nor recommend it to anyone. We live just a couple of hours from NOLA and visit frequently; in a city with so many fabulous places to eat, why would we ever give our business to a restaurant that treated us so poorly?
Great local company. I use them to tow my company trucks when they break down. I've always had good service.

I made two appts with Gina only to have them both cancelled as I was en route to her salon -- about 20-30 mins before my appt. Both days required I take time away from work, and drive across town. She never even returned my call to reschedule after the first time. The second time she hung up on me. Incredibly unprofessional and rude.

I had my car serviced here. Just an oil change which included a car wash and for a nominal fee a tire rotation.  When I picked up my car I noticed it wasn't washed which didn't bother me, but then I started wondering what other services were not done and it looks like the tire rotation wasn't done either. I called Bryan my the service advisor and he said that a 3 tire cross rotation was done (impossible by the way) and to bring my car in this weekend to have it detailed.  After speaking with his manager Richard Phelps I opted to take Bryan up on the offer, but Bryan now said it would have to be either Tuesday through Friday or 7a Saturday morning, none of which worked for me, and so it was an empty gesture. I would think twice about letting them work on your car. They're untrustworthy and dishonest at worst. 

Update: I took them up on the offer to detail my car and rotate my tires. Overall the job is satisfactory and I will not nit pick the small stuff, but they did forget one major thing that I noticed as I was about to pull away. The picture speaks for itself.  Good thing the windshield wiper was on the dash and it was a sunny day otherwise it could have been dangerous for me. As a result, my rating stays.

I stopped by here on my birthday during my annual birthday happy hour food crawl and was pleasantly surprised. The raw oysters were fabulous and the drinks were a delight, although the best part of all was their customer service!! 

I had accidentally noted the the wrong time for their happy hour, but when I walked in the front door and asked it it was happy hour - the GM (I think) said that I was a bit too early but he was happy to honor it!! And he didn't even know it was my birthday! Man, what a great birthday treat! It really made me feel like I was in New Orleans. 

P.S. The bartender was also the oyster shucker and SHE (yes, SHE! Love this!!! ) was awesome and incredible!
75 cents per oyster in the happy hour time!!! We come for lunch and cannot help to order one dozen and another dozen after that!!! Highly recommend this place. Everything is delicious.
Sandwiches are good, and we like the peppers that you can buy in a jar to take home. Good little sandwich shop.

Wonderful atmosphere, friendly staff, and a delicious menu make The Love a top Center City pick. 
The warm and slightly salty Parker House rolls, delicious pasta second course as a savory starter, followed by the entrees. Tasty. If you are a fan of grits and collard greens, don't miss 'em. They are excellent. Dessert was green tea sorbet that was light and a happy ending to the meal.

Sometimes your curiosity gets the best of you and you have to find out what's behind the door. Walking around the neighborhood we stumbled upon The Saint and were curious what this joint was. Without checking Yelp and opting to just find out for ourselves, we walked into this bar to discover some flavor.

From the one-of-a-kind-altar, karaoke night on Tuesday, a sex toy arcade game, photobooth, and all the eclectic decorations- we knew we were in for a fun time. Drinks are very well priced and this bar is no frills when it comes to its vibe. Stellar liquor selection and ample amount of seating, inside and out, you can guarantee you'll have a great time. Bathrooms are definnitely divey but you wouldn't be walking into this joing if dive bars weren't your jam.

I love the staff here, they are incredibly kind and there's a sense of community amongst the customers and staff every time I come in. The sushi is great, very fresh. And if you're lucky you can watch Chef Kim make it for you on the spot. Great prices too, awesome lunch special.

As an event planner I understand firsthand the kinks and quirks of the first round of an event that you'll never know until you give it a try. Leading with this in mind, I thought the Carmel Christkindlmarkt did a fantastic job of creating a cozy and warm environment on the plaza of the Palladium. The German wooden booths combined with the ice skating rink in the center, raclette sandwich booth with Amelia's baguettes, gingerbread, hot cocoa, mulled Guhlwein, brats and sauerkraut from Joe's Butcher Shop and festive decor makes for a lovely winter wonderland. I loved seeing the integration of several Hoosier businesses like X'Chocal Art, Joe's Butcher Shop, Winzerwald Winery and Urban Chalkboard. Carmel has had an impressive increase in local and diverse businesses in the last few years and this event offered a taste of that.  I imagine next year they will spread out the space and add more food vendors to help with the flow and wait lines for eats and drinks. 

My only complaint would be the placement of the porta potties and the proximity of the smell to the funsies. All learnings for next year. Great work!

The classes here are so fun and every day is a chance to push yourself and learn more. The teachers are always super nice and there is always a positive atmosphere. Prices are very reasonable and we always have new students. I have advanced so much in such little time and I encourage everyone to sign up for a class!

I went here a couple weeks ago to kill Tim while waiting to pick someone up from a show at the academy of music, and I've recommended it to at least four people since then.  The food was delicious, drinks were on point, and prices were great!  Can not wait to go here again!

Avoid!  

Pulled up here for a quick oil change and couldn't even get help.  

Some unfriendly, unsavory type rattled off a dozen excuses about how none of his bays were working and he had a car in front of me that would take 45-minutes.  I reminded him they closed in 45-minutes and he just stared at me.  Then he asked, "Is there a problem?"  Uh, yeah.  Your inclmpetence and your attitude, dude.

All their outdoor lights are burned out, the place looks ragged . . . avoid!

I'm super excited to finally have a creamistry in town!  So far, I've only had cookies and cream and the cap'n crunch flavor, but the cap'n crunch is my favorite! The wait is a bit long because of how they make the ice cream and it is a bit pricey, but I'm glad I got to try it out. Not sure if I'll be back super soon because of the price, but it's definitely worth the try! Glad we have another ice cream option in town!

This lives up to its yelp reviews. Food was not great, I just picked at it, even though I was famished. Servers were friendly, but did not pick up when I was not eating my meal. I ordered the P.O.'boy, bread was truly awful. The red beans and rice were fine though.
Delicious ice cream. Generous portions. Unique home-made flavors. Super friendly people. Skip the places with gimmicks. Get the real thing here.

My wife and I decided to try Yolklore after she had read a good review of the restaurant.  We arrived around 8:30 a.m. The place, while busy, had enough seats available.  In regards to the seating, there are perhaps 4 small tabletops, 1 large communal style table that seats around 20, and a long bar style seating area for around 10 persons.  We were able to procure a small table for the two of us.  

My wife ordered our dishes: the Johnny Ham Hands and the large size option for the Gravy Train dish.  The smaller size for the Gravy Train would have been enough, as we only ate half of the dish.  Both dishes were okay, nothing special that would warrant our return to the restaurant, since there are closer options to where we live.  However if you live close by or are in the area, then the restaurant is a fine choice for breakfast.

I have never waited in a drive through line so long. What are they doing that takes so long. Maybe they are short handed on cooks. Anyway avoid the drive through here if you can. Food quality was standard McDonald's.

I stopped in this Starbucks on my way from Delaware County to New York City (all the way up from Florida) and the Barista, her name was Armani and a target employee named Brenda were awesome. They were fast, friendly, helpful and professional. This was the kind of Customer service I ensure with my own business so it was good to see it in the hustle and bustle of the city. Thanks ladies!

Great location for visiting museums.  My kids and I stayed and visited the Barnes and Franklin Institute which were within a quick walk.  The staff was nice and the hotel was pretty nice. A few things did not work perfectly: Internet was spotty and tv didn't get many channels but he pool was perfect for the kids and made up for any short comings.

Churro kettle corn is one of my new favorite things thanks to these guys.  Snagged a bag at the loft the theatre. My other half and I could not put it down. So tasty! Looking forward to encountering their stand and trying their fresh corn.

This place is incredible! From appetizers to desserts, everything was fantastic. My wife and I left our meal selections up to our awesome server, Andy, and he chose the perfect dishes for us. Even the kids loved it-- especially the table side guacamole! We will definitely be back.
I had to try the chili in the food court for $4.  Pretty good and filling!  Short line and nice and hot.  Not too spicy and they even provide cheese.

Gracious hosts.  Super friendly staff.  We stopped by on a whim with a friend and had a glass of wine at the bar.  We decided to stay for dinner and I'm glad we did.  We shared the Buratta Toast and the Calamari, both were superb.  I wasn't crazy about the bread that was brought to the table, it was more of a whole grain bread instead of a baguette, but not a big deal.  We shared the table side Caesar salad, as our server made the salad he told us a funny story.  Good dinner theater, we laughed.  I had a braised Lamb Shank finished with Au Jus for dinner.  I didn't need a knife, so tender.  Absolutely wonderful.  My wife had the Veal Saltimbocca and our guest had a fish special.  All entrees were excellent.  We opted to share two desserts, and our server graced us with a complimentary round of limoncello.  I forgot to mention that we ordered a nice bottle of wine that our server had suggested.  We had a great experience and look forward to going back again soon!
The pork chops were delicious. Yummy burger. Good beer and cocktail selection, nice decor. It was busy when we were there, so a little loud.
Very very fun!!! Did the zombie room with my 13 year old. We solved it, just the right amount of difficulty for us. Highly recommend

Easily the best coffee I've had. I drink 2-3 cups of whatever coffee I can drink on the daily but holy cow this stuff is good. Way better quality than anything I've ever had before. A friend brought me here and I wasn't all that excited to go, but now it's a holy grail. Seriously, if you have the chance stop in. You won't find stuff like frappuccino's or Americano's on the menu but it's 800% better. Trust me. I made a yelp account just to leave this review. Super helpful staff. Decent price for the coffee you get. I'm sold.
Service was ok. Salsa was bland. Steak was overcooked and over-seasoned. Baked potato was covered in salt. Total disappointment!

I love this place! There are always amazing cheese selections, and the chocolates are delicious as well. I recently tried some of their meats and I was very happy with the price and quality. There is always something interesting on their shelves! The frozen shrimp are great, and you can't beat the price. Definitely check it out! It's not a fancy supermarket, but it's good quality with low prices.

this is now a resturant still acting like a taco truck. We ordered tacos,the asada was not fresh the pastor was ok, street taco size. My husband also ordered queso enchilladas which were dry dry and more dry, litterally the cheese was not even melted and the sauce was baked on,  he originally wanted 2 pastor and one queso the lady said she couldnt do that, doesnt make sense since cheese is cheaper , so he ordered just cheese.  You have to pay for chips and salsa, any sit down mexican resturant you go to offers complimentary chips and salsa, but i guess they haven't caught on. The beans tasted like they were out of a can. Save your money! and the lady taking your order is not friendly at all.
The real deal! We had the oyster plate and the shrimp plate. Both were excellent. Prices are reasonable. Great choice for authentic Louisiana cuisine.

I had the shrimp and grits and they were just okay. We went at prime brunch time on a Friday and the place was pretty empty which should have tipped us off. The service was good but I wouldn't make it a point to come back here.
Clean, quiet.....very nice and prompt staff. Benedict Special was unique, AND very delicious!

Hidden Gem! Their coffee and tea along with the amazing customer service brightened my morning. I wasn't feeling well and they were able to give me whatever I asked for to accommodate my crazy concoction to soothe my throat. I'm a regular coffee and tea drinker and I've been dying to try this cute spot on the Avenue. I know that I will be back.

Worst customer service ever.  There are progressive hipsters, and then there are asshole hipsters.

Nothing but shitty-look-giving folks running this spot

Atmosphere is nice. It is a great place to go to grab a drink and chat. Food is nothing special. With so many outstanding places to go in South Philly I would choose another place if you are coming for dinner.

Great place!

Ordered:
- Fried chicken (white meat)
- Boudin balls
- Alligator Cheesecake
- Jambalaya
- Creme brûlée

Came on Saturday night (party of 2) and were seated in 30 mins. The environment is quirky, artsy, and wonderful. The waiter was attentive and informative. We had a great time. The bill came out to $61 and was well worth it. We even had leftovers for another meal. The meals were all cooked well and the cornbread and salads kept us happy until the courses/appetizers came. Alligator cheesecake is a must! It's not the standard cream cheese cheesecake but is more like a quiche. But...my favorite meal here was the jambalaya. The flavor was complex and the consistency was perfect (the rice was fluffy, not soggy). It had a nice refreshing zest too it as well as a deep savory flavor.
