The seafood benedict was arguably the best eggs benedict I've ever had. My husband had the big easy breakfast and said it was great. This place is small and busy so get there early. Once you're seated, the food comes pretty quickly. Highly recommend stopping here!
Excellent work...they were here for 1.5 hours!!!! My car is sparkling~!!!! Definitely an official long term client.

Overall I had a fun experience here, in this unassuming strip mall storefront that opens out into a very nicely furnished pub area. It's not what you expect from the outside at all - the menu is actually upscale (as are the beer selections). Wouldn't hurt if they could update the building exterior. Maybe add a nicer-looking sign from the highway. Little things.

The food, a strong 4.5 stars. My friends had good reports back about crab chowder and the crab enchilada special. While in the middle of my two delicious beers I lit into the special burger of the day, which came with bacon, Gorgonzola, mushroom gravy, and something else I forget. I asked rare, it came out nice and just on the medium rare side of rare, which is really what I wanted. Heck, Courtney (our waitress) asked if I wanted it Pittsburgh rare (similar to "blue"), and so I bet they will do whatever you ask.

Side note: Courtney was awesome. She was a great sport and took everything in stride. She made me feel like the only patron even as she waited on my other 10 friends and other tables. I did have to ask for her once or twice but heck, that's life in a popular establishment. She got all of our orders right, only forgetting one beer on the evening (but not charging for it, and it wasn't mine so who cares!). Kudos to Courtney. If you know her, remind her about The Fest in Gainesville.

Anyway, if I can point to one main culprit for the slide to four stars, it's dessert. I had my heart set on the caramel cake, but apparently it was discontinued (Courtney mentioned that they should remove it from the menu, so it seemed like more than just being out). I tried the chocolate stout ice cream and it was unfortunately sitting in a sea of liquid. The texture of the remaining ice cream was rather icy. The other ice cream ordered did not appear to have these problems, so I'm inclined to blame it on the alcohol from the beer, but TSP may want to check their freezer temperature just in case. Food prices are a bit high but not outrageous enough for a star deduction, not to mention beer prices were very reasonable for the craft selections.

We came into town several days before attending a New Year's Eve wedding. My husband did a bit of research and found Indeblue. 
What a fabulous find! The atmosphere was sophisticated and quiet. The wait staff was knowledgeable and service was timed perfectly.  The food was delicate and very tasty.  Each dish had its own unique flavor and the portions were generous but not overbearing.  Highly recommend this restaurant.
Ordered one pizza online and went to pick it up more than an hour later. It still isnt ready. Terrible, I should have just cooked it myself.

This is a food court eatery. So I always get my food to go. They have fast service and generous portions. To top it all off the food is excellent. I always get the vegetarian plate and am never disappointed. I will go back on my next visit to clearview mall.

Seriously. This place is ridiculous!!!  I walked in at 8:25 am on a Thursday. Went to window. Told her I was here. Didn't ask if I had an appointment. But directed me to "sign in" in on a sheet of paper. I checked the box that said I had an appointment. So felt little better. 

Easily 10 people waiting with me. Finally I asked if my turn was soon ... and she asked me if I had an appointment. 
"YES", I said. And then she said she'd take me back soon, which I appreciated.  I waited 15 more minutes. 

 Well !  I know why the LONG WAIT !!  She was the ONLY employee !!!   Desk and lab work combined.  CRAZY !! 

Thankfully, she was talented enough. Because, she gets a lot of practice I suppose !!

After finishing, I walked through the waiting room to all the long faces. And I announced ..."guess what !! she's the ONLY employee here till 10AM!!!  Patients couldn't believe it. And some left immediately. 

Seriously !  How do you run a business like this ?!

I encouraged everyone to fill out one of the survey cards I saw on the wall. Funny thing, I took it home to fill it out and noticed that somebody had already marked a Pen Mark in the "excellent" category, under "overall experience", so that if you weren't careful, you would handed in and not know that!!!  See attached pic 

We all detest insurance companies.  And having this business to be our designated lab, is a slap in the face. 

I know this isn't an exception At this Bryn Mawr location, as everyone I asked has had the same experience. 

If anyone is reading this, please address and send this woman some HELP!!!!

I'm not a coffee drinker but come here for their gluten free baked goods. They have different donut choices every week and I haven't been disappointed yet! They also have home made "Pop tarts" which are also awesome. I had key like and a mocha which both were awesome.

This is the best vinyl shop I've found in Indy thus far. It is clean and organized the vinyls are priced perfectly. They have a stage for local budding artist to rock out on and the tinker coffee shop in the back has amazing coffee to boot. Definitely check them out.

After living in Vegas for a while, my boba standards have become a bit higher; this place does just the trick. My problem with Reno boba is that their boba is not that chewy! They're usually on the firmer side, but Bubble Tea Station Café have perfected their tapioca pearls. The pearls are the right amount of chewy and gooey, making them have a great bite. 

Now for their drinks, they are delicious! The honeydew snow is very flavorful and you can really taste the fruitiness of it. The Thai tea is also good; the only complaint I had with this drink is that it tasted a bit watered down. I'm sure it was a fluke in the making of the drink, and I'll be sure to update my post the next time I have this drink.

What I also like about this boba spot is that you can adjust the sweetness of their drinks! All of the Vegas boba spots have this as an option, so it's great to finally see this option in the Reno/Sparks area.

They also have a variety of sweet treats, from the Filipino Casava cake to Baklava. I wasn't able to try any of these at this time, but they all looked delicious!

I thoroughly enjoyed this museum particularly because of the Nick Cave exhibit. I've never heard of this particular artist before but I'm glad I stopped in because he has some really colorful pieces. The museum is easy to find with ample parking, however there is a charge for their lot. I paid $3, arriving around 4:00 and staying until closing. The World War I exhibit is on the first level and it's pretty extensive. This might be the first museum I've visited where the 70% of the museum is dedicated to World War I Art. It got pretty boring for me since I'm not into World War I art but did enjoy seeing their small contribution of two pieces of artwork to the Harlem Hellfighters. They could've covered more of that but I digress. The upstairs seems to be reserved for Special Exhibitions which in this case was Nick Cave. The building is so huge that I wish there was more exhibits on display. There appears to be another section of the building that is closed off, going down the hall on the first floor. Not sure if there's something on that side used for rental spaces or offices but I do think the building is underutilized. They also have a cafe which unfortunately I did not visit. As long as they continue to have more interesting exhibits like Nick Cave, I'll keep coming back whenever I'm in town.
Incredibly slow service. Waiting over 25 minutes to get my order. This is not fast food

Can't say enough good things about this establishment. Due to a mistake entirely of my own fault, I neglected to order rice with my butter chicken (I didn't see that it had to be ordered separately). I believe it was the owner (or one of his very nice employees) who drove to my condo to drop off a separate order of rice at no extra charge. I can't believe it - amazingly good service.

The food was amazing as well! Creamy butter chicken sauce with perfectly cooked, large chunks of chicken... I'll definitely be back to Namaste.

I was trying to look for a place close to NOLA airport since we were picking up family. What to feed out of town guests? Seafood of course! This was my first time here and I found this cool gem thru Yelp of course!

The restaurant was easy to find and it looks like they are doing some remodeling.  Couple of the positives that stuck out the most to me were: 

Service: quick, fast, and super friendly 
Food: great prices, portion, delicious food
Value: $9 for 12 dozen oysters? Where do I sign? 

Our favorites were the crawfish tails, calamari, gumbo, and oyster poboy, I will definitely order these in my next visit back. I was really pleased with the quality of food and the prices since some seafood joints tend to be on the pricier side, will definitely be back!

This was my worst experience with food in my life. The order took an 1hr 20 mins to get to me, the driver had my can of soda rolling around his car. Once i opened up my food I realized my fries were all over the bag spilled and the falafel sandwich turned out to be some sort of falafel burrito. The falafels were horrible cold and flavorless and the other ingredients added no flavor to the meal. Overall i wish i had never made this order save yourself the time and money

Located Flapjacks on the Yelp app as we were searching for Sunday breakfast near our church...found a real winner!!  We were pleasantly surprised as we walked in the door to find a really nice atmosphere.  Mostly tables for smaller parties and lots of bar seating.  Service was good, prices were good, and the food was very good.  My husband and I will be back!!

Jimmy at Tampa Bay Tire Plaza is a gem! Very honest and does excellent work. I have been going to him for over nine years. I give him the highest rating. He is very friendly and treats you as if you were a member of his own family.

We absolutely love this place. Lots of live shellfish, very reasonable prices, and just a great vibe and atmosphere.

Expect a wait, but as long as you're not concerned about how shellfish goes from being alive to on your plate, that time will pass quickly as you watch the master butcher win time and time again against whatever poor foe is next on the ticket. 

The food is very lightly seasoned -- only simple stuff like salt, oil, or butter, but with seafood this fresh and at the prices they charge, it won't make a difference to your taste buds. 

For two, we did the live uni/scallops, clam chowder, rock crab, and coconut shrimp. Filled us to our bellies, and we had so much shellfish I might develop an allergy. 

Add to it that the staff is super friendly and very into it. Drop by, have fun, and have some amazingly fresh seafood. Will go again (tomorrow morning, in fact)!

I've had two different experiences with Third Degree and they were both fantastic!  My first was over a year ago we had a glass ceremony for the wedding supplied by this location and after the ceremony blown into a vase and an ornament.  Both products look great and they were very easy to work with.

Just recently we had a corporate outing there to blow glass and make ornaments.  I had a blast and my ornament is amazing.  There were three instructors with about 20 of us.  I heard one instructor didn't have much personality but I didn't work with him I had another who was quite the character.  They shipped the ornaments about a week after our event once they had cured and I've gotten to see pictures as everyone has received theirs, they all look great.  This was such a fun experience!

Alright. Everybody watch out for the maniac drivers in Philadelphia. These MF's just wanna crash into ya at this parking lot. 

The supermarket is ok. A little cheaper than acme.

A little lengthy but I promise worth the read- know before you go-
Club and amenities are incredible, kid care as well. Problem came in when I was told by my account manager I could cancel my membership at any time when I signed up. Time came where I wasn't able to continue membership and called to cancel, I was told then that they require 30 days notice and I have to come into the club to cancel. I told them this is not what I was told previously and they basically told me tough, it's in the fine print of the contract you signed.
Fast forward three months, I've sent five-six emails to cancel and 3-4 phone calls as well and they're still trying to charge my card and sending my emails and calls that I owe over $1000 for a membership I have been trying to cancel for three months- note- at this point I still had not had time to go to the club to cancel in person, hence why I wanted to cancel in the first place.
I finally make it into the club to speak with a manager who was very understanding and empathetic and said he would try to help get my account credited as much as possible and some sort of reduction to cancel, I said given the circumstance and what I was told by the Lifetime Account manager it would be fair to split the difference and I will pay a half month of dues to cancel. He agreed and said he'd try to get that approved.
I was still getting notices via email and finally received one offering one months dues- $314 to bring account current and continue membership. I responded that I cannot continue membership at this point but I would be willing to pay half month and cancel membership now.
The customer retention rep told me the best he could do would be me to pay $225 over the next two months and then in 60 days if I still want to cancel I can cancel then.....
I've been trying to cancel this membership for three months! Last thing I want to do is prolong this anymore!

Take this story and use it as you wish, really a great place just unbelievable this experience. 

Really too bad, I would've loved to return to Lifetime when circumstances changed but with this treatment and experience, I never will...

This place loves that is has a dive bar reputation. I was here for two different events that they hosted and talk about thinking outside of the box. The first time I was at The Hideaway was for their third Tuesday of the month Meat Bingo. Yes, the prizes are meat. This night the place was packed, but it did not stop the fun. If you decide to go, go early. The bartenders kept the drinks flowing and everyone was happy. They have a great selection of liquors to chose from, plus this was an evening that Urban Chestnut sponsored and I think the crowd drank them out of their beer. The next time I was at the Hideaway for was a wine and pizza pairing. This event was a little tamer, around 30 people was guided through a wine tasting with prosseco, chardonnay, pinot noir, cab sav and finished with the best moscato I have ever sampled. We were served bite size samples of breakfast pizza, chicken alfredo, meat, nacho and finally dessert pizza (which this one was made by the owners). We met the owners Sam and Gracie. What a fun and engaging couple. You can tell they love the bar. We talked with them about future pairings....please please do a vodka pairing.

Couldn't actually schedule here. Stopped in after my Ortho appointment with my PT script - apparently they close from 1-2. 
The hours online don't state this closing, the hours on the door don't state any closing hours, the hours posted on their calendar on their wall don't state closing for lunch.

Pulled up to what looks like an abandoned building, not a car in site.
The hours posted on the door says they are open and their door is unlocked.
Reception was bare with a UPS/FEDEX package on the counter, voices can be heard laughing in the back. I call their phone, it rings, no one answers.

What business runs this way?! Half the staff should take a lunch from 12-1 and the rest from 1-2. Called the Ardmore location and their voicemail says they are closed too. 

NOPE, I'll look up exercises on youtube and pay $5 to go to Planet Fitness. I'll be skipping PT this time around until I can find a new GP that isn't stuck with Novacare.

I was super excited to try The Mad Crab after raving reviews. Really wanted to try one of the boils but my hubby doesn't care much for crab so we opted for shrimp platter and fish platter. Both were disappointing to say the least. I was expecting fresh shrimp, battered and fried but it almost had the taste of frozen box shrimp. The fish wasn't any better. The fries were good though. I think it was mainly the tasteless batter used on each one.

Katie was incredibly patient and helpful with me when I had second thoughts about my wedding dress. She worked with me compassionately until we found the perfect dress, and wow did she nail it. My expectations have been exceeded and this was the best customer service you could ask for!

This place is great. Employees are friendly and do a great job on nails. It is a beautiful new place that is nice and quiet with good magazines to browse. Lots of gel colors/brands and pedicure massage chairs. Highly recommend.

Took this tour last night with Michael and he was awesome! I think it's likely the best ghost tour I've ever taken in NOLA!! I loved that he set rules up front and made them fun! I appreciated that so much! His stories were excellent. He knew his stuff! Thanks VDBL and Michael!

Gave this place 1 star, but if could go minus, it would be -10 or lower. 1st appointment (scheduled ahead) no one there to do 60 minute special. After 10 minutes of waiting a man came in door, didn't bother with pretense of washing hands. I lost 10 minutes on an hour service. Thought would give a second chance, again scheduled a 60 minute service a day in advance. Only 1 person when I arrive, and she spoke no english. NONE. I pointed to the service I wanted, she motioned me to a chaise and made phone call. 15 minutes later still waiting. Got up, showed the employee I was leaving & she quickly made a phone call and put me on the phone. The woman on phone said she would tell the employee what to do and did agree to add 15 min on todays service(12-29-2017) to compensate. I had scheduled for 60 minute special - 45 min reflexology foot/back, 15 min head, shoulder, arms. The employee rubbed my feet for an hour. No head, shoulder, arms. It was useless to try to communicate as she had no understanding of anything I said. BTW - BOTH  times there was no one in the building except for me and 1 employee the entire time. No one came in for a massage and no phone calls. It was very odd, as the other reflexology places I frequent nearby usually have people in lobby waiting their turn as well as incoming phone calls to schedule an appointment. Worst foot rub ever had. Should have followed my instinct and left. These people opened 2 places. 1.Kolb/Broadwy. 2. Kolb/Golf Links. May Kolb/Golf Links is staffed and run better. Or NOT.  Save your $$ and time and go elsewhere. A parting thought: Why would this business have only 1 employee who literally speaks no english???

I ended up here because of a snotty cab driver on the evening American Airlines tried to ruin my life...My flight home was cancelled and I was pissed. I grab a cab from the airport and say I want to go to my hotel. To which the cab driver replies, "do you realize we wait three to four hours for a fare and you only want to go xx miles?" So after some back and forth I say he can take me to one of the best restaurants in St. Louis if that's more to his liking. I imagine he took me here because 1. It is a fantastic restaurant and 2. The cab fare was close to $60.
As for the restaurant; it really is phenomenal Italian cuisine. The restaurant is in an adorable Italian area (think Boston's North End but smaller). The restaurant is very old school Italian feeling and I loved the dark, plush decor, and the Christmas decorations did much to bolster my black mood. 
The service was excellent. I had a drink at the bar while I waited for a table. I was afraid I'd be waiting a long time on a Friday night, but I only waited as long as a glass of wine took to drink (not long).
I usually pass on bread but I almost ate the entire basket. It was so fresh and so delicious; don't skip out on the bread here. They had French Onion soup as a special tonight and it was probably the best French onion soup I've ever eaten. For dinner I had chicken lemonota and it was one of the best lemon chicken dishes I've ever had. I ordered a side of pasta since all pasta is made in house. The pasta itself was good but I regretted getting the garlic and olive oil sauce. It was so crazy spicy I started sweating and I live in the south where we pour hot sauce on damn near everything. If I could go back in time, I'd caution myself and insist I order Alfredo or red sauce. So maybe also heed this warning when you go. Unless you enjoy having your taste buds burned off your tongue. 
I ordered cannoli for dessert which was definitely fresh and pretty tasty if not the best I've ever had it was still good!
I would highly recommend this restaurant. It really was one of the best dining experiences I've had in this city and the food is just absolutely delicious. The price is also fair. My bill for all the food I mentioned was $55 which seems like a steal considering how fancy the restaurant is and how delicious and wonderfully prepared the dishes are.
First time in to the new location and I'm happy to report it's the same great food and attentive service as their other locations!

This is the 2nd time we have stayed here and really like it. The rooms are a great large size, and the breakfast is wonderful. I'm a fan of the Managers Reception but the "snacks" are pretty lame really.... 
Beds were pretty comfy, but counter top in hallway area was really dirty like it hadnt been wiped off, and there was a fingernail in the sink. Gross. 
Staff is wonderful!

We have never been deep sea fishing so we opted to go out yesterday afternoon. There were 11 people joining us this afternoon so we had plenty of room once we got to our fishing spot. 

We used the boat's poles and they gave us a a quick tutorial of how to catch some fish. We stayed out for 2 hours and they moved the boat as soon as we stopped catching fish. 

It takes an hour to get to the spot and an hour to get back. So, sit back on the top floor and catch tom rays or grab some food and a drink so you have plenty of strength to reel in those big ones you catch. 

We caught 4 kinds of fish - bass, white grunt, snapper and perch. router we wanted. We were looking for that grouper but when we got back we saw the boat beside us caught the gWhen we got back they cleaned them for a small fee. There are 2 local places in the same marina that will cook up what you caught. One is a 'dinner' and one is 'tacos.' That way if you don't really like that fish smell you don't have to take it home with you other than what you get on you while actually fishing. 

Which brings me to say you can get as messy or stay as clean as you want. There is staff available to take the fish off the lines and bait your hook if you want. I opted to bait my own hook but given the lack of pliers I let others remove my fish. That was also for my own safety as well as everyone else around me. Those fish start shaking back and forth and you can catch your hook in someone skin WAY TOO EASILY. So since I wanted to avoid that I just let Boomer remove the hooks from the fish. 

We had a wonderful time. The price was right. We checked into other days and they do fill up completely on certain days so check online and give them a call and schedule ahead of time to make sure you don't miss out on this fun time. 

And if one of you likes fishing and the other doesn't, thats ok! You can stay up top and catch even more sun and listen to the gleeful fisherman below you.

I look at the reviews and all I can conclude is that, "haters gonna hate". I was promptly greeted and sat at the bar. Was offered chips, salsa and bean dip with the option of queso or guacamole. I ordered the Cadillac Margarita, excellent (so I enjoyed another with my entree). Next, I ordered the carne asada, again, excellent. Well seasoned, cooked perfectly and I really enjoyed the rice and beans. A solid 4 Star effort. I only give 5 stars if I'm totally blown away in extraordinary fashion, so for me this was a most excellent experience and one I hope to enjoy again.
Very authentic Korean bibimbap. Try Kimchi bokeumbap and spicy pork bibimbap. Food here made you satisfying your hunger after losing all your money for slots.

I have been coming here for over 20 years.  I have seen Dr. Stewart, Mariya Ostermiller, and Mike Housley.   They are always very professional, prompt, and efficient. I always feel like I have received the best care possible. They are kind and friendly.   If you have any dermatology needs, I highly recommend this business.

I am not usually providing negative feedback. I prefer to give out compliments when deserved. What a  disappointment with this Chinese place,  after reading all the reviews and hoping that whoever gave one star review made a mistake. Rude service  (not just bad, rude!) They messed up the order and simple apology would solve it, but instead we got the rude treatment. We had a large take out order with variety of dishes and one single dish was a hit. Neither we nor our friends will not be coming back.

What a warm and welcoming studio. Don't be confused when you are directed to enter the studio through the back door. Plenty of space to store your goodies while you get your yoga on. Instructors are knowledgeable and make adjustments when needed. They also pick a charity a month to donate to and do a class on Sunday with the proceeds going to them. Roxanne and staff rock on and Namaste

Was better in the past. Not sure if they got new management or if management just stopped caring, but this gym went from great to mediocre. The cardio equipment is all old, hours are limited on the weekend, they always run out of towels and weights are always laying on the ground and not racked.

Was a loyal member, but will probably look elsewhere.

The vibe of this place is KILLING IT.
I also just popped in because the items pursuing me from the inside as I walked past the windows. Good marketing you guys!
Unfortunately there's no way I could afford anything in this store, including a single ply square of TP, I'm sure.
I want to give this place 5 starts because really everything about this place is incredible, minus the pricing and affordability of any items available in Two Old Hippies.
I would probably more likely describe TOH as Two Ol Hipsters instead.
I don't think I'll be back (insert very sad face)

This restaurant is on a great location overlooking the water. It has a great outdoor bar area and the inside has wonderful decor with many televisions to watch the Games. Service from KEANNA D was excellent. She is super friendly and catered to us so well. We shared plates so she helped us do that. The Mac & cheese and salads are great. I'd recommend you ask for KEANNA at this place!

The service is amazing and the food is wonderful. For low prices, it's amazing how they still make wonderful food. My mother always gets the salmon with the bourbon glaze and I always aim to get something different every time I go and they do not disappoint. Also the atmosphere is really cool, especially the fish tank.

3.5 star What a hide away place! Not very many peoples know of this hideaway. Love how the old rustic brick building turn into a hipster bar. I was a bit confused how pack it was everyone just jumbo up at the bar waiting for a drink. Then 15mins later suddenly the crowds had somewhat broken up and no one on the other of the bar waiting. The flow of the crowds comes and goes. The bar tender was on a mission. She looked intimidating not much people approach her for drinks since she was so fast getting mix's out. She didn't bother to look up. We just happen to stand at a corner bar and a waitress approached us for drink orders. Yes for the price $12 a cocktails I expected to be stronger it tasted just like juice. 
Good luck grabbing that booth seats. Only way you will get one is literally waiting, hanging around in front of the table that your waiting on. Very limited seatings. This place is a really cool place for lounging. Grab a drink place.

This dentist office does good, efficient, timely work and are kind. It's clean and as pleasant as any I've found and seems to be affordable or at least competitively priced. They listen to your wants and needs.

Have now visited this establishment 3x over the past 2 months, and I must say I am incredibly impressed and why this is now one of my favorite restaurants. First is the exceptional food.  My personal favorite is the turkey leg, but others in my group have loved the fried chicken, ribs, turkey meatloaf special, and bologna.  Sides are all solid - cauliflower, Mac & cheese are two favs. Second is the passionate and friendly people who work there and want you to enjoy your meal. Owner / chef Rick gets a ton of credit for creating the right culture!  Third is the setting.  Warm and friendly with plenty of seating. Fourth is the prices which are reasonable.  Fifth is the fact they are constantly experimenting. Whether it be a few new dishes in 2018, to adding a catering menu.

This is a must visit place for those who live in or visit stl.
Yeah, they'll totally mop all around your feet with stinky mop water while you're eating.
Excellent spot for a drink (2for1 happy hour day what?!) and even better for the FOOD. Easily one of my favorite Club sandwiches in the area. Awesome team members and great vibe.

The food was good and the staff did a great job.  I feel they are understaffed on the weekend when they have a rush.  We waited for a really long time for our order.  They also list a parfait on their website but not on their menu and not available.

We see Wil here, and he cuts my son's hair the way I like it everytime.  If I need it cut a certain he listens.  I would reccomend him to anyone who want a good hair cut.  You have make thte appt online I have yet to see them accept walk ins, but I am sure they do it if its slow.

We went on the Super City Tour. Great tour! Our tour guide's name was Ryan and the driver's name was Alton, and both of them were delightful.

The tour was informative, funny, interesting, a good length of time, beautiful, and worth every penny. Plus at the end, Ryan gave us a coupon for another tour which I'm definitely taking advantage of tomorrow.
We had wagyu, bolognese, Brussels sprouts, potatoes, and tiramisu. Seriously, it was all AMAZING!!! I'm not sure you could go wrong in this restaurant! Definitely our new favorite!
Great furniture, service & value! A pro in the furniture business for decades. Trustworthy & friendly! Low delivery charge. Check it out!!

Fun fun place to hand out on a Friday night.  Lots of food and REGGAE MUSIC. Errol and his crew are just amazing.  Always good laughs and dance.  The food is ok not the all authentic Jamaican food I usually like to eat but it does the job for the night.   The rum punch is delicious!!
Frick and Frack running the grill.  Used to be run by a lady named Rose.  She had her stuff together.  These two clowns couldn't dress themselves.  Service slow.  One order at a time
Great to have a place like this in Westchase. Açaí split bowl was great. Nice staff as well.

Tried this place after our go to place ( Dragon Garden ) closed. I rate Chinese food by two things: steamed dumplings and the Gen Szo chicken. Both are on point. I like spicy so I always ask for extra spicy. Never ate there as we always do take out but the prices are reasonable and the orders are always accurate. Will continue to go there.

Ok, so I'm a sucker for Mexican food and this place by far is one of my favs! The food is truly amazing and the prices are just as great! The service is wonderful and this is as authentic as it gets!

I love that the diner is really clean and the kitchen is spec and span! I also love that they gave Horchata! It's pretty good too! I usually get the Al Pastor ($2) and the steak taco ($2) and I have also tried the steak Torta ($6.65) - SO good!!! Sometimes I will drive out of my way to get some tacos and this place is Always on my brain!

Love it!!!

inside the old water works building this BBQ place is awesome. and not to mention a whiskey bar too. but I digress, Wow! what can I say to describe the BBQ pulled pork nachos. layered perfectly, enough cheese, diverse toppings such as the back beans which at first I was worried but they were great addition. we added both the hot and house BBQ sauces which are provided at the table. the wait staff was on top of things with refills and our needs.  then came our 2 meat platter of brisket and spare ribs with cold slaw and fried potatoes.  while the meats were excellent. the sides were both slaw and very disappointing.  I mean the slaw was ok of you like very tiny pieces for slaw and more on the creamy side. but if you put the spice rub on the slaw it is a very nice touch.  the fried potatoes which was a premium side that cost an extra was in my opinion  bits of French fries cut up with some sautéed onion and a dash of spice rub and the serving side was extremely small. when I picture fried potatoes I image slices potatoes fried in oil with onions.

This place is not for the amateur craft beer drinker. This is definitely your place for IPAs and Stouts with a twist. We love the atmosphere and the fact that you can order in your own food. I would say it's probably our favorite brewery in the city.

Just bought coffee so can't speak on house brews but the barista was helpful talking me through bean selections (which they had about 6 different bags). I bought a natural Costa Rica bean that was complex and rich. Will come back again

I am so excited for there to finally be a vegan/vegetarian restaurant in the Indianapolis area! I was a big fan of the market street location, and the restaurant on Virginia did not disappoint. I ordered the sweet potato hash and my husband ordered the tofu scramble. My favorite thing was his tofu scramble, but everything was very tasty and the perfect portion size. My only feed back was that service was pretty slow, but it was only their second day in business, so hopefully when we go back the kinks will be worked out. We will absolutely be back though!

If you want to go to a restaurant where the owner treats you like family and cares so much for his restaurant, this is the place to be! I have been to the Broadway Bar and Grille a couple of times and I have not been let down once. It's a quaint little craft place with a great menu, very reasonable prices, and amazing service.

There food is the perfect mix of bar grub and a classic American/Seafood Grille. I have gotten to nachos, buffalo tenders, and muscles, and they are all great picks. 

There food is great, but the owner's caring attitude towards his restaurant and customers is what keeps me coming back. This restaurant is one of the few places where I enjoy the owner coming around and asking you about your meal/anything you need. Its different from most places where the owner asks if everything is okay and moves quickly to the next table, seeking out problems with the restaurant. Broadway, keep up the amazing service!

Great great food. I found it absolutely unacceptable that the gratuity was automatically included at 20% which included the alcohol and it was only 2 of us!!! So in essence they basically gave themselves 25%. The more I think about it the more upset I get.  I probably would've tipped close to that. Just incredibly ANNOYED that it was presumed. So NOT cool

My ongoing saga for good, mildly authentic Korean food in Philly continues as I attempted Southgate a few months back (listen, 2017 was a hard year!). Now, I have -never- had success with any place that sells both fried chicken and bibimbap, but you have to give everyone a fighting chance.

That being said, my boyfriend and I dined al fresco on the tiny streets of Grad Hospital with a soy garlic happy hour appetizer, which were appropriately crunchy and sweet. The only fault was the whopping 3 wings on the plate for the price, but I'm not bitter considering the atmosphere. I also urged him to try out soju, so we split a bottle of Cham, or I guess it's Charm...romanization is weird. I've never had this brand out of the US but it's like a cross between Choeum Cheoreom and Chamiseul: not bad, not great.

Onto the entrees. I gave into the temptation of a steak dolsot bibimbap while my boyfriend bravely (read: naively) ordered jajjangmyun. The bibimbap was about what I expected, but I respect no establishment that doesn't give me the bottle of bibimbap sauce because it needed way more than what they gave me. The jajjangmyun was as disappointing as expected, with hardly any noodles, the sauce on the bottom, and the bonchan used as a garnish (and not even all that nicely). The flavor was kind of there but meh, needed salt.

Hopefully Southgate has improved over the months, since this was in August. I'll be back soon!

Exactly what your midwestern family thinks Italian food is. 
We started out with cheesy garlic bread, soup and salad.
Do not get the cheesy garlic bread. It was like day old bread covered in cheap cheese with barely any garlic and no butter; Pizza Hut does better. 
The Italian wedding soup was a joke with no meatballs, watery broth, and a couple carrots. 
The Caesar salad was okay. 
I tried a signature dish- Eggplant Rollatini and my girlfriend tried the Alfredo. 
My dish was pretty good, but the cheese on top was paper thin and disappointing. Also, I chose the replace my pasta with "fresh veggies" for extra which turned out to just be a small helping of broccoli :/. 
The Alfredo was alright, but looked bland with zero garnish. 
If I could, I would give 3.5 stars for the main dishes, but overall it wasn't worth the price.

From the atmosphere, to the food, to the service this place gets an all around 5 stars from me. The portions are quite large and the dumplings are delicious! My waitress was very friendly and attentive. Also a plus, the food was out to the table very quickly!

Despite having lived in Tucson many years, I had never made it to a Baggin's, so one Saturday we decided to hit up this new location on the southeast side. To save time we placed our order online, and I appreciate that they have a good, comprehensive ordering system. Despite saying they were set up to do deliveries, there was a note online that this location is not yet delivering - just a heads up, as I'm sure it's related to being a new location and I can understand that it can take a bit to sort out the logistics of delivering food after just opening. I didn't ask for any customizations on my Italian grinder except that there be no bell peppers. There wasn't a specific check box for that (although there were specific check boxes for things like no onions) so I wrote it in the special instructions, but they still included the bell peppers, so that's why I took one star off. Otherwise, the sandwich was good and fresh, and definitely hit the spot. The location is clean, and in a good location.

We've happily dined here before & were excited to try it again but it was very disappointing compared to visits in years past. The service was excellent from the hostess to the waiter but that's where it ended. My husband's entree was $26ish for 3 golf ball sized meatballs. They lacked flavor, seasoning & were very dry. About how the frozen meatballs from publix taste before you put them in any sauces. I ordered the beef tenderloin and it was consistent with steak I've eaten at very low end establishments- not inedible, but not worth the price or quality of somewhere like Red Pony. It was cooked to the right temperature (medium rare) but it was so tough I struggled to cut through it with my steak knife, I wasted half of it because I got tired of chewing and it had no flavor...nor was there any steak sauce to soften the blow. The au gratin potatoes I had as a side were still very crunchy. The dessert menu looked good but we were too scared to attempt any after spending $85 on two entrees that we only ate half of. We paid our bill and ended up going somewhere else and eating because we were still hungry. It was really unfortunate because we frequently have date nights and love downtown Franklin but can't recommend this place after our experience.

We used Big Man's Moving Company on Monday and are SO INCREDIBLY GLAD we did! When you envision the way that your move should go, this is the company to hire to fulfill or exceed your expectations. 

In the past four years, we have completed no less than 8 moves between our household and my grandmother's. Each time has been more stressful than the time before, with either damage to "stuff" or property, movers not showing up, or unfriendly/disinterested movers on phone calls or smoke breaks, to slow and careless packing/moving and the list goes on.. We were very nervous about who to hire for my grandmother's most recent move, but based on reviews and discussions, we chose to hire Big Man'e Moving Company. The moved us this week and it was the VERY BEST moving experience. Ever. For starters, they were on time with the amount of movers and supplies they promised. They worked so hard, diligently, and compassionately all day. It was sort of unbelievable, honestly.  Each of the movers treated our belongings as if they were there own when packing, padding, wrapping, and moving.  We've slowly been unpacking for almost a week and we haven't found one thing broken or damaged. They also appeared to genuinely care about where my grandmother wanted each piece of furniture placed and moved anything for her with a smile.  When a room or area would fill up with boxes to the point that it might impede her ability to get around, they would see the issue and anticipate the problem by asking if they could start placing in another area.  These guys had more than just strong bodies, they put thought and effort into what they were doing, anticipating our needs before we had to ask.  This is not what you get with "other movers" who will box and stack until there is no way to enter/exit, move around, or even fix the problem. It sounds corny, but they were a pleasure to work with and have in our home.  So much so that my grandmother invited them back whenever they are in the area.  I cannot stress enough about how hard they hussled, all with a smile and a gracious, positive attitude. This is something that sounds trivial, but having had experiences with other "not so friendly" movers, I can tell you that their positive attitude makes a BIG difference in this line of work. Lastly, they came in UNDER our anticipated budget. No kidding. We HIGHLY recommend this company.  Thank you to Josh, Charles, Mark and John for everything you did for us. We sure do appreciate you

Went to lunch here after the swamp tour and had a great time. Had my first (of many since) French 75 cocktail. View of the swamp from our table. Food was great. We had oysters, stuffed mushrooms, turtle soup appetizers and all were great.

Tried this place out with a friend for lunch. It was good, the pale was very clean, the service was prompt, and the lunch special was a good value. They have a 10% off deal for Jefferson employees which was nice too. 4 yelps!

I've been here a couple of different times, both for lunch. I love good food, but love good service more. This place struggles bad on the service end. Their food is pretty good but a little overpriced. The service on both occasions has been far from good. The greeting when you walk in the door is average, but not overly friendly. The female server on both trips was either extremely busy (not likely when I looked around the room) or just doesn't really understand the concept of "service". I probably won't be coming back.

This company is horrible! The equivalent of slum lords at this point. I closed in February of 2016 I didn't receive my HOA information until almost 2 months later. This trash and landscape upkeep have been nonexistent since I've been here. They refuse to address the trash dumping issue but continue to raise the HOA fee. I've filed complaints through their website and included pictures to no avail. We couldn't even safely walk our dog due to shattered beer bottles on the sidewalk that have been there all weekend.

As of today after my interaction with Kathy Sullivan or Sutherland(she didn't want to give me her name I had to ask 3x) I can't say anything has gotten better. She proceeded to tell me that even though my agreement and there website states they can have cars towed they no longer do that and I would just need to park elsewhere. Then basically said she had to be there and she wasn't going to do that. Then called me back and wanted to suddenly help. Keep in mind they just sent a tow truck with no hesitation a month before and I told her this. When I told her I wanted to speak with someone else she flat out said, " no you won't they are all under me right now I'm the only one you can talk to." I've never dealt with such a rude "manager".
The Mexican food here was excellent, the employees had really good service, kind and engaged!
Housekeeping is fast and efficient and the staff calls me for feedback and satisfaction the day after my home has been cleaned, overall I'd recommend their services.
Good sauce, cheese and dough. Real authentic Sicilian owner and employees. We will definitely be back. Thank you for being open during the holidays.

Barrio has an excellent selection of beers and good pub food. While I always enjoy the food, the service always seems to be lacking. This is likely due to the fact the restaurant is a seat yourself establishment. I find this rather odd for such a large place, but I don't care as long as the service is fine. We had trouble getting our server's attention, and they seemed to be all over the place. I don't know how it's organized, but it didn't seem like anyone had a section they were assigned to.

In terms of beer, Barrio has a nice variety of beers available, so everyone can find something they like. I prefer lighter beers, such as wheat ale, hefeweizen, etc., so I'm very picky about what I order. I'm not into stouts, porters, IPAs, and many smaller breweries often have very bitter selections. One of my friends suggested half Barrio Blonde, half cider. I was skeptical since the drink was flat as hell when the server brought it to me, but it was delicious. Their cider is incredibly sweet, so the Blonde mellows it out without diluting the flavor.

I've always enjoyed the food here. I usually get the sonora dog as it's a good size for a hot dog meal, and their fries are delicious. We also ordered the chips and salsa. The salsa tasted fresh, but I don't think they make their own chips.

Overall, good food and beer, but the service seems to be hit or miss.

I give stars simply because our waitress was warm and welcoming. Overpriced. Underwhelming. I spent 60 dollars on two small pizzas and a garlic bread.  One hard root beer. I also got the vegan cookies which were horrible. All I could taste was the refrigerator they stayed in. They served them cold too and that made in even more horrible. We won't be back.

We came here on a Saturday it had a good crowd but we got sat right away. They have a game day special all day for discounted beers which was great. The wings and burgers were on special as well. We order the sweet and sour wings, they were delicious. I noticed on their menu there is $2 mimosas on sundays I would definitely come back for brunch.

Snubbed service. 
Me and a party of 3 others walk in, trying to get a table for a party of 5. They tell us that they cant seat us if our party isn't all here, since there are only a few seats that seat a group of five. We ask if we can just sit at a booth and cram our fifth in, and the person who's sitting us begins explaining how much we don't want to sit five to a booth and how they can't accommodate a chair next to the booth. Guess what, when we eventually sit down, the booth next to us has a dude in a chair sitting outside of the booth.

HORRIBLE! We will never return. 

We've been here before and enjoyed it so we thought it would be a safe choice when taking out three of my students after a fun, Christmas-y Saturday in the city. 

We had a reservation for 7:30 but were walking towards the wrong location so I called to say we were running late. Arrived at 7:45 and didn't get seated until 8:00. It was packed and loud. As of 9:00, we still didn't have our food. 

The only saving grace of this experience was the fact that our waitress was nice and the food runner was extremely kind and personable. 

Our waitress was, however, set up for failure. When she greeted us she let us know that they were out of about 6 things on the menu. Never a great start. As the night went on she had to keep bringing back food and drinks from every table in her station. It's hard to be a good waitress when the management, kitchen and bar are not doing their part. 

The most disturbing part of this whole night was that the hallway leading up to the bathroom smelled like a dirty diaper. It was disgusting. I thought it was the bathroom but once we got into the bathrooms, they smelled like bleach. That made me feel better about the bathrooms but wayyyyyy worse about the restaurant. The smell was coming from the hall which is between the bar and the kitchen. If it isn't the bathrooms that smell, then what exactly is it? How disgusting. Even the 3 six year olds with me were making a huge deal and holding their noses and saying how disgusting it was. One of them said, "if you are in a fancy restaurant, it's supposed to be clean, it shouldn't smell like this." EXACTLY. 

The staff were all rude. I stopped to let the bartender go ahead of me since he was working. Even though I was a female with three young girls, he accepted my offer, barreled past us and didn't even look or say thank you. How rude!!!! The manager wasn't even kind until he had to do a table visit but when we were just walking past him, he also blew past without using manners. 

Our burgers both came out undercooked. I said I wanted mine burnt and it came out red. My man said he wanted his med well and his came out red as well. We had to send them back. When they came back out, they had no fries. They had to go back again. When they finally came out they just weren't good. All they tasted like was the grill. They had no other flavor. I didn't even want to waste the calories since by this point we waited over an hour for our food, it was past 9:00 and it wasn't even good...so I ate less than half. The fries weren't good so I didn't eat those either. The manager did not come back to see if they were better. He did not comp the uneaten burger which was clearly still not up to standard...or discount the bill at all. I'm not one to WANT that to be done but when you are offering a terrible experience with sub par food and a kitchen that literally smells like poo, I think you should try to do something. Offer the girls dessert on the house...something! 

One of my students said she wanted only grapes with her children's menu selection. When their kids meals came out she was the only one that had zero grapes. She got a totally different fruit salad from the other two girls. They had grapes and strawberries and she had no grapes at all even though she said she wanted grapes. It made no sense. We had to ask for the other fruit salad to be brought out since she didn't like the fruit options in hers. The manager said they scrambled to make the one she had. Why are you scrambling to make something she doesn't even want when the two girls next to her have something totally different...which happens to be what she wants?! The menu made no mention of there being separate fruit salad options. Even if it did, she was clear she wanted grapes so she still got the wrong one! 

We asked for refills on the girls water multiple times before it happened. There was an old, melted, stepped on butter packet under our table. We personally did not have butter. 

Like I said at the start, it was a horrible, horrible experience and I don't wish to ever return here. I would NEVER recommend this place to anyone looking to dine out in the city. There are too many other places that offer better food, better service and a dining room that doesn't smell like feces. We've been here on New Year's Day before when it was crowded and it was still a good experience so the fact that it was a busy Saturday is not an excuse. The whole goal of a restaurant is to be busy and just because you're busy doesn't mean your service and food should start going downhill. If that was the case, you wouldn't be busy anymore. 

Horrible!!! Never again!

Top notch food. I ordered the 3 course meal and everything was beyond super deliciousness!!! Our waiter Jenna was amazing, knowledgeable and fun. She made our experience sheer perfection. I can't thank the staff enough for making my birthday dinner heaven on my taste buds.

I was having French friends over for terrine de foie gras and cassoulet so I stopped at two Philly bakeries for pastry and baguettes. J'aime French Bakery has a great ambiance and the happy ghosts of the long gone Millenium Coffee (and Afterwords) that used to occupy the space.
Bright and cheerful, simple yet elegant - the visual appeal and feel is great.  I arrived early and my server was nice and cheerful, very helpful.  He seemed a bit chagrined when I purchased most of the stock that was set out - 3 each of: eclairs, pear tarts, orange tarts, blueberry tarts, 6 chocolate croissants, 4 sugar brioches, 3 chocolate brioches and two regular French baguettes.  It was too early for a few of the other items on the menu like the chocolate tartlet or the Paris Philadelphia.
Service was good and the pastries were overall pretty good and the baguettes were excellent.  One of our guests oversees the baking of croissants in France so he felt the chocolate croissant were a bit sloppy and as a baker of croissant and eclairs myself, I have to say I agreed.  They looked a bit hastily made but they tasted fine.  I still think that J'aime French Bakery was pretty good overall in spite of a few issues and so I still give them a 4.

This is regarding my Togo experience today- we started calling at 1130am to order, hoping to pick up and eat by 12:30; however, we had to call 7 times before someone answered and took our order (it was 1230pm). My coworker went and picked up the food and brought it back to the office and one of the orders was incorrect. I was personally disappointed in the kale side salad- it was $4 and was literally 3 bites worth. My lunch total came to $17.83- that was for a side salad and biscuit. The biscuit (the wash) had good flavor and I enjoyed it, bit was a little pricier that I would expect for a biscuit and side. Also, the online menu did not have a prices by the items.

I came here for breakfast this morning. Place looks marvelous inside. Many tables and a lot of space for plenty of people to sit and enjoy their coffee. I tried the traditional bread with garlic and it was delicious. I absolutely love that most tables are for 2 people and if you need more space you can combine tables. They also have outdoors which will be a huge hit in the spring and summer.  The staff were very friendly and explained the menu to me to make sure I ordered exactly what I wanted.  I look forward to coming here more with my family and friends.

You know how some pizza boxes have the slogan, "you've tried all the rest, now try the best?" Lorenzo's should have the slogan, "you've tried all the rest, now try the worst". Oh wait, you'd only get to read that slogan if you pay extra, because, yes, they charge you for the box if you want to take it out!! The pizza is basically flavorless aside from the super sweet sauce. They are surviving on their gimmick large slices, and drunk college students who would eat a piece of cardboard but opt for pizza, because here you need to pay for both.
The coffee and sliders are phenomenal. The cheeseburger one has an upgraded version of Big Mac sauce and the chicken Caesar is to die for.
Totally a hidden gem. Food was amazing and the combo plate is to die for. Everything was fresh and I'll definitely be back!

Stopped by today because of the Yelp reviews, glad I made the decision to do so. Although I know you want to read about the food, however I want to touch first on the service. From the minute I walked I the door I was greeted with impeccable service. The food displayed was explained to me, they even offered me a sample of the sides if needed. Awesome awesome customer service from all the staff members. 

No on to the food!! I had the Swai fish combo with Mac and cheese, cabbage, and yams. Each of the sides were hot, flavored, and yummy!! If you're thinking of stopping here to eat - don't think about it just go!!!

The museum is pretty cool, very nice and clean, well taken care of. The on-site parking garage is very convenient. Really enjoyed visiting for the dogs exhibit and most recently for their jingle rails which was really fun to see!

I stopped in looking for the perfect Christmas card.  Found it, plus several others.  Their cards are creative and feel well made in your hand.  Some are cheeky, even slightly off color.  But sometimes that fits the intended recipient.

I also looked through their prints and scored a great gift.

The staff are very friendly and helpful (but not hovering!).  Here you can buy local, support a small business, and get world class merchandise for a reasonable price.

I'll be back for sure.

This place delivers on every level!  Service is prompt and polite, food is next level amazing BBQ and sides!  If it's your first visit get one of the sampler plates so you can try all the various meats you'd like! Their appetizer of Toast Ravs blew us away!  Even though you will be very full after dinner, skipping desert would be a BIG mistake!  All their pies received high marks from my group, especially the Apple which is what i had!  DEFINITELY WILL BE A REGULAR!

Came in on a Tuesday night because the outside sign said "Master Chef at Layla's", sat at a table across the bar, ordered drinks and then asked the bartender, Sammy,  what the "Master Chef" was for....she had no idea. She even went outside and looked up at it only to still not have a clue. Was there for a few hours and listened to a live band that was good but she still offered no insight to the marque...she just laughed it off-Oh well, I guess. 

After the first 30-45 mins, Sammy saw that we weren't going anywhere and then became attentive to our cocktails. 
It was my 1st time in Nashville and the band was SUPER loud and conversation was difficult even at the back of the bar but not pissed about it. Tis live music. Whaddaya gonna do?!?! Had a good time and enjoyed myself.

Had the Brekky bowl. It was really good. But it was missing something. The Brekky bowl would have been out of this world with something that oozed throughout and meshed all the textures and flavors together. I was thinking a sort of sausage gravy or something. Without, albeit delicious, it still felt like something I could have made at home. It's essentially the cooked eggs with slices of cheese and your meat sitting atop of bowl of heavenly tots. Next time, maybe I'll ask for a side of gravy. 

And the french toast was tasty. You can never go wrong with that.

Tried the uni on scallops and it was very tasty not fishy smelly and melted in your mouth!!! That how fresh it was!!!!! Also had the abalone with tomato rice...  luckily I still have some left to satisfied my craving taste for this dish!!!

Needed a battery for my Lexus.  Drove over to AutoZone in Roxborough at 9 am Sunday morning.  Easy transaction, had the new battery installed within minutes!  Thank you for getting my car back on the road again!

This location can get pretty busy but the staff is super professional and quickly gets the food out to you. I have never had any issues here and the food is always cooked to my liking. The side salads are always fresh and the other side options do not disappoint.
Cashier was very rude fat Hispanic girl at the airport location. Very very rude. Half the menu wasn't even available.
Surprisingly great pizza for lunch on a Friday.  Highly recommend for a pleasant change pace with some of the other and crummy chain places.

Went here before a concert at Bankers Life. There wasn't many people in there. 2 bartenders working. They seemed to be very attentive to them (it's self serve beer and it seems like most take that route) - we had wine. Not only did we have to walk up to asked for another glass (we were seated at a time DIRECTLY in front of the bar area - near their register - so not like we were hidden), but even asked for a glass. They poured it, then forgot to give it to us. About 10 mins later (seemed like longer) we had to question each other if we ever got that glass. We hadn't. Had to go back up to bar. And ask for it. They had it sitting behind the bar....really?!?! We then got a hot sandwich with sweet potato fries. Both came out warm. We ordered a sauce for our fries based off the menu, and was told after we placed order that the menu changed and they didn't have that anymore - fine but shldnt you know that when taking my order. I asked for a different sauce - curry ketchup. I got.......ketchup. Way to listen to me. Was completely frustrating. Not a great experience and actually sorry I even had to pay for what we got. Red wine blend was mediocre (only have 2 wines total). Food wasn't appetizing. Service horrible. Just not a happy experience, which is unfortunate bc I so wanted it to be....place had great reviews and a cool feel inside...but it crashed and burned.
Nothing fancy but nice smoked fish! I started with their fish spread. Terrific! Then I had the smoked salmon which was a big cut and had great smoky flavor and a side of coleslaw. A big meal!

This is a nice looking airport bar/restaurant with a comfortable feel but the beer is just average and at $9-$10 a glass, it's pretty over-priced...even by airport standards. 

My server was quick but was short and didn't seem to enjoy her job much. Overall, I wouldn't recommend this place for a beer. They have a decent selection, but having tried several (Coffee porter, brown ale, kolcsh) they're all pretty one-note and definitely not worth the high price point. 2 stars.
Great healthy fast casual place. I had a really filling vegetarian meal. Very flavorful and tons of options. Will def go back

This place is terrible. They wouldn't serve me because of the color of my skin. We ended up waiting for our shitball ass food for 2 hours and one 8 oz drink took us 45 minutes. Very polite and courteous waiter though
Les pancakes sont à tomber, les omelettes sont aussi très bien. Dommage le sirop d'érable ne fait pas trop naturel. Plus de sucre que derablé.

LOVE Bing's. Best boba in Tucson. Very clean and accessible. Friendly staff. I like this location because it's by one of my favorite restaurants and Lee Lee grocery store. Identical menu to other location.

One of my favorites to take out of town guests to, or for any special occasion. Intimate setting that it great for conversation and the food is exceptional. Friendly, family-oriented restaurant that you can tell has stood the test of time for a reason. This place is an experience! Be sure to wear stretchy pants because you will be FULL when you leave. :)

I was very happy to find this Korean style chicken restaurant. Somewhat over-priced, but it is Edmonton where every food is overpriced compare to other cities in Canada and Seoul. The authentic original flavour and spicy and sweet are awesome. These two are the must try. I personally prefer the soy garlic sauce though, which is the real hit in Korea now. 

Each time we visited, there was no seat available. It is a small restaurant and they serve all food in a pizza box. I hope they could have more tables though.

I had never been to the Gramophone before but had heard lots of good things about the sandwiches there (as well as the giant Pac-man machine!).  After looking over the menu, I decided to try the BBBLT.  While I was not exactly sure what the first two B's were for, I assumed after reading the description, that it just meant more bacon.  I was pretty excited.  When I received the sandwich, while good, I was a little disappointed in the amount of bacon.  Don't get me wrong, it was a great BLT but when the description says "Tons of hickory smoked bacon", I expected a little more than what I got.  The sodas they had were from Excel Soda - always good!  I would like to go back and try some more of the menu.

The beer is good!! They have tables to sit. They have board games to play. It was fun to just sit and have a few drinks. My wife is pregnant and she can't drink(the only reason she beat me in trivia Pursuit). They have popcorn you can buy there(cheddar and cheddar and Carmel mix). You can earn rewards for visiting there. I paid with a card and everything was easy and receipt was sent to my phone. 

Food***You can order from cluster truck they deliver to the parking lot. 1st time ordering you get 10% off Cluster truck has a ton of food options. And the food is Fantastic. You order from an app and they accept Apple Pay too. The reason I focus on the food is because good beer is good beer, but having food too is rare. They also have a stage area for small concerts. I will go back!! Oh and the bathroom has to be one of the cleanest public bathrooms I've used.(just saying)

Great replacement for Serafina. The space is much more aesthetically pleasing and the drinks are awesome. My current favorites are the eggnog and the hot toddy. 

I've dined here twice now and recommend the cheese plate, the veal lasagna, and the short rib stroganoff. I honestly did not enjoy the Gnudi at all - it was recommended to me by our waitress over the ravioli. It was definitely filling despite the small portion but the taste wasn't what I had hoped for. The balls of  sponge-like potato were a little bland and seemed to be tossed with what tasted too much like salad dressing.

All in all a good spot - hard to get a reservation at times so I advise planning ahead.
Love this place! First time going and I will def be back. Got gel manicure and eyebrow wax. Staff was friendly, store was quiet & professional. Def a little hidden gem.

This place is the best Mexican restaurant around. Their margaritas are a must. The food is flavorful and you get a large serving. All of the servers I have encountered have been friendly, helpful and fast. I highly recommend. 

Bonus: shares a parking lot with a gas station so you can fill up both you and your car! Seriously though, don't judge La Casona by the outside appearance or it will be your loss.
Excellent food fast service. My wife finally decided to tell me about this place after me living here for a few months. I got mad at her... because I wish she had told me sooner!!
This place is amazing. Staff is friendly. Food is great. Don't miss out on the chorizo and cheese empanada! Chips and guacamole are also amazing. Make sure you check in to get a free empanada.
They have the biggest, tastiest burritos! I recently discovered this place and I love it! Fast, filling, & great prices.

The service here is amazing. Jeff Davidson was my salesman and his did and tireless effort to get me into a vehicle was a breath of fresh air in these times where customer service has taken a back seat to profits. Immediately from the get go when I walked in and Allana greeted me I knew I came to the right place. I cannot express how great my experience was. I love my 2017 Spark. From my family to the team at Champion Chevrolet, thank you and may your holidays be full of blessings and warm moments.

Woke up hungover as hell and knew I needed a bad ass Bloody Mary and something tasty to save me. 

We had two amazing bloody Mary's and as a former bartender I am super picky. I couldn't find a single thing that was wrong with these. They were fantastic. 

I ordered the eggs Dauphine and it was delish! I wish I would have split my husbands meal though because we had SO MUCH FOOD. They are hefty portions so if you can I would suggest splitting something. 

My husband got the waffle Cochin and holy crap batman it was amazing! It was the perfect blend of spicy and sweet that melts into your mouth! I highly recommend this one!

I've been going to this anytime fitness for close to 6 years now. I've been to other locations and this is by far the nicest anytime fitness I've been to (better equipment, cleanliness, etc.). It's a smaller gym, but it has all the equipment I need. It's doesn't get too crowded, except in the Am 8-9 am and after work (5-7 pm). Overall, I usually never have to wait for a machine. They have an adequate amount of cardio machines and offer some group fitness classes for an additional fee. All the members are nice, I've only encountered a few "gym douches" over the years of going here. Their prices are comparable to other gyms and you can't beat the convenience of being open 24 hours. If you're looking for a bigger gym with a lot of group fitness classes, I would not recommend this place for you.

Always worth the wait. Filling this review out after I've gone a few times (5-6 times). Immaculate baked goods, inspiring latte combinations, creative soulful brunch food. I recommend grabbing a latte and a baked good to munch on while you wait. 

I've had few dishes I haven't loved.  I normally find it hard to narrow down the options, I normally ask the wait staff bc there always seems to be a few dishes that rise above the others. The sorghum bacon is always pretty impressive and a crowd pleaser and I've definitely ordered a few different versions of the Dutch baby. Happy brunching!
Jesse is so kind and sweet and the sushi is always fresh and good. They treat everyone like family and are really accommodating to Little ones.

Posted pictures of our wedding cake. It was white with lace, flowers, and barely brushed with pink. It was so beautiful and we could not have been more happy with it. All of our guests kept talking about how good it was weeks after the wedding. It was so well done and you could really see the time taken in all the details. The lace was so perfect I thought it was real lace and kept asking if I could eat it. Even the flowers tasted good! If you are trying to decide between two places to get sweets for your event go here.

The husband had a hankering for Asian food so we decided to check out this new Thai restaurant based on the reviews. We were not disappointed. We started of with their pork & shrimp dumplings. They looked more like Shu mai which was different than what we expected but very delicious. They have 4 spice levels; mild, medium, hot, & Thai hot. They are not kidding around with how spicy their food is. Normally I order the Pad Thai the first time I visit a Thai restaurant but decided to try the spicier Garlic Beef at their medium spice level. It was delicious & perfectly spicy. The hubby got the Panang curry chicken, medium spice, & it was delicious & perfectly spiced too. The portion sizes were just right. We finished off our meal with their sweet, sticky rice with mango. OMG, it was the best I've ever had! They use the black rice & it was warm & drizzled with hot sweetened, condensed milk. The mango was perfectly ripe & there was more than 2-3 slices. We will definitely go back. The hubby wants to try something hot.
Attention Vegans - they have a separate menu of dishes just for you!

This home goods has really good choices albeit a little messy in the presentation. However, the store has the most horrific customer service ever. I went in there looking for an item and I asked one of the girls out front if she can help me find it. She said she couldn't because she was about to go on break. The other girls were more interested in texting or looking at their phones. It was hard to find anybody throughout the rest of the store to help nor was anybody really interested in helping at all. I was so apalled by the laziness of the people that work there. Normally I don't ask for help in stores, as it is pretty self-evident but I really was looking for someone his input and apparently that was a mistake. The people that work here are absolutely lazy or at least were on the shift I walked in on. Please do something about your customer service.

I love this nail salon! I get a gel manicure and it lasts for weeks with no chipping at all every time. Everyone here is very nice and I am greeted with familiarity each time I go in. Highly recommend this place I wont get my nails done anywhere else!

First time having a DiBella Sub. A small meatball sub, cheddar and sour cream chips, and cherry coke. Sub had much more meat than subway. Pretty good flavor with mozzarella and parmesan cheese. I think I liked the bread much more then subway too. Little more expensive. Slightly over 10$ but very filling for lunch. Now I need a nap.

My GF and I were excited to visit this new burger place in the Providence Market place. Go there at your own risk. The burgers are expensive and very small. It took us 50 minutes to receive our food after ordering. Then when the food arrived, the order was wrong. They corrected it and brought it to us ice cold. I won't be back! I recommend Burger Republic. However, if you're curious about BurgerIM try it, but be prepared to waste your time and money.

I have a lot of pros and only one con about SoulCycle. 

Let's get the con quickly out of the way: it's wicked expensive. $30 per class ($20 introductory).  It is what it is, but people are clearly glad to pay it. Maybe it's because of all of the pros listed below...

Needless to say, the workout is great. You get what you put into it. But as long as you're not just sitting there, you should be sweating profusely shortly into the workout and throughout. The room where you cycle is kept at a comfortable temperature and it has cool lighting and a great sound system. Next, the staff: extremely well trained, super nice, very upbeat people who are glad to help. Every single one of them, including the manager, Natalie. They greet you with a smile and make sure you get acclimated comfortably and quickly. Another pro: very, very clean facility with well maintained showers, locker room area, and bathrooms.  They provide clean, soft towels and filtered water fountains. And lastly, the instructors. I have seen two instructors since I've been coming here and they are both energetic and positive people who get you pumped and motivated to have a good workout. 

I am very pleased with my experience at SoulCycle and I would strongly recommend it to anyone!

I am a regular.   The brisket cheesesteak is heavenly.

Love there potato soup and mushroom and homemade mac n cheese.

Place is very good and their prices are fair.

Best mexican I've had in the city yet! Not only do they serve killer Mexican food, but they also have a full breakfast menu and everything in between! The breakfast tacos are a perfect meal for anytime, and they're bursting at the seams so bring a fork to the party. Don't skip out on this little underrated spot in Broad Ripple
Good atmosphere. Good plate size. Well balanced flavours. Would recommend for nice date night or coming with a few friends.

My wife and I decided to check out Mad Rex before a show at the Fillmore last week and it was decent in some ways and lackluster in others. Our waiter approached our table and asked if it was our first time dining with them, which we told him it was. He seemed excited that we were first timers and he explained to us that all of the decorations were art and authentic etc. He then pointed to the survivors menu and explained that anything were ordered from it would come on a hot salt rock that we would use to cook our own meat. We ordered two drinks which were good from the happy hour menu. My wife and I were both enticed by the survivors
Menu and ordered a Mac n cheese as an appetizer and a survivor menu burger each. The mac and cheese arrived at the exact same time as our burgers, which also came with a side of Mac n cheese making the whole appetizer kind of pointless. Regardless, we ate it and felt it was overly covered in cheez whiz and not enough of the other cheese that were supposed to be on it. We moved onto the burgers that were sizzling on the salt rock with all the topics surrounding it, except the cheese and onions which were already on the burger. No plates to put the burger on once it was done which made eating slightly annoying. The cheese being already on the burger made flipping them impossible, unless we wanted to have all of our cheese stuck to the salt rock. We let our burgers sizzle for a few mins until the bottoms were burnt and took them off hoping they would be medium in the center. They were not. They were in fact burnt on the bottom and raw on the top where the cheese was. I bit into my burger only to find a cold bloody center. I put the burger back onto the salt rock hoping it would cook more but by then the salt rock was not hot enough. We picked the burger apart and ate the parts that were actually cooked. Nobody came to check on us while we were eating but once we had finished and our plates had been cleared, a really nice manager approached said she noticed we ate off the survivor menu and asked how it was. At this point my wife and I were just over the entire experience and didn't bother making a big stink. We ate enough to be full but it was just a very lackluster meal. The last round of drinks that we ordered was taking a very long time so they came out and were in a much bigger glass to make up for the weight which was nice but we still didn't receive them until we were already paying the check. Won't be going back unfortunately due to these issues.

My husband and I had the fried gator bites, gumbo, crawfish bisque, a side salad, and the blackened redfish. Everything was amazing! The green beans that came with the redfish were not really edible, but the redfish made up for it. I ordered a Moscow Mule. They didn't skimp one bit on the liquor. The ONLY reason I gave four stars instead of five, was because our service was lacking. I got a cup of bisque instead of the bowl I ordered, and the server wasn't very attentive. These are both things I can overlook when a restaurant is really busy. However, we came at a time that was what I would call more steady than busy, meaning we had absolutely no wait for our table. Maybe our server was having an off day, which is understandable. We will definitely eat here again!
Amazing mom and pop restaurant! The Patty Melt was great, friendly staff and fast service! Be sure to check this location out on your next visit to the area!

My fiance and I decided to try this place out for dinner last night, and what an amazing experience we had! Our server was sweet, attentative, and immediately brought us water after we sat down. It wasn't very busy, which surprised me. We decided to get a couple starters, the traditional spring rolls and pork belly pops.
