I am a huge spring roll fan, and these ones were tasty and unique with roasted pork belly, basil, and prawns. The accompanying peanut sauce was great; I could've eaten another bowl of it. The pork belly pops were tender, rich, and flavorful. I let my fiance have the last one, and he was happy haha. 

For our main courses, I got the tonkatsu ramen and he got the shoyu ramen. The broth was delicious, creamy and flavorful. My fiance added some sauce to his, thinking it needed a little something more, but I was happy with mine. It was full of meat, which was a nice change, since a lot of places usually skimp on the meat, and the eggs were cooked perfectly. This place is now my favorite in Reno for ramen, and a much shorter drive than our favorite ramen joint in San Francisco. 

There is a full bar, so my fiance enjoyed a couple drinks, and I had a tasty Vietnamese coffee. Although we came for ramen, we will definitely be coming back to try some of the other menu items as well. If you haven't been here, give it a try!

Life long Pinocchio's patron, usually love the place, but in the last few years, this place really went down hill. 

Every time I order for pickup, it's never ready on time,rude employees behind the desk and just plain disrespect for customers. Gave them 2 hours before pickup, and it was still not ready.

Delivery always takes too long, and they will always forget the 2 liter of soda, ALWAYS. And if it's not pizza or cheesesteaks getting delivered, it will usually be soggy or messy when you try to eat it. 

Again, been ordering there for years, but I'm about to stop.

Had a terrible experience today with the go carts there. I went off the track a couple of time and both times I was sprayed with grass and mud from the wheels. At first I thought I was allergic to the grass, because I am allergic to grass, but after hosing off the second time, feeling a horrible burning and stinging sensation, I realized that I was covered with fire ants   ! They were extremely aggressive! They were blasted up my pants with all the mud and dirt too and I suffered hundreds of bites! The staff acted like this never happened before, but I read about it online, which means that they ignore the problem! Avoid This Place! Because you never want to be covered with fire ants  particularly when they are sprayed all over you! It was positively horrible and I'm also allergic to bug bites on top of it! The staff gave me back my money, but it really didn't make me feel any better. I'll see how it goes tonight and maybe have to go to the hospital later! I can't believe this happened to me!

Beautiful studio, impeccably clean with perfectly merchandised boutique... you kinda feel like you're in LA... lovely on all fronts with original hardwoods and a wall of open windows lined with succulents and green stemmed fronds. Took an R2 class since the R3's weren't available and are few and far between on the schedule. Not sure if it was heated but I barely broke a sweat. It might have been the least interesting and creative flow I've taken in years. The instructor had zero energy, monotone voice and a "why did I agree to sub on a Sunday" attitude. She sipped her coffee while she appeared to be still waking up. Overall a disconnected flow and even more disconnected teacher. Pretty bummed.

So glad to find this place! The food is simply delicious! Apple salad is the bomb! Honestly, I tried almost everything on the menu and was not disappointed once. Except for the one time when I tried to order lunch and, they could not place my order because they were extremely busy. Which is NOT a bad thing - the food is just this good!

VERY cool place!! It reminded me of places I visited out in the Pacific Northwest. There's the gallery with all different kinds of art pieces visible for your viewing pleasure, but then there's a shop also.

The shop has a WIDE range of things available. You have some very pricey pieces of art, kitchen wares (the carved wine stoppers were my favorites) and even kids books are available as well!! There's something for everyone in the shop.

Since it's Christmas they have a great display off Christmas ornaments. My favorites were the carved, mini gourds and also the wooden Philly skyline pieces. Definitely will try and be back before the holiday season is over!

Our Friday night party of eight could not have had a better time. Alexa our server was very attentive. The food was spectacular. Started with the sausage and figs appetizer as well as the fried meatballs both of which were perfectly prepared. Our entrees ranged from the special stuffed veal chop (that was excellent), the always good veal parmigiana, the filet with crab meat and a very well prepared gluten free halibut. Every one enjoyed the food and atmosphere. Topped off the evening with limoncello cake and sorbeto. I look forward to returning to this special treasure in South Philly.

Our food was disappointing I am disappointed to say. Prices are high which is fine but not if it just seems thrown together... I had a veal dish that really didn't have much flavor... There wasn't much to it and the potatoes that came with it were kind of like frozen hashbrowns potatoes... I was bummed considering what we were paying. My wife had a maybe 4 to 6 ounce fillet of salmon with a scoop of mashed potatoes for almost $30. Atmosphere is very nice. Servers are kind. Our bill was very high and just not great.  I think they're going to have to step it up to compete in this new Nashville market... I hope they will because they have been a part of the community for a long time... Great wine list.
Loved their rooms,  they are beautiful and they have comfortable beds. They have great restaurants, nice bars to hang out at and cute shopping stores. We are definitely coming back.

Was looking for a place to eat with my son after catching a show at Walnut Street Theater. He's a fairly picky eater but loves his desserts, so thought this would be a good fit for him. Certainly nothing fancy inside and I would say the meal was about on par with diner food. My son enjoyed his hamburger while I started with the Mac & Cheese Fritters, which came with a slightly spicy dipping sauce. This was a big appetizer, at least for one person! My entree was the BBQ chicken with a side of mac and cheese and broccoli. It was decent but nothing special. My son also had the tiramisu milkshake and for dessert had the chocolate peanut butter pie, which was pretty sweet! Service was generally good. Our waitress was quite pleasant but I did have to ask for a refill on my water.

It is obvious after digging into this yelp page that the only reason people continue to patronize this restaurant is because it is paying yelp for premium services which include HIDING THE PLETHORA OF TERRIBLE REVIEWS (over 30) in the "not recommended" section... dozens and dozens of credible yelpers giving honest opinions being pushed to the back pages so a business that should be closed can continue to operate and steal money from unsuspecting tourists (not that I'm a fan of tourists) and locals trying unsuccessfully to continue to give this place a chance. Just a word to  the wise... if you have 30 something reviews that aren't recommended, it's not the reviews that constitute the problem , IT'S THE ESTABLISHMENT. This is why i really don't even trust yelp anymore at all. 

I have ordered here approximately 5-10 times in the last couple years, mostly from Uber eats but in person as well. It has never been good and i don't know why i have yet to learn my lesson. After today, however, I'm actually done and i feel the need to warn others because this place should be nowhere near as popular as it is. It's diner food that tastes like diner food but there is literally ALWAYS something wrong with the order, something improperly cooked, or something missing from the order. This time the wrongness came in the form of a COMPLETELY RAW HAMBURGER that cost $11.50.

Potential customers please see the photo, but Slim if y'all are allowing that garbage to come out of your kitchen you obviously have no quality control whatsoever, let alone a meat thermometer, and certainly don't deserve 3.5 stars or honestly even to be open. I will not be patronizing this establishment ever again and i hope you, my fellow yelpers, won't either.

This is gonna be a short one.. I went because of the lobster grilled cheese that is the main photo on the Pint Room's page here.. Surprise! It's not on the menu. 

Overall vibe was kind of chain-ish. A bunch of tvs with sports. They had a decent beer selection, but it was kind of expensive. Menu was pretty typical, mostly Hamburger variations that were mostly trying too hard. Burgers were pretty good though. Fries and onion rings were better than average. 

I guess it met expectations for a downtown Carmel bar. Everything was pretty ok. I'm looking for something else though.

Such a fun environment to be in! The food is great and always fresh. You can tell their fish is completely fresh and not frozen like most places. Drinks are made well and bartenders are very friendly! :)

I decide to write a review today because after repeatedly picking up my food with missing ingredients I've had enough tonight. I typically eat at Honeygrow 3 times a week. At least 2 out of the 3 times a week my order is always missing an ingredient. I usually do a mobile order and take my food to go therefore I never realize ingredients are missing until I get home. I absolutely love the food however the repeated missing ingredients make me give them a two stars rating. I typically go to the Bala location or King of Prussia location. Bala's location typically gets my order incorrect while King of Prussia picks and chooses when they want to charge for two sides of dressing. Today I did notice several new face therefore that could have possibly been a factor. Today they forgot to add the pasta to my salad. Most of the time they forgot to add the eggs. I just think they have to reinforce to staff to pay closer attention to the job.

Amazing doughnuts! I got half a dozen to bring back to NYC and you can bet I was a hero for the day. The flavors rotate, and the hot cinnamon sugar varieties were my favorite. Blueberry was awesome, too! Only one I didn't care for was the sweet potato/marshmallow.
Clean environment with wonderful music. Got the 60 minute special, and couldn't be more pleased.  Therapist gave me more than what I expected. Visits will be ongoing, 100% recommended! ^_^
Damon is so personable and easy to talk to. He gives good estimates and puts time in for recommending products and services. He and his crew are also very easy to work with. I highly recommend them.
Delicious. Great service. Dishes that even a meat eater would love. And run by wonderful people!
We've ordered from this place twice now, and have had positive experiences both times. The pad Thai is not the best I've ever had, but it is still very good! The scallion pancakes are delicious!

If you're looking for a great place to find a healthy bite to eat, The Eagle is not that place.  You WILL find a fun atmosphere, delicious fried chicken, and a great selection of drinks and sides.  They are usually always busy with a bit of a wait, but trust me, it is worth it.  Try the spicy honey!

I lived in Philly years ago, but this was my very favorite place to eat and shop.  My favorite was fresh meals that they served daily that much later found out was macrobiotic .  It was amazing and delicious!!  I always felt good after I ate there.  At the time thought it was just health food, but then years later found a cookbook on Amazon written by the store owners, and I was like....oooohhhhh, so that was the macrobiotic diet. 
  Every friend that came through town, I brought them here to eat.   They loved the food too. 

 I now live in Portland Or. and, yeah there is great food here, miss this place.  Portland mostly has Gluten-free, organic vegetarian...but not macrobiotic.  (Personally they blame gluten for too much out here!) 

Owners: Come open a store/ restaurant out here!...since I will never be back in Philly again.  Portland is awesome!!!

The good is that these were seriously good burgers--the meat was fresh and the buns were soft and tasty

The only issues were that I called the order in and it took more than 30 minutes for it to be done--when I got it home, the bacon cheeseburger that I ordered "plain" as "only meat, bread and cheese--no condiments or veggies" had the mustard spread in the bread.

So next time I will give them more time to cook and double check the order before I leave--it was really good other than that.

I've been here twice for the few years when I've lived in the neighborhood. It's always been a pleasant experience however I'm certain they don't know how to cut men's haircut. Over the last 6 years, they've increased prices greater than 25%.. it was 15$ 6 years ago for men's cut, and now it's 25$ (not that I'm complaining for what women have to pay to get a cut).

I definitely won't be returning despite the pleasant experience. 

Pros: Quick, walk-ins, local family business.
Cons: Men's haircut.

Really friendly wait staff that make you feel welcome at this lovely Japanese restaurant. An old stand by, they push out consistent tasty Japanese food. Bento boxes are great for when you want to try a bunch of items.  We are wanting to go back and try some interesting desserts...but we are always too full!
Great bar food, the Cuban is the sh@t.  Awesome Saturday bartender!!  All in all, a great experience.

By far the best experience I have had buying a timepiece. I was in Philly for a few days and I had heard good things so I stopped by. It turned out to be quite serendipitous, as they actually had a GMT Master II Batman in stock.

Gregory took immaculate care of the sale. I have large wrists and it was a bit too tight, but it was OK because he tracked down an extra link. He also took me on a little tour of their offices (cool IT stuff guys) and threw me some nice swag. Instead of carrying it around with me they mailed it (for free) next fay air to my local shipping center. 

And I will not mention what I paid for the piece, but it was extremely reasonable. 

Overall I cannot recommend these guys enough. I would absolutely train down from NYC again to work with them.

I was really hesitant to get a second ear lobe piercing after I got it done with my mom when I was like 8 years old on an island at a jewelry store. It was traumatic as I waited to be the last one to have them shoot a stud with one of those retractable guns. They shouldn't even allow those things. It took over a year to heal and it hurt so bad that I walked out in tears. They had to cut the post off after it healed as they didn't inform me how to properly clean it. 

Fast forward, 20 years later, I mustered myself into finally getting a 2nd lobe. This time at a reputable tattoo and piercing parlor. I just walk in without an appointment to Metamorphosis. This was the best ear piercing experience by far. They had a beautiful selection of titanium jeweled or metal studs, but I opted for beaded ones. Guess what? They're reusable for future piercings which is awesome. My 2nd lobe was done by Kristin-down to earth gal and experienced piercer. I highly recommend her. 

I would totally go back and get additional piercings in the future. The price for piercing is competitive to elsewhere, but I like how they take you into a private, sterile room like a doctor's office not like at a mall kiosk with everyone watching you. The piercing process was quick and painless, much less than having a 14 gauge needle stuck into your arm. They give you a care card and two plastic condiment cups with a bag of salt to cup over your ears to keep them clean while they're healing.

The best of the best! Great outfitters with great employees. This business cares about its customers,even to the point of closing if conditions are unsafe on the river. That costs them revenue but they put safety first!
Food was terrible. Eggplant parm was hard as a rock, sausage was cold in middle, gnocchi has a strange taste and texture. Service was also terrible. Will never eat here again!!!!
A great place for fine estate jewelry if your budget allows. It's also a terrific place to find gorgeous charms to memorialize your NOLA trip!

Trapped in an elevator at Courtyard Marriott Lansdale Christmas morning. Local firemen had to rescue us. Even though we did not have serious medical conditions, I experienced a panic attack. I heard a township representative and local firefighters claim that the hotel did not follow proper protocol because they did not contact 911 immediately. I was assured that I would hear from management the very next day. I have not, even though I've called and left voicemail. No response from them. We had to file incident reports with the hotel, firefighters, and the township. Today I woke up to find I was charged extra money for incidentals. You've got to be kidding me. I demand full reimbursement. This hotel has acted irresponsibly and unprofessionally. This hotel is so close to my parents house and I  was hoping to make it a tradition to stay here Christmas Eve. I will never stay at this hotel or recommend it again. @courtyardmarriottusa

One Word: Fresh. My family and I came to visit Philadelphia this past weekend to check out our LA King's play to Flyers. While in town, we wanted a simple classic, fresh place to eat. Luckily for us, we found Bareburger. The found was outstanding, customer service was superb and the atmosphere was decent. The only reason this place doesn't get 5* is because they were out of stock on some items... like bananas, certain beer, and chicken. Besides that, I would definitely recommend this place.

Thanks again Yelp. Old school steak sandwich. Fun help. Great food. 

Small place with excellent food.

Sliders are the best (beef, chicken, pork ...in that order), and I just love their buttermilk drops. I have also tried their monte cristo sandwich which was crispy and savory and sweet all at the same time.

I will never get my haircut from anyone other than Matt ever again. I have gone to high end salons as well as Supercuts like chains and have never been so happy with a haircut. He listened to everything I had to say and executed the cut exactly how I requested- he also gave me some input on how the cut could better frame my face as well as some suggestions for products/styling techniques. Don't bother looking elsewhere for a better stylist because you won't find it.

Seems like every store you go into every time you turn a corner there's an animal in front of you. I doubt that these are "therapy" animals. Why don't businesses require people coming in with animals to prove that they are a therapy dog, cat iguana, etc.?! It's very startling to turn the corner with your small child and realize there's a dog at their level. Most children are bitten in the face because they are at the same level as these canines. Instead of Home Depot worrying about their bottom dollar they need to be more concerned with lawsuits which would definitely affect their bottom line. If they allow these animals to be in their store and they attack and bite someone they WILL be held libel as well as the pet owner. How ridiculous that this seems to be the norm nowadays. If you can't leave your house without your iguana, dog, cat, bird then maybe you should stay home and not subject other people. Did you ever stop to think that maybe people are allergic to fur and pet dander? Be responsible.

Purchased a new 2018 Sonata from Vadim Naumov in Clearwater.
Best car buying experience in a decade. The process was super easy at this dealership. Got a great car and a great deal. V's professionalism is second to none. First class experience all around. My family has purchased several vehicles from him at this dealer. We will definitely be back in the future.

A good fast food style place for gyros close by. The exterior of the place looks sketchy but the food is good. I have only had one of their gyros and I thought it was good but it did not wow me. It is a nice place if you are looking for something other chick fil a or a burger place though.

Visited this location with my kids and a friend on a Thursday morning so there was no line. The lady that took our orders was super helpful and friendly - I think her name was Mason? She let us know the specials and welcomed us since this was our first time eating there. The interior is trendy, I love the Music City lighted sign on the wall. Between us we ordered some bonuts, the Southern Benny, East Nasty, Nasty Princess (special) and the Lily. We all agreed that given the hype and the typical line outside the door and around the corner, we expected our food to be amazing and it just wasn't. It was just ok. Nothing to write home about. Almost disappointing. 3 stars for the friendly staff and ambience. The flavors on the Benny just didn't come together for me. Next time I'm craving biscuits I'll just go to the Loveless Cafe.
Love this place. Great ambience. The corn appetizer is amazing. The Arepas are delicious and presentation is beautiful. And don't forget the cocktails!!!

Kind of a silly wordplay name for a restaurant that has a fun/exotic atmosphere and great food for our meal, which made for a really nice evening out with friends.  The interior is colorful and highly styled.  And having everything served on copper dinnerware and glasses adds to the faux exotic feel.  It's fun.

Our food was very tasty.  You will not find most of these dishes at other non-Turkish restaurants, not even at other Mediterranean restaurants.  Of course there are some dishes found elsewhere, but most are local to or customized as Turkish.  But they were all of high quality.  Only thing was that many of the entrees needed a side to round them out, and the menu doesn't really indicate that or offer a ton of sides.

Service was quite polite, but we didn't see our server for very long stretches.  In fact, I had to find him to get our water pitcher (copper of course) refilled.  But overall, I thought it was a great meal and event.

The manager Jeremy is the rude person I've ever spoken with. That is when he isn't hanging the phone up on your because he doesn't want to deal with any issues. Sad to say but over the years the food and atmosphere degraded and I think Jeremy is partially if not fully to blame.
Ordered the Korean tacos made from naa bread and meat was very cheap. More than half the meat was fat. Also very little meat overall. Unfortunately did not like my experience.

What a disappointment this restaurant is. The food is forgettable and the management is downright rude. Save your money and go somewhere else. In fact, rude doesn't begin to describe how I was treated.

First of all - they get the hush puppy corn muffins right, because if you aren't gonna do that right you shouldn't call it "The Mason Jar". Our table had burgers ( Angus) and one daily special - fried catfish (just right - it will remind you of Middendorf's or Bozo's) and white beans with rice ( yum). The garlic fries and Mac-n-cheese are excellent sides. Can't wait to get back to try the Chicken Cuban and smoked sausage poor boys. 

The staff are warm and friendly. That and the decor gives the feel you're eating in your best friend's Mama's kitchen.  Beer & wine if you want it.

My brother stopped here and I stayed in the car. He needed coffee.

He brought me a regular plain croissant and a bag of cookies from the counter.

The croissant tasted sour. Which is usually a result of over-fermentation.

The cookies were even worse. Rock hard and tasted rancid. Pretty sure they do not use butter to make their cookies.

These people are the worst bakers on the planet.

Horrible place.

This place is horrendous. Rent and additional charges are through the roof for what you are actually getting. Maintenance is slow and does not actually fix any of the appliances when they get there. 3 out of the 5 toilets in my apartment leak, leading us to have black mold in our guest bathroom. It took us forever to actually get someone out here to look at it, and when they got around to fixing it, we were not able to live in our apartment for close to a month. This place is not worth your time and especially not worth your money.

The manager Brittney Thomson and her staff didn't get me moved in on the date committed. Brittney wasn't any help at all. Fortunately, I got in touch with her boss - Chari who was very helpful and accommodating. She resolved the issue quickly and we got moved in with her help. Thank you Chari.

Food...amazing
Service.....amazing
Superheros  on the bathroom walls????  You do not go here for the atmosphere so who cares ...I guess. A bit of a lot opportunity if you ask me, but it will help keep the snobs away.

Wow, absolutely amazing.  We had the caprese salad, the Diavalo and Bianca pizzas and everything was outstanding. We will definitely be back. 

Update 7/8. We came back and it was more "glorious" (term my GF required I use) than previous visits.  Arturo our waiter is fantastic and Scott really takes care of his clients. 

Update 7/10. Scott......you have achieve Pizza God status. "We're not worthy!"   

Update 12/18. Place is really cooking now.  Great service last night and they now have beer and wine. Pizza was amaze-balls as usual.  Place was packed, Scott had it running like a top now.

This is my favorite place to just relax. They have comfortable seating. The owners and staff are always helpful and make you feel welcome. For mornings the breakfast offerings are amazing. Their doughnuts made on site as are the icings. For lunch and dinner it is wonderful cafe food. They make amazing gyros. Full of savory meat, paired with sharp salty bite feta,onions,tomatoes and lettuce garnish the gyro. vegetarian options exist as well. If you want a place that invites one to come relax for a casual meal or to satisfy a sweet tooth. This is a must try.

Dont let the buildings past keep you away. The interior and food have undergone a complete remodel. The menu is a great version of modern American fare.
Service was pleasant as well as the flavors in the food. Be sure to order pepper jack cheese sticks with sriracha dipping sauce for a nice departure from the old mozzarella sticks.
We plan to return for dinner soon. You should plan to stop in and try a new Reno spot that's worth the gamble!

We recently had a new addition to our family - a Beautiful female Cane Corso. We decided to have her ears cropped as most Cane Corso owners do, and searched around to find a good vet who does this procedure. We discovered that there are very few vets who perform this procedure. However, after numerous phone calls, we finally found Dr. Singh at the All Pet Care Center who has excellent recommendations and utilizes lazer surgery. So we decided to have Dr. Singh perform the ear cropping procedure on our Mia and we are totally 100% satisfied with our experience at the All Pet Care Hospital and all of the staff there. Mia's ears look perfect. I highly recommend this vet and his staff located on Sunset Point Road in Clearwater for any veterinarian needs you may have.

I'd say it was just alright. I was impressed with how well the staff worked the line in getting people seated and our server was on it, especially considering her workload which was several tables. The food came out pretty quickly as well. My problem was really with the food itself. I guess I was expecting too much, but the pancakes weren't anything special and the rest of the food: sausage, eggs and bacon weren't prepared very well. Sausage over cooked, bacon undercooked, and eggs were oddly very small. Plus out food came out cold which is an instant killer for me. We were just passing through on this trip but next time I'm in Nashville I won't be returning - there's just too many other options.

Anyone upset about this Company should know that the Owner tragically passed a few weeks ago. So - no, your calls will not be answered or returned. No - no one is controlling the emails, notices, etc. So if you continue to get notifications.... please, give the poor woman & her mourning family a break! She. Is. Dead! So save your crappy Yelp reviews for a business owner that can actually reply to you, fight back, make it up to you or just straight up has a Goddam heartbeat!  No need to tarnish anyone's reputation.

My husband and I stumbled upon this little treasure during our visit to Nashville, and we are so happy we did!  We loved the cozy vibe of the place and their amazing selection of local beers.  What really did it for us though, was the warmth of their staff.  Mark knows his stuff and was more than happy to share his knowledge and help us pick a beer (and then two, then three...) that we'd enjoy.  They also have tasty small bites you can order to munch on while you sample a few beers. Would highly recommend this place for any beer lover.  Wish we didn't live on the opposite side of the country from this gem!

Bull barn is amazing!

If you've never been in before and you eat food, it is time my friend. Give yourself at least 30 minutes, but you're probably gonna need more.

Bull barn carries a huuuuuge selection of baking ingredients, spices, candies, snacks, tea, bulk items (ha- of course) like pasta and grains, and a bunch of other necessary food items! My most recent discovery here was their dog treats. My pup has a sensitive stomach, but she can totally handle their treats with natural ingredients like banana, oats, turkey, sweet potato and peanut butter. And you'll save lots of money compared to pet stores!

I also urge you to check out the coffee aisle. I have a new favorite and grind my beans right there in the store. Deeeelish.

And of course, this place is heaven on earth for anyone with a sweet tooth. Brace yo' self.

The staff at the shop was extremely rude/borderline hostile to individuals who are coming in to rent a firearm. First off, their website doesn't have accurate information as to what pistols you're able to rent. Secondly, they will give you the most expensive ammunition they have at the shop to use and if you question ANYTHING you'll be spoken to as if you were the worlds dumbest person. Overall we felt extremely unwelcome from the moment we walked in the door. Highly suggest you avoid a range that treats people with such contempt for trying to give them their business, and one that somehow let TWO people commit suicide in their shop, one of whom snuck the rental gun into the bathroom. DON'T GO THERE.

When my husband and I got engaged, we decided that we wanted to find the ring together. We talked about it a lot and we both agreed that we wanted the ring be 'one of a kind'...and for us, this meant having the ring designed and made by a local jeweler. We went to 7 ring shops before we walked into Portche's. The first thing I want to say about Portche's is that the staff is incredible! From the moment we walked through their doors until the day my husband picked up our rings, and every visit since then, has been so wonderful. Everyone we have encountered has been so helpful and kind...not to mention how professional and talented they are. I should mention that even though we opted to have our rings made special, I was slightly tempted to buy a ring that they already had in store. Some of their jewelry is vintage and most of the jewelry at Portche's has a kind of elegant quality. So, if you're looking to have something made special or just want to ogle beautiful jewelry, I would recommend a trip to Portche's.

Worst service here ever! Waiter could not speak English, got our orders wrong multiple times, charge us wrong, had to rewrite the receipt 4 times before he and the manager got it right! I worked(bust my ass) as a waiter in the food industry before so I cannot stand terrible services. Never eating here again!

Great price for the size and Quality of the room. Spend a weekend with my significant other in the executive room with an in room jacuzzi.  Worth every penny. Staff was Courteous and friendly. Breakfast mediocre. And location, not much going on.

what can I say? I truly believe my life just changed!! Cynthia is amazing! She is so kind and understanding. This was my first visit with her after having 2 bad experiences with acupuncture and she has made me a believer!  I have issues from menopause to polycystic kidneys and liver to chronic pain and I look forward to having Cynthia and acupuncture help me regain my life!!

UPDATE ON 12/15/17 - I have now been to see Cynthia for a few weeks and I just want to say again how amazing she is!! Not just as an acupuncturist but as a healer all the way around. She listens and responds and tries to find alternative solutions to your problems. Cannot say enough wonderful things about her!!!
Excellent food!  Excellent service.  Bacon-wrapped shrimp and grits divine!  Best crab cakes I have ever tasted.  Get there 15 min before opens to get a seat without reservations.

After a beautiful autumn walk through the Botanical Gardens I stopped in for lunch. It is basically a old service station turned restaurant, but don't let that throw you off. Trust me - you will love this place. 

Think vintage oil cans and crystal decanters with silver trays and copper tagines. Add to the mix a variety of artisanal gin, rye and Japanese whiskey served over an upbeat but chill background music (Like ARE & BE on Spotify).

I ordered the Ugni blanc with some baba ganoush and the autumn root vegetable tagine. Homemade bread was amazing and everything was delicious. I'll let the photo do the talking.

I'll be back!
Love this place. Come in sit in the back,  relax and have some me time.  They have all types of spiritual  items for sale. Really nice gifts too.

These people are so rude. Saturday my washer quit and held my clothes hostage.  Called them told them this and my motor was making noise and not working.  Told them going to have to buy new.  Just asked how do I get my clothes out.  They told me they would have to charge me.  What I am coming to buy new. I said it's Christmas and they don't service Breese area.  No they need money.  Never will I buy from them.
The service was awesome as soon as I walked I they got me seated and started working on my nails they got me in and out and I am in love with my nails. I will be going back here again

If you have not experienced this ... you must!!  This style of restaurant you can only find in big cities like NYC & Cali .  The food is like no other!! Ramen like this you won't find anywhere.  The staff is so friendly & welcoming.  If you don't get to experience the whisky VIP room on your first visit, make sure you do!  It has its own bar & some incredible bottles of very unique & hard to find whiskies .  They have a DJ booth.. yup, a DJ booth with their own DJ playing some of the latest music mixes & entertaining the crowd as they all eat.   Awesome place!

If I could give a minus for a review I would. These so called plumbers came out to install a few sinks and faucets in my home from a remodel. The remodeling company employed these idiots. After 4 attempts to install sinks in the master bath I was told by the owner, Eric that foreign sinks should not be allowed in this country, a 1 1/4 in flange could not be found in all of Tucson and finally,  he could not do my job and must leave. They also tried and failed three times to install a faucet in the powder room. It's made in the US so not sure why that proved impossible. The three people I had to deal with are the two owners, Michelle and Eric and their plumber, Leo. Michelle is so unprofessional she actually hung up during a call. Please....read all the reviews on yelp and other sites and do not employ these people. If your home warranty wants to send them out BEG them to send someone else.

Chuck E Cheese's is affordable fun for the kids...heck, it's fun for adults too! This is a great Sunday Funday activity for the family. They have games and activities for all different age groups. The pizza isn't too bad and it seems clean and organized. I like how they stamp the kids with the adults they enter with and actually check to see if stamp is the same upon exit. My kids look forward to returning!

Given that it was Christmas day, I'm not surprised there was quite a long wait for a table (1.5-2 hrs was the estimated time). Luckily we called ahead of time when we got to the hotel (online reservations can also be made but the front desk lady did mention something about being completely booked for the next 2 weeks..) so had our name put down 45 minutes before we actually headed down to the resturaunt. We still had to wait another 30 minutes but it was much better than waiting for over 1.5 hours like some other people.

Onto the food, we got the AYCE sushi (dinner price $32.99) as their normal entree items (not sushi) already cost around $26+ and definitely got our money's worth. There's a large selection of rolls and although you can't get sashimi, they give you a good fish to rice ratio for their nigiri and their rolls weren't stuffed with thick layers of rice. Our favorite rolls were the San Francisco and Hokkaido. I'm also a big fan of salmon sashimi but their seared nigiris are also really good! The fish tasted fresh and pleased us all. You put in your order on a sheet of paper and it comes out in batches which is nice so you don't  have to wait forever for everything to come out all at once. However, it did take a while for everything to come and in the end, we cancelled 3 of our orders because we were stuffed (so perhaps it was a good thing it took a while for it to come out?). Granted the place was packed so that may have affected the speed of the sushi making. Our waiter was extremely friendly even though we could tell she was really busy and overall I would recommend this resturaunt.

P.S. don't forget to check in for a free cocktail or draft beer. Only one check in is allowed per table though

This was my first time here. I was here to watch the holiday boat parade of lights.  The pavilion is attached to the river walk. Restaurants were open all the  shops were closed.   I arrived at 7:15 p.m: and the event began over an hour later.  It was packed.  No where to sit except the steps.  No where to stand. We walked down the river walk away from the crowd and found a bench to sit on.  It was slightly more difficult to see the boat parade but we could see it. I took my dog.  There were lots of dogs.  It was a good evening.

Dan came to my house because I wanted his opinion on whether or not he could remove pet stains and odors.  He first did a "trial" area to see if it would be ok, then returned 2 days later to do the rest of the house.  Needless to say, he did a great job!

Very cute cafe that replaced sweet pea ice cream that used to be near the green parrot pub. 

The owner was extremely friendly and let us pay for our drinks after we finished them and invited us to stay and chat for as long as we wanted. We had got chocolate made with almond milk and it was perfect - not too sweet, just enough flavor. 

The owner is still putting some finishing touches on the space, but if you're looking for a tasty beverage or a crepe, stop in!

From the moment I walked into Cake Bake, it felt like I was living a dream. I was lucky enough to visit during the holidays and I'm so glad I did! Every inch of the place was covered in absolutely beautiful holiday décor. Christmas trees and garlands everywhere, twinkling lights and the most amazing smells. My team at work had lunch reservations and we were seated in this decadent room with a fireplace and a giant farm sized table to gather around. 

The food was remarkable! Every bite I took had me in awe. I started with a lavender latte, which I tend to order whenever it's on the menu. I have to say that this was one of the best I've ever had.  It was so smooth and flavorful, there was even crystalized lavender sprinkled on top. How fab is that?! Next up was my actual lunch. I ordered the soup of the day (sweet potato) and a ceaser salad on the side along with a baguette. The soup was thick and creamy. It came with a dollop of orange crème on top and I ate every single bite. Dipping the baguette in the soup made for heaven in your mouth - seriously. The baguette wasn't tough to get through like most baguettes I've tried. It was crunchy (but not too much) on the outside and nice and warm and chewy on the inside. I also got a slice of carrot cake for the road. After a three-hour drive back to Columbus, I couldn't wait to dig in to it. First of all, it was enormous! I only ate half and saved the rest for later. The cream cheese frosting was thick and sweet, the carrot cake itself was so incredibly moist and flavorful. It was a fantastic choice! Another adorable little touch, glitter was on every single thing I ate. I'm not kidding, everything from my latte to my soup to my salad. Now, I'm not typically a glitter girl but this made everything so fun and unique. I totally embraced the glitter during my stay. 

Lastly, the service was top notch from the moment I walked in the door. The hostess greeted me warmly and our server was the sweetest and so on top of everything. Another cool aspect of this place was the window into the kitchen. You could see all the chefs in their neat chef hats, hard at work. It's easy to see why Cake Bake has been so successful and Indy is so lucky to be getting a second location soon!

A sensory experience for the eyes as well as the tastebuds. Every nook is full of specialty products freshly made or of the highest packaged quality.  My only disappointment is that desserts look so outrageously delicious, but many times I could not enjoy them for they tend to be overly sweet to the point you gag. So I stick to the muffins and cookies. A magical treat is to get there when the store opens and take in the aromas of just made breads and pastries that you can enjoy with your cappuccino.

_____FORGET ABOUT JHONNY_____

   If you need termite control & treatment, DON'T EVER EVER EVER make any sort of agreement for work with the company known as Jhonny's Pest Control. If you do, you'll be sorry!!  When just part of the job at our place was completed, everything halted. No one showed up. When we telephoned, Jhonny's office crew never functioned at all. That is to say they behaved in a completely unprofessional way: phone calls never returned... not by Jhonny, not by anyone. When someone finally spoke to us, that person claimed that the employees assigned to our job had "disappeared" and would not be coming back. Not only that, we were told that part of the office staff had disappeared at the same time. That was all we ever learned. We were then double-charged with the tasks already completed. We gave up trying to negotiate anything that made sense over the telephone and drove to their office. Another mistake !! If you enter their office you'll come into contact with with Jhonny himself: also rude & brusque & aggressive... always denying anything that's wrong could possible be his fault. 
   
We continued to complain to Jhonny that partial work done at our place seemed done too hastily and-- remember-- NEVER COMPLETED!!!... & of course, that he was over-charging in every category.  When we pressed our complaints, Jhonny demanded that we sign an statement agreeing not to post a BAD review. I refused. Now we will, of course, be filing a complaint with the the local Better Business Bureau, as well as the California Pest Control Board.

Be forewarned...

James M.

We hired Patrick and crew to clean, restain and seal our rather large wooden home, fence and decks.  Our home is very tall in numerous places but that obstacle was easily handled. The job they did was nothing short of perfection.  Their attention to detail was superb, always immediately cleaned up after working and our home looks stunning.  Another major benefit is that Patrick always showed up on time; answered calls, texts and emails promptly; and completed the project on schedule.  Anyone in the Tahoe area knows how rare this is. We will hire him hands down for any future painting needs.

I'm probably one of the few Yelpers that is not a fan of Bru's burgers. They're just not my thing.  Now the buttermilk fried chicken tenders-mmmmm! Expertly fried, not greasy with the right amount of flavor, these tenders are awesome! Definitely shareable (or not)!

And the Bru fries, oh the fries are wonderful! My personal favorite dipping sauce is the black pepper mayo. 

Both are excellent as a to go order or for staying in the restaurant. And, as I've written before, don't be afraid to sit at the bar if you're able to! A great way to cut the wait for a table and chat with knowledgeable bartenders!

I don't know why we don't visit here more.  We're up and down Keystone quite often, but for some reason...we seem to not think of it.

Sahm's family of restaurants has always impressed me.  They're combination of solid food and service, the fact they're locally owned, and a nice, varied menu makes me a fan.

This restaurant appears, on the inside, a bit more upscale to me than some of their others.  It doesn't have the sports bar feel that the one in Fishers has, it's more of a place to go have a quiet meal and conversation.

Although it appears a bit more upscale, the menu isn't expensive, rather, I'd call it moderate.  Nice mixture of salads, burgers, steaks, fish, and more.  I'm pretty certain anyone can find something to suit their palate here.

The knotted buns on the burgers are AMAZING.  Huge fan.

The one thing that kept me from giving a 5 star review was the service.  I found it to be a bit aloof and not especially prompt.  It wasn't terrible, mind you, but enough to knock a star off.

I came here to watch Essence on Saturday night. I got there as the doors were opening so I got promptly seated. This is the first time I have ever been to Sammy's showroom and I was surprised how small the stage was. I have been to the Eldorado showroom and I was expecting the showroom to be similar of that size, but nevertheless, it didn't take away from the great show that these beautiful ladies put on. 

I decided to limit my alcohol that night, so I didn't order any other drinks, but I did appreciate the complimentary glass of champagne upon being seated.

We got seated up front and in retrospect, I regret sitting so close to the stairs. Being so close to the stage, you become victim to awkward eye contact and having to keep turning around to see what was happening when the performers went off stage into the crowd. 

I loved the show although and thought it was a great burlesque style show and the lead singer slayed those songs! She has an amazing voice! The dancers were very entertaining and comedic as well. They got that bend and snap and hair flipping down to an art!

I had a great time and great thanks to Yelp for making this experience possible for me.

I would definitely recommend this show to anyone wanting to watch a good show.

We decided to give it another chance tonight after hearing that they've hired a new chef and completely overhauled the menu. We could not believe the change. Everything - and I mean everything - was vastly improved. From Asian staples like goyza and sushi, to new twists on Brussel sprouts and scallops, to inventive and flavorful cocktails, we could not have had a better evening. So thrilled for LAN and the changes he's bringing to this great venue. Congrats on the perfect evening. We will be back, many times, to try everything!
Oysters are awesome! Rest of there Food was not that great and employees acted like they did not want to be there.  Smittys seafood down the road is 1000% better

Nothing like a good roast beef sandwich every now and then to satisfy that craving we all get in this suburban area dotted with all these green, healthy foods. Sometimes, you really just need a sandwich with too much sodium, gluten-full bread, and good old American cheese. When that particular hunger strikes you, Arby's is there for you!

We're not here a whole lot, but it's nice to have it around for those cravings that come on a whim now and then. It's also possibly one of the few Arby's in the area, as I don't believe they have one in King of Prussia. Didn't make the cut, I suppose.

Anyhow, staff is friendly and food is what you'd expect at any Arby's - tasty and a good reminder that there is life beyond green smoothies and restaurants that only serve salad...

Whenever I'm in Tucson I stay at a hotel down the road from this place and part of the reason for that is so I can have some of the best pizza I've ever had delivered right to my room. The sauce is thick with an excellent blend of spices and the cheese is generous without being too much. I always go for the pepperoncini topping because it's not offered at many places and is surprisingly delicious on top of a pie. After two years the quality has never gone down so I hope they're around for many more years to come.

Nice and clean little "hole in the wall".  You seat yourself. Waitress was prompt. NicE menu selection. Food was hot. HUGE portions and cooked just right. A for real large glass of orange juice was served! You will enjoy your left overs. I think we've found a little hidden gem. We will be back for lunch AND dinner. Oh and did I mention the price is right?!

Having just moved to the area, I tried several different nail salons in hopes of finding my next routine spot. I was pleasantly surprised at how clean, professional, and beautiful the salon was. Not to mention that my gel manicure lasted nearly 3 weeks, which rarely ever happens. The entire staff here is very courteous, although I would highly suggest a appointment as they get very busy. Mary and Kim are both great! Highly recommend!

Really great burgers but their rewards system is so frustrating. First lost sll.of our points a few years agonwhen they changed programs and then they accidently used our free burger we earned on a $6 bill even though we asked them not to. They told us it was fixed and would be there when we come back in. Low and behold, surprise surprise, it wasn't there. Managers just shrug their shoulders and say there is nothing they can do. Very frustrating.

Great happy hour specials!! Amazing food. Large portions for a fantastic price. The staff are awesome and don't bombard you. They have a great balance between making sure your needs are met and letting you enjoy your time with your party.

Draft latte and the cappuccino - both amazing. The place is huge inside with a really cool atmosphere that almost would be too hipster if they didn't back it up with awesome food and coffee. Can I come back later on Christmas Eve?
This is the best place to stop between DC and northern destinations. No tax btw.  Starbucks coffee and tons of restrooms.

This is pretty much one of my favorite stores in the city and I've found some really great deals recently for gifts and for myself. I don't think I've ever left this place empty-handed! 

Besides enjoying the historic architectural details, I routinely find the staff to be helpful and knowledgeable, whether I'm getting something $ or $$, or just asking questions about something I can only afford to add to my wish-list for now. 

I've only had them gift wrap my purchases a few times and, unlike another reviewer here (perspective dude: First World problems!), I'm a little more forgiving when it comes to a free service. When it's busy (weekends, holiday time, weekends at holiday time) there's going to be a big line, and the people who stay in it are the ones who are going to get their things wrapped before the people who leave it behind for later pick-up. At least, that's what I'd expect if I continue to wait. If you ask, they'll probably just give you paper to wrap it yourself (though, Lord knows it will look like crap if I do it!), or you can go down the street to Papyrus (beautiful wrapping job, but they charge).

This is one of my favorite spots in STL. I love the atmosphere. The food is delightful, the lattes are all very good and the service is always friendly. Whether I am out with someone or just need quite place to work this place is a good fit for both!

The male bartender (not sure his name) is super friendly, super knowledgeable, and... super friendly. By the looks of the place we thought it would be bad... it was seriously awesome. We got the shrimp tacos and the steak and cheese.. there are no words to describe... maybe we are just tourists and any Nola food is 10x better than what we are used to ... but it was amazing... the steak came out piping hot and each bite was like butter. The shrimp were seasoned wonderfully and just tasted awesome. This review was written only two beers in....

Pho Bac has made its way onto the regular list for our Friday lunches at work. Most of us get the typical P7 orP9 but I have to say that that barbecued pork is my favorite. It has a wonderful sweet tinge to it which goes really well with the cinnamon spice in the pho. Make sure to throw jalapeños and basil into that bowl because they add quite the spicy combo kick!
I have also been with my wife and she chooses the cold vermicelli noodles with the spring rolls and that is a delicious dish as well.
Whatever you do don't miss out and skip on the coffee with evaporator milk over ice. It is quite the treat!
Expensive. $15 for 2 breakfast sandwiches, meat, egg and cheese. Thought at least it would come with some home fries, but no. They tasted fine, but absolutely not worth it.

My first visit to this business even though I have passed it for years, and after I got over the $26.99 shock, I was excited to be getting what I expected to be a great wash. My car wasn't very dirty to begin with and the interior was slightly dusty as it was washed a few weeks ago. After I left, I went to the grocery store and when I got out of my car, I looked on the passenger side and was surprised and disappointed at how streaked it was on both doors. Front bumper was sad looking also. I have to say I couldn't believe I had just gotten a car wash, except the interior looked nice (one of the stars). I attempted to call when I got back into the car to explain that I would like to come back another day, but got the answering machine. I'll try and call tomorrow, but only as a courtesy call because I doubt that I even want to go back. The employees were very nice -- thus the other star. Don't waste your money unless you are getting an oil change, then I think it might be a decent price if you don't expect much.

Let's just start this one with WOW! I do not like coffee or hot chocolate but have found something to love every visit! Let me suggest to you the French White Chocolate with Lavender for a very sweet treat! Great fast customer serve loved all year around. Don't forget a scoop of ice cream or a toasted warm pastry while you're here too!

Looking for a super filling lunch that won't break the bank? Try IndeBlu's express lunch, which allows you to select an appetizer as well as a small plate or entree for your lunch meal. The amount of food was so much for me that I had it packed up and had dinner later on!

For my appetizer I selected the tandoori chicken naan pizza. To be honest, it wasn't exactly what I was expecting - if I hadn't known that the pizza was made with naan, I wouldn't have had any clue. It seemed just like a regular personal sized pizza. It was tasty, with a little bit of Indian seasonings and delicious peppers, in addition to the chicken and cheese.

For my entree, I got the chicken makhani. To be honest, I really didn't have much of a clue what I was ordering, I just know that I like chicken, and figured I'd give it a shot. The menu I had didn't mention that it was a "butter chicken" dish, which might have given me a better idea. Nonetheless, I thought that the chicken was delicious and flavorful, and just the right tenderness with the meat. The rice was a bit on the bland side, but the sauce on the chicken made up for it. 

All in all, the food here was pretty good - my husband ordered the chicken madras, which I sampled and we both agreed that the makhani was far better. So if you're visiting, I'd definitely recommend that dish. Can't wait to come back and try a bit more of the menu!

The Tuscan Tower rooms have always been the best in town but it appears they are in need of some renovation.  On my last visit, the reading lamp in between the two beds was flat out missing, yep, just an empty pedestal (not a good look to the room).  Immediately notified the front desk.  Also, it appears they have removed many of the decorative pillows, etc. that make the room appear more luxurious, not sure why they aren't being replaced.  Overall, the room just looks tired. The casino looks dark and dated with terrible ventilation.  Plus, what's with the double security to use your comp dollars?  Please enter your PIN and show me your ID to get a latte? Then, stand in line at the passport club desk to show your ID yet again to get your free play?  Really??!!  Ridiculous.  Have a little class Peppermill, these are your customers. You get three stars for the Terrace Lounge and a nice swimming pool.

I had fabulous service for my daughter and me at by Nikkie at Divinity Salon. We were in dire need of a salon that was well versed in ethnic hair. I'm black mixed and my kids are black, plus we have tons of hair. We're from CT and use to such variety of hairdressers that can do any type of hair. We've tried many salons in the Tucson area that promised they are well trained in "ethnic" hair and are excellent with black hair. I didnt realize they feel they could do ethnic hair because they have a large amount of Mexican clientele. The results from those salons being only that my bank account was lighter and I had to try and fix something as simple as a blow out on my own at home. 
Someone suggested Ms.Nikkie at Divinity and sent me a link to her work. Needless to say, the very next day I  called and made an appointment for my daughter AND me. Nikkie was able to take both of us on that afternoon. We might have missed the salon had we not seen the inconspicuous sign in the front that we were informed was just put up not too long ago. FYI, the salon is all the way around the back of the building. 
Upon our arrival, we were promptly greeted by our stylist who offered us a seat as she was just finishing her client. That was fine, we looked around, used the bathroom and had some water. I found the salon was clean with a nice decor. The music they played was something everyone would enjoy and was not so loud you could barely concentrate nor was it so soft one would struggle to hear. 
There's plenty services offered in this one salon, which is great if you don't want to travel all around Tucson. They offer mani/pedis and eyebrows. They do weaves, wigs, braids, twists, basically any and everything to do with enhancing your beauty. They offer clients the option to book appointments entirely online, but I prefer making appointments with a human being to be sure there are no misunderstandings.
All in all I found our stylist, Nikkie, to be pleasant and very talented. It was a major plus that my daughter liked her. Our hair looked flawless upon departure and we received tons of compliments! We've been back and I'm making another appointment asap. 
I did leave one star off ( I wish I could only leave 1/4 of a star off instead) because you will most likely be there for hours and that may deter some folks pressed for time. I've always alleviated this issue with any salon by automatically assuming I'll be there quite some time. I only book days I have nothing to do, but that's just me.

I love this place so so so much. I came here during one of my first visits to Philadelphia and I'm so happy I ended up living down the street! Great playlists, great food, and very warm and friendly people. The owner, Blew, and her daughter are so kind and welcoming. Every time I come here I stay longer than I mean to, in the good way. Very thankful to have such an inspiring local business around. 

Other awesome things about this place:
The seating
The little library in the back
The mission and the intent of the space

Everything feels right about this spot :)

First off I have been to a few nail salon's in Reno, all disappointing! Until I came to Diva Nails, the customer service is amazing and the talent is worth every penny spent. Plus they have an extensive collection of colors and foils. So ladies and gentlemen make sure you try this place!!!

Thanks Vincent for my beautiful Ombré nails, I love it!! I am so impressed and amazed how beautiful my nails look.  Can't wait to show off my nails tomorrow at my niece's wedding. Vincent  is so talented and you can tell  he loves what what he's doing. I came there tonight, there were a lot of people in the shop because of the Holiday plus they're popular, but he took his time, pay attention to very detail and he makes sure they come out perfect. Niki is so sweet too, she suggested to me that to put some glitter to it (good idea). I love coming here! The atmosphere is friendly, and they even have complimentary drinks.

After years of passing by this unassuming business in my neighborhood, I finally tried it and can't believe I've been missing out! 

I was easily able to make a reservation for my group of 6 on a Sunday evening. The restaurant was not crowded at all on this particular night and they made sure to set a table for six prior to our arrival. The place itself is rather small, with a long bar running down one side and a row of tables along the opposite wall. There was a pretty narrow path between the two. This did make it a bit squishy for those of us with our backs to the people at the bar and awkward for others to walk in between. 

Our server was very friendly and helpful with the eclectic menu. We opted to eat family style, with food delivered as it was prepared. We started with the korean fried chicken, one spicy and one soy garlic. These are essentially amazing chicken wings. I say go for the spicy - it was super flavorful and not all that spicy. My personal favorite were the short rib ho-ppang. The buns were fresh and delicious and the pork was seasoned absolutely perfectly. We then had the beef dolsot bibimbap - ours was not served sizzling as described, but was very tasty all the same. Finally, we had the japchae which was probably my second favorite. 

Overall, this was a great group experience. We loved the food and option to eat family style. I'll definitely return for more of those pork buns and other deliciousness in the future!
Food is always good and drink specials are decent! Place can get very busy but worth the wait.
Awesome local produce and meats with a small but strong daily menu of specials and wonder drinks. Stop by for some unique simple foods, but be prepared to wait unless you come during off hours.

We did not have a good experience.  We arrived at 5.00pm when it was very slow. We were seated quickly and were offered our drinks and our order was  taken.  We both ordered a steak and had it delivered to our table in good time.  That's where things went south.  I cut into the edge of the steak and found it to be tough and overlooked. I then tried to cut into the centre and it took all my strength to cut through it.  My wife really could not cut through hers.  We called  a waiter over and he said he would let our server know. Five minutes later we still had our inedible food in front of us with no sign of our server or any indication that our concerns were going to be addressed. We had no choice but to walk out.

I have to admit, the food was good. However, the 1.5 hour wait for our food, on a slow night, completely ruined the experience. Sushi is meant to be quick, not an all night affair. So, while the food was good, it was not good enough to make up for the 90 minute delay.

I visited here a few weeks ago...and the pizza was perfection. I got a traditional pizza with vegan cheese and caramelized onions. Such a good combination. I would go back again and order the same thing. The only thing that I would complain about was the service. There was only one person on the front of house and serving. ​

This place done pissed me off on December 23 got fired for no reason i was the front manager i came in to work for the owner son and he could not take up for me when it wasn't even my fault all the shit i done for them and and this the shit i get so to my customers if they telling u anything different they lying if u wanna know what happened call my number its 6156018727 and ill tell u cause i know they telling all my regular customers some bull shit
Experienced girls, but sometimes a bit pushy. All pretty hot though. There's a bar next door though and they let me back in after getting a drink.
This place is amazing! Delicious mimosa's, food and pastries! Best place for breakfast in Tuscon, and you can join waitlist online! Try it, you won't be disappointed!

Only ordered there pizza but man is it salty and just plain. Lack of toppings doesn't help but the crust is cardboard. New to area I just want a good pizza but for anyone new to Port Richey area there's no such thing. 
Not good tasting and not good visually.

Terrible service and parts department!  OK, bad service one time, I give it as a fluke and pass it off.  Two times, and well they made good after a complaint to the service manager, so I hoped it too was a fluke.  But THREE times!!! That did it.  I drive a distance to service my car at Glanzmann because I bought it from them, and wanted to be loyal.  This last service call was a warranty repair.  So I have to wait 3 weeks after they order the part (and I'm told the part is in), to make sure I get a loaner car--waaayyy too long.  Ok though, I do, and book an appointment.  When I take the car in it should be ready the next day.  No one calls me with an update on the progress of the car, so I call them at the end of the 2nd day and they tell me it will be ready in a few hours.  Because I can't make it there before they close, I drive down the next morning to pick up the car.  Upon arrival they tell me they ordered the wrong part and I have to wait 6 more days till it gets here.  What a waste of time----I still have the loaner but would prefer my own car.  It would have been helpful it anyone would have called me BEFORE I drove down to get the car, which I was already told was completely repaired!!!  This is just the third mishap, the other two were not as drastic, but still a great inconvenience.  So you have to wonder if there is a serious gap in service and parts department management and communication.  Don't bring your car here, one hand doesn't know what the other is doing.

Lobby Bar looks great, was told at 10 minutes to 1pm the bar doesn't open till 1pm, the bar looked totally stocked and ready to serve, we then watched the bar tender play on their phone for the next several minutes while we sat and waited for it to open....

We didn't have reservations but were welcomed and waited less than 30 minutes. This place is the real deal. Wait staff was very friendly and not at all snooty, a place with this high level dining experience could really go that direction. Another review complained about the portion size, but ours was perfect, and every bite was over the top delicious. Beautiful dining room, professional staff, relaxed although classy atmosphere. Aahh. I had the drum with an exquisite sauce with shrimp and crab, my hubs had a beautiful airline breast of chicken. We both had the house salad. This is definitely food heaven.
Amazing wings and the best Philly cheesesteak west of Philadelphia!! This is a must try and you won't be disappointed. Don't let Geo scare you away! Lol

This is a very tasty spot for a casual meal with refined and nuanced flavors. On a recent visit, we had a few mezze - the celery salad was a major hit, and we always love the whipped feta! (The cooked radishes were a miss - too bitter even for we radish lovers!) We also had a huge grilled mushroom and a to-die-for plate of fried chicken thighs. 

One important issue: the back of the meal was very rushed. Looking back on it, that was partly our fault - we ordered everything at once. But I wish our server would have coached us about the pace of the food. We hadn't even received our initial glasses of wine when the first three items arrived at the table. And the bussers were incredibly eager to clear our table so they could bring the next two plates. Next time we go we will be more assertive about the pace we are seeking, and we will probably order the mezze first, take a pause, and then order our mains so we can be in better control of the timing. 

Otherwise, a very lovely meal.

The hotel had a prime location in a quiet section, only a 5 minute walk to canal street. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the breakfast was adequate. The selections during breakfast were limited, something unusual for Embassy Suites. The hotel itself seemed kinda old, however the hotel rooms were nice and had good space and better-than-average beds. We stayed here four nights and we will probably come back again.

I went to lunch with my fiancé today at burger up and our experience was phenomenal thanks to our server, Reid. He went above and beyond to make sure we had an exceptional experience. Our table was a little wobbly, so he immediately got a rubber piece to stick under the foot of the table. He constantly filled up our drinks (and we drink a lot- my fiancé even ordered two drinks, coke and sweet tea) and we had at least three refills for each drink!it was just the little things that made this lunch so amazing. Great food and even better service!!!!

Amazing! The chicken & dumplings were the best thing I've ever eaten. It was obviously made with care. Like out of your Mom's kitchen. The atmosphere was beautiful and staff was very knowledgeable. We will be back.

Fiorello's since your manager could not provide us with a satisfactory response I will ask you in a public forum.  My wife and I were just in the middle of the main course of our dinner, up until that point a pleasant meal with good service, when we were asked to move tables, since you had a reservation that needed the table apparently and they had "shown up early".  We literally picked up our own plates and had to move with no apology at all from your staff.  Only after we moved, when I asked our new waitress , a very nice person, whom the manager was I was informed by her it was the man whom had been taking care of our table but had since disappeared after we were forced to move and had made no attempt to remedy this situation. When he finally came over after I specifically asked, I asked if this was representative of the treatment your restaurant provides their customers, embarrassingly asking them to move tables with other patrons staring and wondering what is happening.  I was provided neither a satisfactory answer nor any apology or attempt to remedy this.  I left my half eaten meal on the table as I was disgusted at this point.  So again I ask you is this the way your company treats customers?  Being busy and having reservations is not an excuse for unacceptable practice.  I hope all that view your site for restaurant recommendations read the above and your response or if none lack of before patronizing

Whenever something happens to one of our expensive apple electronics we ship them straight to these guys because they always have the right equipment and a fast turnaround time. Also, very affordable and professional to deal with. Couldn't ask for a smoother transition.

Yes, it's out of the way. Yes, it's small and somewhat chaotic. But, it's probably the best cheesesteak you'll get anywhere. After trying the tourist traps + Dalessandros etc, I decided to venture out to try John's today and was not disappointed. The cheesesteak came hot off the grill in a seeded roll. There is covered seating outside, but definitely bring a jacket. They take credit cards with a $5 minimum and there's an ATM inside.
Stopped by on a late Sunday night and grabbed the last two seats at the bar.  Split the Maurizio and the Salsiccia pies - both were really tasty.  Service was great.  Would return for sure.

Stopped in earlier today around 4 and the place was dead. Sat at the bar and sampled a few of the beers on tap. They had a great selection and settled on the Paul's Pilsner. They had board games which was a nice addition. The restaurant area is huge and would be a great place to visit on a Friday or Saturday when busier.
Swedish reindeer meatballs and gravy? Fried taters and reconstituted powdered scrambled eggs? Free senior coffee with a view of SLU? Try IKEA $1 breakfast!

Went in here on a Friday night recently to get a quick clean up cut before a networking party that night... the only guy in there, whose name I can't remember, cut my hair. I was in a rush and paid after the cut TRUSTING that if it looked bad, something would be said. Stopped at home to changed and style my hair then noticed the botched cut he gave me. He literally went half way up on the sides with clippers then blended nothing in. It just stuck out like he barely touched it. I spent over 30$ on this cut only to have to go to another barber to get it fixed. 
I will never give business to Regis or any other big chain again. I knew I shouldn't have went in the first place but come on, the notch cut was very noticeable and nothing was said. What a joke.
Great rooms, great fun. They have private rooms. Lots of great songs to choose from. I don't think there is any other place in Edmonton that has private rooms I hope they never close this place down.

I've heard lots of great things about this place and finally got a chance to try it out the other day.  The atmosphere is very casual with open seating and an open view of the kitchen. The menu has nice options that aren't the usual pizza fare. We ended up going for the Trentino, and the big version as we both wanted the same thing.  

The pizzas are thin crust but not too thin they are crunchy. The whole flavor of the pie was delicious. The pork speck and balsamic was such a great combo! My brother honestly wanted the whole thing to himself! We really enjoyed the casual atmosphere and even made some new friends with the family seated next to us. 

The staff was superb from the moment we arrived. Greeted with a smile and our waitress was funny and spot on with timing and her suggestions for beers.  It's a great place for a casual but and a great place for a date too since the food is so good you'll want to make it a tradition!

Wow! The food here is EXCELLENT! My husband and I had the buffet today (22 items since it was New Year's Eve) and everything was delicious. My favorite was the goat curry. Loads of meat with very little bone in a luscious sauce. There were several different kinds of chicken all very good, vegetables, plain rice, chicken biryani, soup, appetizers, salad, chutneys, desserts, mango juice, and masala tea all for $10.99. Can't beat that price anywhere! Before you sit down you are asked what kind of naan you would like to have and then it is brought to you in a basket. Water is constantly replenished. The food is piping hot at the buffet. Service is quite attentive. It is a small place, but homey and quiet. A friend who is a chef highly recommended this place. We finally have a new Indian restaurant to go to and I cannot wait to return for another meal.

Had lunch with 7 co-workers at Burger Study today - a variety of burgers, salads, etc.  Great food, great service!  The BYOB (build your own burger) option was especially praised by those who ordered it.  I had the Espanol - great guacamole!  Sampled the fries, onion rings, tots - all were tasty.  Will definitely be back!

Tremblay Financial Services helped my family member with a time-sensitive retirement account issue. They were thorough in explaining options and in reducing the number of steps he had to take to complete the transaction. We are happy to have them on our side.

This is a wonderful style steakhouse that also offers fantastic seafood my wife treated me to go here for my birthday I had a delicious prime rib and she really enjoyed her crab Imperial fantastic service very elegant atmosphere probably recommend
Probably the worst cioppino I have ever had in my life. So disappointing that I paid $16 for it

While the food selections at this location are inferior to Las Vegas and San Francisco, I'm still grateful this lounge has debuted in PHL. Fantastic bar selection. And the wide and high back chairs are NOT exclusively reserved for fat assed and big headed black card members. Try sitting in those seats in the Seattle location and you'll find yourself on the receiving end of a prosthetic you know what from the lounge dragons.
A perfect taste of India fast food and cheaper than other local chains. I tried vadapau, dabeli, tea, 7 thalli, cut mirchi, etc everything was at a satisfying point the only vote for no is Khaman

I'm not sure what happened to this restaurant , they were awesome;  but the doors are closed and a sign in the window just says CLOSED so its too bad. You finally find a place with fresh food, and reasonable prices and they close, its hard to keep afloat with the bullshit prices these plazas charge for rent!!  They would rather lose months or a years worth of rent rather than lower their leases!!! Idiots
Really good Brunch, but comes with long waits. You have to use the No Wait App to avoid. Get the Avocado Toast and the French Toast, actually all their toasts are good :)

Love this place! Lived in Mexico City for two years and for me this is the most authentic Mexican restaurant in the south Tampa area. Unrivaled guacamole, and the tequila flights are well worth the $15. The ambience is beautiful too, especially outside by the fountain under the twinkly lights. Our server Andy was exceptional and made the experience even more outstanding! Will continue to frequent this as my go-to Mexican spot.

I almost don't want to add this as it might make it harder to get an appointment. I've been having Anne cut my hair for over 10 years even before she moved to this location and then bought it. She always gives me a good haircut, takes her time and has never asked for a tip like one person reported here. Not Asian and have never had anyone else cut my hair.

We haven't been in St Pete very long and are constantly on the lookout for cute places with fresh seafood. (Why else live at the beach?)

Several people have mentioned Shells so we headed over to check it out.

Cute place, small parking lot behind with street parking all around. I'm guessing during season lots of people are within walking distance.

We were welcomed even before we got to the door as one of the ream was helping a disabled woman out the front door. (HUGE BONUS POINTS). Hosts welcomed us again and seated us quickly.

We were seated in the bar area to the right... initially the bartender was a little (OK, A lot) loud; but I think our server said something. Seems there was a large group in the main dining room which is why we and several other tables we seated in the bar.

Our server was awesome, welcomed us, got soft drinks, told us about happy hour drinks and as it turns out our Yelp checkin got me a margarita!

The walls have chalkboard paint with cute quotes and specials - we ordered the Fried Calamari ($7.99) while we checked out the menu.
