The basket of Fried Calamari was good sized, crispy and flavorful; just enough for two of us to share... the "spicy Diablo sauce" didn't have much of a kick.

My husband went with the Jambalaya ($12.99) a big bowl of blackened chicken, shrimp and Andouille sausage with peppers, onions, rice in a creole sauce... the position was a great size, plenty of chicken, shrimp and sausage... not as spicy as he would have liked (we do like spicy)... but our server quickly brought him hot sauce.

I went for the Seafood Cioppino over linguini ( their special that night and out servers recommendation). It was a big bowl with a good sized portion of pasta, a TON of seafood for the price (I think it was $15.99) clams, mussels, fish, bay scallops and shrimp with chunks of tomato is a garlicky broth. I was really impressed with the amount of seafood and the flavor. It also came with two nice chunks of garlic bread.... which as great to sop up the last of the amazing broth!

We didn't have any room for dessert... but will next time!

Happy hour specials, wonderful service, fresh seafood and really reasonably priced for the quality and amount of food. 

WE will absolutely be back; there's LOTS on the menu we want to try.

The server Morgan was fabulous and knowledgeable and the chef Twin made the most amazing crab cakes! Just the right amount of crispy. They were seriously the best crab cakes we've ever had anywhere on the planet Plus the music was amazing.

We used this company to tour the French Quarter and the Garden District. Both tour guides were very interesting and answered any questions you have. They also recommend restaurants in the city and during the tour, include fun facts and the Garden District tour guide points out the houses of celebs(Manning, Bullock..)

I had high hopes from the reviews but the salmon croque was just mush from all the grease and I found mold in my mixed greens :-(
I'll have to come back and try the pastries because the lunch items were just disappointing 
(the salmon the time wasn't bad though)

Coming from the other escape room in Tucson we were disappointed in this experience.  Our game master was misleading to the point we would have been much better off without her (ie giving hints that turned out to have nothing to do with the game);  not to mention she was texting during our entire time.  Some of the clues themselves were ambiguous and just illogical. I just feel this room (which was very small) doesn't have the value or ingenuity of other escape companies we have experienced.

Yelp does it again. In Nashville for work and I brought my aunt along because it's her birthday. All she really wanted was a strawberry margarita. Searched yelp for recommendations and came across this place. The food here is soooo good. We both had the Del Mar entrees-she the quesadilla me the enchiladas. Very good choices. Real crabmeat, shrimp and lobster. Yummy! We also had the house quac which our server mentioned is made by the chef himself constantly throughout the day. It was awesome!! I highly recommend this place if you find yourself in the Nashville area.
Great food, love all their options! Just don't expect a quick in-and-out during lunchtime rush. This location is particularly busy around noon.

From the layout to the lighting to the delightful and hospitable hostesses to our knowledgable and friendly waiter David, all the non-food-based categories get five stars at Parc.  On top of that, the dining is equally memorable. 

Our entrees, the salmon and trout amandine, were perfectly cooked and proportioned, and were bookended by savory and sweet showstoppers: the mushroom tart and a Bouche Noel that was was absurdly ethereal-- like a master class in mouth mindfulness.  It was a top five meal, to be sure.

Thanks to everyone at Parc for a spectacular night.

Only way it would have been better is if you paid for our $36 parking ticket! (But I guess that's on us)

stopped in here the other day and tried some of the sushi and some of the chinese food. i have to say both were really good ! the chinese i ordered was just a basic shrimp & asparagus dish but it was super tasty. the place has a good vibe and the waitress was nice. i'll be back for sure.

First stop in Nashville! As a vegetarian, not the easiest to navigate, but several options. The pimento Mac and cheese and black eyed peas salad were fine. LOVED the banana pudding! My husband got the hot chicken tenders and was surprised by how spicy they were. He liked the potato salad and Mac and cheese too. Waitress was so nice and told me the potato salad had pork in it--person who took my order did not realize that. We got there at noon on a Saturday and waited about 30 minutes which wasn't so bad! About 10-15 more minutes to get the food. Line got a lot longer when we left. Seems like a must-do in Nashville and recommend to try!

It's a nice place. Parking is a pain. Drinks were good and the food was just ok. We had our work holiday party there. They were more interested in making the party starting after us happy. They just off our bowling lanes 40 minutes before our time was up and when we said something we just got a phony sorry. All this after they had us change the day and time.

Very good.... my daughter loved the food and thought the staff was very nice.  The owner or manager was at the table several times and delivered our food.  The seafood ravioli was excellent and so was the fresh tomato and basil sauce.  It was authentic and well done.  (Italians in the restaurant business- so not easily impressed)
Great Memphis style Barbecue. Babybacks, pulled pork, pulled chicken and macaroni and cheese were big hits.
My favorite new nail spots in Old city. Always, clean and one the best gel manicures I've have had.

This is one of the nicer and cleaner McDonalds I have been to!  They even had a couple of touch screens that allow you to order and skip the normal line.   The bathrooms and seating area is clean.  They also still have hazelnut iced coffee, which some locations have discontinued!  The only thing is that the cinnamelts we ordered for breakfast were kind of dry and not very warm. :(
Crazy busy during lunch time, but with good reasoning! Best authentic Mexican food in tucson!!

Went to v street on a Thursday night for a 'light dinner' ended up eating way too much.

It's a tiny little restaurant and very busy so reservation is a good idea. There is a happy hour menu that applies to bar or window sections. 

Our greeter and server were both awesome. They are attentive and quick to respond. 

The food choices were interesting. We ordered the Peruvian fries, Brussels sprout salad, tempeh taco, and cauliflower taco. Everything was really good. I've never had such good vegan food!

I couldn't say more good things about v street. My experience was great and can't wait to go back in the near future!

Had an amazing time at V street today! Had no idea Vegan food can be so so tasty! We had a 7pm reservation but the previous guests took longer than anticipated. We had to wait for 20 or so minutes but it was no trouble, we sat at the bar counter and chatted away. The staff was so courteous and really apologetic because we had to wait. We got the desserts on the house, which they really did not have to do but we really appreciated it. They also gave up a complimentary appetizer. The Dan dan noodles are fabulous and spicy (careful if you don't like spicy food). We also got the Mee goreng which was delicious. The Harissa grilled tofu tacos were so tasty as well. We got the Rose Lemonade and Imli Soda which were great, a bit on the sweeter side though. The soft serve of the day was really good. All in all, the place is great, good food , ambience and excellent staff.

It saddens me to give this restaurant 2 stars. This was one of our favorite restaurant to go to. I have celiac disease and this restaurant was always over the top accommodating which is why we kept going back. Last night I found out they no longer offer gluten free pasta and the waiter told me the chef would not do any special orders to accommodate. The majority of restaurants are moving forward to help their diners with dietary restrictions while this place seems to be the complete opposite.
Excellent nachos! Bloody Mary's are just as great. Awesome location and perfect to catch a game on the TV or to grab some drinks with friends.

Went for the puddin' so my review is narrowly-focused, this time around...

Prior reviewer mentioned Magnolia's in The Village (as in NYC). I have to agree, at least banana puddingwise, yes comparable. Magnolia's makes ice box cake, which we didn't see at Sweet Life, and I LOVE ice box cake... but I am also a Phulph'n, and Magnolia's ain't worth 2 hours on the Chinatown bus for pudding, when I can get some BETTER options here on South Street.

Unlike Magnolia's, Sweet Life has a variety of pudding flavors: peaches-n-cream, banana, banana caramel, salted caramel, no-nana, "magic" (like a Snickers bar), etc. And Sweet Life adds cake at the bottom, which I do not remember being in Magnolia's cups (just wafers). Bakery cake, all saturated with the pudding to make it thicker, was a really nice twist to America's idea of Jello snack cups.

Also got the potato pie, which was sweet, and spicey, and savory too. Very good!

Can't wait to try more next time!

My fiancé and I were brewery hopping in the area and decided to stop into the Raven to try the craft beer. At first the host wouldn't seat us when the restaurant area was almost empty. We were confused and finally Chase (a server) came over and said he would take care of us. I am so glad because we were going to leave. He gave us some of the best service I've had in a long time. Very knowledgeable and friendly. The food was amazing, I got the Ruben and fries my fiancé got the burger and salad. The Ruben was so hot I couldn't even eat it for a few torturous minutes. The fries were delicious and crispy, the corned beef was so freaking fresh it was ridiculous! My fiancé's burger was amazing and fresh as well! The beers were super good too! 
All I can say is that management needs to handle things better because if Chase hadn't stepped in and made sure we were seated we would never have had an amazing experience here and discovered this gem. We will definitely be back when we are in the area to try more wonderful food!

We were traveling through town and Soup Kettle Grill came up as Gluten-Free.... not only do they have GF bread, the soups are also ALL Gluten-Free, even the Lobster Bisque we had! Great taste and fresh made food! Thank you!

Was in New Orleans for Saints game. Heard about this place for a great breakfast. Went 2 mornings. Outstanding!  Had baked breakfast sandwich and it was fabulous. Pancakes with eggs day 2. Best pancakes I have had. 
Highly recommend

Soups were freshly made and I especially loved the tomato basil soup where the basil flavor really hits you. I'm eating the blueberry lemon scone now and I love how it's not too overly sweet and you can really taste the blueberry in it. Owner also personally came out to greet and talk to us while we were there which we appreciated. Could feel some Sunday morning vibes. Great place for brunch and lunch and I will definitely come back!

This place is amazing.  They have an outstanding atmosphere and their food is the best in the area.  At The waitresses request I tried the Tuscan gravy w short ribs.  It was like a culinary moment.   I can not recommend this cool new place enough    .

It was almost midnight on a Tuesday and we had just returned home from a full 13 hour day of traveling; we were hungry and tired. Instead of opting to go to a sit down place we decided to drive thru Steak n Shake. It had been forever since we had been to one so looking at the menu was something we had to do. I was hoping to get a chicken melt, but I didn't see that on the menu. Instead, they had a grilled chicken sandwich and that seemed to be the only chicken sandwich I saw, so I ordered it. My husband just wanted to order a burger with fries. There was a car in front of us so we didn't think much of it. We placed our order and were told to pull around to the window to pay. The car in front of us was still waiting so that's exactly what we did too. It took about 10 minutes for the car in front of us to get their meal and then we pulled up to pay. Once we paid we waited for about 6-7 minutes before our food was ready. I guess it's a good thing they cook our food to order, but that was a long time to wait IMO. We were handed our bag (we double checked it for accuracy) with drinks and were on our way.

Super friendly staff, very quick service, and the massaman curry was great. This is a great place if you're looking for inexpensive, quick, tasty Thai food. Recently moved to the area and have only been once but will definitely go back here.

Foods are excellent and service is above standard. 
We ordered two sandwiches for the lunch- oyster po boy and DLT- both were great! 
The only thing that I can complain is the speed for the food to be prepped- it's a little longer than we have expected.
Overall, great place to grab a quick bite if you are around and are craving for good fusion food.

We live on Cape Cod, and obviously know very well what good New England seafood is.  A local tipster told us of this place and that they serve fresh Ipswich Clams (those, if you are not familiar with, are tops!) ... so we were happy to find good home seafood in Florida.

I got the fried clams, and wife got the lobstah roll.  Well, based on all the great reviews I am reading here, we must have caught a really bad day.  The service, and our server, were good.  The food was not!  We live on fried clams and lobstah back home, and I've never had such chewy clams.  Actually took 3 of them out of my mouth to throw away.  My wife's lobstah roll was tasty, but much chewier than it should have been ... maybe overcooked a little.

So, we left disappointed in our $50+ lunch (more than we spend back home, but afterall they have to have it shipped here).  I guess by all the great reviews they are getting you might want to give them a try.  We will look elsewhere!

My husband & I came here last night for a work Christmas party.  We had a fixed menu.  Chips and salsa ( nothing fancy), guac ( husband said it had no flavor except lime).  We ordered the filets.  Best Filet I've ever had.  But that was the only positive of the restaurant.  I wanted to plan another trip to try things on the menu ...but the service was horrendous!!!  We were given wrong drink orders, or waited 20+ minutes for the correct one.  Once the food came our waiter (Jeffrey) never waited on us again.  All our waters were empty from when we received our food until desert FINALLY came.  Great steak but extremely disappointed in the lack of service from our waiter.  It was too bad because we did want to visit again, and now we will take our business elsewhere.  For a several hundred dollars tab, we should have had superb service, not an annoyed waiter.  2 stars because of the horrible service.

We have stayed here many, many times. I have thoroughly enjoyed each & every stay. On this trip (celebrating my 40th) I somehow forgot to pack my conditioner, curly hair ladies know how tragic this is. . . . I sent a text to house keeping (yes, that's an option) & left a note requesting extra conditioner be left, hoping & praying for 2-3. I was thrilled to return to my room and find an assortment of products & 7, yes 7 conditioners waiting. Yessss. She (Maria Madena) literally saved my life (and trip) because this hair cannot be tamed without extra conditioner ! ! ! Thank you Peppermil, for a fantastic room, stay & impeccable service (as always).

Sprig & Vine is a great vegan restaurant to try even if you're not vegetarian or vegan! I absolutely love vegan food, so I was really excited to go with my vegetarian friend. We ordered broccoli rabe, and oyster mushroom, spinach, and root stir fry to start. Both were very good. We also ordered BBQ tempeh sandwich and oyster mushroom po'boy. We were both really excited about the po'boy, but it was actually lacking in flavor. It wasn't as good as we expected, so we were pretty disappointed. However, the BBQ tempeh sandwich was out of this world! So delicious and flavorful. Sometimes tempeh can be too chewy or crumbly, the texture was perfect and crispy. It was amazing.

Great location. Staff very friendly. I wish I could remember the name of the young man who took my order. He had red hair and was outgoing and had a nice friendly smile. Lauren prepared my drink and it was yummy! I hate seeing the reviews complaining about the clientele, It was a beautiful day and I sat outside with a homeless man. Instead of complaining sit down and engage.

I chose this as my regular vet, and I have been so glad that I did! Everyone at this clinic is friendly, helpful, and so great with my dog! He genuinely gets excited to go to the vet because of this. Every issue I've had with him has been treated conservatively, and has been affordable. The place is spotless as well, and they have a great waiting area with coffee and tea. Best part is, they are open 24/7 for any emergencies!

I absolutely love this salon! Finding the right hair stylist is more difficult than dating, and  I had several haircuts around town before finding this gem. 

The staff is friendly and welcoming, offering a smile and refreshments. The atmosphere is bright, modern, clean, and comfortable. And Natalia is amazing!! She is always able to give me the cut and style I'm looking for and is the most friendly and personable stylist I've met!
Solid, fresh, authentic food.  We had two great dishes and will return.  Unexpected find in our area.

Met the owner through an Audi online forum back probably 10 years ago regarding an issue with an 2001.  Went back later for another issue where he installed a new part that didn't fix the issue and he never charged me.  Later he called and said he had an idea so I came back and it was fixed.

I've been bringing my 2009 A8 to him since I got it in 2013 and they take real good care of me.  Glad I found them.

Inspections, Oil changes, Brakes and all the little stuff.  On the 2001 battery and timing belt.  They do it all.

We've driven by here several times crossing the waterway and outdoor seating on the water is always a huge plus for us.

My husband found a Groupon for Salty Rim and thought it was a great opportunity to give them a try.

I originally thought the parking area on the water was there space and quickly learned it was a watercraft storage and launch and that they share the lot on the other side of the building (with the Italian restaurant, bar and a few small shops); on a Friday night, it was pretty crowded and hard to find a space.

Once we found a space we made our way between the buildings to the entrance, met the hostess and were seated. The inside seating was completely empty with about 8 people at the bar.

The inside is really cute with a nautical feel and the mixed wood on the walls adds a really interesting (in a good way) look to the space.

We opted to sit outside - it was 60 degrees out and they had plastic tarps above the fence to block the wind and several propane space heaters near guest tables.

There were about three other tables outside and another 8-10 people at the outside bar. (not nearly as crowded as the other places we've passes in St Pete Beach and I'm still not sure why. 

They had a guy playing guitar and singing outside, who was actually very good, and I'm sure he froze his butt off. The heater near our table did the trick and kept us comfortable during dinner. The only turnoff to outside dining was that people were allowed to smoke at the outside bar with the smoke blowing over to the dining tables.

Our server approached the table, offered drinks, took our order and split... when she NO, so we ordered.

My husband ordered the Fish and Chips and I ordered a small house salad with balsamic vinaigrette and the Drunken Mussels. She did ask if I preferred the salad first.

Our server refilled our soft drinks (diet Coke and iced tea - $2.49) and told us food would be out shortly. In a few minutes, she returned with all of our food; pretty quickly, but then again it was really quiet. 

My husband's Fish and Chips ($14.00) was a BIG piece of cod, the batter was light, crispy and not too tick; the menu says it's a Jamaican ginger beer, but the flavor was really faint. It came with a nice pile of crispy fries and blueberry cole slaw. The blueberry cole slaw was a small cup of regular, creamy cole slaw with about four blue berries on top; nothing unique.

My Drunken Mussels ($12.00) were a pretty big portion (its listed as an appetizer) with a really nice garlicky tomato broth - the ONLY drawback to this dish was that it is listed as coming with garlic toast points; it actually came with two, tiny, thin, crispy slices of baguette. The really delicious broth left in the bowl really needs a big hunk of bread to sop it up.

The small House Salad ($4.00) was HUGE, mixed greens, wedges of tomato, sliced cucumber, onion and some croutons. The balsamic vinaigrette dressing had a great flavor.

Our server checked in brought our check, applied the Groupon and disappeared. She was sweet; but I'm kind of old school I want to know your name, suggest a cocktail or appetizer (even to share), suggest SOMETHING. If it's this slow I can't imagine not taking the time to increase the check.

To that end, the oddest part of dinner was the check - at the bottom, like many places there are 'suggest tips'. Most places list 15%, 18% and 20% calculations. This bill listed "Average", "Great" and "Super!", the odd part was that the calculations were 15%, 20% and 25%... I'd like to think that the average tip for their servers as closer to 20%, but at least 18%!

We're likely to give it another chance as the food was pretty good, the portions were really great for the price and there are some things there I'd still like to try.

Although sometimes this place can be dead, it shouldn't be. This place has quality food full of tantalizing taste. My girlfriend and I both ordered the Spiced honey roasted squash, kale, queso, pepita, and salsa verde. One will leave your belly happy and two, maybe 3, will leave your belly full. Hope this place survives the Santa Barbara rent!

Saji is wonderful & very reasonably priced. I bought this adorable romper from Sierra Belle, but the straps were a bit too big and kept sliding off. She was able to alter my romper perfectly & it fits comfortably! I highly recommend and plan to have her as my go to alter queen!
Excellent Chinese, Japanese, sushi and pad Thai. Very clean facility, good service. This will be a regular go to place for us.

While staying at the Hotel Monaco for a wedding, we came to the Red Owl Tavern for drinks on both Friday and Saturday night, and brunch on Sunday. The place was packed all three times. It is definitely the after party spot for all the wedding guests staying in block rooms. Given the crowds and the bar otherwise being nothing special, I would avoid as a late night destination except for convenience if you're staying in the hotel. I also had some strange experiences with the servers and bartenders at night. They ran out of clean glasses   and we had to wait for our drinks. Not a problem, except when they finally brought them they did so without the water my friend requested. She asked again and they responded that there were no clean glasses...while making another alcoholic drink in one. They were clearly prioritizing the paid drinks but it was obvious and rude. They also said told us they couldn't communicate with the kitchen and serve food which also seemed odd. 

Brunch was decent. I had a chicken and waffles special that was nicely spiced. Reservations are highly recommended.

HORRIBEL / DISGUSTING/ FILTHY / 
Ripped towels 
Piss stains on the sheets asked for new ones and she couldn't even bring them up to the room I had to go back down stairs to get them! TV wasn't working called front desk for them to come fix it said "be right up " never came up ! I wouldn't recommend anybody to stay here the price is ridiculous for the piece of crap you stay in rather sleep in my clean car.

We visited Pho 79 because we're close to Garden City and Pho Bac was closed.
I wish I could say I've found a great pho place, unfortunately it's not the case. The noodles are steak were fine, but the broth was not. They use too much anise, so there's a heavy black licorice flavor. And they char the white onion before adding it to the soup, which at first intrigued me, but ultimately added a strange burnt flavor.
I won't be returning.

Was concerned with all the negative reviews but also saw some food ones, so the wife and I decided to give it a go. Really glad we Did! Food was excellent and the service was top notch! Wife had the chicken rice bowl and loved it. Really liked the egg rolls, so fresh! I had the flank soup bowl and it was EXCELLENT. We will for sure be back often.
Buy your tickets online in advance! We were turned away this weekend due to it being sold out for the evening 10 minutes after the gates opened.

Food: 4/5 

Ordered: Lagos Brunch Bun and Waffles
- Portion sizes are NOT consistent throughout dishes.
- Lagos Brunch Bun was filling and flavorful. A good blend of tart and sweet flavors, which can be hard to balance. 
- Each waffle had their own dressing which was great. You aren't forced to mix the two flavors if you don't want to, I chose not to. 
- The sesame butter on the waffles had a lot of texture, which Puja doesn't like, but I don't mind. 

Ordered: Po-boy Tacos
-Average flavor. 

-Bloody Mary was spicy.

Service: 3/5
- Nothing exceptional, service was average. 
- When it was busy, you could tell the hostess was stressed. Definitely rubbed off as we entered. 

Ambiance: 3/5 
-Semi-casual for brunch and dinner.
-It's a really small space so be ready to be bumping elbows with people as you eat. 

Would we go back? Yes. (Go for the items that are not a safe choice).

My friend invited me here for dinner knowing I hadn't ever been to a pho restaurant before. It was a good experience and I would gladly eat here again. The service was very quick even for a packed Friday night. The portions were generous. We split calamari and spring rolls as our appetizers and ordered separate spicy beef noodle soups, all very delicious. The Vietnamese coffee is a must! It basically a black hole in a cup. Think Turkish coffee to the power of ten, which if that's not how you take your coffee, you can get it with sweetened condensed milk. Being my first experience I can't really say wether it was overpriced or cheap as far pho restaurants go. It is a very open dining room which wasn't very conducive for conversation. As we ate and talked I could hear the nearby tables conversations as well which was distracting. The restrooms were clean, but average and they were out of paper towels. There's plenty of parking out front, but the place can be a little difficult to find because they have a small sign out front.
Its fun and there are alot of things to do from karaoke to arcade, bowling, cornhole, etc. However, it's pretty crowded and the games are first come first serve so...

My first time and what an amazing treat. The empanadas were amazing and I ordered the pork tenderloin which was cooked to perfection. I also had the carriage house margarita which was yummy. Everything was wonderful including our very helpful and knowledgeable server Miriam! I will definitely be back

Two stars for the lunch time bento box. While you get tons of decent food, it is not what I expected. When I order a bento box, I want a cute compartmentalized box. Instead, the food comes out on a large plate with a handful of items such as miso soup, salad, california roll, some vegetables, and some dumplings. I got the Chicken Katsu (fried) over rice for my bento box entree, and it wasn't even crispy.
Do yourself a favor and eat here. Delicious fresh and healthy. The owners are awesome . I always get the Venezuelan arepas so yummy

I am a really big fan of this place.

Their food is pretty good and the beer is great.

I love the atmosphere. Its a great place to watch a game or just relax with a flight and play shuffleboard. 

Barrio is a must try on the Tucson beer circuit.

First time dinning this restaurant, have had carry out once before just last week......The carryout was so fresh and delicious we had to come in for a second round tonight. I was a bit apprehensive to come as it was a bit late 7:45 or so but hey we were very hungry and this was the place we had decided to dine. The place has clothe table covers and I am a fan....it just dresses the place up! When we arrived the folks directed us to pick any table (I am told this a family ran and worked restaurant)....a lady followed us as we picked a table and she wiped it down although it was very clean. Our server was very knowledgeable and friendly, he kept our glasses full while we waited for our meals. ...be prepared to wait a bit for the food as it is fresh and yummy, which makes the waiting worth it!!!  We had ...well see the photos and you will see that is was all good!!!
Fajitas were really good except they didn't slice the veggies small enough to fit in the puny tortillas. Otherwise, really good

I could not be happier with the help and service I received from Mark at JB Factory Flooring.  I explained our situation; We needed flooring installed in a vacation condo and would not be in town for weeks.  We needed the flooring so we could use our bedrooms and set up furniture.  Mark was excellent -- he came right over to the condo, reviewed the situation, made recommendations, and gave us an estimate.  I trusted him with the keys!  And sure enough, he got the job done quickly, efficiently, and even came in under the original estimate.  Excellent service!  I had friends recommend JB's, and they had used them multiple times over the years and had been pleased.  I too am now a happy customer and would recommend them to anyone looking for a flooring company you can trust.

Rented a space to store some things for my business. It was so hot when I was unloading my boxes, but the manager Lauren saw and brought me water. That was very thoughtful and I was very appreciative. She has been very sweet each time I have stopped by. I've only had a good experience thus far.

The food was good. I had Pad Tai and it was dry. The rest of the food was very good. Especially the coconut chicken soup. 
Wish they delivered!

I have heard about Zen Thai from friends for a while and finally made my way there today.  I ordered the spicy basil at lunch with a friend and it was delish! You can pick your level of spicy from 1-5.  I went with a 4 and it was perfect, and SPICY!  I also ordered the eel, avocado roll and it was very good. 
Highly recommend you try this place out.  The variety, quality and service was great.  Hidden little gem.

The food is good but be warned. If you would like to have a conversation inside Timpano don't go for lunch on Sunday. A singer/guitarist was performing WAY TOO LOUD. We kindly asked (more than once) for the volume on the amps to be lowered. But they were not. Since we came to eat and talk with friends, and not attend a concert, we had to leave the place and find another nearby restaurant. In this case, we were very happy with the Wine Exchange and Bistro. Great food and quiet. If Timpano is a must, and you want to talk, make sure you get an outdoor table. The traffic won't be as loud as the singer.

Came here for brunch and wasn't disappointed. Plenty of options, even gluten-free. I had the vegetable buckwheat and egg crepe, which was delicious and hearty. They offer fresh squeezed juices, smoothies, and alcoholic breakfast beverages. 

The space is small but they fit a good amount of tables plus the dozen seats at the bar. Service is friendly. The kitchen is clean, which I saw from my seat at the bar.

I loved this pleasant little hole in the wall on Magazine St. I normally can't eat much at restaurants because of my food allergies but I was VERY pleased with Lilly's vegan pho. At my request they were happy to take out the noodles and add more veggies and mushrooms. I have to say, it is the most delicious pho I've ever tasted, and there was plenty of basil, bean sprouts, and jalapenos to add to the broth. I went back a second time before I left New Orleans. When I return I will definitely go to the garden district for another round.

Not bad, but not fab. If you need your food fast, you may want to try another place. Considering airport prices, it makes it hard to say I'm a fan. The roast beef sandwich had a hint of horseradish. It would have been nice have more of a kick. Don't be afraid to ask for more sauce if thats your thing. The gu.y serving was cool dude and had a bit of the pirate vibe going which works well with the theme. I took a long time for the food to arrive. One guy had to pack his food. 
Overall not a bad experience. Very convenient though.

I absolutely love iPho. I've been coming here quite a lot for their vegetarian pho, summer rolls and banh mi's. Every time I go the food is incredible. The tofu is crispy perfection and the banh mi's taste sooo, so good. Their vegetable broth is also amazing and I prefer their pho over anyone else's overall. On top of that, our servers are always very polite and accommodating!

Amazing poutine great atmosphere and great and nice staff. 

Was able to meet the chef and he was happy to meet us

Food is pretty good. Big fan of the chicken sandwich. Ask for a side of the hop hands mustard for the fries. Beer is always top notch. What I can't stand is the entitlement that exudes from the waitstaff. A bearded hipster with an attitude problem shouldn't be talking down to a paying customer. On top of that the noise levels are just too much. I get the idea of beer garden style layout with no walls or partitions but you have to draw a line somewhere. Besides the waitstaff being hit or miss and the noise. This place is still enjoyable

My family ate here last night. My daughter loved the avocado rolls; I loved the tofu and vegetable teriyaki. My wife loved the miso soup -- "flavorful," "hot," "inexpensive." It was the best tofu I've ever eaten. Soft, and smooth on the inside; crispy on the outside. Drizzled with delicious teriyaki sauce. We also enjoyed the Udon stir fry. We weren't sure about coming in, because it was empty, but we are so glad we did. After we ordered, another couple came in; they were regulars who greeted the server and the sushi chef by name. We plan to stop in Mount Laurel again, just to eat here again.
Ordered shirts from here, sizing was off and we orderd lots of shirts. They didn't help whatsoever with the size discrepancy. They were not very nice either.

This company is so over priced!! We called because our shower handle broke and we needed a new cartridge. They charged us $350 for a half hour worth of work and that was with $100 taken off because of the service contract. Then the repair man didn't even have the right knob for our faucet so he rigged something up so we could use the shower and told us he we get us the correct knob and drop it off the next day. The repair man told my husband he would drop it off and my husband could put it on. 4 days later we had to call the company and tell them we never got our correct knob. They did drop it off when we weren't home and now my husband still has to put it on.
We will never use this company again!!

Best service hands down. I came in on a busy Friday evening needing my flat tire evaluated. They managed to repair the tire and installed it with no charge.  When my car is due for tires I will definitely buy them here!

Ok now I know my reviews are going missing bc i could have sworn I wrote a review for Kendra Scott! Heck, it's my favorite jewelry store (sorry Pandora but I've moved on! Hehe).

I've come here so often that I recognize almost all of the sales ladies here! The most recent time was when my bestie, Mary Elizabeth and her sorority had a fundraiser here. So I bought her Christmas present and my own!

I love the fact that they are so philanthropic and help raise money for charities. One night I popped in and they were having another fundraiser for a non profit. They had snacks and drinks!

I love Kendra Scott's jewelry and appreciate that they have a great exchange policy if I change my mind. I have the abalone pearl, black, white druzy, and now purple druzy earrings and necklaces! What can i say, I'm addicted!

And the service here is impeccable! Just remember there is parking in the back! And in your birthday month you can get something for half off except for the fine jewelry (diamonds!).

Happy jewelry shopping!
Great place for good healthy eating. Been waiting for this kind of place for a while.  Cold pressed juices, smoothies and bowls.
I'm still seeing Dr. Aric and he still get's 5 stars! I go when I need to, he doesn't BS me and tell me I need to come in every week. He knows his stuff.

Over priced out dated beer selection.  Several of the beers I picked up were over 6 months old and many were over priced. It's packed with rude hipsters d-bags standing around in front of the coolers sampling beer. Talking to the inattentive miserable employees, who act irritated if you ask them a question. Parking is also atrocious. Better options out there

I'm new in town and need to find a top level barber so I turn to Yelp and find Barber's Club of Cherry Hill.  The shop itself is very clean and the staff was welcoming and kind. Based on other reviews I read, I asked for Ish and was not disappointed. I got a haircut and a beard trim and I can honestly say that neither has ever looked better. The reason I go to a place like Barber's Club is that I want a level of service above the "Great or Fantastic" chain shops. I got exactly that and more. If, like me, you want to look your best and don't mind paying a little (very little) more, then you have to check out Barber's Club of Cherry Hill. I will definitely be back.
Scheduled an appt for 3:45 on a Saturday.  Was not even acknowledged for 40 minuets despite being 5 minutes early.  Staff did not seem to care.

Stopped in for brunch around noon after calling to our our name on the waitlist. We waited about 20 mins before being seated inside. When the doors are shut it can get really loud so if you're looking for an intimate conversation over a meal, this isn't the place. 

I opted for the oyster Benedict which was full of flavor! Two poached eggs on the softest and fluffiest biscuits with creamed spinach and a spicy hollandaise sauce made this one of the best Benedict's I've ever had. On the side were a handful of perfectly fried oysters that gave some texture to the meal. I also ordered a side of fried green tomatoes that were crispy and paired well with the spicy dipping sauce. I'll definitely be back!

This was my first time trying Three Carrots and i was satisfied. I am vegan and typically i don't eat out much. This was a great way to break up my normal routine. I went on a Wednesday night, i had to park a block away. The walk would have been appreciated more if the winds weren't so terrible. 

I came with my best-friend and my son. The hostess originally  wanted to sit a 4 year old in a bar chair. I kindly let her know this wasn't appropriate - especially when there was a table available for us to sit comfortably. The restaurant was pretty bright, which i liked, i could easily see the menu. There wasn't a wide variety of beer or wine maybe 7 options combined. This wasn't an issue but I'm hoping soon they will pick up a contract with a local distillery. 

The food was ok. I loved the smothered seitan! But, the macaroni and  cheese needed a lot of help. I've been to other vegan restaurants in the past and noticed this same issue. It just doesn't compare.. it could be the milk they use or just the cheese substitute but it shouldn't be apart if the menu until perfected. The mashed potatoes were ok, they needed a little more seasoning but overall it was good.  The gravy taste great but looked very thick. 

Overall my experience was ok. I'll definitely go back and try different options! The only reason this review is a 4 and not a 3 is because i really want to see this restaurant be great! I know with time it has the potential to be amazing!
The best experience I could've asked for! The entire  team was very welcoming and so much fun. Highly suggest!!

Hugely inconvenienced w/ having to come back 3 times to get these letters ordered 2 days ago (and owner fully aware and involved in my service but didn't seem to have any regard for my time/trouble). Also, the N unfortunately isn't as lucky as the M.  All the other letters match in size/shape. I ordered them individually wrapped, but said I'd do myself since they weren't done.  $25.25 for 14.25 oz of chocolate letters that caused a lot of frustration on my part.
Tabby was a great waitress her service was second to none and the Manager Steve as well! Thanks

Everything here is always consistently really good!
The pizza is probably hands down best in this city. 
Tonight's special "chicken Pot Pie"! I've never had one this good before! It was Fantastic!
And lastly (the best for last) the owner and entire staff are great!
They are exactly as described, a discount outlet .  Great deals.  Fun place to look around.  They have a large selection of toys and books.

The service is great and everything taste so fresh and authentic. This is my favorite Mexican restaurant in Tampa. They give you so much food for a great price. All my friends have been put on to taco son. The food speaks for itself!

I would block off a good two hours of your schedule to come here. This book store has two floors packed (and by packed I mean be careful where you step this place might trigger your claustrophobia) with books. 

They have everything from popular brand new releases to titles no ones ever heard of. And as messy as the place looks when you walk in, everything is actually very well organized. They also have books in many languages. 

The second floor has plenty of small nooks for you to hide away and preview any books you will be purchasing. And the windows give a great view of the neighborhood. 

The also have a small section of music and record for sale available in a room upstairs. 

I can't wait to back here again on a free Saturday and load up with books to read all winter long.

The host is a real mean person.  THEY left out a part of our To Go order and we called them went go home.  Her attitudes sucked about fixing our problem. We paid for it and we wanted it. See call and go back up, again they were the problem not them.  I love their food but we will not go back. Lost a customer over rice

First time at Kabob House and we were so impressed. The service, food and atmosphere were all awesome. We got beef curry, sambosas and the combo kabob with lamb and chicken. Don't forget to order the bread!!! Everything was delicious. Absolutely try the Turkish coffee. Make the trip there if even just to try the coffee! We will be back!
We were there for a Holiday party.  The food was good and hot, and the service was good.  We were a party of about 40 and would recommend going back.
Hidden in the Washington Square Mall! Amazing curry noodle soup. Will definitely be back! Must try!

I stayed here for 3 nights during a conference in November. These are some things I liked about the place:
1. The cookies that they gave during check-in. Those were great and came in very handy the first night when I was craving a late-night snack and the following morning when I did not get the chance to get breakfast and simply had a cookie, along with coffee that I could make in the room.
2. While Wi-fi wasn't provided for free to everyone, the bar was set fairly low. All you had to do was to provide your Hilton Rewards number and you could have access to wi-fi for free. While this means that people who haven't signed up have to do so to get the free wifi, it is still infinitely better than having to pay $11.99 or however much it is that Sheraton or Marriott wants to charge me when I spend one night at their hotels.

Here are some things that were not so great about the place:
1. The poor quality of the sound-proofing: I was on the 23rd floor of the hotel and yet the road noise from below was enough to bother me on two of the nights that I stayed at the hotel. That is one of my biggest peeves about hotels - if they invest in sound proofing their rooms, they can help their guests get a better night's sleep but some choose not to invest in that consciously. I have stayed at hotels on the Las Vegas strip where in spite of all the ruckus going on below, the rooms themselves were practically noise-free.
2. The quality of the food: Overall, very unimpressive. We had two lunches at the conference catered by the hotel and they were not inspiring. One of the lunches was better than the other but in general, they were not great. On the last day of the conference, I also ordered room service and again, I was not happy with the taste of the food. I had sausages that were overcooked to the point of being burnt; the scrambled eggs I had were not fluffy or well-seasoned - all in all, not the kind of food that makes you either happy or excited.
I stayed here for the sole reason that the conference was happening here. Given a choice to freely pick across hotels, this wouldn't be my first choice in the area by a long shot.

This place doesn't even deserve 1 star. It smells like cat urine in there.  I went back a second time for redemption and it was just as bad. They like to do your manicure and pedicure at the same time, never have the gel colors in stock, don't know what an American gel manicure is and can't file a nail worth a damn.
Delicious coffee and food.  Breaded finger steaks are fantastic.  They are prepared in house and its taste reflects it. Highly recommend!

The food is actually a four star. But HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE.  Two of us Arrived at 6:10 yesterday for a 6:30 reservation. The third was looking for a parking spot. The maitre d would not seat us. We said we would like to get a cocktail at our table. He said absolutely not. There were three tables with customers. Kinda dead. He told us the bar upstairs is closed so go across the street and up the corner to a bar ralphs owns called Bar One.

Vaguely remember coming here when the bar went by a different name, but glad to see it now operating as a solid happy hour spot.  Decent discounts on drinks, and a fairly varied food menu for happy hour, too.  Was here on a Tuesday, and was impressed by the solid crowd that came in for trivia, as well.

Dont be offput by its location or awkward parking this spot is a gem. Coming from austin with quirky spots galore, this lounge stood out as a unique and friendly gem to grab a extremely strong drink for a darn good price. Bartender was very nice and explained every frozen flavor. Cash only was the only issue but thats nola for ya

They are working out the kinks - had an 8pm reservation and didn't get seated till after 8:30pm, which I'm totally fine with except that when we arrived they said it would only be a few moments. If you set my expectations, please meet them or let me know so I can happily wait in the bar. After we ordered they came back to let us know they were out of their signature Chicken ramen dish which was a bummer - again, expectations and disappointment. Otherwise, the food was very good especially the Fried Korean Chicken, cauliflower and steak appetizers. Ramen was solid as well, just give them time to get in their groove.
Decent restaurant with fairly good service and the wraps are fantastic. Bottomless fries and they're awesome too.

Verdict: It's not the original but it's not a bad alternative at the airport.

This place is located in the outskirts of the airport terminals, in what seems to have the local food offerings. You'll also find the Philadelphia Pretzel Factory right across the food court. The Tony Luke's here isn't cheap by any stretch but you'll pay the premium when in need of a Philly fix.

I loved going to the original Tony Luke's before they started popping up everywhere. They made a decent cheesesteak but you could get that in a lot of places in Philly. This place probably does a better job than most with their pork sandwiches.

Looking for that familiar flavor, I ordered the roast pork with broccoli rabe. There wasn't anything really on the lighter end but I did find and order the cooked spinach side dish. The sandwich was exactly what I expected and I enjoyed every bite. The spinach side was tiny and a bit salty but otherwise good.

Even though this terminal is at the far end, there's a shuttle that brings you right here from one of the more central locations. If you have the time and crave some more authentic local cuisine, this place might be worth the trip.

I went in on 12/19 to get me something to eat and I was stunned at how the owner sent his cashier home .. He was very rude and arrogant and this is not the 1st time I've seen him act this way he's a huge dick head and doesn't deserve to own or eun a business..How he treats his employees is ridiculous..I won't ever eat there again after that incident

I had an absolutely divine hamburger experience. Everything about it was delicious. Of particular note was the fried Honduran cheese and the sweet plantain that were included in the sandwich. 

The tamarind juice drink made me shake my head in amazement. I had no idea what I was doing with it at home. This was excellent, I wish I could reproduce it. 

This place will be my regular refueling spot after landing in New Orleans.

Well it was snowing and we needed somewhere close so we went here for dinner. I really want to like this place because it is close to home. We have been here before and we're kind of non committal as to wether it meets the mark.  We decided to sit and eat at the bar. The good---the drinks were adult poured and very good. The bad The menu is very lacking in small plates and apps. The bar space is not planned very well and not real comfortable. A little music please? Dull would be the word to describe the atmosphere and the food choices. 
We will come back in a pinch, but the Yardly Inn is much much better.

so happy to have this special nice fun place in the neighborhood. friendly faces and killer food. things are nice here and everything is good. i recommend eating the food and drinking what they have to drink.

I HAD THE BEST SERVER!!!! My server, Brandon, was absolutely fantastic!! So funny and kind, he got the food out super quick and was so polite! I'd give him tree extra stars if I could! I will definitely be back and will be requesting Brandon as my server again!!!!

Came in (first visit) on a busy Friday. Station was dirty, with nail clippings from prior customers and same paper towel from last person. One girl started my nails by giving me a tiny dish of cold water to soak my cuticles in, no soap. Without explanation, she disappeared and 10 minutes later someone else came over to continue. The technician took her tool box (which was not lined or clean) from working on someone next to me, did a quick douse with soap and water and began to use them on my hands. I asked her if that was the typical sanitation procedure, and she said yes. Very unsanitary, as they should be disinfecting and sanitizing. I gave two stars because the gel manicure itself looks fine, very typical. If you are concerned for hygiene, however, I do not recommend this place.

I've used the Nordstrom Group for a couple of years now to manage my rental and they have been great. My property manager Vanessa is super friendly and always on top of it. Some tenants can be a real hassle but it makes such a difference to have an experienced property manager helping.

Went on the 26th of December with family and the experience couldn't have been better. I had the chicken tenders while the rest of the family split what was a very large pie. The tenders and fries were good (our waitress was gracious enough to tell me that they had just come from the frier) but it was the pizza. Both the cheese only and pepperoni slices were great. Not only the pizza and chicken but the atmosphere. Everyone in there was hustling as it appeared to be busy. With that, our wait time was minimal and I will say it was a great way to get a break from the usual chain pizza stores. I would recommend East Coast Pizza to any of my Florida friends looking for a break from the "usual". Will return the next time I visit.
OVERRATED! This was not scary and a waste of time. Eastern State Penitentiary was much better. Don't waste your time or money here.
Best restaurant in NOLA metro area for the money. From the homemade salad dressing to the Italian dishes. Great inexpensive catering as well. Art Egan

Fun location in northern liberties, much bigger than we expected! Go when the weather is nice and the windows are open. We liked the wooden decor and outdoor seating area. Everyone was very accommodating and polite without seeming like automatons - they enjoy being there too! We were seated right away on a busy Friday night. We had the beer battered pickles as a starter - scrumptious! For pizza we had the kelly and the Rita - one unique and one classic pizza, both delicious! Another highlight are the beers brewed on site. You can get 2oz tasters of all their beers which is a fun way to find out what you like. My favorite was the nectar - light and crisp. My fiance's favorite was the Huntingdon, he got a full glass of it. Excellent service and we'll definitely be back!

Poor service. Went in for lunch and sat at the bar for 15 minutes and no service. They were all too busy congregating at their section enjoying their drinks and conversation.  Nah, I ain't giving away money today!

South Grand has many delicious good offerings; currently, my brother and I are trying as many as we can. This particular place was the next on our list. The restaurant was inviting but only a few tables were occupied on what should have been a busy Friday night. After dining there, my guess is because the service is not the best. It took a bit for someone to come over and take our drink order by the time they did, we were ready to order our food from an extensive menu. The menu has many great offerings for those who are vegetarian or love seafood along with other meat options as well. We tried the Shrimp spring rolls which were excellent. You get five of them for about $6 and it is the perfect amount for an appetizer. Our main meal arrived and it was delicious as well, though it was not quite enough to eat for my brother. He ordered one of the seafood items while I went for a vegetarian option. I ordered a Pad Sun Wen which was a perfect amount for me; I even took some home. The Thai iced tea is also delicious and was my favorite part of the whole trip. We never were asked if we wanted refills and the only time someone came by, was to drop off our food, drinks or the check. I did observe that this place seemed to do a lot of carry out and perhaps that is the way to go.

I have always loved Frost Gelato, but tonight there was truly something wrong with the gelato. I ordered my usual Gianduia-Chocolate with Hazelnut & it has never tasted like this before. My husband ordered a peanut butter and that was also not same flavor as before ( it had too much creme and not much peanut butter flavor, almost tasting like milk. My gelato tasted tart and something was off about it.   I had my husband taste my gelato as well as I tasted his and we both agreed there is something not right tonight.
So I went inside to tell the very young person behind the counter about how it tasted tart and not fresh. He turned and said to me, " well, we haven't changed the tray yet" Then he tells me that different Frost's locations sometimes have different colors/tastes and depends on "chef" who makes it & that it could taste different. I never heard anything like this before. This young "boy" offered me another one, but after his explanation I told him no longer interested and that I was throwing my gelato away in the garbage-and did so in front of him. He never said I will refund you.  He just watched me toss an entire cup away as did my husband. I did not care about the money but the fact he made excuses for something that was not right-is just wrong.
This is what happens to any good place turns into a Franchise. Any Pastry Chef will tell you making Desserts are like a science. Each measurement must be done right or it will never turn out the same. 
There must be a recipe they have to follow as well. 
Sorry Frost, I have supported you since you opened in Tucson but now, I will not eat Gelato in Tucson. 
I love gelato and fortunately I do travel, so I will have to wait to have my gelato when I return to Italy.

The Dan Dan Noodles delivered: perfectly textured noodles dunked in a spicy/sweet/savory chili oil. There's a tiny dollop of ground pork present.
Scallion Pancakes: fine. The dipping sauce is spicy oil. Naturally.
Thrice-fried chicken: tiny bite-sized spicy white-peppery nuggets lost in a pile of hot chilies that I didn't really have the guts to eat. Comes with a side of steamed rice, which is essential to survive eating in this joint, where everything is spicy. 
Coming from the Manhattan branches of Han Dynasty, this giant restaurant is a welcome change!

Stopped in while on vacation and really glad I did. With so many great choices to eat this is a must visit! Had the shrimp and fish poboy and the seafood gumbo. Both had great flavor and very good portions. Very spacious and we were sat immediately, even though the place was packed. Great drinks as well! Was not disappointed and definitely worth another visit!
Food was excellent. Service was a little slow. A little pricey. Worth a try. Really good. Small intimate restaurant.

Though I was totally enamored by the idea of being served dishes crafted by an Iron Chef (Jose Garcia), I thought the dishes were a bit lacking. I thought that the head chef for the day was a bit heavy-handed with the seasoning. I get it, you want each dish to pack a punch but there's magic in the subtleties of combining flavors that make your taste buds dance. Maybe my expectations for the Iron Chef were too high... I'll check back in when I try my favorite Iron Chef's restaurant (Michael Simon). ;) 

Other than shattering the pedestal I placed Garcia on, the experience and ambiance of the restaurant was so romantic. It definitely made me give my date some brownie points for surprising me with an ad hoc dinner here during my very short visit to Philly. :)

Having gone to this popular establishment multiple times with friends and colleagues, I can comfortably say that Han Dynasty is...ok, not great, but not bad either.

My recommendation is to get the Han Dynasty tasting menu option as it comes with so much food that you'd be waddling your way with the inevitable food coma. Of the menu items, I recommend the dan dan noodles, the twice fried (insert protein here, but I like the fish), and the eggplants. The food that didn't live up to expectation were the pork buns (really dry meat), the rabbit w/peanuts (which was more like peanut with rabbit bones) appetizer, and the dumplings in chili oil (more carbs than protein). The other dishes, like the bak choy and mapu tofu were standard.

One of the main reason why I was disappointed at Han Dynasty was the lack of communication between the staff for large party organizations. I called ahead 1 month in advance to prepare a dinner with specific food and spices request due to individual preferences. When I arrived on that evening, the waiter had no idea of the previous arrangement, and I spent 15 minutes trying to re-order the entire menu and we ended up getting multiple dishes with the wrong level of spices and excessive amount of meat dishes even though we had multiple vegetarians in our group.

I think at the end of the day Han Dynasty isn't bad, but if you're trying to impress a native Chinese foodie, there is much room for improvement.

Food: 3 stars
Price: 3 stars
Service: 2 stars
Ambiance: 2 stars (very stuffy, despite the tall ceilings)

Our wedding was last January, and I cannot tell you how easy it was to book and coordinate Jump on the School Bus. They were a pleasure to work with and were more than accommodating with every request. They went above and beyond. They listened carefully and cared a lot about what I wanted -- from beverages to music, they made sure all of my wants were met, with sincerity. Needless to say our wedding transportation went off without a hitch, and I have sweet Darren and Sierra to thank!

I have to give this so called restaurant 1 star because yelp won't allow me to give 0 star. Food is not all that great and they have the WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER! I do not recommend this place at all!!! Don't waste your money!

First time to New Orleans, and I decided to visit a colleague of mine and take her to lunch.  She said that she had heard great things about  Cafe Reconcile,  so we decided to try it out. Walking in, it is simple and clean, and has a decent sized menu.  I ordered the grilled catfish with mac and cheese and crawfish sauce. I was completely floored at how good the food was. I inhaled ever bite. 

Over all great food, great service, and great mission!
Terrible customer service! They will yell at you from across the store! Don't go here!

I messaged Fixit on a Sunday, before they were even open for the day about my aging laptop. My precious MacBook had decided on Friday evening to not fully boot up. My goggling on my phone lead to dead ends and I was losing my mind by Sunday as nothing I did would work. They messaged back within minutes. Their Veterans BLVD location is less than a mile from my house. They had no one to look at it on Sunday, so I gave them my information and a deposit. Monday after work, I stopped by and the technician was looking at it. Tuesday morning, they call me and tell me it was repaired. With the discount at check in on YELP, the whole bill was less than $100, and they did not have to wipe my hard drive clean. Yes, my laptop was purchased in 2010, but they were completely non-judgmental I so appreciated that. Yes, I know that I should not have put money into something so old and outdated, but I really dislike change, even something as minor as a laptop. I don't really use it all that much for anything but iTunes and my iPod (please don't judge me for that, I will NOT go to the iPhone and all that entails).

They were honest and did not bat any eye about my grandmother of a laptop. I will probably suck it up eventually and get a new laptop and transfer all of my music over. They do repair the iPhone, but do not repair any other phones of any sort. I hope to never come back, but if the need arises, I will know where to go, and I will refer everyone hear and shout their good news from the tree tops. Great customer service. Fast and affordable. I am grateful for this place.

For the price, the room is decent. Very small though and the painting on the handle bars in the bathroom is starting to peel. 

The hotel itself is pretty and clean. But I automatically smelled smoke when I walked in and the room itself smells like a bit of smoke too.

Dishonest!

Last December I negotiated a trade. They allowed me to test drive the car overnight and I let them know that they should go ahead and draw up the paperwork; I'd be in to sign them in the morning if there were no issues.  When I returned the next morning, they refused to honor the negotiated price. Shame on me for not getting in in writing, I know.  I left their car on the lot and drove mine home.
About a month later I realized that I had left my inflatable kayak in the hatch of their car.  When I called, they took my information but claimed they didn't have it.
Good luck inflating the boat, crooks.  I had one of the necessary bits for proper inflation at home.
Decent array of food options. Nice architecture. Just be sure to keep your coat on in the winter because when those doors open... Brrrrr!
